description: David R. Berkowitz, a onetime volunteer fireman in the Bronx, may have set 2,000 blazesmost in that borough in the four years before he was arrested in August 1977 for six murders, the Bronx District Attorney said yesterday.

description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI)The Defense Department suggested today that thousands of former Government shipyard workers call a tollfree number or write for information. on the hazards of contracting cancer from exposure to asbestos.

description: MANILA, May 8 (Reuters)After a threeday gun battle, Government troops today freed 75 families who had been held hostage by Communist guerrillas in the southern village of Alab, the Defense Department said today.

description: The Central Intelligence Agency advised and supported group of dissident army officers who overthrew the regime of President Kwame Nkrumah of Ghana in February 1966, firsthand intelligence sources said yesterday.

title: Houston Quiet After Violence Hospitalizes Over 12
description: HOUSTON, May 8The police were keeping a close watch over this city's predominantly MexicanAmerican North Side today after a night of burning, looting and violence that left more than a dozen persons hospitalized, including two local television newsmen and four police officers.

title: TV: Willa Cather's America, Pilot for an Abandoned Series, on Channel 13 Tonight
description: When certain literary types are not complaining about the crassness and vulgarity of television, they are likely to turn around and start whining about how the medium ignores serious writing and writers. In brief, unlike the lucky few, such as an Irwin Shaw, they are being denied a piece of the profitable action.

title: Talks on SouthWest Africa Halted
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 8Leaders of the ma.n insurgent group in SouthWest Africa have abruptly called off scheduled negotiations with Western diplomats here on proposals for bringing independence to the territory by the end of this year.

title: Ethics Panel Investigating Gewertz
description: TRENTON, May 8An ethics committee of the State Legislature began looking Kenneth A. Gewertz, who divested himself of his interest in a company that has sold 250 slot machines to Resorts International, which expects to open Atlantic City's first gambling casino this month.

title: $4.4 Billion in State Appropriations Is Voted
description: TRENTON, May 8A $4.4 billion appropriations bill for the 197879 fiscal year that begins July 1 cleared the Legislature today with a minimum of debate.

description: HACKENSACK, May 8A doctor at the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich challenged today an autopsy finding that one of the five patients Dr. Jascalevich is charged with killing might have died of a distended bladder.

description: WHITE PLAINS, May 8A State Supreme Court justice today barred the public and reporters from the pretrial hearings for Richard James Herrin, who is accused of the July 1977, hammerbludgeoning death of Bonnie Joan Garland of Scarsdale.

description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz May 8 (AP)Raymond Rubicam, cofounder of Young & Rubicam, the country's largest advertising agency, died at his home here today, He was 85 years old. In 1974, he suffered a heart attack and had a pacemaker implanted about a month ago.

title: DORIS G. O'HALLORAN
description: Doris G. O'Halloran, a retired advertising copywriter, died Saturday at Bellevue Hospital after a long illness. She was 64 years old and lived at 67 Park Avenue in Manhattan.

title: Sudan Seeking to Arrange Arab Summit Meeting
description: CAIRO, May 8The Middle East swing last week by President Gaafar alNimeiry of the Sudan represented the latest effort by moderate Arabs to reconcile President Anwar elSadat with the Arab critics of his peace initiative and thereby create a climate for a show of unity at a conference of the Arab League.

title: Market Place
description: The 7.5 percent increase in the price of primary aluminum ingot by the Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation announced yesterday kindled hopes in Wall Street for an industrywide followthrough and for advances in aluminum stocks, already up smartly in the recent market rally.

title: Competition and Recalls Hurt Chrysler's Wagons
description: DETROIT, May 4In the fall of 1975, the Chrysler Corporation gambled that American car buyers were ready for a compactsized station wagon that would fill the gap between the tiny subcompact models and the fullsize,models. The gamble paid off. The Plymouth Volare quickly became the nation's bestselling wagon, a position it kept through the 1976 and 1977 model years. Combined sales of nearly 380,000 Volare and Dodge Aspen wagons in those two model years contributed significantly to Chrysler's recovery from the 197475 recession.

title: Blumenthal Indicates New Moves to Spur Investment
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Carter Administration,. renewing efforts to improve relations with the business community, today signaled new initiatives to spur investment and said it was reconsidering the whole structure of income taxes on capital gains.

title: F.T.C. Head Accused Of Bias by 4 Groups
description: Four national associations involved with advertising to children have accused the chairman of the Federal Trade Commission of evident prejudice and bias on the subject and have asked that he disqualify himself from the current hearings.

title: Italian Terrorists Wound Doctor and Blow Up Car of Union Official
description: ROME, May 8Terrorists in Milan shot a physician in the legs and blew up the car of a labor union official today.

title: The National Stake in a Tax Treaty
description: For a generation, except in the recession year of 1977, the exports of the industrial countries have been climbing annually about twice as fast as production, spurring growth rates, income and prosperity. That growth has depended on the reduction or barriers to international trade and investment, but many impediments remain. One of them is the discriminatory taxation of American investments abroad, and it can be significantly reduced if the Senate this week approves a new tax treaty with Britain. It would also reduce discriminatory taxation British companies in the United States; unfortunately, it is opposed by several state governments that fear the loss of revenue. The twothirds vote needed for ratification is in doubt.

title: Obituary 6  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Berkowitz Pleads Guilty to Six Son of Sam Killings
description: David R. Berkowitz pleaded guilty yesterday to the six murder charges against him, and publicly affirmed that he was the gunman known as Son of Sam, the 44caliber killer.

title: Athlete Aid Bill Gains
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI)Hoping to end the bickering many feel has hindered recent United States Olympic efforts, the Senate today approved legislation coordinating all amateur athletics under the United States Olympic Committee.

title: Article 1  No Title
Debate on Nepotism Rules Grows With a Rise in Working Couples
description: WASHINGTON, May 8When Charles and Lee Tidball began looking for their first jobs 20 years ago, they dreamed of a glorious future collaborating in medical research.

title: Disaster Aid Funds Approved
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP)A $758 million extra appropriation to meet the demands of disaster victims for emergency loans from the Small Business Administration was approved today by the House and sent to the Senate. That would bring total appropriations for such loans in the year that began Oct. 1 to almost $2.3 billion.

title: Merger of Antipoverty Agencies Without Civil Service Proposed
description: WASHINGTON. May 8 (AP)A Federal official is proposing a merger of two antipoverty agencies into one Cabinetlevel organization whose employees would be removed from the Civil Service system.

title: KISSINGER SUPPORTS INCREASE IN NUMBER OF JETS FOR ISRAEL
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Former Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger urged the Carter Administration today to increase the number of jet fighters it pro:poses to sell to Israel while the Administration gave further signs that it was seeking a compromise on the $4.8 billion warplane package for the Middle East.

title: Weicker. Says Brzezinski Views Jews as Impediment to U.S. Policy
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., Republican of Connecticut, charged tonight that Zbigniew Brzezinski, President Carter's national security adviser, had singled out American Jews as an impediment to the Carter Administration's policies.

title: Adams Seeks Amtrak Service Cuts To Stem Railroad's Rising Deficits
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Secretary of Transportation Brock Adams proposed to Congress today sweeping changes designed to trim the everincreasing deficits of Amtrak, the rail passenger corporation established by Congress seven years ago.

title: CONVICTION REVERSED IN MIGRANTS' MURDER
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 8A new trial for Juan Corona was ordered today by a California District Court of Appeal, which reversed his conviction in the murders of 25 farm workers on the ground that his lawyer had failed to represent him competently.

title: INTEREST RATES UP DESPITE FED MOVES
description: Interest rates crept higher in the money mairket yesterday and the Federal Reserve pumped temporary reserves into the banking system three times in an apparent effort to curb the trend.

title: Thurman Munson's Isolation
description: He doesn't have Howard Hughes's money or Greta Garbo's mystique but Thurman Munson is a recluse now, a recluse from newsmen. Throughout his decade as the New York Yankees catcher, he has projected a grumpy image. Grumpy, grouchy, ornery, irascible, sometimes surlyper. haps he believes that such an attitude makes him appear tougher than he really is. Some people swear that, deep down, Thurman Munson is a softy underneath that gruff bark. Whatever he is, this season he has been unavailable for comment. In the Yankee Stadium dressing room he is seldom at his locker. After a game he prefers to retreat into the trainers room or the game room with its TV set, bumperpool table and soft couches; both those rooms are off limits to newsmen. By the time he emerges, the newsmen usually have departed. They accept his whim which he has maintained since his announcement on the first day of spring training that I'm not talking to writers. Or into microphones. It's not unprecedented. Ted Williams used to growl at Boston sportswriters, Roger Maris and, occasionally, Mickey Mantle grumbled at New York newsmen. And now Thurman Munson is intent on isolating himself from newsmen and, as a result, from the public those newsmen representthe public that pays his estimated $400,000 salary.

title: FINAL ARGUMENTS ARE SET ION REPORTED HUGHES WILL
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 8 (UPI)Attorneys for both supporters and opponents of the socalled Mormon will rested their cases today, clearing the way for final arguments next Monday in the case to determine the authenticity of the will purported to be that of Howard R. Hughes.

title: Utah Town's Deadline Extended And Bonus offered by Kennecott
description: LARK, Utah, May 8 (AP)The Kennecott Copper Corporation announced today that it would give families another year to move out of this doomed, companyowned town, would pay each family up to $1,500 in relocation allowances and would buy their homes at 20 percent above appraised value.

title: Firmer Dollar Spurs Small Drop For Futures of Precious Metals
description: A stronger dollar, reflecting the decision by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries this weekend not to raise oil prices at this time, caused a moderate decline in prices of precious metals futures yesterday.

title: MORT WEISINGER, AT 63, EDITOR OF COMIC BOOKS
description: Mort Weisinger, president in 1977 of the American Society of Journalists and Authors, and for 30 years executive editor of Superman comic books, died Sunday night in Long Island Jewish Hospital after a short illness. He was 63 years old and lived at 9 Hen Hawk Road, Kings Point, L.I

title: A Homemade Still Is Now Producing Gar Fuel
description: SELMA, Ala., May 37Albert Hubbard could not recall exactly how many of his 47 years he had spent in jail for making corn whisky illegally, but he scoffed at the ?? that he had ever been a moonshiner.

title: Warnke to Head Team for Talks
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (Reuters)Paul C. Warnke, head of the Arms Control Agency, will lead the American delegation at talks with the Soviet Union next month on banning socalled hunterkiller satellites, the State Department announced today. The negotiations will open in Helsinki, Finland, on June 8, the department spokesman, Hodding Carter 3d, said. The Soviet Union has developed , the weapon, which is capable of seeking out satellites in orbit and destroying them, over the last 10 years.

title: Begin Quits the U.S. After a Day's Delay
description: Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel left for home yesterday after an eightday visit to the United States.

title: Berkowitz Pleads Guilty to Six Son of Sam Killings
description: David R. Berkowitz pleaded guilty yesterday to the six murder charges against him, and publicly affirmed that he was the gunman known as Son of Sam, the .44caliber killer.

title: Theodorakis Ensemble Performs
description: When this observer heard Mikis Theodorakis five years ago, the experience was a lot more enjoyable than Sunday night's concert at the Felt Forum (Mr, Theodorakis and his ensemble will be back at the Felt Forum tomorrow night).

title: Obituary 11  No Title
description: ROSOWSKYIrving. beloved husband of Helen. devoted father of. Carol Gary and Arlene Blustein, dear brother of Samuel, Sol, Ida Levy, Sylvia Muslikat, dear brotherinlaw, cherished uncle and adored grandfather of Cheryl.Jill, Morissa, Michael and Glen Blustein. Services BoulevardPark West', 115 W. 79 St, Tuesday, May 9, 12:30PM..

title: Mets Beat Reds In 10 Innings, 32
description: CINCINNATI, May 8Isn't every win against the Cincinnati Reds lucky? asked Bruce Boisclair of the New York Mets. If you win the game, you feel like you've escaped.

title: General, at Espionage Trial, Says Documents Involved U.S. Defense
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., May 8The prosecution completed its case today against two men accused of giving Government documents to Vietnam with testimony from a Pentagon expert that the documents in question involved matters touchine upon the national defense.

title: Growing Japanese Concern OverWorldwide Depression
description: The danger of a world depressionand the political and military disasters to which it might give riseare very much on the minds of Japanese leaders today. Nobuhilce Ushiba, Japan's Minister of External Economic Affairs, says he sees an alarming parallel between word economic conditions today and those at the start of the Depression of the 1930's. He is particularly worried about the threat of protectionism and the fragility of the world monetary system with an unstable dollar.

title: Production of Steel Declined To 2.69 Million Tons for Week
description: Stell production for the week ended May & declined to 2.69 million tons, down 1.8 percent from the 2.74 million tons produced in the week before, according to the American Iron and Steel Institute.

title: Carew, Twins in Battle of Wits, Words and New Pact
description: Rod Carew, who has been warned by Commissioner Bowie Kuhn to cease his talk about wanting to play for contender, is not leaving the Minnesota Twins so quickly, at least not so long as Clark Griffith has a vote.

title: U.S. Agency Suggests Ford Pintos Have a Fuel System Safety Defect
description: DETROIT, May 8The Goverment announced today that it had made an initial determination that a safety defect exists in the fuel systems of the 1.9 million Ford Pintos produced for the 1971 through 1976 model years. The finding raises the prospect that the subcompact cars will be ordered recalled by fall.

title: Bribe Data Destroyed After Miller Was Questioned, Textron Reports
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Textron Inc. said today that evidence showing a company unit had made a $300,000 payment to sell helicopters in Ghana was destroyed the day after G. William Miller was asked about the transaction at his Senate hearings to be Federal Reserve chairman.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Harlem Hospital announced yesterday that it had won back the accreditation it lost in 1974 for a wide variety of structural deficiencies. At the same time, announced the opening of nighttime clinics in medicine and in prenatal care to serve Harlem residents who work during the day.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Black & Decker Manufacturing Company, owner of 2.2 million shares of the McCulloch Oil Corporation, said it had given an option to buy the McCullock stock to the Federated Reinsurance Corporation of Houston at $3.50 a share.

title: International Paper Expansion
description: The International Paper Company has begun production at its expanded facilities at its mill in Texarkana, Tex., 26 months after groundbreaking in February 1976. The $155 million expansion makes it the world's largest producer of bleached board, the company says. Capacity has been expanded from 240,000 tons a year to 561,000 tons.

title: Four Teams Gain Final In World Hockey Event
description: PRAGUE May 8The Soviet Union and Canada each had a burst of scoring late in the third period as the Soviet team posted a 42 victory over Canada and Czechoslovakia recorded a 32 victory over Sweden in the World hockey champlonships tonight.

title: Bribe Data Destroyed After Miller Was Questioned, Textron Reports
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Textron Inc. said today that evidence showing a company unit had made a $300,000 payment to sell helicopters in Ghana was destroyed the day after G. William Miller was asked about the transaction at his Senate hearings to be Federal Reserve chairman.

title: ROY ELTON CARR , AT 77, AN INSURANCE EXECUTIVE
description: Roy Elton Carr, retired preSident of the Providence Washington Insurance Company, died yesterday of cancer at his home at 151 Prospect Street in Providence, R.I. He was 77 years old.

title: Man Is Shot to Death on Bench In Subway Station in the Bronx
description: The body of a man in his 50's, apparently shot in the chest, was found last night seated on a bench on the southbound platform of the Hunts Point Avenue subway station of the IRT Pelham Bay line in the Bronx, the police reported.

title: ENERGY DEPT, WARNS OF PERIL TO DOLLAR IN OIL IMPORTS RISE
description: WASHINGTON, May 8A research arm of the Department of Energy estimated today a rise in oil imports over the next decade that, unless checked, could further widen the nation's trade deficit and jeopardize the stability of the dollar.

title: Giants Open Early Camp With Optimism in the Air
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., May 8The Giants opened a threeday training camp today10 weeks before summer practice and 116 days before their season opener,with all the optimism of an undefeated and untied team.

title: Cooperative Formed for Oil Spills
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 8 (UPI)  Ten companies that handle petroleum have formed the Delaware River Copoerative to contain any major oil spills that occur on the Delaware River and the Schuylkill.

title: Tucker Statue for Park Studied
description: New York City's Art Commission, in an unprecedented move, yesterday formed a committee to study plans for a proposed midtown monument to Richard Tucker, the opera singer, which had been criticized by a member of the local Community Planning Board.

title: A Homemade Still Is Now Producing Car Fuel
description: SELMA, Ala., May 3Albert Hubbard could not recall exactly how many of his 47 years he had spent in jail for making corn whisky illegally, but he scoffed at the icrea that he had ever been a moon shiner.

title: Miss Stephenson Wins By 4 Shots on 74283
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., May 8 (AP)Jan Stephenson, despite a final round of 74, won the Women's International golf tournament today with a 72hole total of 283. five under par and four strokes below Beth Daniel, an amateur.

title: 27 Municipalities Go To the Polls Today
description: Voters in 27 municipalities will elect governing bodies today. The polls will be open from 7 A.M. to 8 P.M.

title: I.C.C. Says Carriers Bill Clients For Funds Spent in Entertaining
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Auditors on the staff of Interstate Commerce Commission today told a Congressional panel that truckers and railroads that, haul . freight spend up to $1.5 billion a year wining and dining shippine agents, including Government officials, then pass the costs along to customers.

title: Mozart EFlat Concerto Played By PeterSerkin in Music in May
description: The New York Philharmonic's Music in May series, a truncated but welcome series of four concerts, came into full and final flower Sunday night when Pete Serkin played Mozart in a way that few of his colleagues among the younger pianists could begin to approach. Mr. Serkin has shown an affinity for Mozart from the start of his career, but this listener does not remember his ever before coming so close to the heart of this difficult composer as on this occasion. The work was the Concerto in E flat (K. 482), and the conductor was Alexander Schneider, long an artistic guru of the pianist.

title: KIDNAPHOLDUP TEAM GETS $68,000 AT BANK
description: After holding a bank manager and her husband handcuffed at gunpoint overnight in their home, thugs employing terror tactics and careful timing used the woman to invade a Queens bank yesterday morning. They find with some $G8,000 after taking nine more employees hostage as they arrived for work.

title: People and Business Carter's Approach to Inflation: Burns Views It as Forthright
description: Mr. Burns said the President should have cut his own salary, trimmed Federal salaries more sharply and asked corporate executives to freeze their own salaries for two years.

title: Adams Seeks Amtrak Service Cuts To Stem Railroad's Rising Deficits
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Secretary of Transportation Brock Adams proposed to Congress today sweeping changes designed to trim the everincreasing deficits of Amtrak, the rail passenger corporation established by Congress seven years ago.

title: Carol Bellamy's Struggle To Play a Star Role
description: Just about everyone hatiled carol Bellamy as the brightest new face in New York politics when She was elected City Council President last, November. Just. about eyeryone agreed that her brief speech Was the hit of the inauguration on Jan. 1.

title: Article 2  No Title
New York City and Its Unions Study Using 78 Surplu
description: New York City and the municipal labor unions are working on a package of wage increases that will use the surplus from the city's 1978 budget for what will be called 1978 expenses even though the money will be paid in 1979.

title: Brezhnev Back Home From Bonn
description: MOSCOW, May 8Leonid I. Brezhnev returned today from his visit to West Germany, just in time for the celebration of the victory over the Nazis 33 years ago tomorrow.

title: Pop: Blondie's New Directions
description: Growth in rock bands can be a problematic matter. A lot of them simply lack the technical skills and temperamental depth to grow much at all. And the simplicity of rock music poses its own traps: Often growth means selfdefeating experimentation, in which a successful formula is abandoned, and something unsure and selfindulgent takes its place.

title: KAISER TO LIFT PRICE OF ALUMINUM INGOT 75%, OR 4C A POUND
description: The Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation announced yesterday that was raising the price of aluminum ingot, the primary product, from which other items are made, by 7.5 percent, effective June 1.

title: In Region of Moro's. Hometown, Party and People Feel Numb
description: BART, Italy, May 6This city, the heart of Aldo Moro's constituency, is numb, battered by the intense emotions of the captivity of its most respected and admired leader.

title: DELANEY, IN CONGRESS SINCE '44, TO RETIRE
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Representative James J. Delaney of Queens, the chairman of the HouSe Committee on Rules and eighth in seniority in the House, is Calling it a career.

title: NATO Views Carter Policies With Unease
description: PARISA basic uneasiness about the development of the United States defense policies toward West Europe has been expressed by military and political leaders of some of the most important members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

title: Dow Jones Industrials Drop 4.51 Despite Optimism on Oil Pricing
description: Stock prices staged a moderate pullback yesterday, erasing earlier gains that wei e inspired by favorable signs on the oil pricing front.

title: PROSECUTIONS SOUGHT UNDER BACKTAX RULE
description: Assemblyman Charles E. Schumer, Democrat of Brooklyn, called yesterday for prosecutions to enforce yearold city regulations that bar tax delinquents from buying city properties at realestate auctions.

description: It was Sunday evening and the man rushing to the shuttle flight from Washington to New York's La Guardia Airport was instantly recognizable. Taller than all, he was, as usual. beine stared at.
