Richard (23), who leads the National League in strikeouts with 57, equaled the league seasonhigh total.

title: Deficit for Conrail Record for Quarter
description: The Consolidated Rail Corporation, which was created by Congress in 1976 to serve the freight needs of the Northeast and also operates commuter passenger services, reported yesterday a record quarterly deficit of $216 million.

title: Boeing Up 2 on Heavy Volume; Dow Declines by 2.51 to 822.07
description: While most stocks continued to beat a modest retreat yesterday, Boeing was the star issue of Wall Street as it climbed on heavy volume on the strength of a hugh aircraft order.

title: Dollar Stronger and Gold Gains $1
description: The dollar rose against most major currencies in foreignexchange trading in New York and abroad yesterday, The Associated PreSs reported.

title: Best Buys
description: A SEVENTH consecutive week of rising food prices sent the cost of feeding a family of four in New ork City last week to $82.69.

title: Senate Confirms Civiletti, 72 to 22
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP)Benjamin R. Civiletti won Senate confirmation as Deputy Attorney General today after being urged by his chief opponent to help remove politics from the Justice Department.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, MAY 10, 1978

title: Screen: 'It Lives Again':3 Monster-Babies
description: "IT LIVES AGAIN," which opens today at the National and other theaters, is Larry Cohen's sequel to the financially successful horror film he made last year, "It's Alive," in which a new-born baby laid waste a large part of Greater Los Angeles.Shot for shot, performance for performance, non-scare for non-scare, "It Lives Again" surpasses the tackiness of the original, perhaps because the new work has three monster-babies instead of one.The cast includes venerable Eddie Constantine, the American-born-and-bred French film star, as a doctor who walks as if he were wearing a cement corset. The other actors have less assurance than porn performers attempting to play a scene of straight dramatic exposition. Being fully clothed, they don't know where to look or move. Mr. Cohen wrote, directed and produced the film, which, most of the time, has the manner of something improvised in blind panic.

title: Technology: AM Radio Preparing For Stereophonic Broadcasting
description: radios were sold last year in the United States with a value of more than $1.4 billion.

title: The Year Of the Dandelion
description: FIERY RUN, Va., May 9The annual agricultural or garden report from this corner of the Blue Ridge is bad as usual, but not too bad. Everything in our garden suffered from inflation except our production, and the deficit at the end of our fiscal year (May 1) stood at $106.56.

title: Boys' Club Gets a Mansion, And 19 Designers Move In
description: ALL was bustle and goodhumored confusion as the cleaning teams departed and decorators made lastminute touches before the 15,000 expected visitors began to thread through. Helen Hollerith, who was responsible for the design selection, could hardly believe she was climbing the stairs yet another time  but she wanted to make apsolutely certain thateverything was in apple pie order in the 19 showrooms that opened last week in the former York Club at 4 East 62d Street to benefit Kips Bay Boys Club.

title: Oil Exports of Saudis Fell 30% Last Month
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, May 10 (Reuters)Saudi Arabian oil exports were down to 6.2 million barrels a day last month, 30 percent lower than last year's average, informed sources said today.

title: Bahamas Official Says Vesco Arrived  April 30
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas, May 10 (Reuters)Robert Vesco, the fugitive American financier, arrived in the Bahamas last week and was given a 75day residence permit, a senior Government official said today.

title: The Other Middle East Package
description: If we hear them right, leading members of Congress and the Carter Administration are hinting at an early compromise to permit the package sale of jet fighters to Saudi Arabia as well as to Egypt and Israel. And if we heard him right at the end of his fencemending journey across the United States, Prime Minister. Begin returned to Israel this week determined to find some added flexibility in his formula for selfrule by the Palestinians of the West Bank. Slowly, but significantly, things are moving in the Middle East.

title: A MEDICALCARE BILL OFFERED IN ASSEMBLY
description: A bill to reorganize the regulation of medical care in New York State has been introduced in the Assembly, Speaker Stanley Steingut, the measure's chief sponsor, announced yesterday.

title: Moro Is Buried as Family Bars Leaders
description: ROME, May 10Aldo Moro was buried today in a small village 35 miles north of Rome in a simple and restricted ceremony that his family had arranged in response to his wish that leaders of the Christian Democratic Party be barred from his fureral.

title: Neighborhood Acts to Revitalize Union Sq.
description: The Union Square subway station is dark and inhospitable. The park above is a gathering place for derelicts and drug dealers. and the entire neighborhood, once the fashionable domain of Diamond Jim Brady and Lillian Russell, has deteriorated.

title: Corporation Affairs Singapore Airlines Is Seeking ExIm Aid to Buy Boeing Planes
description: The chairman of Singapore Airlines said yesterday he hoped the Export Import Bank, an American lending institution, would provide up to $360 million of the financing for its purchase of $900 million worth of Boeing jet airlinersone of the largest aircraft purchases on record.

title: Q&A
description: Q. A small section of aluminum flashing on the roof of my beach house corroded and I want. to replace this section with copper. A contractor has told me that copper and aluminum cannot be used on the same roof. If copper is used, he says, all flashing must he replaced with copper. Is this true, or can copper and aluminum be coated to prevent a reaction such as he describes or would I be better off replacing with aluminum?  H.G., New York City

title: Rider Killed as Horse Bolts Into Deep Water
description: A 25yearold Brooklyn horseback rider was swept from his mount and apparently drowned in Jamaica Bay yesterdayafternoon when the horse reportedly bolted suddenly into deep water while being ridden through the surf at Gateway National Park.

title: Miss Costanza Agrees to Pay $500 For Delay on 74 Campaign Report
description: WASHINGTON (UPI)Margaret Costanza, an aide to President Carter, has agreed to pay a S500 fine for delay in filing a campaign spending statement relating to her unsuccessful 1974 race for Congress, the Federal Election Commission said today.

title: Goethe's Faust Staged at La Mama
description: AS PART of Ellen Stewart's laudable policy of welcoming foreign as well as American directors to La Mama, the German director Fritz Bennewitz has staged an Englishlanguage Faust. The production is presented in collaboration with the International Theater Institute.

title: Tire Maker and U.S. Agency Clash Over Memo Inadvertently Released
description: DETROIT, May 10A Federal document raising questions about the safety of millions of steelbelted tires now in use, inadvertently made public, has thrust the Federal highway safety agency and a major tire manufacturer into a court battle that could have serious consequences for the agency as well as renewing controversy over the tires.

title: INCREASE CONTINUES IN INTEREST LEVELS
description: Interest rates continued to inch higher yesterday in the money market, pushing the Federal funds rate as high as 7 percent and increasing the likelihood that the Federal Reserve will raise the discount rate soon.

title: Alberta Gas Will Fight Allegations By Du Pont on U.S. Methanol Prices
description: J. J. Loporto, president of Alberta Gas Chemicals Ltd., denied yesterday that his company was selling methanol in the United States at less than fair market prices.

title: Lady Hailsham, Aged 58, Is Killed In Horseback Accident in Australia
description: In Horseback Accident in Australia SYDNEY, Australia, May 10 (AP)Lady Hailsham, wife of one of Britain's most distinguished statesmen, was thrown from her horse and fatally injured today, authorities said.

title: Music: Choral Society
description: THE New York Choral Society under Robert De Cormier's direction filled Carnegie Hall with wonderful sounds and some rarely heard music on Friday night, all by Czechoslovak and Hungarian composers. Mr. De Cormier chose a fascinating program, showing an ad venturous spirit that other choral groups, which seldom stray from the standard repertory, might do well to emulate.

title: What Limits on Lobbying?
description: Embarrassed by the Korean bribe scandal and besieged by pressure groups, Congress seems determined to do something to stiffen the law requiring lobbyists to disclose their activities. The House recently passed a farreaching disclosure bill and the Senate Governmental Affairs Committee is considering an even tougher measure this week. In both versions, Congress seeks to open up Government without infringing the rights of those who seek to influence it. But for all their good intentions, the bills go too far in the direction of regulation.

title: Democrats Move to Ease Proposed Rules Changes
description: WASHINGTON, May 10The leadership of the Democratic National Committee moved today to take the sting out of proposed rules changes that have been widely critciized as intended to thwart possible opposition to President Carter's renomination in 1980.

title: SENATE ENERGY PANEL REJECTS SUBSIDY RISE ON HEAVY OIL IMPORTS
description: With a decisiveness that can only mean trouble for East Coast consumers, the Senate Energy Committee yesterday passed an amendment that would make it illegal for the Government to increase the present subsidy for heavy fuel oil imported into this region or to grant further subsidies for imports of refined petroleum products.

title: Letters
description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: Cabaret. Claudia McNeil
description: ALTHOUGH more than 20 years have passed since Claudia McNeil was singing pop sings in night clubs from Harlem to Greenwich Village, the actress still has a commanding presence as a singer. She has returned to clubsinging with a program made up entirely of songs associated with Ethel Waters at Michael's Pub, where she will be.appearing through May 27.

title: Canadiens Show Off Their Wealth
description: MONTREAL, May 10The Montreal Canadiens were able to bowl over the Toronto Maple Leafs in four straight games and enter the final round of the National Hockey League Stanley Cup playoffs for a variety of reasons. The sweep, capped by last night's 20 triumph in Toronto, was produced by good goaltending by Ken Dryden; good coaching by Scotty Bowman; great bench depth, courtesy of General Manager Sam Pollock; intelligent, mobile defensemen like Larry Robinson and Serge Savard; excellent shooters and skaters like Guy Lafleur and Yvan Cournoyer, and a firm sense of purpose, a Montreal tradition.

title: Ballads by Bonnie Raitt
description: BONNIE RAITT'S antinuolear power benefit concert Tuesday night at the Palladium went pretty much as advertised. Michael Franks, with his sometimes clever but rather bland folkish jazz, was the opening act. John Hall.who organized a celebrities petition against nuclear powerwas on hand as a guest guitarist and vocalist, and James Taylor and Carly Simon showed up at the end. The only other addition to Miss Raitt's regular band was Jon Payne, a firstrate saxophone player who is part of Mr. Franks's band and who has played with Miss Raitt in the past.

title: New Rioting Erupts In Iranian Holy City
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 10 (UPI)New antiGovernment rioting broke out in the holy city of Qom today in the third day of political violence across Iran that has caused the death of at least 12 persons in three cities.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: OPEN HOUSE The public is invited to attend free the first major flute competition in Classical music in this country, scheduled for today from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. in Carnegie Hall, under the auspices of the Walter W. Naumburg Foundation. The flute, cello and guitar have come to the fore markedly in recent years, with an increasingly large number of professional recitals given here on these three instruments.

title: Vote on Gas Plan Set By Energy Conference
description: WASHINGTON, May 10The HouseSenate conference on energy, in its 30th week, plans to meet tomorrow to vote on the latest version of a natural gas pricing compromise, Administration and House leaders worked anxiously today to line UP a majority of the votes on the House side for the proposal, under which price controls on new natural gas would be removed as of Jan. 1, 1985.

title: Parley Is Told of European Gains By Burning Waste and Garbage
description: CHICAGO, May 10The Wett German city of Munich, with a population of 1.4 million, is deriving 11.8 percent of its electricity by burning its own garbage and other wastes.

title: MIGUEL ANGEL CARCANO
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 10 (UPI)Former Foreign Minister Miguel Angel Carcano died yesterday at the age of 88 after a long ilness.

title: Historic Preservation Week
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (UPI)President Carter today proclaimed this week National Historic Preservation Week.

title: American Went to Help, and Stayed
description: TEL AVIV, May 10The audience of high school students seemed stunned. They'had just seen a hlm showing survivors of Nazi death camps trekking over European mountains, through snow drifts and forests toward ships bound for Palestine.

title: Crews Searching for Oil and Gas Climb to Highest Level Since '65
description: More seismic crews were out searching for oil and gas prospects last month than any time since May 1965, according to the Society of Exploration Geophysicists, which is based in Tulsa, Okla. The society said a total of 342 land and marine crews were active in April, a 17 percent increase from April 1977 and a 44 percent increase from April 1976.

title: Moro Is Buried as Family Bars Leaders
description: ROME, May 10Aldo Moro was buried today in a small village 35 miles north of Rome in a simple and restricted ceremony that his family had arrtmged in response to his wish that leaders of the Christian Democratic Party be barred from his funeral.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Judgment on Son of Sam
description: For all its shortcomings, the courtroom ceremony in which David Berkowitz pleaded guilty to six murders has produced a reasonable result. The defendant, for reasons sufficient to himself, waived all defenses including the obvious one of insanity and admitted responsibility for the homicides that so frightened New Yorkers and appalled the world. He was judged competent to enter the pleas after persuading the court he understood his situation and was able to take part in his own defense.

title: Koch Drafts Plan to Curb Speculation in. Real Estate
description: In yet another effort to curb speculation and other abuses in the resale of taxforeclosed property, Mayor Koch announced a measure yesterday that, in some cases, would have the Board of Estimate select the buyer instead of selling the property at auction.

title: Nimeiry's Unity Mission in Algiers
description: ALGIERS, May 10 (Agence FrancePresse)President Gaafar alNimeiry of the Sudan arrived here today on a new stage of his attempt to organize a unity meeting of Arab leaders. General Nimeiry, who arrived from Tunis, has also visited Egypt and Syria. The Sudanese leader is chairman of an Arab solidarity committee appointed by the Arab League.

title: Horton Leads Long Island Open With a 68
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I., May 10Just a year ago Mal Galletta won the Long Island open golf championship by coming from five strokes off the pace after the first round of the twoday, 54hole tournament.

title: CBS Affiliates Are Told Network Is Recovering
description: LOS ANGELES, May 10Sitting with their wives over a poolside breakfast at the Century Plaza Hotel, amid the elegant Southern California foliage, the owners and managers of some 200 CBS affiliated stations betrayed nothing of the network's fall from glory. Two decades of leadership in the audience popularity ratings have made aristocrats of the CBS affiliates, and their sense of being the nobility of television has not been diluted by the emergence of ABC as the No. 1 network in the last two ratings campaigns.

title: BISHOP WALTER FOERY, 87, LED DIOCESE OF SYRACUSE
description: The Most Rev. Walter A. Foery, who served for 33 years as the Bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Syracuse, died at his home in Syracuse Wednesday. He was 87 years old.

title: C.I.A. Aide Disputes SpyTrial Witness on Payments
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., May 10A case officer for the Central Intelligence Agency today contradicted some of the testimony. of one of his former undercover agents, a key witness in the prosecution of two men accused of spying for Vietnam.

title: Hua Ends His Visit to North Korea
description: HONG KONG; May 10Hua Kuofeng, the Chairman of the Chinese Communist Pally, concluded a sixday visit to North Korea today in what appeared to be more of an initiation in international travel than an important diplomatic mission.

title: NEW JERSEY UTILITY EASES RATE REQUEST
description: TRENTON, May 10The Public Advocate and the. Public Service Electric and Gas Company have reached an agreement that would give the state's largest utility a 7 percent rate increase, officials announced today.

title: Landlords Assail Industry Group For Ignoring NonLuxury Owners
description: Spokesmen for several major landlord groups in New York City charged yesterday that a key industry association was not responsive to the needs of thousands of owners of older apartment buildings.

title: Ballet: Flagwaving From Balanchine
description: THE New York City Ballet waved a flag on Tuesday night at the New York State Theater, where George Balanchine's Stars and Stripes received its first performance this spring. However. balletgoers allergic to flagwaving could find solace in the sylvan glades of Raymonda Variations.

title: Bouton Fans 7 In Pitch for Job
description: RICHMOND, Va., May 10 (AP)Jim Bouton, pitching for Richmond, struck out seven Atlanta Braves batters in an exhibition game today, but despite his wellused knuckleball the Richmond team lost to Atlanta, 73.

title: Albany Delaying Dying Man's Bid To Aid the Aged
description: A dying man's wish to bequeath more than $1 million to build a home for the aged may never be fulfilled because New York State health and social agencies have delayed giving their approval.

title: Moro's Legacy
description: Aldo Moro was not a man hungry for power. It is true that he was not loved by the people. But he was loved by those who have a cultivated taste for politics. Why? Because he was the Christian Democrats only real statesman since the death of Alcide de Gasperi, the founder of the Christian Democratic Party. He was a man of longrange visionvision regarding the country's problems. That is why Italians of political vision cared deeply for him.

title: 10 Indicted in Foolproof Scheme For Smuggling Cocaine Into U.S.
description: Ten persons have been indicated for narcotics smuggling in what Federal officials concede was a foolproof scheme that used luxury cruises to bring cocaine into the United States. Others, Federal drug officials, may still be using the scheme and the only reason the officials became aware of it was that an undercover agent was approached and asked to participate. The 10 who were indicted, officials said, brought in cocaine worth more than $4 million wholesale in less than two years.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: Deaths

title: SEOUL WON'T ALLOW EXENVOY TO TESTIFY
description: WASHINGTON, May 10The South Korean Government refused today to make one of its former officials available for questioning by a House committee investigating the alleged bribery of members of Congress.

title: GARDENING
description: LILACS. Is spring complete without them? They are hardly mentioned anymore. Have they been forgotten?

title: South Africans Say They Could Raid Angola Again
description: CAPE TOWN, May 10Despite condemnation by the United Nations Security Council, South Africa has said that It will repeat last week's strike against guerrilla bases In Angola if the insurgents of the SouthWest Africa People's Organization continue their attacks.

title: 20 Seized in Jersey on Charge Of Jobless Fund Fraud Scheme
description: NEWARK, May 10 (AP)Twenty persons have been arrested and authorities are looking for up to 40 more in connection with a Si million unemployment fund fraud scheme, state officials said.

title: CasaleHalpern to Rock Garden
description: We wouldn't have fought him a couple a year ago, said Nick Baffi, Guy Casale's manager. I don't like to fight fellows just out of jailthey live too clean. You gotta wait a couple of years, then they're easy.

title: Mets Top Expos, 72
description: MONTREAL, May 10Nino Espinosa, who was roughed up by the Phillies in his last start, scattered six hits tonight in hurling the New York Mets to a 72 victory over the Montreal Expos in Olympic Stadium.

title: NEW &
description: Tourists in Venice who are taken to the glassworks of Murano often come away with the impression that the only things made there are animal figurines and glasses embellished with floral designs and lots of gold. Not true. Murano is also where ultramodern glass lamps, bowls and vases are produced. The most recent arrivals from Murano to these shores are designs by Ettore Sottsass for Vistosi, now on display at Ambienti. Mostly in milky white with Jewellike tones of garnet, sapphire, emerald or ruby, the collection is made in numbered editions of 250. Prices range from about $180 to $419. Some pieces are purely decorative, but most can be used to hold flowers, fruit, candy, nuts and the like. In addition, there is Mr. Sottsass's mushroomshaped table lamp in white glass with colored trim for $331. Ambienti is at 792 Madison Avenue (on the corner of 67th Street).

title: Senate Bill Authorizes Audits Of Fed, F.D.I.C. and Comptroller
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (Reuters) The Senate today passed a bill authorizing an audit of the Federal Reserve Board, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and the Comptroller of the Currency by the General Accounting Office. The G.A.O. is the investigating agency of Congress.

title: Bombs Set Off in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, May 10 (UPI)Six small pipe bomb blasts have damaged three post offices, a Navy recruiting office, Navy bus and a bank. There were no injuries in the late night and early morning blasts, which the police suspected might be the work of an independence cr labor extremist group.

title: FRENCH UNITS IN LEBANON QUIT SOME TYRE POSITIONS
description: TYRE, Lebanon, May 10 (UPI)French troohs in the United Nations peace force pulled out of some of their positions around Tyre today and reinforced others in a move to ease the tension after fighting last week with Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Music: Promenades Anew
description: SPRING was a little late this year, to paraphrase a oncepopular song, but the New York Philharmonic's annual Promenades arrived on time. What has become a Maytime institution in the Big Apple opened last night in Avery Fisher Hall, and the mood was suitably festive.

title: Westchester Board Takes Stand On SolidWaste Disposal Issue
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 10The Westchester County Board of Legislators last night adopted a resolution establishing a boardmonitored process for developing a solidwaste disposal plan, but the County Executive, Alfred B. DelBello, said he was not abandoning his own plan for a $135 million countywide system.

title: Landlords and Tenants Battle Over Rent Control Bill
description: TRENTON, May 10Landlords and tenant groups are battling over a proposed state rent control law that realestate interests say would devastate apartment construction in the state and that tenants groups say would be beneficial.

title: F.B.I. Chief Backs Bill to Guard Agents From Suits
description: WASHINGTON, May 10William H. Webster, the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, today urged Congress to pass legislation that would grant individual Federal agents immunity from civil suits. Our agents in the field want this bill very much, he said.

title: Anorexia Nervosa: A Diet Disease That Proves Thin Is Dangerous
description: At only 71 pounds, waiflike and emaciated, 23yearold Rochelle Spangolett is slowly starving herself to death.

title: Carey Declares Mourning Period
description: ALBANY, May l0Governor Carey today ordered that flags be flown at halfstaff on state buildings and declared a period of sympathy for the family of former Prime Minister Aldo Moro of Italy and other victims of terrorism. In a brief statement, the Governor said: Terrorism never has been and never will be an effective instrument for furthering political gains. The kidnapping, imprisonment, and murder of Premier Moro is sickening to me and to all those who hold freedom dear.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: State police background investigations, conducted for the Governor to determine the fitness of a prospective appointee, are not public records, the New Jersey Supreme Court ruled yesterday.

title: Dance: Four From Ailey
description: IT WAS one of those magical nights on Tuesday at City Center where the Alvin Ailey Ainerican Dance Theater opened the second week of its threeweek spring season. The company presented four of the dramatic dances it does so well, and the dancers were in top form, nowhere so notably perhaps as in the first performance this season of Donald McKayle's Rainbow `Round My Shoulder.

title: Article 1  No Title
Overcharging Laid To Electric Utilities During Coal Strike
description: WASHINGTON, May 10  A Federal commission said today that it has evidence that several electric companies collected excess revenues during the recent coal strike and has ordered a full investgat on of alleged overcharges..

title: Orioles Murray Homers, Ends Red Sox String at 7
description: BALTIMORE, May 10 (AP)Eddie Murray's tworun homer in the bottom of the ninth inning gave the Baltimore Orioles a 32 victory tonight over Boston and ended the Red Sox winning streak at seven games.

title: Bloom Enters Race Against Carey
description: On the twin arguments that Governor Carey's leadership has been lukewarm and that New Yorkers are disenchanted with him, the Governor's Brooklyn neighbor, State Senator Jeremiah B. Bloom, said yesterday that he would challenge Mr. Carey for the Democratic nomination. The 64yearold Mr. Bloom conceded that his was not a statewide household name, but he said that I'm banking on the fact that the present incumbent is so wellknown.

title: When May a Businessman Study Talmud?; Seven Years to Complete Style Is Intense and Brisk
description: Shortly after noon on weekdays, while most employees of the State Insurance Department scan luncheon menus in the adjacent Wall Street area, Issmar Dier, an examiner in the department, partakes of his steady diet of Talmudic readings.

title: A Western Burden, Paying Income Tax, Looms in Spain
description: MADRID, May 10Leaning slightly over the gold cutlery, the Spanish businessman smiled slyly at Treasury Minister Francisco Ord6fiez and turned to the countess seated across the table.

title: Democrats Pull Back Bill Ordering Life Without Parole for Murder
description: ALBANY, May 10Democrats in the Assembly sought today to push their bill authorizing life imprisonment without parole for convicted murderers.

title: Rock: Stanky Brown, Ellen McIlwaine
description: THE main interest Tuesday night at the Bottom, Line was the return of Ellen Mcllwaine, who was the opening act. The Stanky Brown Group, which headlined, is an industrious rock sextet from New Jersey that is clearly pointing toward MiddleAmerican success.

title: Advertising
description: Bob Guccione, whose Penthouse magazine developed an audience of young males on one level, will be after that same crowd again on a higher planea much higher planewith magazine called Nova, described as The First Magazine of the Space Age.

title: Aerospace Issues Continue Gains
description: Aerospace issues continued to push ahead yesterday as the strongest group in the stock market. For the first time this week, advancing issues outpaced the losers on the New York Stock Exchange, but the hectic buying activity that characterized the late April surge in stock prices was absent.

title: Calendar of Events
description: A tour of Manhattan homes, for the benefit of the Industrial Home for the Blind, will take place on two consecutive Tuesdays, May 16 and May 23.

title: Soviet Beats Canada, 51, In Hockey
description: Prague, May 10Helped by a controversial penalty, the Soviet Union defeated Canada, 51, at the world hockey championships tonight.

title: Sadat Suggests Return of West Bank, Gaza as Peace Step
description: MIT ABUL KOM, Egypt, May 10President Anwar el  Sadat suggested today that the West Bank might be returned to Jordan and the Gaza Strip to Egypt as interim steps toward peace in the Middle East.

title: Ain't Misbehavin Born of Waller Music
description: A IN'T MISBEHAVIN  was born, more or less, when Murray Horowitz played his Fats Walter records for Richard Maltby. Mr. Horowitz had suggested that there was a revue in Walter's music. Mr. Maltby had thought not. Then he heard the records. This was a year ago.

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: Death

title: Design Notebook
description: IN LIFE, as in the theater, everyone loves a transformation scene. They love the lights, the color, the perfume (real or imagined), they love the music, the costumes, the hundreds of people who turn up from nowhere, they love the sense of luxury and abundance:

title: Argeptina Combats Inflation but Finds Social Cost Is High
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 9Argentina is being weaned from inflation the way an addict comes off drugs, with wage earners and pensioners suffering the most acute withdrawal symptoms.

title: DR. SHERMAN E. JOHNSON
description: Dr. Sherman Ellsworth Johnson, an internationally known researcher in the economics of agriculture, died April 28 at his residence in Strasburg, Va. He was 81 years old.

title: Credit Suisse to Buy Interest of Merrill
description: Credit Suisse, a major Swiss bank, said yesterday it would exercise its option to buy Merrill Lynch & Company's 31 percent interest in an overseas joint venture called Credit Suisse White Weld. Merrill Lynch had acquired the stake last month when it bought White Weld Holdings Inc. for $50 million.

title: Stage: Angel Turns Wolfe Into Music
description: THROUGHOUT the new musical, Angel, the tall frame house that serves as its principal set turns first this way, then that way, and finally shudders around in complete circle.

title: Plaque to Designate Lyceum a Landmark
description: A bronze plaque commemorating the designation of the Lyceum Theater as a city landmark is to be unveiled at the theater in a ceremony at 2:30 P.M. on Tuesday.

title: For Redford, the Real Star Is the Sun, With Energy for All
description: NESTLED into the south side of an alpine knoll in the Wasatch mountains of Utah is one of the world's most expensive solar homes the Western residence of Robert and Lola Redford. This fivebedroom house; finished last year, is at once a source of pride and embarrassment to the Redfords. Robert and Lola Redford are committed to the solar energy movement, and they are proud of the ground they have broken in Utah. At the same time, they are concerned that they May be fostering the notion that solar energy is a plaything of the rich.

title: $733.6 MILLION ACCEPTED ON GULF OIL LEASE BIDS
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP)The Interior Department today announced the acceptance of high bids, totaling more than $733.6 million for petroleum leases in Federal waters off the Gulf of Mexico.

title: LABOR REJECTS PLEA BY CARTER TO ACCEPT GUIDELINES ON WAGES
description: WASHINGTON, May 10Organized labor rejected a plea by President Carter today to accept voluntary wage guidelines as part of a unified national struggle against inflation.

title: 11 Establishments Cited as Failing New York City Health Inspections
description: The New York City Health Department listed 10 restaurants and food establishments yesterday that had healthcode violations and one that had been closed for failing to correct an earlier violation. The restaurants are:

title: CORRECTION
description: It was incorrectly reported in The Living Section yesterday that a concert and auction to benefit the pre?? ratory school scholarship fund of the Mannes College of Music would be held today at the school, 157 East 74th Street. The event took place last Saturday.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Events Today
description: NEW YORK PHILHARMONIC PROMENADE CONCERT, Avery Fisher Hall, Lincoln Center, 8:30.

title: U.S. CRUDE OIL PRODUCTIbN AT HIGHEST LEVEL SINCE '74
description: For the first time since February 1974, United States production of crude oil in the week ended April 28 reached an estimated 9 million barrels a day, the American Petroleum Instiutte reported yesterday. Output for the weekended May 5 was estimated at 9 millfon barrels a day also.

title: World News Briefs
description: RANGOON, Burma, May 10 (Reuters)Burma today denied charges by refugees that its army had waged a campaign of terror against the country's Moslem minority.

title: Notes on People
description: Aformer Assistant Attorney General, John W. Douglas, has been elected board chairman of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace. John Chancellor, coanchorman of the NBC Nightly News, was elected vice chairman. Mr. Douglas, a partner in the Washington law firm of Covington & Burling, was an Assistant Attorney General in the Justice Department's civil rights division from 1963 through 1966. He is a graduate of Princeton and of Yale Law School, and was a Rhodes Scholar. His father was the late Senator Paul H. Douglas of Illinois. The 56yearold Mr. Douglas succeeds Milton Katz, director of international legal studies at Harvard.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Tailor From Iran Has Few Regrets
description: JERUSALEM, May. 10The needle darted in and out of the dark blue cloth like a silvery dragonfly as Yehuda Janion talked and worked in the holeinthewall of a tailor shop that he has called his own for 25 years.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Soviet Diplomat's Wile Is Suicide
description: MOSCOW, May 10Leongina I. Shevchenko, the wife of the Soviet diplomat who defected last month in the United States, was reported today to have killed herself with an overdose of sleeping pills in her Moscow apartment.

title: Brimfield Hosts a Feast of Antiques Fairs
description: BRIMFIELD, MASS. FROM the game bag on his hip, the young man in the Woody Gu thrie lonesome traveler costume extracted a walkietalkie and deftly ran its antenna to full length. Do you see anything over there? he asked the box.

title: Daniel B. Frey, 69, Retired in 1973 As Jewelry Company Executive
description: Daniel B. Frey, who retired in 1973 as vice president of Harry Winston Inc., the jewelry concern at 718 Fifth Avenue in Manhattan, died yesterday in his home, 211 Central Park West. He was 69 years old.

title: Philip Morris to Lift Bid for 7Up by $5, to $46 a Share
description: Philip Morris Inc. announced yesterday that it planned to raise its offer for the SevenUp Company to $46 a share from $41, or to a total of about $490 million from about $440 million.

title: Locomotive Engineer Killed
description: LANE, S.C., May 10 (AP)An Amtrak Vain hit a logging truck today at the Lane crossroads near Kingstree and derailed, killing the engineer and injuring at least seven other persons. The authorities said that the train was carryng 50 ties said that the train was carrying 50 passengers from Savannah, Ga., to New York.

title: Spot Where Moro Was Found Is Enshrined
description: ROME, May 10  A blanket of flowers, wreaths and flags of the governing Christian Democratic Party now covers the spot in a midtown street where a car with the body of Aldo Moro was found yesterday.

title: Sound
description: BACK in the 1930's, when electricity was still regarded with some suspicion, a British humorist named J. B. Morton satirized incipient intrusions of technology into the personal sphere by predicting the invention of an electric toothbrush. The idea struck everyone as funny.

title: Hers
description: HOW difficult it is, at any age, to separate the longing for traditional mothering from the recognition of one's mother's ambitions. Such a difference there is between my daughter's acceptance of my writing and the way I felt about my mother's painting. I am not sure how much of this is due to social change, how much to the specifics of personality and circumstance. How I hated it when my mother would say, I want you to know me as a person. I swore I would be a Real Mother. I based my definition not on mothers I knew, but mothers I saw in the movies. Even though as a child brought up in'Hollywood I might have noticed those roles were played by some of the most driven women in the world, I never made that connection.

title: Indian Parliament Begins Debate On Censure Motion Against Desai
description: NEW DELHI, May 10The lower house of Parliament began debate today on a censure motion brought by the opposition against the Janata Party Government.

title: Anorexia Nervosa: A Diet Disease That Proves Thin Is Dangerous
description: At only 71 pounds, waiflike and emaciated, 23yearold Rochelle Spangolett is slowly starving herself to death.

title: TV: Body Human Explores Brain
description: THE BODY HUMAN is not, as Dorothy Parker might have said, the program lousy. But, with continuing exposure, the series raises several delicate auestions. Produced by the Timorrow EntertainmentMedcom Company, the latter entity being directly connected to the medical profession, the programs are crammed with the latest advances in both medicine and probing photography. Some of the material is fascinating, but the overall format, akin to a latterday version of Marcus Welby, M.D., often disintegrates into celebratory mush.

title: A Dinner for 2 in Texas at $2,783
description: AUSTIN, Texas, May 10 (UPI)In a state that proclaims chill, beer and barbecue as the staples of a fine meal, Lawrence V. Skloss's $2,783 dinner last night was most unusual.

title: White Talks His Way Into Yank Lineup
description: While the Yankees waited for the rain to determine whether they would play or take the night off last Monday, Roy White walked into Billy Martin's office for a quiet chat about his playing status. The day before, late in the game with Texas, White was not so quiet in the dugout. He was said to have erupted in a volatile way most untypical of the Yankees elder statesman.

title: Tonao Senda, 59, Vice President Of Japan Air Lines, Dies in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, May 10 (AP)Tonao Senda, vice president of Japan Air Lines, died of cancer in a Tokyo hospital yesterday, doctors reported today. He was 59 years old.

title: I.T.T. EARNINGS ROSE BY 9.6% FOR QUARTER
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation reported yesterday a 9.6 percent rise in firstquarter consolidated net income on a 13.1 percent revenue gain.

title: Business Records
description: Wednesday, May 10, 1978

title: A FosterCare Proposal Suggests Permanent Placement Incentives
description: ALBANY, May 10A major overhaul of New York State's fostercare system, using financial incentives and penalties to encourage faster permanent placement of children, was proposed today by the Temporary State Commission on Child Welfare.

title: Obituary 7  No Title
description: Deaths

title: BROWN SAYS SAUDIS WILL ACCEPT CURBS ON THE USE OF F15'S
description: WASHINGTON, May 10Defense Secretary Harold Brown said today that Saudi Arabia had agreed to prohibitions and restrictions on the use of F15 fighter planes it wants to buy.

title: About Newyork
description: A spotlight cut through the empty darkness of the State Senate chamber in Albany all through last Saturday night, shining deep red off a bouquet of roses on the desk of the late Senator Bernard G. Gordon, a decent, wily, newly departed politician who loved the pokerante aspects of tht endless bills and issues.

title: Inflation, Trade Protectionism and Rising Steel Prices
description: Does the left hand know what the right hand is doing? Does it care?

title: Takeover Target in 7Up Fight: A FamilyControlled Company
description: When SevenUp first appeared in 1929, it was billed as a headache remedy. It is a safe bet that there are at least a few people around corporate headquarters in St. Louis who wish it still was.

title: SENATE PANEL APPROVES AIRCRAFT CARRIER FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP)The Senate Armed Services Committee approved a $36 billion weapons bill today, authorizing funds for a new nuclear aircraft carrier and for conversion of civilian jumbo jets to carry cruise missiles.

title: U.S. AGENCY ASSAILED ON SCAFFOLD DEATHS
description: WASHINGTON, May 10A public interest group charged, today that Federal safety officials had been aware of a safety risk 13 months before the fatal West Virginia scaffolding collapse but had done little to prevent the equipment from being used.

title: Police End Blockade At Home of Radicals
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 10 (AP)Members of the radical group Move took to the sidewalk across the street from their fortified house today as policemen watched and neighborhood residents walked on 33d Street for the first time in 55 days.

title: 1,000 Construction Workers Rally To Back Seabrook Nuclear Plant
description: CONCORD,. Nil., May 10 (AP)More than 1,000 construction workers rallied at the Statehouse today to dramatize their suppert for the Seabrook nuclear plant.

title: Mr. Koch Moves In on the Schools
description: When Mayor Koch propelled his candidate for School Chancellor through the Board of Education last month, he made good on his promise to seek greater control over New York City's schools. He has now asked the State Legislature to give legal sanction to the powers he seeks. Specifically, he wants a new and expanded board on which his appointees will hold a majority. In addition, Mr. Koch asked for a review of the city's controversial school decentralization which, by giving local communities greater power, has diminished that of the central board.

title: Pakistan Seizes 4 in Press Protest
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, May 10 (Reuters)Four journalists and press operators were arrested today for having joined a hunger strike to protest the Government's closing of an opposition newspaper, the Pakistan Federal Union of Journalists said today. The Urdulanguage newspaper Musawat has been shut down for publishing a statement by former Prime Minister Zulfikar All Bhutto, who has been sentenced to death by a military court on charges of involvement in the killing of a political opponent.

title: George Maciunas, Artist And Designer Organized Fluxus to Develop SoHo
description: George Maciunas, an artist and industrial designer who organized the Fluxist movement and who was one of those chiefly responsible for the development of SoHo as an artists community, died of cancer Tuesday in the University Hospital in Boston. He was 47 years old and lived in New Marlborough, Mass.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New York State Transportation Commissioner said the bulk of the $800 million that Governor Carey had promised Mayor Koch for .transit would go toward subway and rail improvements.

title: Small State Bank Discloses Talks By a Holder to Sell 60% of Stock
description: The Central State Bank, a small New York City commercial bank, said yesterday that one of its major shareholders was negotiating an agreement for the sale of 60 percent of the bank's common stock to a South American banker.

title: Mondale Outlines New. U. S . Agenda For Pacific Region
description: HONOLULU, May 10Vice President Mondale, en route home from a 12day tour of Southeast Asia and the Pacific, today outlined a new agenda for American involvement in the Pacific in the nostVietnam War era.

title: Companies Report Earnings
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stuck Exchange,(A) the American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: NELSON BROOKS OF YALE, AN AUTHORITY ON FRENCH
description: Nelson Brooks, professor emeritus of French at Yale University, died Monday of cancer at his home in New Haven. He was 75 years old.

title: Atlanta Plan May Shape Mass Transit's Fate
description: ATLANTA, May 4The future of costly, longterm subway projects in the United States may depend on the sucoess of the system Atlanta hopes to open this Christmas.

title: Home Beat
description: SINGERS and dancers from the cast of On the Twentieth Century were a little surprised, perhaps, but they entered right into the spirit of things. Give an actor the chance, and you know how he'll run with it. So. when all those overnight bags, duffels and assorted pieces of luggage were arranged on the stage in front of the musical's spectacular set at the St. James Theater the other day, it didn't take a minute to have the cast members all break out into mugging and clowning and several spontaneous softshoe routines.

title: Bernard Tomson, at 69, Elected To State Supreme Court in 1976
description: MINEOLA, LI., May 10Justice Bernard Tomson of State Supreme Court died at the Albert Einstein College Hospital in the Bronx yesterday after a long illness. He was 69 years old and lived at 43 Vista Hill Road, Great Neck, L.I.

title: On 30th Year, Israel Honors Past, Ponders Present, Charts Future
description: JERUSALEM, May 10After a day of intense mourning for its thousands of war dead, Israel tonight began celebrating its 30 tumultuous years as an independent nation.

title: THOMAS CHAMBERLAIN, 82
description: Thomas G. Chamberlain, a New York lawyer who was once active in Republican politics and who served as a trustee of Mark Twain's estate, died of pneumonia Tuesday at New York Hospital. He was 82 years'old and lived at 870 Fifth Avenue.

title: Oil Spill Seen in Delaware River
description: WILMINGTON, Del., May 10 (AP)An oil spill of undetermined origin and concentration was sighted today in the Delaware River between here and Salem, N.J., a Coast Guard spokesman said.

title: SECURITIES INDUSTRY CHEERED BY S.E.C. AIDE
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS. W. Va., May 10A commissioner of the Securities and Exchange Commission told the Securities Industry Association today that the Federal agency might be ignoring some of the industry's positive accomplishments.

title: Search Begun for Fishing Boat
description: MOBILE, Ala., May 10 (UPI)An air and sea search was started today for four persons who said by radio that their 25 foot fishing boat had exploded and was sinking. The search for the. Trinidad's crew, none of whom were immediately identified, was concentrated 15 miles west of Dauphin Island in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP)  The Government is tightening its rules for obtaining Social Security cards, beginning Monday.

title: Ailing Turkey: Ecevit First Aid; Prime Minister Is Pulling Nation Back From Brink; News Analysis; Ecevit Supporters Unperturbed; Seeks to Refinance Huge Debts; Curbs on Consumption Favored; Ecevit Flies to West Germany; ANKARA, May 10 (Reuters)Prime Minister Ecevit left today for a fourday official visit to West Germany. The visit, to be followed by trips to Britain and Austria, is seen as particularly important: Mr. Ecevit said yesterday he would ask the Germans to supply equipment to Turkish security forces and aid in the production of military equipment for possible sale to third countries.
description: ANKARA, TurkeyWhen Bulent Ecevit defeated the Government of Prime Minister Suleyman Demirel and came to power at the start of the year, Turkey was at its lowest point in decadesfacing economic ruin, lingering international ostracism because of its 1974 invasion of Cyprus and the worst wave of political violence in its history.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: It was incorrectly reported in The Living Section yesterday that a concert and auction to benefit the preparatory school scholarship fund of the Mannes College of Music would be held today at the school, 157 East 74th Street. The event took place last Saturday.

title: The Last Optimist
description: CAIRO, May 10From the beginning of the peace initiative, it is clear now, the Israelis misread President Sadat in one fundamental respect. They thought he was not really serious when he talked about the West Bank and the Palestinians. They thought he would drop those issues in due course, and make a separate peace.

title: Consumer Spending For April Rose 2%
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP)A strong burst of auto sales contributed to a percent increase in consumer spending in April, the Commerce Department said today.

title: MAY 20 DEADLINE SET ON CITY FISCAL GOALS
description: At the urging of Treasury Secretary W, Michael Blumenthal, participantg in talks on New York City's fiscal problems yesterday set what they called a deadline of May 20 for resolving all of the complicated issues that have held up renewed Federal aid to the city: agreement on union contracts, bond purchases by pension funds and financial institutions, and legislation on borrowing ceilings of the Municipal Assistance Corporation.

title: East Germans Publish in U.S.
description: EAST BERLIN is a wall and world away from the publishing scene in Manhattan, yet what appears in the United States and Western Europe affects the creative and personal lives of authors in East Germany.

title: Senate Unit Bars Breakfast Plan For Pupils but Backs Mothers Aid
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP)The Senate Agriculture Committee today rejected the Carter Administration's proposal that breakfasts be required to be offered in schools where half the pupils come from poor or lowermiddleincome families and receive cutrate lunches.

title: House Restores Cut In H. E. W W. Spending, Sets Budget Goals
description: WASHINGTON, May 10The House voted tonight to restore $3.1 billion that it cut just yesterday from health, education and welfare spending goals.

title: Haverstraw Judge Quits In TicketFixing Inquiry
description: ALBANY, May 10 (AP)Town Justice George Cobb of Haverstraw has become the first judge to be barred from the bench as a result of the the statewide investigation of ticketfixin

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, MAY 11, 1978

title: Rumors Help Cold, Silver and Platinum Contracts Move Up
description: Rumors swept the commodity markets yesterday that the Swiss would soon lift their restrictions on foreign investments in their country and that the petroleumexporting countries p lanned to restrict production and thus force prices higher.

title: Study Challenges Carter Position Against Breeder Atom Reactors
description: WASHINGTON, May 10A study sponsored by the Rockefller Foundation has challenged the policies of the Carter Administration on the peaceful uses of nuclear energy and urged the United States to start an intensive program of international cooperation for development of the controversial fast breeder reactor.

title: COLLEGE TAX CREDIT BILL SENT TO FLOOR OF HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (UPI)  The House Rules Committee today cleared for floor action a tax credit bill for college tuition that could save parents up to $250 a year in taxes.

title: China Asks Ozawa To Conduct, Teach
description: Seiji Ozawa, the Japanese conductor of the Boston Symphony Orchestra, has been invited to Peking by the Government of the People's Republic of China without his orchestra. Mr. Ozawa. who is expected to arrive on June 11 for eight days, has been asked to spend his time with the Central Philharmonic Orchestra of Peking, living with the musicians in their dormitory, working with them and teaching them something about performance traditions of Western music.

title: A.B.A. Chief Criticizes Carter's Attack on Lawyers
description: WASHINGTON, May 10William B. Spann Jr., the president of the American Bar Association, counterattacked President Carter today for his criticism of the legal profession, characterizing the President's speech last week as simplistic, misinformed and politically inspired.

title: Home Improvement
description: SUBTERRANEAN termites the kind that do most of the damage to buildings  actually live in the soil, not in the house. They feed on cellulose, the principal ingredient in wood, so structures made of wood provide the most readily available source of food when the colony cannot find enough in the ground near its nest.

title: Greek Premier Shuffles Cabinet, Appointing 2 Liberal Ministers
description: ATHENS, May 10 (Reuters)Prime Minister Constantine Caramanlis of Greece appointed two liberal politicians and accepted the resignation of Foreign Minister Panayotis Papaligouras in Cabinet shuffle today.

title: BROWN SAYS SAUDIS WILL ACCEPT CURBS ON THE USE OF F15'S
description: WASHINGTON, May 10Defense Secretary Harold Brown said today that Saudi Arabia had agreed to prohibitions and restrictions on the use of F15 fighter planes it wants to buy.

title: MAY 20 DEADLINE SET ON CITY FISCAL GOALS
description: At the urging of Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal, participants in talks on New York City's fiscal problems yesterday set what they called a deadline of May 20 for resolving all of the complicated issues that have held up renewed Federal aid to the city: agreement on union contracts, bond purchases by pension funds and financial institutions, and legislation on borrowig ceilings of the Municipal Assistance Corporation.

title: Writing In Style
description: WHO ever said writers had to be tweedy and motheaten and palefaced and flabby and stay hunched over a typewriter in a booktumbled garret? No such stereotypes apply to the bestselling author Nancy Friday or her husband, the novelist William Manville.

title: Former Secretary Agrees to Give Up $ 1 Million in Gifts
description: The former secretary of an 86yearold retired vice president of General Motors agreed yesterday in State Supreme Court to return $1 million in stocks and art workincluding a Renoirshe had said were gifts from him.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: There are three foreign armies in Lebanon todaythe P.L.O., the Syrians and the Israelis. The Lebanese people want all of them out of their country and deserve the right of selfdetermination without the presence of foreign troops. A lasting solution of the crisis can only be achieved by expelling all these foreign troops and turning over control of all Lebanese territory to the Lebanese army.

title: Has Conran's Conquered The Colonies?; Has Conran's Conquered the Colonies?
description: WHEN Conran's, the American version of England's Habitat, unveiled its glass walls to the public seven months ago, Terence Conran, chairman of the operation, and his associates more than once implied that they were going to teach us poor benighted Americans a thing or two about retailing.

title: Resorts Tells Casino Commission F.B.I. Has Cleared It of Crime Tie
description: TRENTON, May 10An attorney for Resorts International told a public hearing today that the Federal Bureau of Investigation had investigated the company and had found no ties with organized crime.

title: The U.N. Today
Backgammon:
description: Gino Scalamandre, one of the world's toprated players, won the important Clermont Club spring tournament last week in London. His path to victory was unusually difficult. In several matches he staged dramatic comebacks to avoid being eliminated. For example, in his 17point semifinal match against John Sterling he appeared to have little hope when he fell behind, 15 , to 9. However, his luck changed just in time and he won all the remaining games. Similarly, he Was in serious trouble in the 21point final against Raoul Rosenzweig from West Germany. Rosenzweig won 10 games in a row to take a strong 14to6 lead. Again, however, Scalamandre rallied to tie the score, 20 to 20. He then won the final game at double match point.

title: Times and News Set July 4th as Deadline For Pressmen's Pact
description: The New York Times and the Daily News yesterday set a July 4 weekend deadline for a new labor contract with the pressmen's union, but did not say what they would do if the deadline were not met. The Times employs 574 pressmen; The News 700 fulltime and 250 parttime.

title: Village Voice Names New Editor
description: The Village Voice yesterday announced the appointment of an editorinchief, and the newspaper's staff issued a statement vowing not to work for any new editor imposed on us in secret and without warning by the management.

title: Police Subdue a Hospital Worker Who Killed Wife and Unborn Child
description: POTTSTOWN, Pa., May 10 (AP)A 27yearold hcspital worker stabbed and mutilated his pregnant wife today, killing her and her unborn child, and slashed his daughter and grandmother, the police said.

title: Top Pop Records
description: These are the most popular albums and singles nationwide, compiled by Record World, a trade publication. Albums are determined by sales figures from major retail outlets: singles are chosen by combined sales and radio airplay. An asterisk indicates an especially fastselling record.

title: Bridge:
description: The world's oldest pairs tournament will be played at the New York Hilton Hotel at the end of this month, and will be a very special event indeed. Competing in the 50th Goldman Pairs will be a galaxy of past winners headed by Oswald Jacoby of Dallas, who won the very first Goldman in 1929.

title: Gov. Briscoe Stays Execution
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 10 (UPI)Gov. Dolph Briscoe issued a stay of execution today to keep a convicted murderer, William David Hovila, alive for at least 30 more days, even though he Wants to die.

title: Issue and Debate
description: When the National Associaion of Secondary School Principals recently set forth proposals to help stem the tide of falling scores on the Scholastic Aptitude Test, the recommendations were assured a receptive audience.

title: Philippine Troops Kill 81 Rebels In Attempt to Rescue 37 Hostages
description: MANILA, May 10 (Reuters)Government troops shot and killed 81 Moslem rebels and wounded 85 in an attempt to rescue 37 hostages taken from a ferryboat in the southern Philippines, the Detense Department said today.

title: TWO TRAINS ARE REMOVED FROM DROPSERVICE LIST
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (UPI)Two trains that the Transportation Department had included on a list of recommended terminations from Amtrak routes have been removed from the list. They are the Adirondack from New York to Montreal and the Niagara Rainbow from Detro't to Buffalo and New York.

title: The Economic Scene
description: Leonard Silk discusses the Administration's fight against inflation while raising the trigger prices on imported steel. ??.

title: Taxi Drama.: Small Cast
description: The new system of taxis lining up in the theater district for departing theatergoers has been plagued by a shortage of vehicles during the periods of peak demand, the chairman of the Taxi and Limousine Commission said yesterday.

title: Curare Defense Seeks to Prove a Patient Died From Other Causes
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., May 10The defense in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich sought to show today that other causes  especially substandard medical care at Riverdell Hospitalhad resulted in the death of a patient whom Dr. Jascalevich is accused of killing.

title: Princess Margaretto Be Divorced
description: LONDON, May 10Princess Margaret and the Earl of Snowdon announced today that they would be divorced, ending two years of formal separation and 18 years of marriage.

title: Market Place
description: The 5.75 percent revenue bonds of the Chesapeake Bay Bridge & Tunnel Authority touched 93 this week and holders who bought the bonds on issuance 18 years ago must have felt some relief.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Commercial Banks to Be Allowed To Issue FloatingRate Certificate
description: WASHINGTON, May 10The nation's commercial banks and savings institutions will be permitted to issue sixmonth certificates of deposit at floating interest rates under a plan just approved by three Federal bank regulatory agencies, Government sources said today.

title: Disks: Woody Shaw
description: JAZZ ALBUMS that are slickly produced with an eye on the marketplace routinely sell hundreds of thousands of copies these days, and the commercial pressures on musicians, especially musicians who record for major record companies, are overwhelming. Often the pres

title: Doug Williams Is Happy... but
description: About an hour and a half after the National Football League draft began last week, Doug Williams was sitting Coach Eddie Robinson's office at Grambling University when the telephone rang. The Tampa Bay Bucs were calling to inform him that he had been their firstround choice, the 17th player selected, the first quarterback. Even more important sociologically, he was the first black quarterback ever taken in the first round who was projected as a quarterback. Back in 1968, the Oakland Raiders named Eldridge Dickey of Tennessee State in the first round, but transferred him to wide receiver. But after 98 touchdown passes at Grambling with a wrist snap reminiscent of the young Joe Namath, Doug Williams will be a quarterback at the Bucs training camp.

title: Atlantic Richfield to Dismantle Anaconda's New York Headquarters
description: The Atlantic Richfield Company, which bought the Anaconda Company, the copper giant, early in 1977 for $700 million, is dismantling Anaconda's New York headquarters staff instead of moving intact to Denver as originally planned.

title: JAY D. RUNKLE
description: Jay D. Runkle, a former merchandise manager for B. Altman & Company, died Monday in Community Memorial Hospital, Cheboygan, Mich. He was 88 years old and lived in Cheboygen.

title: Heavy Blow, Husband Says
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 10Arkady Sheirchenko said today in a statement that the death of his wife was a heavy blow and he charged that the Soviet authorities had forced her to reurn to Moscow.

title: OTHER CAUSES CITED BY CURARE DEFENSE
description: HACKENSACK, May 10The defense in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich sought to show today that other causesespecially substandard medical care at Riverdell Hospitalhad resulted in the death of a patient whom Dr. Jascalevich is accused of killing.

title: Man to Be Tried in DogStabbing
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 13 (UPI)A man accused of stabbing a police dog has been ordered to stand trial in District Court. The police said Jodie Fizer, 18 years old, was in his home screaming and waving a butcher knife. The dog, Blazer, was stabbed in the neck when he caught up with Mr. Fizer, who was trying to elude officers.

title: Princess Margaretto Be Divorced
description: LONDON, May 10Princess Margaret and the Earl of Snowdon announced today that they would be divorced, ending two years of formal separation and 18 years of marriage.

title: Michigan House Expels Member Convicted in Embezzlement Case
description: LANSING, Mich., May 10 (AP)The Michigan House voted today to expel a popular colleague who had been convicted of embezzling $24,000 from an heiress whom he had represented as an attorney.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, MAY 11, 1978

title: Soviet Diplomat's Wife Is Suicide
description: MOSCOW, May 10Leongina I. ShevcIlenko, the wife of the Soviet diplomat who defected last month in the United States, was reported today to have killed herself with an overdose of sleeping pills in her Moscow apartment.

title: On BigShot Crooks
description: LOS ANGELESToo often these bigshot crooks escape the full conse quences of their acts, President Carter told the lawyers of California. Justice must be blind to rank, power and Position.

title: U.S. and Local Inquiries Begun Into Alleged Selling Of Admissions to Medical Institution in Westchester
description: Federal and local officials have begun separate investigations into allegations by doctors formerly on the staff of the New York Medical College that places in the institution's freshman classes have been sold for as much as $100,000 each.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Death

title: Keeping Up With Freshwater Fish Records
description: After 68 years of keeping freshwater gamefish records, the editors of Field and Stream magazineprobably with a sigh of relief have turned over teir voluminous ledgers, and the ongoing chore, to the International Game Fish Association.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: IS IT possible for a conventional novel to do justice to the holocaust? Stefan Kanfertelevision and film writer, Time magazine book review editor, and author of The Journal of the Plague Years, about the witch hunts of the 1950'shas certainly made an honest effort in his first novel, The Eighth Sin, about a gypsy boy named Benoit who grows up haunted unto terminal despair by the memory of his deathcamp experiences. The story's epistolary text, addressed by Ben to his foster child, Daniel, is studied with excerpts from Nazigenocide literature, which serves to lend Ben's odyssey a horrifying documentary patina.

title: Service for Paul McGrath
description: A memorial service for Paul McGrath, the actor, will be held at 3 P.M. tomorrow at the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour, 59 Park Avenue, at 38th Street. Mr. McGrath died of a heart attack April 13 in London, where he and his wife were visiting.

title: Playoff Talk Starting Early Among Jets
description: As the New York Jets looked through that mysterious, valuable piece of property known as a playbook the last few days, they discovered a longforgotten insight: It made sense.

title: Best's Misbehavior Draws Suspension
description: PASADENA, Calif., May 10 (AP)  The Los Angeles Aztecs have suspended George Best indefinitely for skipping practice.

title: Bomb Kills Policeman In Argentine Garage.
description: BUENOS AIRES, May .10 (AP)A bomb exploded in a basement garage of the World Soccer Cup press center today, killing a police bomb expert and wounding an undetermined number of people, the police said.

title: 76ers Beat Bullets, Trail in Series, 32
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 10The Philadelphia 76ers, with their National Basketball Association championship hopes crumbling, resorted to team play tonight, something they don't usually do. and routed the Washington Bullets, 10794, in the fifth game of the Eastern Conference final playoffs at the Spectrum. The victory closed the Bullets lead in the fourofsevengame series to 32. The sixth game will be played Friday night in Landover, Md.

title: A GoldRush Relic Faces Bulldozers in San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 10Lastminute effort; are under way here to save the remains of a ship that was ahandoned in the Gold Rush and unearthed two weeks ago when construction crews began excavation for a downtown office building.

title: Czechs Hijack a Plane to Frankfurt
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, May 10 (AP)Hijackers seeking political asylum surrendered today after having forced Czechoslovak airliner with 46 persons aboard to fly to West Germany, police and airport officials said.

title: Unlucky Sister Of the Queen
description: LONDON, May 10An elderly Cockney woman drinking beer in a London pub tonight summed up the current British attitude toward Princess Margaret. She's been very, very naughty, the woman said.

title: Atlantic City Locale Picked for Major Film
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 10This resort will become in August, the setting of a major motionpicture production, the director of the state's Motion Picture Development Commission announced at a news conference today.

title: Piano: Silverman Debut
description: ROBERT SILVERMAN's recital in Alice Tully Hall last Sunday night was his New York debut, but judging from both the quality of his playing and the extent of his career to date, this 40yearold Canadian pianist can scarcely be considered a fledgling artist.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: Deaths

title: On 30th Year, Israel Honors Past, Ponders Present, Charts Future
description: JERUSALEM, May 10After a day of intense mourning for its thousands of war dead, Israel tonight began celebrating its 30 tumultuous years as an independent nation.

title: China Asks Ozawa To Conduct, Teach
description: Seiji Ozawa, the Japanese conductor of the Boston Symphony Orchestra, has been invited to Peking by the Government of the People's Republic of China  without his orchestra. Mr. Ozawa. who is expected to arrive on June 11 for eight days, has been asked to spend his time with the Central Philharmonic Orchestra of Peking, living with the musicians in their dormitory, working with them and teaching them something about performance traditions of Western music.

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY, MAY 10, 1978

title: ApartmentHunting, in Black and White
description: WILMINGTON, Del.  Appalling was the term used by Patricia R. Harris, the Secretary of the Department of Housing and Urban Development, in releasing the results of a H.U.D.financed study indicating that only one of four blacks is given the same choice as a white person when seeking an apartment.

title: Primary Results in Nebraska Produce a Mixed Outlook for Democrats
description: LINCOLN, Neb., May 10With yesterday's primary election behind them, Nebraska Democrats are looking forward to November with some optimism about their chances of finally seizing control, of the Congressional delegation in this traditionally Republican state.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Fordham defeated C. W. Post, 51, yesterday to win the Metropolitan Collegiate Baseball Conference title for the first time since 1942.

title: Dollar. Loses Some Of Its Recent Gains
description: The dollar slipped against most major currencies in light foreign exchange trading in New York and abroad yesterday, giving up part of the gains made earlier this week, The Associated Press reported.

title: ALLEGHENY LUDLUM SETS 7.5% PRICE RISE ON STAINLESS STEEL
description: The Allegheny Ludlum Steel Corporation, the nation's largest producer of stainless steel, announced yesterday that it would raise the price of a certain grade of stainless sheet and strip by 7.5 percent, effective June 1.

title: British Cabinet Loses Parliament Vote Again
description: LONDON, May 10 (Reuters)Britain's Labor Government tonight suffered its second defeat in Parliament this week on tax issues but once again said it would not resign.

title: U.S, URGING ISRAELIS TO BACK PEACE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 10The Carter Administration urged Israel today to accept the latest AmeriCan peace proposals as perhaps the only possibility for breaking the deadlock in Middle East peace efforts.

title: LABOR REJECTS PLEA BY CARTER TO ACCEPT GUIDELINES ON WAGES
description: WASHINGTON, May 10Organized labor rejected a plea by President Carter today to accept voluntary wage guidelines as part of a unified national struggle against inflation.

title: Connecticut Swears In  Woman Justice
description: HARTFORD, May 10 (UPI)A Yale law professor and mother of three was today sworn in as the first woman member of the Connecticut Supreme Court. Ellen Ash Peters, 48 years old, was sworn in by Gov. Ella T. Grasso, a mother of three and the state's first woman Governor. It's a great time to be a justice and it's a great time to be a woman, said Mrs. Peters, who has never practiced law or served as a judge.

title: NASSAU RESIDENTS FACING MAJOR PROPERTYTAX RISE
description: MINEOLA, L.I., May 10Nassau County residents appear to face a substantial increase in their property taxes next year as a result of a decision by the county's Republican legislative delegation today not to support any increase in the county sales tax.

title: When May a Businessman Study Talmud?; Seven Years to Complete; Leaders Are Rotated
description: Shortly after noon on weekdays, while most employees of the State Insurance Department scan luncheon menus in the adjacent Wall Street area, Issmar Dier, an examiner in the department, partakes of his steady diet of Talmudic readings.

title: The Urban Homesteader: Joy and Pain
description: WHEN Barry and Lynn Israel  he's a lawyer, she's a physical therapist  moved into a decaying old house in Washington two years ago, it was partly because they wanted to be near the capital's cultural attractions.

title: AMERICAN MOTORS RECALL IS ANNOUNCED BY E.P.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP)The Federal Government ordered the American Motors Corporation today to recall most of its 1976 automobiles for exhaust system repairs, an action that could cost the smallest United States car manufacturer $3.1 million.

title: Former Secretary Agrees to Give Up $ 1 Million in Gifts
description: The former secretary of an 86yearold retired vice president of General Motors agreed yesterday in State Supreme Court to return $1 million in stocks and art workincluding a Renoirshe had said were gifts from him.

title: Rhodesia Leaders Greeted Coldly at a Rural Rally
description: MREWA, Rhodesia, May 10A crowd of 600 black people sat impassively here today as Ian D. Smith and two of his black coleaders in Rhodesia's transitional Government stood on a weedy soccer field explaining that peace and oneman, onevote majority rule were now at hand.

title: Ambassador in Bogota Abducted,  Then Freed
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, May 10 (AP)The Nicaraguan Ambassador to Colombia, William Barquero Montiel, was dragged from his house today by four armed men and released unharmed two hours later, a police spokesman reported.

title: Talmadge's Former Wife Enters. Contest for a Seat in the House
description: ATLANTA, May 10It was as if Scarlett O'Hara had taken Rhett Butler's retort and thrown it right back at him. She was not going to think about it tomorrow.

title: CIVIL SERVICE CHANGE SUGGESTED BY BYRNE
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May 10 (AP)Governor Byrne urged New Jersey legislative leaders today to make state Civil Service reform a top priority of the fall legislative session.

title: Adelphi Beats Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, May 10Kevin Miller scored five goals to lead Adelphi University to a 2315 victory over the University of Baltimore today in the first round of the National Collegiate Division II lacrosse playoffs. David Sells added four goals for the winners, who face Roanoke College in the quarterfinals Saturday.

title: MacPhail Warns Players on Betting From Clubhouse
description: President Lee MacPhail of the American League warned league clubs yesterday about players betting on horses in or from the clubhouses.

title: How Many People Reach a Goal?; Red Smith; Sports of The Times; Show Biz; Who Did He Beat?
description: GROSSINGER, N.Y., May 11Larry Holmes, who has never lost a prizefight, sparred four rounds with Jody Ballard. showing swift hands and a jab that snapped like bullwhip. He flogged the big bag with blows that had 212 solid pounds behind them. He played on the speedbag with .practiced hands, and the pounding rhythm was the next thing to music. His white satin trunks were drenched when he pulled on a robe and sat down to talk with visitors.

title: Levitt Shocked at Being Left Out. Of Fiscal, Parley With Blumenthal
description: Arthur Levitt, who is retiring as the New York State. Comptroller, said yesterday that he was shocked and annoyed that he had not been invited to the highlevel meeting on Wednesday with Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal at which a May 20 deadline was set for resolving New York Citys financial issues.

title: Dance. Sweet Games
description: A program of his dances, performed Wednesday at the Theater of the Riverside Church by the. David Anderson Dance Company, suggested a real concern for his dancers. They are a welltrained and appealing group, and he makes them look better. But what was for the most part aneevening of sweet games for dancers very quickly began to wear thin.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TOMORROW, May 13

title: Environmentalist Disputes Priorities
description: TUXEDO, N.Y.After four decades of scholarship and research on the troubled relationship between people and their environment, a leading environmental scientist is convinced that American society now has its ecological and health priorities confused.

title: Friends Gathre Tonight To Remember Will Geer
description: Friends of Will Geer, the actor who died last month, will gather for a Farewell to Will Geer, tonight at at the Martin Luther King Jr. Center, 310 West 43d Street. Film, theater and music people, including Pete Seeger, Arlo Guthrie and Howard daSilva, will speak about Mr. Geer and sing some of the songs that he wrote with Woody Guthrie.

description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Stock Exchange and (0) over-thecounter.

title: About Real Estate New Industrial Park: A Rebirth Plan in Port Washinton Area
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I.  Everyone hereabout knows the Port Washington sandpits, the scarred western shoreline of Hempstead Harbor. Its 1,200 acres have been mined at least since 1880 by the Colonial Sand and Stone Company and others, supplying sand for the Concrete needs of construction in th entire metropolitan area.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Florida Power & Light Comport} announced today that it had sued the Westinghouse Electric Corporation. Florida Power is seeking damages for allegedly faulty equipment in two nuclear power plants supplied by Westinghouse.

title: Carey Names Willowbrook's U.S. Court Monitor to Administer Its Reorganization
description: A Federal Court monitor who has frequently criticized New York's slowness in reforming and reducing the huge Willowbrook Developmental Center for the re- tarded has been appointed by Governor Carey to handle the Implementation of the court's orders, among other tasks.
