Events Today
description: The Bronx Is Up: Boroughwide celebration, including music, dance, art and other festivities; for details on times and locations of these activities, call 294.7932.

title: New White House Moves on Inflation
description: President Carter, whose commitment to battle inflation has thus far been limited to calls for voluntary wageprice restraint, last week moved to get his own bureaucratic house in order.

title: A New and Different Life for Pele
description: They lead him around the way the Secret Service leads the President, respectfully but firmly. Pedro Garay, a Cuban expatriate, risen from bodyguard to personal assistant, wearing rich suits now, smoking imported cigarettes. Julio Mazzei, preferring the title of Professor, a soccer coach with a doctorate in physical education. They are his advance men and constant companions as he travels the world protecting the economic interests of the companies that rent his name, smile and reputation. They have made out his daily schedule, down to the hour, through October.

title: I.O.C. Denies Misleading Los Angeles
description: ATHENS, May 20Insisting that he would not get involved in throwing stones, Lord Killanin ended the International Olympic Committee's 80th general meeting today by denying that Los Angeles had been misled privately by I.O.C. officials.

title: Jet Trails
description: Arming the Arabs is no trivial matter. It is, or should be, an act of high policy. But for a time in recent days it has been an occasion for the most inflammatory politics. People on both sides are still reviling each other. They should understand that the base motives they claim to see at work in this debate can in fact be recklessly awakened.

title: TaxFree Properties On an Upward March
description: Real estate in New York City has an assessed value of more than $63 billion this year. But only $38 billion worth is taxable.

description: BLOOMFIELD (Bloomfield College, Franklin and Fremont Streets)  The Shadow Box, in an Actor's CafTheater production. Thursday through Saturday, 8:30 P.M. $3.50$5.50; students and the elderly, $2.50$4.50. (201) 4297662. Westminster Theater.

Appel, a writer of fiction and poetr??, were married yesterday in the Rive??daleYonkers Society for Ethical Cu??ture in the Bronx. Dr. Matthee I?? Spetter, a society leader, performed t?? ceremony.

title: Great Lakes Fishing Losing DDT Faster Than Scientists Expected
description: WINDSOR, Ontario, May 20 (AP)DDT is disappearing from fish in the Great Lakes faster than expected, a research scientist, Victor Bierman Jr., of the United States Environmental Protection Agency says.

title: At Home: The Great
description: WE take the Jeep, of course with its fourwheeldrive, winch, and sidemounted pick, shovel, ax and crowbar. In their Bean Vagabond Packs, my wife and daughter carry the Stanley Vacuum Bottles, the Frontier Camp Ware and the food. The Folding Camp Table (seats four) is my responsibility, while my son is charged with the Smoke 'N Pit Barbecue.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: ART Imitation of Life
description: HARTFORD THE Tapestry Room at the Wadsworth Atheneum no longer houses tapestries, as its regular visitors know, but instead has American paintings of the 18th and 19th centuries. These are temporarily acting as a backdrop to six lifesize figures by Duane Hanson, an artist in Americana whose reputation should soon be rivaling Norman Rockwell's.

title: Reverend Charity; MIRACLE JAWS 2 HIGH IDEALS? Charity
description: CHARITY TABERNACLE, a North Carolina church that resembles a bowling alley, has a neon sign that reads, JESUS THE LIGHT OF THE WORLD. Next to it is a billboard showing a mangled Jesus on the Cross with the caption, IS IT NOTHING TO YOU? A more baroque church in Los Angeles comes complete with potted palms and Busby Berkeleyesque swimming pool: Above it dropping rose petals on the water, young women white gowns and cotton angel wings swung from invisible strings, like Christmas seraphim in a store window. Sister Aimee said they were God's Flying Squadron of Virgins. These images typify the almost surreal vulgarity of Miracle, Dotson Rader's new, excruciatingly accurate novel about fundamentalist Christianity.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 7 P.M. (Channel 2) 60 Minutes: A controversial taxcut proposition in California and the man behind it; juvenile crime; a followup on the two black students who challenged George C. Wallace.

title: Boys High Triumphs in Eddy Track
description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y., May 20Brian Denman won the 440yard dash, then anchored victories in the 440and 880yard relays today, pacing Boys and Girls High School of Brooklyn to the team championship in the 38th annual William F. Eddy Jr. Memorial track meet at Mount Pleasant High School.

title: HOME CLINIC A Way to Beat Lightning to the Punch
description: WE ARE entering the time of year when the weather forecast, frequently ends with the prediction local thunderstorms are likely. And thunderstorms usually mean lightning, that awesome display of atmospheric electricity that causes many fires and millions of dollars worth of property damage each year.

title: `Keep It Simple, Says Sy Oliver
description: The Rainbow Room is what a Hollywood set designer thinks a night club looks like but never does, said Sy Oliver. He looked around appreciatively at the pink and gold expanse of the room. Couples and parties of couples dined, talking and laughing, at candlelit tables set on terraces around the blond parquet dance floor. Chandeliers gleamed in mirrors, and in the windows the lights of the city were jewels in a blackness far below.

title: Marriage Announcement 3  No Title
description: Elizabeth Archer Wed

title: DINING OUT A Menu So Good It Can Travel
description: THE ARCH, a restaurant on the Westchester scene for nearly 15 years, moved last summer from its North Salem site to somewhat larger quarters in Brewster. Though it could not take along the stone arch after which it was named, we are glad to report that the excellence of its food has survived the move.

title: FOOD
description: MORRISTOWN IT'S not every day that you can buy parsley bread, violet jelly, lavender fans, witches charms, calico wreaths, tussymussy bouquets, plants like orach and skirret and herbs like woundwort, corn frey, wormwood and wode.

title: Scott Dennett Fiance Of Virginia Wheeler
description: Mr. and Mrs. Willard L. Wheeler Jr. of Darien, Conn, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Virginia Elisabeth Wheeler, to Scott Joseph Dennett, son of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Dennett. also of Darien.

title: The Waterbed Has Come Out of the Closet
description: LOS ANGELES  The waterbedbane of landlords, butt of jokesseemed destined to be a dinosaur, one of those products that quietly passed into the annals of American curiosities. But for all its thousands of pounds of weight and eccentric ways, the waterbed is today far from extinct.

title: American Motors Extending Recall To 85,000 Units Sold in California
description: SOUTHFIELD, Mich., May 20 (AP)The American Motors Corporation announced yesterday that it was extending its latest recall of AMC cars and Jeeps to Include some 85,000 units that were sold in California and suspected of having defective emissionscontrol units.

title: Up the Laundry Room!
description: Getting out the ring around the collar was once about all a person could hope for in a visit to the laundry room. But increasingly there is more to a laundry room than the wash. It is new and improved, like detergents.

title: U.S. Scientists Cancel Soviet Trip In Protest Over the Trial of Orlov
description: WASHINGTON, May 20All 19 members of an American delegation to a scientific symposium in Moscow next week announced today that they had canceled participation to protest the trial and sentencing this week of Yuri F, Orlov, a Soviet physicist.

title: Publicly Owned Packers Report Low Profits for 77
description: The Green Bay Packers, the only publicly owned team in the National Football League and therefore the only one to display its financial laundry, earned only $266,810 last year on a gross income of $7.1 million and the profit was 40 percent less than in 1976. There was, however, one extraordinary expense that helped to reduce the earnings to 3.7 percent of the gross take. But the television income for each team will jump this year from $2.1 million to $5 million and the Packer profit figures are going to soar for this year regardless of how the team does on the field.

title: HONE CLINIC A Way to Beat Lightning to the Punch
description: WE ARE entering the time of year when the weather forecast frequently ends with the prediction local thunderstorms are likely. And thunderstorms usually mean lightning, that awesome display of atmospheric electricity that causes many fires and millions of dollars worth of property damage each year.

title: JERSEY POLICE GET LENIENT I.R.S. AUDITS
description: NEWARK, May 19An official of the Internal Revenue Service said today that accountants auditing the tax returns of 2,300 present and former New Jersey state troopers, many of whom owe thousands of dollars in back taxes on meal allowances, had been told to be as lenient as possible in requiring substantiation for deductions.

title: LETTER FROM STONY BROOK For Commuters, A Feeling of Separate Worlds
description: EXCEPT for the classroom, James Fontana regards the 1,100acre Stony Brook campus as the exclusive domain of resident students.

title: THEATER `Pippin eplayed Minus the Frills
description: EAST WINDSOR THE musical Pippin was the darling of Broadway in 1972 and for several seasons after that. At the time, despite the many people who worked on it and a performance by Ben Vereen as the Leading Player that made him a star, what Pippin really seemed to be was a showcase for the dazzling talents of Bob Fosse as directorchoreographer. His dance numbers were breathtaking, his staging electric, and he had the good sense to stage the show without an intermission, preventing the audience from leaving out of weariness with the book. For underneath all the razzledazzle, Pippin seemed a bore. Despite its eighthcentury setting and making the son of Charlemagne the central character, it wo jpst another story of a young Everyman asking what life was all about.

title: Waiting for That One Big Break
description: IT can be like living in a space capsule, says Gary Sachs, owner of the Arcadia Ballroom, a rock music showplace in New Haven. You're together night and day, Often dealing with five or six tremendous egos. It's not an easy life, and you've got to want it very badly.

title: ART The Now and Future Classic
description: HUNTINGTON A GOLDEN age of photography is upon us. An unprecedented number of photographic displays have been held throughout the country this spring, and many museums and galleries that might have mounted shows of painting and sculpture in the past have concentrated on photography. In the metropolitan area, such exhibitions have especially flourished, and particularly on the Island.

title: News Summary
description: SUNDAY, MAY 21, 1978

title: Dental Insurance Plans Covering More Costs for More Americans
description: The cost of tooth care is increasingly being carried by one of the fastest growing categories of employee fringe benefits dental insurance.

title: `Desert Song, Operetta, Affectionately Sung by Village Group
description: What to do about The Desert Song'? Five years ago. Sigmund Romberg's once popular 1926 operetta was revived on Broadway, where its dated aspects were least likely to be disguised, and most people agreed that the music was still wonderful but the book impossible. Perhaps the answer would be tender loving care from a national operetta repertory company, if such a thing existed.

title: Civil Liberties Union Urges Court Review Of Decision by V. A.
description: A new handbook published by the American Civil Liberties Union contends that the frequently arbitrary Veterans Administration should be subject to judicial review as are all other agencies.

title: Article 2  No Title
PAPERBACK AUCTION: WHAT PRICE A HOT BOOK?; STAR PROPERTIES
description: It was the winter before last that Howard Kaminsky, president of Warner Books Inc., a paperback publishing house, asked Paula Diamond, subsidiaryrights director at Harper & Row, over a lunch of fettuccine and white wine to tell him the name of the hot book on her spring list. She leaned over the table, whispered, The Thorn Birds, and proceeded to describe a then unpublished novel by an unknown writer about three generations of Australian sheepherders.

title: DINING OUT A Reminder of Prohibition Days
description: IT'S just the way it was when I came here during Prohibition 50 years ago, said the senior member of our party, as we parked among the Cadillacs and walked past a derelict barn and shed toward a white clapboard house that was straight out of Bonnie and Clyde.

title: LONG ISLAND JOURNAL
description: THE Republicans have an 11to7 majority on the Suffolk County Legislature, but the discontent over the leadership of that body  and of the party itself  has risen so much that the G.O.P. can no longer count on automatic approval of any partybacked easure.

title: Miss Munves Wed To David Sherman
description: Elizabeth Ann Munves, a securities analyst with Salomon Brothers, was married last evening to David Michael Sherman, an account executive with the Fund Monitoring Service in New York, an independent auditor for pension funds.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Grania Beauregard, Senior in Nursing, Wed to George N. Allport, Underwriter
description: Grania Nano Michelle Beauregard, daughter of Mrs. William H. Crocker and Henry G. Beauregard of Washington, was married there yesterday afternoon to George Nichols Allport, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter W. Allport of Bronxville. N.Y.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: From the loins of the Newport Music Festival, which is celebrating its 10th anniversary from July 14 to July 22 (with a prefestival weekend July 8 and 9), has sprung a new one, also to be held in the famous Rhode Island resort town. Let's go back to'.1969. At that time Glen Sauls got the idea of presenting concerts in the fabled mansions of Newport. He wanted to reconstruct the 19thcentury salon, and he started a festival of Romantic music.

title: Sunday Observer
description: It was a mean town. It was a curse on the lips of everybody in the territory. It's time to clean that town up, everybody said. Restore law and order. Make it fit for kids to go to Sunday school again and for schoolmarms to walk the streets. Slop the bamboozling and cheating and stealing and shooting.

title: Shows and Sales

title: Admiral Took an Unlawful Role In Navy Discipline, fudge Rules
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., May 20 (UPI)Rear Adm. Roy F. Hoffman, commandan of the Sixth Naval District, used unlawful command influence over the service's judicial process, a Navy judge has ruled.

title: Rags to Riches

The results of his rummaging showed up on the racks of his Unique Clothing Warehouse, a store in the East Village, and he prospered. But times have changed. Now the 31yearold Mr. Russack fills his store with newly manufactured old clothes. The growing demand for genuine vintage Barb has shrunk the supply, generating tough competitive pressures. Says Mr. Russack, I just couldn't hack it any more.

title: A New Focus On Health
description: WITHOUT fanfare, the Connecticut Health Department has begun to move into a new health area the protection of the public from poisons in the environment, according to Douglas S. Lloyd, the State Health Commissioner.

description: When they arrived at City College for classes, the dashing figure of Mark Twain was spotted at the opening of Shepard Hall. And when they graduated, World War I was a storm that was still gathering over Europe.

title: Makeup of Fiscal Control Board Called Key to City Labor Talks
description: Efforts to untangle New York City's financial problems centered yesterday on a fiscal monitor to oversee the city's monetary affairs, which participants said held the key to unlocking the stalled labor negotiations.

title: Stevenson Keeps Title At Belgrade
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 20 (UPI)The Cuban heavyweight champion, Teofilo Stevenson, retained his title today when he stopped Dragomir Vujkovic of Yugoslavia in the first rcund and gave Cuba its fifth gold medaltwo more than any other country at the second world amateur boxing championships.

title: Bahamas Has Become Main Avenue for Marijuana and Cocaine Illegally Entering U.S.
description: NASSAU, the BahamasWith 700 islands and 2,000 cays almost like steppingstones into Florida, the Bahamas has become the principal avenue for marijuana and cocaine entering the United States illegally from South America.

title: Move to Permit Cameras in Courtrooms Is Gaining Momentum
description: Should courtroom proceedings be televised?In the 13 years since the United States Supreme Court reversed the conviction of Billie Sol Estes because the televising of his trial created such a carnival atmosphere as to deprive him of due process of law, cameras have been banned from almost all the courtrooms in the country.

title: WHOLESALE PRICES FOR BEEF RISE AGAIN
description: WASHINGTON, May 20Wholesale beef prices have climbed again, presaging another retail price rise in the next week or two, and experts said that the only force that might check further increases was another consumer boycott.

title: Bruce Lawrence Atkins Weds Debra Roseberry
description: Debra Ruth Roseberry, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jack V. Roseberry of Woodcliff Lake, N.J., and Bruce Lawrence Atkins, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Atkins of Emerson, N. J., were married yesterday by Rabbi Abraham Krantz at the Tamcrest Country Club in Alpine, N. J.

title: Stolen Children: Pawns in the Battle of Divorce
description: THE ISLAND lost about 120 children last year. They were not killed, beaten, abandoned or hospitalized. They were snatched. One parent took the children and hid, preventing the other parent from seeing or talking to them.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: I t was not a serious work and not one of my favorites, so wrote George Balanchine about Marius Petipa's 19thcentury ballet,Don Quixote. It was this version that Balanchine scrapped when he choreographed his own Don Quixote to a new score by Nicolas Nabokov in 1965. And yet beneath Balanchine's very modern conception in which Don Quixote becomes the narrator as well as hero, the old Petipa ballet still found its echo. Many scenes such as the prologue, the market place of Act I, the puppet show, the divertissements at the Duke's court and the dream of Dulcinea and the dryads, had their counterpart in the Don Quixote, descended from the 1869 Petipa original, as amended by Alexander Gorsky, which Balanchine remembered as a child from the Maryinsky Theater in St. Petersburg. No matter how often it has been criticizedand that hasDon Quixote is quite simply the ballet that will not away.

title: IN BRIEF
description: Time Inc. continued its acquisitive ways last week, announcing lentative plans to merge with the Inland Container Corporation in a cash and stock swap valued at $281 million. Some of Time's most recent acquisitions: the BookoftheMonth Club and The Washington Star. It also has an agreement to purchase the American Television Communications Corporation, a big cableTV system. ... A takeover bid from Sweden's Esselte A.B. brought a firm negative from Dymo Industries, the popularizer of the hand embosser. Esselte, which seeks control of Dymo through its American subsidiary, Oxford Peodaflex, offered $24 a share for all of Dymo's common stock. Dymo said the offer was less than the book value of the company. .. Wood Industries, a manufacturer of printing equipment, rejected as inadequate an $8 a share bid for its common stock from Maschinenfabrik AG, a West German engines and commercial vehicles maker.... Marine Midland Banks Inc. received $100 million of new capital from the Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation in the first step of an agreement that would give Hong Kong and Shanghai a 51 percent stake in Marine Midland by 1980.

title: Carol Jane Wallace Wed To Roy Drysdale Brown
description: Carol Jane Wallace of New York. daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Keene Manning Wallace of Charleston. S.C., and Roy Drysdale Brown, son of Mrs. William Andrew Brown of HenleyonThames, England, and the late Brown., were married yesterday?? Michael's Episcopal Church in Charleston by the Rev. Edwin C. Coleman.

title: Nervous Breakdowns
description: ALAN LELCHUK'S first novel, American Mischief, which came out in 1973 after enormous prepublication ballyhoo, capitalized upon campus unrest; its chief characters were a dean with a harem of six women and a student rebel who, among other exploits, murdered Norman Mailer in an undignified fashion and kidnapped 10 of the nation's top (and readily identifiable) intellectuals. The second novel, Miriam at Thirtyfour (1975), depicted a woman whose progressive sexual liberation led to schizophrenic complicity in her own rape. Both novels were roughly treated by a number of reviewers who objected to what they saw as trendiness and exploitation. Shrinking, Mr. Lelchuk's third, deals with the events leading to the second breakdown of one Lionel Solomon, a 38yearold novelist and teacher of creative writing at a university not unlike Brandeis. Solomon's first breakdown, we are told, resulted from savage reviews of his novels by critics who were outraged by their explicit sexual content. As if anticipating a similar fate for the huge manuscript that makes up the bulk of Shrinking, its fictional author (whose career parallels that of Mr. Lelchuk in a number of respects) invites the reader to compare the reception of his earlier novels with the equally disastrous reception of Melville's Moby Dick.

title: BelgianFrench Rift Over Zaire Reflects Differences in Interests
description: BRUSSELS. May 20The Belgian Government sought today to put more distance between itself and France in the rescue operation in Zaire by publicly stressing that its own objective was purely humanitarian and not to reinforce the Zairian Government in its struggle with the secessionists in Shabv Province, the former Katanga.

description: AVON  Masks and sculpture from New Guinea, through June 30. Lappen Fireside Center, Rte. 44. Phone 6780779.

title: The Nation

The 7to2 ruling, which relaxed considerably Congress insistence that law enforcement agents minimize the interception of private conversations during courtapproved surveillance, was one more step in the gradual rewriting of criminal laws under Chief Justice Warren E. Burger.

title: ART VIEW
description: MINNEAPOLIS At the age of 73, Isamu Noguchi can look back what is probably the most varied and farreaching career in the history of American sculpture. Indeed, no other sculptor of our timeAmerican or otherwisehas extended the interests of modern sculpture into so many areas of public life while continuing to produce with a prodigal abundance and exquisite invention the kind of smallscale art object that, whether encountered in a museum, a gallery or a private collection, affords an essentially private experience. Mr. Noguchi is at once one of the purest of living sculptors, having sustained and refined for half a century a commitment to the kind of absolute form first glimpsed in the work of his master, Brancusi, and one of the most socially oriented, exulting the large public projects in which this world of ideal form obliged to accommodate itself to the rude demands of daily use. He has designed parks and playgrounds, outdoor sculpture, gardens, fountains and public plazas, for some of the world's busiest cities. He has worked a good deal in the theater, especially in collaboration with Martha Graham; and with his series of akari lamps, he has produced one of the classics of modern interior design. Earlier this year, his 36foothigh sculpture, called Portal, was installed on the plaza of the Justice Center in Clevelandit was discussed on this page on February 19and later this year an even more immense enterprise, the Civic Center Plaza occupying acres of downtown Detroit and crowned with a huge fountain, will be completed. At the same time, visitors to the new East building of the National Gallery of Art in Washington next month will find one of his most severe and elegant stone carvings prominently placed in the highdomed great hall, where it holds its own in the company of Calder, Miro, Caro and other classicists of modern art.

title: What to Do Until the Airplane Comes
description: In the KLM waiting area at Kennedy International Airport on a Monday afternoon two couples from Pekin, Ill., have turned a suitcase into a card table and are playing hearts to pass the time until their flight leaves for Amsterdam.

title: FOOD Meat and Potatoes of Kitchen Utensils
description: STARTING from scratch in the kitchen can be a mindboggling task. Newlyweds, the newly single and thousands of others who change their living arrangements and households must face it. In addition, people whose kitchens have been equipped helterskelter over a period of many years might welcome the opportunity to replace their dated, barely serviceable kitchen tools. But not only is there more cookware on the market today than ever before; there is also more in the way of professionalquality utensils.

title: He Brought Fats To Broadway
description: Richard Maltby Jr., who conceived and directed the new hit musical Ain't Misbehavin, walked very slowly into Sardi's the day most of the reviews appeared. He was wearing a fashionably thin tie and a leather jacket, looking somewhat dazed, and slightly late, but he did not hurry. A friend who'd been involved in another Broadway success had walked into Sardi's on anothet opening night and everyone stood up and cheered. Walk slowly, someone advised, this doesn't happen very often. Mr. Maltby remembered the advice. Nobody was cheering, but only because it was the middle of the afternoon and nobody was there. Mr. Maltby, the son of a society orchestra leader and a successful lyricist, screenwriter and deviser of crossword puzzles, had just read 25 reviews and all of them were ecstatic. The preview and opening night crowds had leaped to their feet at the end of the show as if responding to a cue, roaring.

It was the type with a vineandbars edge and was graded AU55 by the ANA gray book criteria. The wreath reverse was the one that replaced the chain links which some citizens of the new country found too reminiscent of bondage. The design on the front of the coin was the same as that on the chain cent except that an effort was made to smarten up the face of Miss Liberty, which had been described as idiotic.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: THE LITERARY VIEW
description: IN recent weeks  somewhat to our suprise  we have run three frontpage reviews of fiction by young American writers. Mary Gordon's Final Payments is her first novel; John Irving's The World According to Garp is his fourth; Barry Hannah's Airships is his first collection of stories, though he has already published two novels. Irving and Hannah are still in their mid30's ; Mary Gordon is 29. All three have been acclaimed by an impressive array of critics, reviewers and fellow novelists, who range from the familiar bookchat folks to Philip Roth and Denis Donoghue, Mary McCarthy and Richard Gilman, who almost never commit blurbs. These young writers deserve praise: they are strong and original and clearly in touch with life, not just with literary games and fashions. Their books are very different in scale and subject and style, and each of them has a different literary strength: Mary Gordon has a sharp eye for character and social detail ; John Irving has a large gift for narrative and structure; Barry Hannah has a distinctive comic voice.

title: ANTIQUES
description: The muchpublicized plight of the rapidly disappearing American carrousel continues to spur exhibitions, collecting and controversy. Indeed, even the wellintentiOned show The Art of the Carrousel opening Friday at the Brandywine Museum in Chadds Ford, Pa., is bound to attract praise and criticism.

title: Three Poets
description: It would be difficult to find a first book of poems more consistently skilled and poised than this one. You'd have to go back to Richard Wilbur's The Beautiful Changes, which Mr. Shaw's book recalls in tone and stance as well as talent. The key, perhaps, is that he wants to comfort rather than confront the wilderness, not to deny it, but to come to human, nurturing terms with chaos by practiced measures. His virtues are many, both wished for and exemplified, and they reach back through Frost to Ben Jonson and even to Horace. But the Augustan balance doesn't eliminate a modern irony and suspicion. Mr. Shaw's leading virtue may be his need to habituate the twisted, and his Janus, gargoyle and jacko'lantern are made more humanly revealing than the humans who made them. He trusts in the larger orders beyond the dark; as he says of Roethke:

title: More Than Zaire, Less Than Vietnam
description: By the standards now prevailing all over Africa, the United States airsupply shuttle for French and Belgian troops into Zaire hardly deserved to be called an intervention. Eighteen transport planes landing more than 100 miles from the battle against Shaban separatists did not justify any fear of another Vietnam in the making. Nor did the decision to let a dozen Americans alight to unload fuel and handle communications. Our European allies, in competition rather than cooperation, moved again to prop up the shabby regime of President Mobutu and for the sake of their goodwill, if nothing else, this much help seemed justifiable.

title: Hoover's Revenge

description: A former top aide to State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz who was indicted last year on charges of receiving bribes alleged last week that there was a conflict of interest in the handling of his case because the judge who ruled on important pretrial motions was the subject of a corruption investigation.

description: New Yorkers kicked up their heels citywide yesterday, highlighting what seemed a miniseason of festivals compressed into one sunny weekend.

description: INTERNATIONAL STUD, by Hervey Horstein ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? at the Players Theater, 115 Mac ?? Street 6:43.

title: Haitink Leads Beethoven
description: B FRNARD HAIT1NN and the Concertgebouw Orchestra continued their fiveconcert Beethoven cycle at Carnegie Hall on Friday night. The Program consisted of the Egmont Ovet:iure, the Pastorale Symphony and the first Piano Concerto, with Vladimir Ashkenazy as soloist.

title: Laura Berkowitz, a Buyer, Wed to Robert S. Gordon
description: Laura S, Berkowitz and Robert S. Gordon were married yesterday at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Sidney Berkowitz of Chestnut Hill, Mass. Mr. Gordon is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Manuel W. Gordon of Peekskill, N.Y. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Paul Citrin and Cantor Murray Simon, both of Temple Israel in Boston,

title: New High in Research Outlay
description: Spurred by the search for new products, business plans to spend a record total of $34.5 billion for research and development work this year, or 12 percent more than the $30.9 billion expended in 1977.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, MAY 22, 1978

title: Pakistani ExLeader Opens Appeal
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, May 21The Supreme Court of Pakistan was told yesterday that the trial at which former Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto was convicted of murder was biased and poIitical.

title: And No One to Lead
description: JERUSALEM, May 21  An intellectual hawk changes his mind because he sees a chance for real peaceand then finds the country still gripped by his earlier fears. That is the fate of one of Israel's most interesting figures, Gen. Yehoshafat Harkabi. His story has a larger meaning: an extremely depressing one.

title: Andretti Scores Belgian Victory
description: ZOLDER, Belgium, May 21Mario Andretti, driving a new Lotus 79, won the 36th Belgian Grand Prix this afternoon, nine seconds ahead of his teammate, Ronnie Peterson of Sweden. Carlos Reutemann of Argentina took third place and Gilles Villeneuve of Canada was fourth. The latter two drove Ferraris.

title: PBS Urged to Stress Live News
description: RICHARD C. WALD, who was once president of NBC News, has been studying the news and public affairs situation of public television and has come up with proposals for a number of roads it should follow, including routes that will not bring it across the paths of commercial television.

title: Washington Watch
description: WASHINGTONDon't expect much progress soon on the Administration's tax cut (nee reform) proposals. The House Ways and Means Committee does not plan to resume consideration of the measure until after Memorial Day, and even then the prospects are uncertain. Some people are saying it will be almost Christmas before a bill is enacted, and no one has a clear idea of what the final legislation will look like.

title: Ballesteros Prevails
description: EPSOM, England, May 21 (Reuters) Severiano Ballesteros of Spain posted the 14th victory of his career today, scoring a 69 in the final round and a 14underpar total of 270 in a $57,000 international golf tournament. Ballester??s, who went into the last round with a sevenstroke lead, won by five shots from Nick Faldo of Britain, who had a final round of 67.

title: Another Argentine Triumphs
description: FLORENCE, Italy, May 21 (Reuters) Jose Clerc of Argentina, an unranked 19yearold outsider who had to qualify for the $50,000 tournament, won the Grand Prix tennis championship here today by beating Patrick Dominguez of France, 64, 62, 61, in the final.

title: The U.N. Today
Sports Vacations For Adults
description: WHILE a growing number of youngsters spend their summers at sports camps, there is a booming phenomenon that is attracting grownups who want to live in their own sports world. The era of athletic vacations is here.

title: A.D.A. Sees Pernicious Threat From U.S. Rightist Organizations
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (UPI)Americans for Democratic Action warned today in a Citizen's Guide to the Right Wing that rightist forces in America represent a pernicious, if not dangerous, sector of the American political arena.

title: Business People
description: Someone once referred to Thomas Mellon Evans as the ranking heirloom collector of United States business, the heirlooms being familyowned businesses that had fallen on hard times. Now 67 years old, he began companycollecting at the age of 28 with $15,000 from profit on some stock borrowed from a muchricher Mellon for whom he worked in Pittsburgh. That first acquisition was the H.K. Porter Company, a locomotive maker in the red. He turned it into an 18division manufacturer of rubber, electrical and steel products.

title: Outdoors
description: MARTINS CREEK, PA. ASTIFF breeze was ruffling the 36degree waters of the Delaware River when Dennis Scholl and I launched his outboard skiff at MartIns Creek, a few miles north of Easton, for an afternoon of shad fishins.

description: Morning

title: Sports Today
description: Padres vs. Los Angeles Dodgers, at San Diego.

title: Pamela Foa Wed To Paul D. Guyer
description: Pamela Susan Paola Foa, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Foa of New York, and Paul David Guyer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving H. Guyer of San Francisco, were married yesterday afternoon at Temple Sinai in Pittsburgh. Rabbi Alan D. Fuchs officiated.

title: BEHOWITZ FACING SENTENCING TODAY
description: David R. Berkowitz will be sentenced today on all charges stemming from the yearlong shooting rampage known as the Son of Sam murders.

title: Trainer Believes In Alydar
description: BALTIMORE, May 21A few hours after Affirmed beat Alvdar by a neck yesterday in the 103d Preakness, a professional handicapper reached the loser 's trainer by longdistance phone.

title: Nancy Lisagor Is Married to Frank Lipsius
description: Nancy Lisagor of Philadelphia and Frank Lipsius of New York, were married yesterday afternoon at the Barclay Hotel in Philadelphia by Rabbi Jack A. Luxemburg of the Main Line Reform Temple in Philadelphia.

title: Search Fails to Find Tugboat Crewman
description: SANDY HOOK, May 21 (AP)A tugboat crewman presumed dead after he had been thrown overboard when the tug collided with a merchant vessel off the coast here was still missing today, Coast Guard officials said.

title: MISS COSTANZA TO STAY IN HER OFFICE, SHE SAYS
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass., May 21, (UPI) Margaret Costanza, the Presidential assistant threatened with the loss of her prestigious White House office, said today that President Carter has personally .assured her she would remain where she is.

title: Advertising
description: UP to now, the only thing preventing the peanut from becoming our national bird was that it couldn't fly. But the brilliant creative people at Scali, McCabe, Sloven have quite accidentally changed all that in a multimedia campaign for Texas International Airlines.

title: Question Box
description: ?QUESTION: What is the world record in the cleanandjerk in weight lifting, and what is the American record?

title: EGYPT VOTES ON PLAN TO SUPPRESS CRITICS
description: CAIRO, May 21With Egypt's experiment in democracy at a crossroads, it held a controversial national referendum today on a proposal that will, if approved, give President Anwar elSadat a sweeping mandate to crack down on his political critics and limit expression in the press.

title: CHILE HAS AN OPENING IN EXTRADITION PACT
description: WASHINGTON, May 21Government sources here say there is a narrow diplomatic opening through which President Augusto Pinochet Ugarte of Chile could choose to turn over to the United States authorities Chilean citizens who become suspects in the murder of Orlando Letelier. However, the sources saw little chance that President Pinochet would avail himself of the opening.

title: Indy's Fastest Cars To Face Handicaps
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 21The fastest two cars in the history of the Indianapolis 500 will start in the back of the field when the 62d adition of the race is held May 28.

title: Thai Villagers on Cambodian Border Being Regrouped for Defense
description: BURIRAM, ThailandVillagers in Buriram Province on the Cambodian border are being regrouped to consolidate their houses in defense against mounting incursions by Cambodian troops and Thai Communist forces based in Cambodia, the provincial Governor, Bumroong Sukbusava, said in an interview here.

title: When Interests Conflict
description: The central thesis of Justice Oliver Wendell Holmes's clsssic, The Common Law, concerns the gradual change in the law from moral to external standards in establishing a defendant's responsibility for conduct that damages a plaintiff. Actual intent is ultimately found not to be a practical test: intent sufficient to create liability will be imputed to a defendant who behaves in a certain way. Thus a man who sets fire to his own house, even if he does not intend that the fire should spread to his neighbor's, even if he is convinced that it will not, must pay the damages if it does. The intent to burn the neighbor's house is deduced from the fact that a reasonable man would have envisioned such a consequence.

title: Dining at the Supermarket
description: The American supermarket is badly threatened by the growing trend toward eating out. That is why Denny's IGA in Cape Girardeau, Mo., serves food like catfish and hush puppies for $1,20 in the store cafeteria and why a supermarket in Phoenix, Ariz., has a lounge cailed C3's Liblitions where shoppers can have a snack and a cocksail.

title: Yankees Beat jays, 21, 91
description: TORONTO, May 21The Yankees, who halve been hitting well all through an 11game road trip that ended today, came up with some firstrate pitching to go with their offensive punch as they swept a doubleheader from the Blue Jays, 21 and 91, before a crowd of 41,308, the third largest in the twoyear history of the Toronto franchise.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The nation's banking authorities have decided to insulate the housing industry from the full impact of rising interest rates, but the move could backfire, money market economists believe.

title: Pranks, Theft, Disease and Other Fallout From the CB Boom
description: On Route 10 east of Houston not long ago, a fearful female voice crackled over citizen's band radios. The woman said she had a flat tire and needed help.

title: LetEm Eat Cake' Is Sung
description: LET EM EAT CAKE. the sequel to or Thee I Sing, was, unlike its Pulitzer Prizewinning predecessor, a flop. It ran for 90 performances in 1933, done in, the theory was, by the fact that audiences in the depths of the Depression were not attracted by a bitter satire on the Depression. Be that as it may, in the 45 years since then, through wars and booms, the show has never been performed again and George Gershwin's score was allegedly lost.

title: Ballet: Balanchine's Steadfast Tin Soldier
description: FROM time to time the New York City Ballet's vast repertory brings back ballets that resemble a piece d'occasion in search of an occasion.

title: Sharing City Surpluses
description: For the last four years, New York City's major governmental problem has been how to deal with a declining city economic base. As the base declined, the revenues necessary to support governmental services declined, which meant three things: a contracting city bureaucracy, deciding where to reduce manpower, and where to impose attrition.

title: Flatbush Cantor Still Singing After 50 Years
description: Not many people spend 50 years in the same job, which is why the people at Temple Beth Emeth in Flatbush, Brooklyn, are making a fuss this month over Walter A. Davidson, their cantor for the last 50 years.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Susan Joyce Denenholz Bride of Bruce Rivkin
description: Susan Joyce Denenbolz, a financial administrar for RCA Global Communications, a subsidiary of the RCA Corporation, was married yesterday to Bruce Charles Rivkin, a certified public accountant. The ceremony was performed in the Rainbow Grill by Civil Court Judge Burton G. Hecht.

title: Jersey Incumbents Favored to Win in Congressional Primary Election
description: Despite a field of 46 candidates, New Jersey's 15 incumbent Representatives in Congress are favored in the June 6 primary election and can thus concentrate their campaign money on the general election in November.

title: The Best Spots
description: Consider the river from I ackawxen, Pa., north as your best bel from midMay to mid??.

title: 71,219 See Cosmos Beat Sounders, 51
description: EAST RUTHERFORD. N.J., May 21Soccer players are like stage actors: When they see a large audience, they tend to perform better.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: The gasoline business is changing. With the start of the summer driving season upon us, retailers are finding their market shares shifting and experts say that the new marketing patterns will eventually have a profound impact on how and at what level consumers buy their gasoline. (D1.)

title: Pranks. Theft. Disease and Other Fallout From the CB Boom
description: On Route 10 east of Houston not long ago, a Tearful female voice crackled over citizen's band radios. The woman said she had a flat tire and needed help.

title: Miss Lopez Wins Again
description: JAMESBURG, N.J., May 21Nancy Lopez, the 21yearold rookie sensation of the Ladies Professional Golf Association tour, continued to set records today as she rallied from four strokes behind on the back nine of Forsgate Country Club's East Course to force a playoff and then beat her childhood idol. JoAnne Carrier, on the first hole of sudden death. The victory gave her the $15,000 first prize in this week's $100,000 L.P.G.A. tournament.

title: Duke Ellington Annual Concert
description: THE ANNUAL springtime concerts of the Duke Ellington Society have, for the last 17 years, been programs of Mr. Ellington's music p'ayed by groups that included some musicians who had been associated with Mr. Ellington and. at times, played in the Ellington style. The society 's 18th annual concert yesterday afternoon at the New School broke with this precedent in that, although the music was all Mr. Ellington 's, neither the musicians nor the styles in which they played had any relationship to the late pianistcomposer.

title: Four Children Drown As Boat Capsizes in Lake in Alabama
description: ALEXANDER CITY, Ala., May 21 (UPI) Four children drowned when a pleasure boat carrying two adults and 16 children apsized todas during a heavy thunderstorm on Lake Martin, the authorities aid.

title: 6 Points on Ballot Submitted by Sadat
description: CAIRO, May 21The six points of President Anwar elSadat's referendum, which Egyptians were asked today to approve or reject in its entirety, are as follows, in unofficial translation from Arabic:

title: Grim Refugees Return to Brussels
description: BRUSSELS, May 2IGrim and exhausted and sobbing as they told tales of murder and atrocity. the first. European refugees from southern Zaire arrived here today. They were met by emotional crowds of relatives and friends in scenes of wrenching grief and hysterical relief.

title: Sports World Specials
description: The executive committee of the Women's Tennis Association will meet in San Francisco starting today to consider a package offer that could make Avon Products a more powerful force in the sport.

title: Mondale Praises Carey at a Party As Best Governor
description: ALBANY, May 21Mixing political partisanship with a bit of selfdeprecating humor, Vice President Mondale came here tonight to help Governor Carey raise money for his as yet unannounced campaign for reelection.

title: Letter: On Alaskan Land
description: To the Editor: I was disappointed with your May 16 editorial Preserving Alaska's Crown Jewels  because you chose to support your endorsement by reducing a complex issue to a simple dichotomy of conservation vs. development.

title: Bruins' Fans Now Believers
description: BOSTON. May 21The light flashed, signalling Bobby Schmautz's overtime goal and with it flashed the reality that the Boston Bruins had tied the Montreal Canadiens in their Stanley Cup final series at two games apiece. Instantaneously, the sellout crowd reacted in uninhibited fashion.

title: EXGOV. JOHN S. FINE OF PENNSYLVANIA DIES
description: John S. Fine, a veteran of Pennsylvania's political wars and the state's 100th Governor, died yesterday morning at WilkesBarre General Hospital at the age of 85. A resident of Loyalville, Pa., he was a longtime champion of his hardcoal mining region in northeastern Pennsylvania.

title: Yachting: Turner Sails To Victory
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., May 21Ted Turner is a hard man to keep down. The peripatetic owner of major league baseball and basketball teams, plus two television stations, came up from Atlanta for a lovely weekend on Long Island Sound and won all major honors with Tenacious, his 61foot sloop, in the Larchmont Yacht Club's annual distance race.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, MAY 22, 1978

title: Hurtubise Disrupts Indy 500 Qualifying
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 2lJim Hurtubise, a scarred veteran of the clays of the roadster, disrupted qualifying for the Indianapolis 500 for 20 minutes today when he climbed into a fellow competitor's race car and then broke onto the track while the car was warming up there.

title: Adventuresome Banker From the Far East
description: Michael G. R. Sandberg, the 50yearold chairman of the Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation says he joined the bank 29 years ago for the adventure and the elegance of expatriate life.

title: DAVE CHAPMAN, AT AGE 69
description: Dave Chanman, a designer of modern1 classroom furniture who was a past president of the Society of Industrial Designers and had received its top award twice, died Saturday in Chicago after a lone illness. He was 69 years old.

title: Inquiries on Korean InfluenceBuying Appear Near End
description: WASHINGTON, May 21Congressional investigations into Korean influencebuying have foundered in the last few weeks and, barring some unexpected development, appear headed for oblivion.

title: Dodgers Close In on Giants
description: It has been a long time since a Giant doger game meant a battle for first place, but this last weekend, more than 105,000 fans came to see the latest renewal of ahe ancient and wonderful rivalry. In yesterday's game at Dodger Stadium, Los Angeles beat San Francisco. 41.

title: TV: Bastard and Dain Curse
description: TWO multipart drama projects get under way this evening. One, on WPIXChannel 11 at 8, is a syndicated production called The Bastard, plucked from a curious collection of historical romance novels by John Jakes. Inspired by the recent Bicentennial festivities, this is the story that asks: Can the illegitimate son of one of England 's richest, most handsome lords find happiness in the rebellious provinces of Massachusetts? Tune into tomorrow 's column for several hints as to the swashbuckling outcome. (Any station nervous about the title has the option of calling the twopart presentation The Kent Family Chronicles.)

title: Avildsen to Produce And Direct Robin Hood
description: John Avildsen, who won an Oscar for his direction of Rocky, will do Robin Hood as his first project under twopicture contract with Universal, it was announced by Ned Tancn, president.

title: Bergland, in Soviet, Checks on Grain
description: MOSCOW, May 21In the rolling wheat fields of the Ukraine a week ago, a cold, gray wind spun snowflakes over tiny green sprouts of grain. Almost 2,000 miles away. in Kazakhstan. the vast level plains of the new lands had just been sown after the best spring rains in several years.

title: Carter Attends Niece's Wedding
description: PLAINS, Ga., May 21 (Reuters)President Carter joined about 900 people tonight at the wedding of his brother Billy's 18yearold daughter, Jana Kae Carter, to John Theus, 19, of Plains. Th President's mother, Lillian, his wife, Rosalynn, and their daughter, Amy, also attended the ceremony. Working reporters were barred from the private ceremony, although several journalists were invited guests.

title: Voznesenskv Regains Poetic Crown
description: Moscow TO BE A POET in Russiv has always been to live dangerously. Andrei Voznesensky's bold verse has been getting him into trouble ever since Nikita S. Inrushchey angrily shouted that he was dedaring war on him in 1963.

title: YOUNG VOICES DISSENT ON POLICY IN AFRICA
description: VASHINGTON, May 21  Andrew Young, the chief United States delegate to the United Nations, said today that contrary to concerns voiced by President Curter, he did not believe the President ivies unduly restricted by Congessionally imposed restraints in aiding Zaire and other friendly African countries.

title: PRISONERS IN ULSTER PROTESTING STATUS
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland  Three hundred Irish Republicans who consider themselves prisoners of war are trying to force the British Government to stop treating them as common criminals in a Northern Ireland prison.

description: IN Ball Four, his ever freshly irreverent, crazinessrelishing diary of the 1969 baseball season, Jim Bouton reminisces about his first start in Yankee Stadium, back in 1962:

title: Deborah S. Steen Is Bride
description: The marriage of Deborah Susan Steen, an actress. to Gerald Shikora, a lithographer, took place yesterday at the Beach Point Club in Mamaroneck, N.Y. Rabbi Judah Cahn of New York performed the ceremony. The bride is a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Philip M. Steen of Mamaroneck. Her father is a dentist. Her grandfather, the late Alexander H. Low, was a governor of the American Stock Exchange. Mr. Shikora is a son of Mrs. Abraham Shikora of Far Rockaway, Queens, and the late Mr. Shikora. His previous marriage ended??in divorce.

title: Badge:
description: Perhaps the greatest mystery in the game is how many players there are. The national organization has 200,000 members, and perhaps three times as many play duplicate. But this is only the tip of the iceberg, and nobody knows how many borne players there are.

title: 172 Violations of Fire Code Found in Many School Buildings
description: The Educational Priorities Panel has found 172 outstanding firecode violations recorded since March 31 in many of the city's 960 public school buildings, accordthe panel, an umbrella organization of civic and education groups,

title: Peru's New Team to Ask Easier Terms on Debt
description: LIMA, Peru, May 21A new team of Peruvian financial negotiators is to resume talks in New York this week With United States banks on rescheduling the heavy foreign debt obligations that have brought this country to the brink of default.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: IF YOU missed Saturday's newspaper, you missed a story reporting that the Fund for Animals, spearheaded by Mary Tyler Moore and Princess Grace of Monaco, has protested the annual Calaveras County jumping frog contest as a cruel exploitation of frogs. I am serious. This was a serious news item onpage 17 of The Times, May 20. Where is Mark Twain when we need him? One thinks of grenouilles  la meuniere. One also thinks of Luigi Calvani. And one sighs.

description: JERUSALEM, May 21The Israeli Cabinet set June 13 today as the date for the final withdrawal of Israeli soldiers from southern Lebanon.

title: 210 Inmates to Get Degrees
description: WALLA WALLA, Wash., May 21 (AP) A record 210 inmates are expected to receive degrees at ceremonies June 9 at Washington State Penitentiary. Len Williams, institution principal. said 4 inmates would receive bachelors clogrees general studies from Washington State University, 81 would get twoyear degrees from Walla Walla Community C??lege and 125 would get high school equivalency certificates.

title: Scrutiny of Doctors Is Said to Cut City's Medicaid Costs $27 Million
description: A computerized scrutiny of the fees and practices of doctors has reduced Medicaid costs in New York City by $27 million in the last two years, state Medicaid officials say.

title: Hard Times For Boomer
description: CHICAGO WE had been talking in a restaurant called the Clock, and the ballplayer made reveries. and chewed his steak. He would star for the New York Yankees. The fans would chant his name. He would frolic on sod that had felt the spikes of Ruth. All this happened in 1970, a long time ago, before baseball had battered Ron Blomberg's body, and before the New York Yankees had become the Bronx Zoo.

title: Special U.N. Disarmament Session Opening
description: UNITED NATfONS, N.Y., May 21The General Assembly begins a special session on disarmament here Tuesday, searching for a global strategy to end the nuclearweapons race and divert toward economic development the $400 billion spent annually on arms.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: DOVER, Del., May 21 (AP)David Pearson, seemingly out of the running midway through the .race, charged to the front when pitstop problems overcame the leaders, and gained an easy victory in the MasonDixon 500 stock car race today. He scored a 12.4second decision over Cale Yarborough, the defending champion. Pearson drove a Mercury. Yarborough was in an Oldsmobile.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: POUNCE What's thisa concert by the Dizzy Gillespie Qiiartet for only $1. That's right, and the place is the Henry Street Settlement Playhouse, 466 Grand Street, with two performances scheduled tonight at 7 and 8:30.

title: Carter Backed On Energy Posts
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP)The Justice Department said over the weekend that there was nothing improper in the Administration's appointment without Senate confirmation last year of four top officials to interim posts in the newly organized Energy Department.

title: Thomas Block Marries Miss Friedman, Lawyer
description: Marilyn Friedman, counsel to New York City's Municipal Assistance Corporation. and Thomas Block, executive vice president and treasurer of the Block Drug Company in Jersey City, were married yesterday at the Explorers Club. Rabbi Ronald Sobel performed the ceremony.

title: Chess:
description: Youth was served black bread and water in the Yugoslav championship as wellestablished players made otf with the top prizes. Grandmasters Borislav Ivkov, 44 years old, and Aleksandar Matanovic, 48, the editor in chief of both Chess Informant and the Encylopedia of Chess Openings, tied for first place, tallying 107 each.

title: 300 Demonstrators for Peace Now Picket as Begin and Cabinet Meet
description: JERUSALEM, May 21A group of 300 to 500 protesters from the peace now movement picketed today in front of Prime Minister Menachem Begins office as the Israeli Cabinet deliberated a further withdrawal from southern Lebanon.

title: LAST WHITES LEAVE ZAIRE BATTLE ZONE
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, May 21The last of 2.500 white civilians were evacuated today from the coppermining center of Kolwczi, bringing with them accounts of brutality and raeineg violence.

title: Building Big in Harlem
description: Like new brooms, incoming administrations promise to sweep clean. After taking office they often learn that some corners can't he got at without knocking down some walls and threatening others. For example, Mayor Koch has repeatedly vowed to build only lowcost, low rise structures for a small number of families, and so his decision to proceed further with the highpriced 14story Booth Towers scheme on Harlem's 123d Street looks like backsliding. But the Mayor's pledge to avoid such proposals was too sweeping to he taken at face value, and his reprieve for Booth is more limited than its many opponents fear.

title: Catherine Cleary Ends Long Career
description: Catherine Blanchard Cleary, who on Friday retired early as chairman and chief executive of the First Wisconsin Trust Company. Milwaukee, began to make herself known in the world of business and finance back in the early 1950's, when women were advanced, they were told, because they thought like men. While never quite accepting that logic, according to friends, Miss Cleary, now 61 years old, never aligned herself with the moreardent exponents of feminism either.

description: 67:30 A.M., WNYCFM. Excerpts from Die Meistersinger, Tannhauser and Die Walkure, Wagner.

title: Penske and Co.: Big Wheels at Indy
description: INDIANAPOLIS ONCE upon a romantic time, before automobiles were ever recalled to Detroit and years before the first theft of a hubcap, men brought cars to Indianapolis with the same dreams as their brothers who took onehorse stables to Louisville.

title: The Net Worth Of the Senate
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The typical senator is worth close to half a million dollars, does not invest heavily in areas close to his work in the Senate and is unlikely to hold any formal outside positions, except for an occasional membership on a college board of trustees or the like. The 10.000odd pages in the Senate's stack of financial disclosures, like the even higher pile that the House produced earlier this month, offer no bombshell revelations about Congress. But they tell quite a bit about the institution, as much for what they appear to disprove as for what they appear to prove.

title: Stockbroker Aims at the Deaf
description: MIAMI Like most stockbrokers. Robert H. Grossberg, a vice president in the office here of Shearson, Hayden Stone Inc., is always looking for ways to increase business.

title: Mexico Says Marijuana Poison Scare Is Propaganda
description: MEXICO CITY, May 21Dismissing complaints about the dangers of marijuana treated with herbicide as propaganda nut out by groups in the United States favoring its legalization, the Mexican Government is continuing its campaign of spraying marijuana fields with a toxic chemical known as paraquat.

title: State Dept. Asks Soviet To Call Home Diplomat Linked to Spying Case
description: WASHINGTON, May 21The United States has asked the Soviet Union to call home a diplomat named as a coconspirator in an espionage case. the State Department announced today.

title: Around the Nation
description: LINCOLNSHIRE, Ill., May 21 (AP)About 200 legislators, business executives Ind conservative political activists ?? 38 states gathered here this weekend to pIan a nationwide campaign for constitutional limits on spending by the Federal Government and the states.

title: RIVAL BLACK GROUPS FIGHT AFTER RALLY IN SALISBURY
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 21 (Reuters)Fighting between rival black nationalist factions broke out in the Salisbury township of Highfield last night, and the police said today that at least 84 people had been arrested.

title: Fiscal Crisis Dims Albany's EarlyAdjournment Hopes
description: ALBANY, May 19No session of the New York State Legislature is complete without a controversy over the adjournment, and this year has proved to be no exception.

title: Israelis to Leave Lebanon June 13, Cabinet Decides
description: JERUSALEM, May 21The Israeli Cabinet set June 13 today as the date for the final withdrawal of Israeli soldiers from southern Lebanon.

title: Villanova Gains Track Title by Point
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 21Villanova wanted to go headto head against Maryland in the final race for the IC4A outdoor track team title today. But when officials decided to stay with predetermined sections that split the two Eastern powers in the I,600meter relay, the Wildcats won the event with a meet record of 3 minutes 4.5 seconds that produced a onepoint victory over the twotime defending champions.

title: Rock: Helen Wheels Band
description: THE Helen Wheels Band, which was at Max's Kansas City over the weekend, has sonic of the visual appurtenances of punk rock, particularly in the razorblade earrings and general appearance of its lead singer. But this is really a solid, tight, potentially commercial rockandroll band of a sort that could very easily be encountered at the Palladium during one of those crazed, threeact bills that appeal to rowdy white teenagers.

title: Blind Getting a Chance to Bowl As Part of New Bronx Services
description: Tessie Terlizzi of the Bronx howled only a 57 the other day. but she was undaunted. She is 82 years old, and she is blind.

title: Despite Hints of Changes, More of the Same for France
description: PARIS, May 21The news from France, obscured by the strong emotions provoked by the kidnapping and assassination of former Prime Minister Aldo Moro in Italy, is that nothing has changed. Two months after the centerright Government won an unexpected electoral victory over the SocialistCommunist alliance, which was beset by feuds, there is no clear sign that the Government intends to change its policies beyond a severe economic belttightening.

title: Navajo Leader Seeks 3d Term
description: TEEC NOS POS, Ariz., May 21 (AP)Peter MacDonald, the Navajo tribal chairman, has announced that is seeking a third term as head of the nation's largest Indian tribe. The 48yearold Mr. MacDonald said her yesterday that he did not think his job was done and there were many programs that he could complete. Among these were the tribe's recent move to work more closely with other Indians in efforts to improve living conditions.

title: Cancer Research Now Shifting Away From War Policy,
description: BETHESDA, Md., May 21In a major policy shift. the National Cancer Institute is backing away from the view that the time is ripe for a tightly planned and blueprinted research war against cancer.

title: Bruins Triumph In Overtime
description: BOSTON, May 21A suddendeath goal by Bobby Schmautz gave the Boston Bruins a 43 victory over the Montreal Canadiens tonight, tying their National Hockey League championship plavoff at two games each.

title: Issue and Debate TeenAge Abortions: Do Parents Have the Right to Be Informed?; Background
description: The 16yearold highschool junior sat in a conference room at the Boro Hall Center of Planned Parenthood in Brooklyn the other day and talked about why she had chosen to keep secret from her mother the abort ion she had last fall.

title: Too Fast on the Draw
description: The House Appropriations Committee will have opportunity this week to undo the mischief recently created by two of its subcommittees. One subcommittee seeks to prevent the Treasury Department from carrying out proposed regulations that would help trace stolen guns. The other subcommittee would hobble a proposed inquiry by the Federal Trade Commission into television advertising aimed at children.

title: New StateLoan Plan Helps Many Improve Honies Economically
description: Janet and Patrick Redman of Mullica Hill in Gloucester County now have the funds to build a 12by35 foot addition to their ranch home, not to mention money for a fireplace.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A caption in the Times of May 15 with a picture of Vernon Bellecourt said a planned march to Washington was to be in support of pending legislation affecting Indians. The members of the movement are opposed to that legislation.

title: Amtrak Officials React Cautioulsly to Maguire Commuter Plan
description: WASHINGTON, May 20Officials of Amtrak, the federally subsidized national rail passenger system, are reacting with caution and some concern to Representative Andrew Maguire's plan, now before the House, to put Amtrak into the rail, commuting business, especially in New Jersey.

title: John Burroughs, at 71
description: DALLAS, May 21 (UPI)Former New Mexico Gov. John Burroughs, who served from 1959 to 1960, died today in a Dallas hospital of pneumonia after a lung infection. He was 71 years old.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A caption in the Times of May 15 with a picture of Vernon Bellecourt said a planned march to Washington was to be in support of pending legislation affecting Indians. The members of the movement are opposed to that legislation.

title: Mets Top Phils in 10th
description: Tug McGraw's gesture said it all. After the Philadelphia Phillies ace reliever had given up a double into the leftfield corner to Steve Henderson of the Mets that scored Lee Mazzilli with the winning run, McGraw flung the ball into left field in disgust.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Sporting Gear
description: Longdistance bicycle racers may have to turn in their 10speeds. Just being introduced is a camdriven bike, which in recent time trials shattered all American records in distances from 10 to 150 miles. The bike, called the BioCam, eliminates derailleurs, sprockets and gear shifts, and its transmission allows an almost infinite gear range. Because the bike is cam driven rather than sprocket driven, the rider can utilize a much higher gear ratio with the same level of leg force. The cyclist is able to shift just by sliding a lever, much like playing a trombone, and the simple construction of the bike overcomes the 10speeds biggest problems: difficulties in alignment and repair. The camdriven bicycle, weighing a little more than 20 pounds, is being built by Facet Enterprises, 7030 South Yale Avenue, Tulsa, Okla. 74136. The price is $1,395, fully equipped.

title: GOTBAIM BIDS CAREY PLAY FORCEFUL PART IN FINANCIAL TALKS
description: Victor Gotbaum, the union leader, yesterday called on Governor Carey to play a mere forceful role in helping to achieve a fiscal package needed for continuing Federal help to New York City.

title: Grim Refugees Return to Brussels
description: BRUSSELS, May 21Grim and exhausted and sobbing as they told tales of murder and atrocity, the first European refugees from southern Zaire arrived here today. They were met by emotional crowds of relatives and friends in scenes of wrenching grief and hysterical relief.

title: Craft to Study Heat Effect of Venus
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., May 21Scientists expect Pioneer Venus 1, the spacecraft speeding smoothly away from Earth after yesterday's launching here, to test a theory that a runaway greenhouse effect accounts for Venus being such a hot, dry, desolate world, apparently without life.

title: Palestinians Leaders Rule Out Any Full Arab Summit Talks Now
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, May 21 (Reuters)Palestinian leaders announced today their firm rejection of any move to hold an Arab summit meeting as long as Egypt persisted in its peace initiative with Israel. Instead they called for a conference of Arab hardliners.

title: Fiscal Hurdles Facing New York
description: All the required elements to resolve the city's financial situation remain unsettled. Here, at a glance, is what needs to be done.

title: New Chinese Diplomat in U.S.
description: HONG KONG, May 21When the Chinese Ambassador to Thailand was preparing to leave his post last week, three years after opening the embassy there, he was lavishly wined and dined by senior Thai leaders. When he departed from Bangkok, officials and army generals were on hand to see him off.

title: LAST WHITES LEAVE ZAIRE BATTLE ZONE
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, May 21The last of 2,500 white civilians were evacuated today from the coppermining center of Kolwezi, bringing with them accounts of brutality and raging violence.

title: Foundation for. Aiding Victims Of Burns Organizes Campaign
description: WEST ORANGE, May 21 (UPI)More than 100 former burn victims from the New YorkNew Jersey area met today to organize a campaign to speak up for their rights and to publicize the free services that are available for burn victims.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Taubman Company Inc, has elected Richard P. Kughn vice chairman, not president, as previously reported.

title: Byrne Tells Graduates of F.D.U. To Take Interest in Government
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, May 21Governor Byrne urged 1,014 graduates on Fairleigh Dickinson Universitys Rutherford campus yesterday to pursue an interest in government and to work in the service of the state either in the public or private sector.

title: Simons Triumphs With Par on 18th
description: DUBLIN, Ohio, May 21Jim Simons sank all the desperate. clutch putts he neededseven, including a breathtaker of 21 feet on the final holeand won the third annual Memorial Tournament today by one stroke.

title: Commodities
description: THERE are, or used to be, a lot of soybeans in Brazil, so many, in fact, that in just a few years, Brazil has emerged as the second largest exporter of the oilseeds. after the United States. That fact has not been lost upon traders of bean futures.

title: Where to Find Specialized Programs
description: Following is a list of places that offer specialized sports vacations and instruction. Further information can be obtained from travel agents or from a packager such as Thomas Cook.

title: FALL OF CHURCH ROOF KILLS GIRL, HURTS 60
description: GARLAND, Tex., May 21A 9yearold girl was killed and 60 people were injured today when the roof of a church in this Dallas suburb collapsed just after the opening hymn at Sunday morning services.

title: Sonics Capture Opener, 106102
description: SEATTLE, May 21The Seattle SuperSonics, staging the kind of comeback that has characterized their entire season, wiped out a 19point deficit in an eightminute span that ended in the middle of the fourth quater, won the battle down the stretch, and defeated the Washington Bullets today, 106102, in the first game of the National Basketball Association final series.

title: Medical Test Scores of 30,000 Reportedly Were Miscalculated
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 21 (AP)Standardized test scores for almost 30,000 premedicine students across the nation were miscalculated, and admissions officers at Stanford University and other Bay Area medical schools have been told to disregard the scores from the April 15 Medical College Admissions Tests. university officials said.

title: Market Place
description: MANY investors who rely on banks and insurance companies to manage their investment tunds probably know by now that their performance record in the decadelong bear market has been only fair at best. But a new review of the performance of institutions in managing both stocks and bonds indicates that fewer of these institutions have managed to show consistent excellence than even severe critics might have imagined. In fact, only two banks among the 200 banks and insurance companies suryeved were consistently superion their handling of commingled stocks and bonds their commingled accounts.

title: From the Violent Halls of a Brooklyn School to the Shores of Education
description: After a yearlong struggle against youth gangs, drug pushers and assaults on teachers, the administration of Boys and Girls High School in Brooklyn believet that it has seized control of the volatile school.

title: Talmadge Says He Used Small Gifts for Expenses
description: WASHINGTON, May 21Senator Herman E. Talmadge, a Georgia Democrat and a millionaire, says he has used small gifts of cash from friends and supporters to cover thousands of dollars in personal expenditures over the years.

title: World News Briefs
description: PEKING, May 21 (Reuters)President Carter's adviser on national security, Zbigniew Brzezinski, held longer talks than had been expected with Deputy Prime Minister Teng Hsiaoping today, and they continued their discussions over dinner.

title: A Tale of Two Horses
description: THE score is now 62 in favor of Affirmed but the game is tar from over. Not since Jack Britton and Ted (Kid) Lewis made slugging each other their life work has there been a rivalry in sports to captivate the public like the continuing duel between the winner of the Kentucky Derby and the Preakness and his indefatigable pursuer, Alydar. Half a century ago, Britton (who was Ernest Hemingway's model for the main character in Fifty Grand') fought Lewis 20 times. Britton won four bouts, Lewis three, there was one draw and 12 were nodecision matches. There is always a decision when Alydar hooks Affirmed, and there will be another decision in the Belmont Stakes June 10, for narrow and repeated deteats have not discouraged Admiral and Mrs. Gene Markey, who own Alydar, or John Veitch, who trains him. I'm looking forward to it, Veitch said of the Belmont after losing the Preakness by a long neck yesterday.

title: MEDICAIDCOST CUT TIED TO STATE DRIVE
description: A computerized crackdown on alleged cheating by doctors has reduced Medicaid costs in New York City by $27 million in the last two years, state Medicaid officials say.

description: TONIGHT

title: C.I.A. Oil Study Upheld
description: WASHINGTON, May 21The Carter Administration did not manipulate Central Intelligence Agency predictions on Soviet oil producticn, a Senate staff report said today. But the report criticized the agency for poor presentation of its findings.

description: Blackened, hollow shells of buildings ?? from fields of rubble in the area Of Fox and Simpson Streets in the South Bronx. It was in one of the dark abandoned tombs that an 8yearold boy was sexually abused last Mother's Day by a youth in a brown ski cap.

title: Patti Smith Gives Palladium Concert
description: PATTI SMITH'S concert Saturday night at the Palladium was triumphant, insofar as audience response and commercial success constitute a triumph.In the course or ner constant costume changes she even wound up in a Tshirt with the word Triumph emblazoned on it, although in fact the Tshirt had the motorcycle in mind.

title: Visitors Lose Train Link to Mental Hospital on L.I.
description: ISLIP, Li., May 21Every other Sunday for the last 18 years, Blanche Hoffman of Brooklyn has escorted her son by train from home visits back to the Pilgrim Psychiatric Center here. But starting next Sunday, the tripand the trips of a dozen other regularswill be just a little more difficult.

title: Outer Critics Circle Honors Da
description: Da, Hugh Leonard's play, which has been garnering prizes since opened May 1, was cited three times in the annual awards given by the Outer Critics Circle, the organization whose members write about the New York theater for outoftown newspapers and other media. The play was chosen as the best of the 197778 season; Bernard Hughes was named for his performance in it and Melvin Bernhardt for his direction. Ain't Misbehavin was voted the best musical.
