Many dishes develop, particularly in home kitchens, through the simple expedient of what happens to be at hand.

title: U.S. Bankers Are Leery Of More Loans to Zaire
description: The invasion of Zaire last week has left United States bankers uncertain as to whether they will extend further credit to the country.

title: Film: Adman's Romance
description: WHAT sort of scenery comes to mind when you dream about falling in love? Are you the kind of romantic who envisions purple sunsets, walks along the beach, orange sunsets, more walks along the beach horseback rides  deux, sailboat rides  deux, and ice cream cones  deux, all accompanied by a dangerously overworked string section? If so, "If Ever I See You Again," which opens today at Loews Tower East, would like very, very much to be your kind of movie. However, as the film itself readily acknowledges, in song and story and encounter-group jargon, wishes don't always come true.On the outside, "If Ever I See You Again" is the treacly stuff-and-nonsense of which greeting cards are made. On the inside, though, something quite different is going on.The story is about Bobby Morrison (Joe Brooks), a composer of jingles who has, in the words of one of his friends, "made the big time." He's rich, he's in demand, he uses a huge photograph of himself to adorn what he would undoubtedly call his work space, and he has been profiled in TV Guide. However, there's one thing Bobby lacks: Jennifer Corly (Shelley Hack), a college sweetheart who jilted him 12 years ago.This episode has taken just enough wind out of Bobby's capacious sails to make him vow to track Jennifer down, a decision that smacks at least as much of revenge as it does of romance. The main thing Bobby wants, he half-jokes, is to know that Jennifer has seen that TV Guide story about him.His wish is more than granted: not only is Jennifer gorgeous easy to find and conveniently unattached, but she has also read the article and loved it all by herself. Even better, she admits to Bobby that the fellow she preferred to him years ago is now a dress manufacturer of no particular renown. "Oh, I love it, I love it!" Bobby gloats, very unbecomingly.As played by Mr. Brooks, Bobby is an ambitious egomaniac whose immodesty knows no bounds, and this makes him something less than the ideal leading man. As played by Miss Hack, Jennifer is just one more model with a monotone.Miss Hack, perhaps best known as the star of Revlon's "Charlie" ads, made a previous movie appearance in "Annie Hall," as half of a beautiful couple Woody Allen approaches in the street. Mr. Allen asks them how they manage to look so radiant, and Miss Hack replies in essence, that maybe it's because they haven't a thought in either of their heads. Here, in a role that has her gazingly either adoringly or sadly at Mr. Brooks and saying things like "I'm not a forever person," she generates much the same mood.The only redeeming feature of her performance is the way in which, whenever she is called on to do anything silly, Mr. Brooks promptly does something sillier. For example, after Miss Hack watches Mr. Brooks conducting an orchestra in a recording studio, she cries out. "It's unbelievable! Unbelievable!" Replies Mr. Brooks, with a completely unconvincing display of bashfulness: "It's what I do for a living."Actually, what the real Mr. Brooks did for a living before he wrote, produced, scored and starred in "If Ever I See You Again" was exactly what the character Bobby Morrison does: compose enormously popular commercials. The hit song from his first film, "You Light Up My Life," was an illustration of the overlap between pop and commercial music at a time when Top-40 radio had become particularly tepid.This time, Mr. Brooks has tried to one-up himself by filling the screen with the visual imagery of television commercials as well as with their sounds. When an airplane is shown taking off for California, accompanied by one of Mr. Brooks's songs, it truly seems to be flying the friendly skies of United.Early in the film, there is enough turnabout and self-mockery to suggest that the director is aiming for something halfway between caricature and salesmanship. But his send-ups of the advertising business quickly turn nasty, and it becomes all too apparent that Mr. Brooks is both extremely talented and contemptuous of his own gifts.It's easy to see why he was so resoundingly well suited to his former line of work, but as a film director he has not yet progressed beyond the visual monotony of most television direction, nor does he risk much in his pacing. The film is entirely without dramatic highs or lows.Mr. Brooks's title song this time sounds much too much like his title song last time, but his real gaffe is a song called "California," which includes a syrupy lyric about how "the winds called Santa Ana make you feel that you belong." The Santa Ana winds, as they have been vividly described by Joan Didion and other Californian writers, are a nightmare. Mr. Brooks's peppy presentation of them can't help but make one wonder what was really in those soft drinks and fun foods he used to help sell, in his earlier more appropriate incarnation."I Ever I See You Again" is rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"). It includes a love scene between Mr. Brooks and Miss Hack that is strictly soft-focus, in every way.

title: Rosenberg Case Revisited On WHETTV June 19
description: The RosenbergSobell Case Revisited will be televised as a 90minute program on PBS on June 19, the 25th anniversary of the execution of Julius and Ethel Rosenberg for conspiring to reveal atomic secrets to the Soviet Union.

title: Manila Says It Erred On Tribe Discovery
description: MANILA, May 23 (Reuters)The Philippine Government acknowledged today that discovery of a remote tribe of cave dwellers, announced last week, was made at least 15 years ago.

title: Retail Chains' April Sales Up
description: Sales among 33 of the nation's largest retail chains in April rose 10.4 percent over the like 1977 month, registering nne of the year's lower monthly increases due primarily to this year's earlier Easter in March, according to a survey by Chain Store Age, a trade publication.

title: Woodcock Testifies About the Reopening of Curare Inquiry
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., May 23  A former Prosecutor testified at the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich today that he had no idea where a New York Times reporter obtained the document that led to the reopening of the case of the sudden deaths at Riverdell Hospital.

title: The 20Year Hitch
description: ARLINGTON, Va.The President 's Commission on Military Compensation has made the big decision to recommend junking 20year retirement for future career servicemen. So, it 's just a matter of time before the White House and Congress will have to come to grips with the issue.

title: Comptroller to Centralize Supervision of Big Banks
description: TARPON SPRINGS, Fla., May 23John G. Heimann, Comptroller of the Currency, said today that he hoped, within six months, to transfer the responsibility for supervising the nation's 15 largest banks with multinational operations from his agency's separate regional offices to a central office in Washington.

title: Albany Appears to Doom Koch Bill To Gain Control Over School Board
description: ALBANY, May 23  Mayor Koch's attempt to take control of New York City's Board of Education appeared doomed today, as the Slate Senate passed only the section of the proposal authorizing a new study of school decentralization.

title: Witness Tells of Reopening the Curare Investigation
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., May 23  A former Prosecutor testified at the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich today he had no idea where a New York Times reporter obtained the document that led to the reopening or the case of the sudden deaths at Riverdell Hospital.

title: The Value Of Less Freedom
description: LONDONHow free are we? The question provokes a reminder of a savage Monty Python skit. Two housewives decide to telephone that nice Monsieur Sartre in Paris to settle a philosophical point. A lady answers. They ask: Is M. Sartre free?, (Meahing is he.there?) And they fall off their chairs in hysterical laughter as the reply comes back: He 's been asking himself that all his life.

title: The Premature Storm Over SALT
description: Rapid recent movement toward the second strategic arms limitation treaty with Moscow has been accompanied, ironically, by erosion of Congressional support for it. Former President Ford, who shaped the initial outlines of the SALT II pact with Leonid Brezhnev at Vladivostok in 1974, has expressed strong reservations about its current form. He has been joined now by 33 of the Senate's 38 Republicans as well as some influential Democratsand 34 votes can block the treaty. With the treaty still incomplete and GromykoVance negotiations resuming this week in Washington, we do not propose a judgment now. But we are dismayed to find the critics hammering away at the pact while the Carter Administration is compelled to keep silent for the duration of the negotiationseven about some significant recent progress.

title: Business People Tootsie Roll Picks Officer
description: You have to pace yourself, said Ellen Gordon on the subject of eating Tootsie Rolls all day long. She should know. She has been eating them all her life. Yesterday, Mrs. Gordon was named president of Tootsie Roll Industries, the first woman to hold the post since the company was founded in New York by an Austrian immigrant in 1896.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ROME, May 23 (AP)Vic Amaya, a 6foot7inch, 220pounder from Holland, Mich., ousted seventhseeded Corrado Barazzutti of Italy, 63, 76, to gain in the $175,000 Italian open tennis championships. It was his first triumph over a top player in three years on the international circuit. In another upset Dick Crealy of Australia ousted Raul Ramirez, 06, 76, 63.

title: Ford, in New York for a Degree, Is Critical of Congress and Carter
description: Former President Gerald R. Ford had a busy day in New York City yesterday, accepting honors, offering advice to Congress, being critical of his successor and being reticent about his own political plans.

title: 5 Arrested in Drug Raids
description: FREEHOLD, N.J., May 23 (AP)  A major drug distribution ring in Monmouth County has been broken up. with the arrests of five persons, including a 45yearold Aberdeen housewife, authorities said. Four were arrested sunaay night in raids that also uncovered $50,000 in cash, two handguns, three pounds of marijuana and eight ounces of cocaine. The fifth suspect was arrested yestrerday, said Clinton Cronin, Acting Monmouth County Prosecutor.

title: Homosexuality: A Church Stand
description: SAN DIEGO, May 23  In the aftermath of the vote by the General Assembly of the United Presbyterian Church late last night to disapprove the ordination of avowed, practicing homosexuals, the question of whether such persons can still be ordained under church law remains unresolved.

title: Radio
description: 89 A.M. WKCR. Vier Deutschen Psalmen, Stoltzer.

title: Peruvian Troops Maintain Order
description: ?? Peru, May 23 (AP)?? armored cars were out in force today to head off any repetition of riots that reportedly claimed five lives yesterday, the first day of a general strike called to protest Governmentimposed price increases.

title: A.T. &T. TO HOLD RISE IN TOP PAY UNDER 5%
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company, the world's biggest company and private employer, announced yesterday that it was voluntarily holding executive pay increases to less than 5 percent and freezing prices of its manufactured products this year.

description: DALLAS, May 23Ending three years of debate on the matter, the American Institute of Architects has approved, 3 to 1, a change in rules that will permit architects to act as building contractors as well as designers. Until now, the architects from any role in the building process except that of creating a design.

description: TEL AVIV, May 23 (AP)A new dispute over land in the Israelioccupied West Bank of the Jordan flared today as an Arab mayor charged that the Israeli Government was planning to confiscate property owned by Arabs living abroad, with the aim of using the land to enlarge Jewish settlements.

description: MONTREAL, May 23  The Montreal Canadiens reacted to the unaccustomed pressure of their close National Hockey League final series against the Boston Bruins with a display of muscle and power tonight that led to a 41 triumph.

description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 2 Reuters)  Black nationalist guerrillas attacked the town of Wedza last night only, 14 hours before leaders of the Rhodesian Government were to address a rally there, military headquarters announced today.

title: Toll Collectors Quit After Inquiry
description: CONCORD, N.H., May 23 (AP)Seven more toll collectors at the Hooksett toll plaza have resigned as a result of a state police investigation into skimming. John T. Flanders, associate commissioner of public works and highways, said yesterday that the seven had agreed to make restitution, He estimated the amount aken over several months at about $200. He said that an eighth toll attendant. who had been prosecuted, had resigned earlier.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 23  The General Assembly opened a special fiveweek session on disarmament today as some diplomats privately voiced uncertainty about the commitment of the United States and the Soviet Union to the undertaking.

description: A 26yearold woman was found stabbed to death in her apartment at 572 Grand Street yesterday after police arrested a man who had tried to use her credit card at May's department store nn 14th Street and Broadway.

title: Ballet: A Dance Banned in Russia
description: THE newest addition to the American Ballet Theater repertory is a pas de deux from a work that was banned in Leningrad. In 1969 Igor Tchernichov choreographed a fulllength Romeo and Juliet tor the K??ov Ballet but the work was canceled after two performances by Soviet arts authorities, apparently on the ground that it was too avantgarde for general consumption.

title: CORRECTION
description: A headline in Business Day yesterday incorrectly stated that the Hyatt Corporation had sued to block a takeover of Hyatt by the Pritzker family, which holds 35 percent of Hyatt's stock, In fact, a class action suit was filed against Hyatt seeking to block the Pritzkers from buying additional shares.

title: Breckingridge Loses in Kentucky
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 23 (AP)John B. Breckinridge, a threeterm Democratic Representat:ve from Kentucky 's Sixth District, Was narrowly defeated in today 's primary election. Meanwhile, Senator Walter (Dee) Huddleston easily won renomination for another term.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BUBBLES AND BOUNTY Theater buffs can mingle with celebrities and sip champagne, as the stars autograph memorabilia from Broadway musicals at a benefit party today at Sardi's restaurant from 5 to 9 P.M. Proceeds from the sale of inscribed sheet music, along with sketches, posters and books, will go to a new nonprofit group, the National Music Theater, and Its first productin, a reprise of George Gershwin's Lady Be Good!

title: Byrne to Disclose Plan for Housing Poor in Suburbs
description: TRENTON, May 23  Governor Byrne said today he would disclose in two or three days a new state housing plan to implement the Mount Laurel decision of 1975

title: Gannett Hints At More Links
description: Hard on the heels of its acquisition of the Combined Communications Corporationwhich turned it into a major communications empire, the Gannett Company disclosed yesterday that there might be more takeovers in the works. Speaking at the company's annual meeting in Rochester, Paul Miller, board chairman, said other newspaper. companies are considering  merging with Gannett, but he would not say who or where they are.

title: Nebraska and Wildlife Groups Sue To Halt Building of Wyoming Dam
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (Reuters)  NeDraska and three wildlife groups have riled suit in Federal District court in Linmin, Neb., to stop construction of a $12 million dam in Wyoming.

title: 8 Indicted in Scheme To Bilk Businessmen
description: Eight men were charged In Manhattan yesterday in connection with a nationwide scheme that allegedly bilked 40 financially troubled businessmen of almost $1 million in socalled advance fees for financial assistance that was never delivered.

title: CARTER CITES LIMITS ON POLICY IN ANGOLA
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  President Carter told a group of senators today that because of Congressional restraints, the United States was unable to provide assistance to antiGovernment rebel forces led by Jonas M. Savimbi that are operating in Angola.

title: For Most, Beef Is The Staple
description: AMERICANS observe some of the most curious dietary customs in the world. Although most people around the world regard bread as the staff of life or consider a meal to he inadequate without rice, Americans disagree and generally hold that a proper meal must. contain a substantial portion of animal flesh. Among the most highly prized forms of this flesh is the psoas muscle of a castrated bull  otherwise known as filet mignon.

title: Senator's ExWife Goes It Alone
description: LOVEJOY,GA. FOR 35 years Betty Talmadge supported a myth about the inviolability of a political marriage, that pristine, smiling, nuclear ideal so beloved by voters and campaign consultants. It's an image cooed over on the hustings and calculated in the polls, the perfect political pair whose public appearances elicit constituent murmurings: how clever he is, how devoted she. So there could be no better place for the myth to die than here in the heart of Gone With the Wind country, in a white pillared mansion 35 miles south of Atlanta and now temporary headquarters for Betty Talmadge's Congressional campaign.

title: The Night Canadiens Lost Their Halos
description: MONTREAL, May 23  Gallic blood boiled over tonight. The Montreal Canadiens, praised for peace and prosperity in the National Hockey League, threw off their halos and slugged it out, toe to toe, with the roughneck Boston Bruins.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: NEW York's panhandling population is so ubiquitous in the urban scene that pardon the pun  it pays to look in on the inhabitants from time to time to see what they're handing out.

title: League Approves Sale of the Red Sox
description: CHICAGO, May 23 (AP)  Sale of the Boston Red Sox. for $20.5probably the most ever paid for a major league baseball teamwas approved unanimously today by the American League owners.

title: Athlete of the Decade, in Midair
description: The Athlete of the Decade was identified yesterday at a luncheon in the New York Hilton Athletic Club, and no doubt Air France will recover in time. Flight 031, already reported four hours late, made an unscheduled stop in Montreal so the Athlete. who wac en route from Nice to Chicago, could deliver his acceptance speech over an amplified telephone hookup. Muhammad Alifor it was indeed heacknowledged the honor with characteristic humility and unusual static. More than slightly blurred, his words came over something like this: Appreciate.... strange thing... Chicago. ... Montreal... very smart choosing me.

description: Roosevelt Hospital and St. Luke's Hospital Centertwo of New York's oldest medical institutionssaid yesterday that they would seek to merge their medical services and administrations under a single board of trustees. Both West Side hospitals would be kept open, but some beds and duplicated specialized services would be eliminated.

title: Concerns Seek Curbs On Product Pirating
description: Ten companies, including two wellknown foreign concerns, have established a coalition to combat international pirating and counterfeiting of their products.

title: Rating the Electric Wok: No Stirring Experience
description: When It ?? to gadgets, I am an unabashed fanatic. If the next thing in sight can be plugged in and turned on and has a purchase price, it will probably become an irresistible need: if it is batteryoperated, so much the better. I can number among my acquisitions assorted Japanese rice cookers, tempura pots, half a dozen can openers and one of the most elaborate collections of cork extractors, many of which have been used once.

title: Best Buys
description: IF you live in Manhattan and are trying to make the lowest possible expenditures cover the cost of feeding a family of four in New York City, where prices set a new record last week, the City Department of Consumer Affairs has some advice for you: go east.

title: Ithaca Wins Baseball Title
description: WILLIMANTIC, Conn., May 23 (AP)  Ithaca College beat Brandeis University, 195, today in the Northeast championship baseball game of Division III of the National Collegiate Athletic Association. Gavin Russo had a onehitter through 7 innings for Ithaca, which now goes to the national competition June 24 at Marietta, Ohio.

description: Bankers Trust Company has announced that Fred J. Leary Jr., executive vice president in charge of the creditpolicy department, is retiring, effective June I, and joining the Bank of Ireland as a consultant.

description: For the first time in seven years, applicants seeking the job of principal or any other supervisory position in New York City's public schools will soon be required to pass an examination administered by the Board of Examiners.

title: 250 PROTESTERS ARE HELD AT COAST SUBMARINE BASE
description: BANGOR, Wash., May 23 (AP)Morel than 250 protesters opposed to the Trident nuclear submarine and insisting upon arrest clambered over a fence today onto a Trident base being built here, the second such demonstration in two days.

description: WASHINGTON, May 23Juries testing obscene magazines and films against community standards may not consider the possible reactions of children but should weigh the views of sensitive adults and the special interests of deviant sexual groups in reaching a decision, the Supreme Court ruled today.

title: Levy, Coach of Chiefs, Thrives on Competition
description: The 28 coaches of the National Foothall League, 10 of them new to their jobs, were on display here yesterday at their annual meeting. Collectively they looked fine, most sporting suntans and an ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? time of the year when coaches take vacations and feel good about their chanees for the coming season, which also means their chances of being at the next annual gathering.

title: ZAIRE RAIDERS INTENT ON MOBUTU'S OUSTER
description: BRUSSELS, May 23The Congolese National Liberation Front, whose forces invaded Shaba Province in Zaire from Angola earlier this month, has established itself as the strongest of the many opposition movements trying to end President Mobutu Sese Seko's 13year rule, in the view of liplomats and officials here.

title: Brzezinski in China: The Stress Was on Common Concerns
description: HONG KONG, May 23  When Zbigniew Brzezinski, the White House national security adviser, visited the Great Wall of China yesterday during his threeday visit to Peking, he jested with his hosts that the last one to the top would oppose the Russians in Ethiopia. The comment was typical of the antiSoviet banter the President's adviser tossed at the Chinese. Last night at a farewell dinner, Mr. Brzezinski said the theme that had emerged most clearly in his discussions with the Chinese leaders was that our shared views outweigh our differences.

title: Maverick Sonic Owner Gets All the Applause
description: In Seattle, the autograph of the SuperSonics owner, Sam Schulman, is said to be worth two by Marvin Webster, Fred Brown or Paul Silas. Schulman. a maverick 68yearold from Brooklyn, is the center of Seattle's excitement over the Sonics first trip to the National Basketball Association championship round.

title: Plentiful Supply Of Oil Foreseen
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP)Estimates of the world's oil reserves have skyrocketed in recent years, making it more likely that sufficient oil will be available for the future, but at high prices, an official of the World Bank said today.

title: HIGH COURT, 53, BARS U.S. SAFETY CHECKS WITHOUT WARRANTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  The Supreme Court ruled today that the Occupational Safety and Health Administration could no longer make spot searches of employers Premises, looking for violations, without first obtaining a warrant.

title: Private Lives
description: IF there was a Spiderman party this year. I missed it. I hope they didn't forget to invite me to the Spiderman party, because my paranoia already has more than it can handle, what with the widely reported decline of the American sex drive and the threat of killer fire ants from Florida. Nevertheless, there should have been a Spiderman party  or, more properly, a Marvel Comics partyeven if they didn't invite me, because my feelings are less important than the sociology of Spiderman parties.

title: Discard Says Troops Will Leave When French in Zaire Are Saved
description: PARIS, May 23President Valery Giscard d'Estaing announced today that France's expeditionary force in Zaire would be called home as soon as its assignment of rescuing French civilians from the southern battle zone of Shaba Province was completed.

title: POST NOTIFIES GUILD IT IS DISMISSING 18
description: The New York Post told the Newspaper Guild of New York yesterday that it was dismissing 18 staff members who had been with the newspaper less than two years. Junior employees were subject to such action under the vast union contract.

title: CRUISE SHIP, 1,600 ABOARD, IS SEARCHED FOR A BOMB
description: LONDON, May 23  The 1,600 passengers aboard the British cruise liner Oriana spent a tense day today while their ship was searched for a bcmb that an anonymous letter said had been set to explode on the ship. No bomb was found in an eighthour search by the crew.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Personally, I think the idea is nuts, but I never thought the Pet Rock would sell, or Donny and Marie would last. So, if for any reason, you want a sterling silver injector razor, don't run around in desperation. Just go to Bonwit Teller's Men's Accessories on the main floor and part with $55. It may be some small salve to your conscience that you can use regular blades in the thing, and that women would probably like it as well as men.

title: Chase Realty Offers Plan
description: The Chase Manhattan Mortgage and Realty Trust proposed a plan of reorganization yesterday that would allocate $180 million of its $242 million in properties to its 21 bank lenders.

title: Macy's Suspends Policy
description: A Macy's spokesman said yesterday that the company had suspended a controversial policy of taking photographs of all customers returning purchases for cash refunds in tnree of its stores Queens Center, Kings Plaza and Staten Island. The policy, which was discloSed last week in the Living Section, was suspended Monday, the spokesman said, pending the resolution of several inquiries into the procedure started by the New York State Attorney General's Consumer Frauds Bureau and the New York City Department of Consumer Affairs.

title: Record Profits for R. H. Macy
description: Profits of R. H. Macy & Co., rose 11.3 percent in the April quarter and 16.5 percent for the ninemonth period, both setting records, the company said yesterday.

title: For the Wine Enthusiast With Foresight,
description: THE production of wine writers, alas, seems to increase in geometric proportion to the production of wine makers. The wine is more than welcome; whether the prodigious output of writers is equally sought after is another matter. There are a tew wine writers who are also wine makers. Most of them write rarely because they have other things to do, so their words are particularly valued.

description: ALBANY, May 23  Governor Carey's office and the Legislature were near an agreement today on a bill that would create a state corporation to guarantee mortgages in decaying urban areas Where homeowners charge they cannot get loans because of lenders redlining policies.

description: PITTSBURGH, May 23  For the first time during a season marked by injuries, the New York Mets gathered their starting eight into one lineup tonight and neither rain nor gloom of night nor the Pittsburgh Pirates could stop them.

title: 2 Judges to Sentence Berkowitz June 12
description: David R. Berkowitz will he sentenced for the Son of Sam murders on .lune 12 no matter how he behaves in court or what his next psychiatric examination shows, Justice Joseph R. Corso of State Supreme Court said yesterday.

description: RYE, N. Y., May 23  Mrs. Thornton Gerrish and Mrs. Robert Estes, both of the Apawamis Club, teamed for a gross score of 79,80159 at their home course today to capture the Women's WestchesterFairfield Golf Association's 36hole betterball tournament. They nreviously won in 1973 and 1974.

title: Kuwait Oil Tank Fire
description: KUWAIT, May 23 (AP)A fire burning overnight destroyed three oilstorage tanks and damaged oil and gas pipelines at a holding facility, a Kuwait Oil Company spokesman said today.He said that the fire at the Persian Gulf ElManagisb center, north of here, had been caused by technical reasons, but he declined to elaborate. No injuries were reported. The company said that the tanks had a total capacity of 50,000 gallons. The loss of oil, if any, was not reported.

description: William L. Lynch, former counsel to the New York State Commission on the Courts, died Monday at the St. Agnes Hospital in White Plains. He was 70 years old and lived in Montauk, L.I.

description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP)The Federal Government filed suit today to force school officials in Ocala, Fla., to integrate two public schools that are attended almost entirely by blacks.

description: NAZARETH, Pa., May 19Sears, Roebuck, that giant retailer to whom every country boy has turned for one thing or another, used to sell a $17 guitar called a Silvertone. Name to the contrary, the instrument produced a sound that would irritate a saint. Elvis Presley had one. Charlie Pride had one. All God's poor pickers had one.

title: For Some, Organic Is Better
description: EMMAUS, PA. ROBERT Rodale has every right to be smug. For more than 30 years he and his family have been ranting, raving and railing about air pollution, food filled with chemicals, filthy water and wasteful living. Now that many other people are beginning to believe that the alternative life style may well become the imperative life style, it would be natural for him to say I told you so.

The playwright is Wendy Wasserstein, and this production, except for one cast change, was originally done at New York's Phoenix Theater.

description: The Board of Education is expected to approve tonight a proposal to toughen standards for high school graduation but to delay putting the plan into effect until September 1979.

title: Peru Crisis: A Dilemma
description: WASHINGTON, May 23  Rioting, strikes and bloodshed in Peru have created a profound dilemma for the Carter Administration, which has been groping for ways to balance at least two competing and, some officials argue, inconsistent ??oreign and economic policy objectives.

title: World News Briefs
description: ROME. May 23 (AP)  During the search for the killers of former. Prime Minister Aldo Moro, an apartment used by terrorists was discovered in the nearby beach town of Ostia, the police said today.

title: Truck Falls on Car, 4 Killed
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, May 23 (AP)  Four persons were killed and two were injured early this morning when a truck overturned on a car on the Ohio Turnpike near here, the State Highway Patrol reported. The victims were not Identified, hut the authorities said that the car had New York State license plates.

title: Stockholders Enjoy A. T. &T. Meeting in Morris
description: MORRIS TOWNSHIP, May 23 About 1,400 stockholders of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company gathered here today in what turned out to be a virtual cheering section for the country's biggest corporation.

title: CORRECTION
description: A headline in Business Day yesterday incorrectly stated that the Hyatt. Corporation had sued to block, a takeover of Hyatt by the. Pritzker family, ?? ?? 66 percent of Hyatt's stock. In fact, a class action suit was filed against Hyatt seeking to block the Pritzkers from buying additional shares.

title: Q&A
description: Q. Can you tell me what soy sauce is made of?

title: BILL ON DRUGS GEAR MOVES UP IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, May 23  After extended, and often sarcastic, debate, the Senate today passed and sent to the Assembly legislation banning the sale of such drugrelated paraphernalia as marijuana pipes. The vote was 43 to 8.

title: Ballet:School Offers 2 Workshop Shows>
description: THE stars of the future in ballet are never found seated at a soda fountain. More likely, they can be spotted in the yearly performances given by the School of American Ballet at the Juilliard Theater.

title: Advertising
description: You Say you've never heard of Iroquois Brands? Well, join the crowd.

title: Topics No Dice
description: Some two dozen American physicists have canceled trips to the Soviet Union to protest the harsh sentenceseven years in jail and five away from homeimposed on Yuri Orlov, a Soviet physicist. Emphasizing the issue of human rights in SovietAmerican exchanges, Dr. Philip Handler, the president of the National Academy of Sciences, warned that if the trials of two other dissenters, Aleksandr Ginzburg and Anatoly Shcharansky, turn out similarly, SovietAmerican scientific relations will have been profoundly damaged.

title: Gold Sold to Defend Dollar
description: WASHINGTON. May 23It could have been tin, tungsten, chrome, old desks, chairs, typewriters, used jeeps, motorcycles or any other Gove.rnment property the General Services Administration sells from time to time to trim surpluses and recoup some Federal expenditures.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: YOU'RE going to have a party. The florist has been hired, the caterer has been hired, the servants have been hired, the guests have been hi red.

title: Mideast Plane Conflict: How Carter Won and the Implications for Victors and Losers
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Eight days after the Senate upheld President Carter's proposal to sell warplanes in a package to Israel, Egypt and Saudi Arabia, theIsraeli Government, the soCalled Israell lobby in Washington and key political figures on Capitol Hill remain deeply troubledeven scarredby the fight and are weighing their political losses.

title: HIGH COURT, 53, BARS U.S. SAFETY CHECKS WITHOUT WARRANTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Supreme Court ruled today that the Occupational Safety and Health Administration could no longer make spot searches of employers premises, looking for violations, without first obtaining a warrant.

title: French Commander in Zaire Says Troops Will Stay Until an International Unit Arrives
description: KOLWEZI, Zaire, May 23  The commander of French troops in this ghostly southern Zairian city said today that he regarded his mission here to be of indeterminate duration, lasting until an international force could protect the area from new attacks by insurgents based in Angola.

title: Roosevelt and St. Luke's Hospitals Announce Plan to Merge Services
description: Roosevelt. Hospital and St. Luke's Hospital Centertwo of New York's oldest medical institutionssaid yesterday that they would seek to merge their medical services and administrations under a single hoard of trustees. Both West Side hospitals would be kept open, but some beds and duplicated specialized services would be eliminated.

title: White House is Studying Plan to Create a New Border Control Agency
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Carter Administration is giving serious consideration to a reorganization of Federal law enforcement agencies that could result in a new agency to manage the nation's borders, within the Treasury De partment. and greatly expanded powers for the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, according to sources familiar with the plan.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Cleveland Indians, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 8 P.M.

title: Turkish Oilfield Strike Spreads
description: ANKARA, Turkey, May 23 (Reuters)A strike by more than 3,000 oil workers in southeastern Turkey spread today to a vital pipeline that supplies the country's secondlargest refinery, union officials said. The strike, at the staterun Batman refinery and oilfields, began over a pay dispute.

title: Reality on Radio: Airing Your Problems
description: Some years ago I wrote an article for Life magazine on a group of orangutans and chimpanzees who very much enjoyed looking at television. I had wanted to take a survey of which primetime shows they preferred, but when I arrived at the Yerkes Primate Research Center in Atlanta I found that the apes went to bed at 5 o'clock. As for their daytime viewing habits, these were almost identical to my own. Except for moments of high drama, as when a game show contestant won a dinette set, they tended, like me, to pay only intermittent attention to the screen. Still, after I smeared the screen with a banana their attention span increased considerably, just as mine would if a person did that to my set.

title: Ceausescu Visiting Hanoi
description: HONG KONG, May 23 (Reuters)President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania arrived in Hanoi today for an official visit, the Vietnamese press agency report ed, Vietnamese newspapers carried frontpage editorials welcoming him, and thousands of people lined the streets to greet him, the agency said.

title: White House Plans Tribute to Jazz
description: ATRIBUTE to Jazz, honoring the 25th anniversary of the Newport Jazz Festival, will he held on the lawn of the White House on Sunday afternoon, June 18. More than three dozen musicians wilt play in the one and a half hour program for an invited audience of 600.

title: Joseph A. Colombo Sr., 54, Paralyzed in Shooting at 1971 Rally, Dies; Some Progress in Condition A Departure From the Usual A Series of Arrests What's the Mafia?
description: Joseph A. Colombo Sr., the reputed Mafia leader who was a founder of the ItalianAmerican Civil Rights League and who was gunned down and left almost totally paralyzed at a 1971 league rally in Columbus Circle  died Monday night at St. Luke's Hospital in Newburgh, N.Y. He would have been 55 years old on June 16.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: The directors of the financially troubled Commonwealth Oil Refining Company, whose principal facility is a refinery in Puerto Rico that serves the United States market, announced that they had authorized discussions concerning a possible merger with Arab interests headed by Robert E. Tamraz, chairman of the First Arabian Corporation. Mr. Tamraz had previously disclosed that he had discussed buying into Corco, which last March sought court protection from its creditors under the Federal Bankruptcy Act, but this was the first confirmation of his interest from Corco.

title: U.S. Asks Delay on Dust Rule
description: WASHINGTON, May 23President Carter's economic advisers today ordered the Occupational Safety and Health Administration to delay publishing a broad, new rule designed to reduce the high incidence of lung disease linked to cotton dust among the 800,000 people who work in the cotton industry.

title: Earthquake Strikes Japan
description: TOKYO, May 23 (Reuters)An earthquake shook Kyushu and other areas of southwestern Japan early today, the Central Meteorological Agency reported. The agency warned coastal areas in southwestern Japan of possible high waves generated by the quake. The agency said that the earthquake had a magnitude of about 6.8 on the openended Richter scale.

title: Chess:
description: Lubomir Kavalek, a United States grandmaster, defeated Ulf Andersson, Sweden's only grandmaster, in a 10game match with a score of 63. Kavalek received $3,000, while Andersson's share was $2,000. The match was sponsored by Volvo of Washington.

title: Technology
description: IN 1975 American cities dumped or buried 130 million tons of waste. Had it been burned as fuel, the Energy Department estimates, it would have reduced by 7 percent the need of the United States for oil imports.

title: Michigan Sheriffs Seeking, Law to Save Their Jobs
description: DETROIT, May 23Efforts by Michigan's county sheriffs and their deputies to protect their jobs against urbanization and declining jail populations are shaping up as a major political issue for Gov. William B. Milliken, who is running for reelection this fall.

title: The Mayor's Chef: Gracie Mansion Is Her Test Kitchen
description: She studied psychology at college, tried her luck in advertising and theater, and has never taken a cooking course in her life. But at the age of 24 Rozanne Gold has managed to land herself a job as chef in Gracie Mansion.

title: Protection Rises For Investors
description: WASHINGTON. May 23 (UPI)President Carter signed a hill that increases customer protection against stock brokers and dealers who go out of business to $100,000 from $50,000. the White House announced today. Cash coverage is doubled to $40,000.

title: Publisher of More Seeking to Sell His Monthly Review of Journalism
description: James B. Adler, publisher of More magazine, said yesterday that he was looking to sell the monthly journalism review, which has been losing about $30,000 a month.

title: Boe Cautions on Islanders' Receivership
description: MINEOLA, L.I., May 23  Lawyers for Roy Boe, president of the Islanders, contended today that if a receiver for the hockey club were appointed, it might well jeopardize the franchise in the National Hockey League.

title: SADAT PLANS DRIVE ON POLITICAL CRITICS
description: CAIRO, May 23President Anwar elSadat indicated today that he would use the strong endorsement he received in Sunday's referendum to drive his main critics out of the country's leftist and conservative political parties.

title: Brzezinski Tells Japan's Premier Peking Is Pressing for Peace Pact
description: TOKYO, May 23  Zbigniew Brzezinski, the White House national security adviser, arrived here today from Peking to brief Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda on his talks and tell him that the Chinese leaders wanted a peace treaty with Japan.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Defier of U.S. Pleased
description: POCATELLO, Idaho, May 23 (AP) The man who started it all said he was relieved to know that Justice has triumphed after the Supreme Court ruled today that the Government could not make unannounced inspections of workplaces without a search warrant.

title: SENATE PANEL APPROVES 3 FOR JOINT CHIEF POSTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP)President Carter's candidates for three of the country's top military jobs were approved unanimously today by the Senate Armed Services Committee.

title: JUSTICE DEPT. BACKS NIXON WIRETAP VIEW
description: WASHINGTON May 23The Department of Justice told a Federal appeals court today that former President Richard M. Nixon and his chief aides should Be immune from lawsuits for ordering the wiretaps of 17 Government officials and reporters in the early 1970 's.

title: ExRealEstate Salesman Is Found Guilty In 1974 L.I. Kidnapping of Businessman
description: MINEOLA, L.I., May 23  Richard Williams, a former California realestate salesman, was found guilty today of kidnapping Jack J. Teich, a wealthy business executive of Kings Point, LI., three and a half years ago for $750,000 in ransom.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (UPI)The average cost of educating youngsters from kindergarten through high school shot up 56 percent between 1971 and 1976, according, to a 466page report issued by the National Institute of Education, but average enrollment went down 2.3 percent in those five years.

title: FORMULA FOR INFANTS IN 3D WORLD OPPOSED
description: WASHINGTON, Maly 23 (AP)  Nurses and doctors working in poor nations said today that American manufacturers were promoting infant formulas that impoverished mothers can neither afford nor mix properly.

title: Expert Tells of Excess Mercury in WoodRidge Plant
description: HACKENSACK, May 23  An industria toxicologist testified here today that he found excessive ??vels of mercury contamination between 1966 and 1970 in and around the WoodRidge Chemical Corporation. The company has been accused by the state of polluting Berry; Creek in the Hackensack Meadowlands with abnormal amounts of the toxic metal.

title: Rudin Sues Webb on Legal Costs
description: We haven't even seen the suit yet, said the assistant general counsel of the Del Webb Corporation in Phoenix. He was talking about a suit by Milton A. Rudin, a former Webb director, which alleges that Webb officers caused the company to incur substantial and unnecessary legal expense and costs in fighting his election to the board. But, Richard Waters, the Webb official, said, I guess that's the way Mr. Rudin works.

title: Case Would Beat 3 Democrats, According to an Eagleton Poll
description: TRENTON. May 23  Senator Clifford P. Case, the fourterm Renublican incumbent, would defeat any of the three leading Democratic contenders forhis s eat if the election were held today, according to a survey by the Eagleton Institute of Politics at Rutgers University.

title: PRAVDA ASSAILS THE WEST ON INTERVENTION IN ZAIRE
description: MOSCOW, May 23 (AP)The Soviet Communist Party newspaper Pravda said today that the Western powers built up the SovietCuban role in Africa as a smokescreen to divert attention from their own designs in Zaire.

title: Court Reverses Decision by Babitt To Liquidate Overmyer Company
description: A bankruptcy judge's decision to liquidate the financially troubled D. 11. Overmyer Company was overturned yesterday by Judge Lloyd F. MacMahon of Federal District Court in Manhattan.

title: Price Rises Stem Car Imports
description: Last month's sales decline for foreign cars, the first in nearly two years, may be the first tentative sign that the boom in imported modelsparticularly from Japanis flagging because of higher prices.

title: Bridge:
description: Old bridge books, like old newspapers, are almost invariably unreadable and of interest only to historians. But there are exceptions, and a notable one has been brought to light by an enterprising publisher.

title: Kennecott Seen Beating Curtiss
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation is expected to be given official notification today that, on the basis of a preliminary tally, it has defeated the CurtissWright Corporation in the biggest proxy fight in many years, wellplaced Wall Street sources said yesterday.

title: MISSING GIRL, 7,FOUND SLAIN NEAR FAR ROCKAWAY HOME
description: A 7yearold Queens girl, whose family had reported her missing last Sunday night, was found dead behind her apartment. building in Far Rockaway yesterday morning. Hours later, a man living in the same building was charged with her abduction and murder.

title: 17 Seized in Jersey Drug Raids
description: JERSEY CITY, May 24 (AP)Seventeen persons have been arrested as members of a ring the police say was the largest area supplier of the drug PCP, or angel dust, Hudson County authorities sairl. The Hudson County Narcotics Strike Force conducted three raids in the last two days on the Swan Motel in Linden, an apartment in Bayonne and another apartment here, where a secret drug laboratory was found, the police said.

title: Home Beat
description: Our interests are being guarded. At least they are at the Parsons School of Design, 2 West 13th Street. The school has the oldest department of interior design in the country and has been training stuaents since the turn of the century to think about how people can live more intelligently and esthetically.

title: Freeing Puerto Rico
description: STANFORD, Calif.Fidel Castro and his friends vociferously castigate imperialist exploitation of Puerto Rico by the United States and demand Puerto Rico's release. From time to time, extreme Puerto Rican nationalists plant bombs as arguments against Yankee imperialists. Yet bad advocates do not make a bad cause.

title: For the City's Elderly, Camp in the Country
description: JOSEPH GALLON, a 64yearold Flushing resident, has some advice for elderly people who plan to spend the summer in the city. Get off your rocker, he says. Take a chance.

title: Quiet Site in Jersey Holds Nearly a HalfBillionWar Stockpile
description: SOMERVILLE, N.J.Next to the fabulous gardens of the Doris Duke estate, off Route 206 near here lies an unlandscaped, wirefenced, 880acre site that has the earmaeks of a beggarly neighbor. It appears to contain piles of abandoned materials and warehouse and railroad tracks that are only rarely used. A closed military base, perhaps?

title: The Battle To Keep Old Estates Intact
description: CHICAGO BEATRICE RITCHIE, a speech therapist, is living in her dream house in her dream neighborhood of spacious older homes near the University of Chicago.

title: New Chlorination Equipment Lessens Missouri Water Hazard
description: WEST PLAINS, Mo., May 24. (AP)New chlorination aplipment supplied to several communities near the site of a massive sewage spill has secured the last of public water supplies against bacterial contamination, a state environmental official said today.

title: Noise Abatement Aid For Airlines Challenged
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The airline industry, seeking Federal aid, reported today that it might require more than $7 billion to meet the noiseabatement standards of the 1980's, but the chairman of the Senate Commerce Committee challenged the companies to justify their need for Federal help.

title: When Charles O. Hired Billy Martin
description: Insurance is his real business but Charles 0. Finley would never write a policy on the dugout expectancy of his Oakland A's managers. Impetuous and impatient, he has discharged many, traded Chuck Tanner to the Pittsburgh Pirates and went to court to preyent Dick Williams from joining the New York Yankees in 1973 after the second of the A's three consecutive World Series triumphs. But now, with the A's the surprise leaders in the American League West, the manager has discharged the owner. Bobby Winkles has resigned, only to be succeeded by Jack McKeon, who had been succeeded by Bobby Winkles early last season. Even in first place, or perhaps especially in first pace, Bobby Winkles told Charles 0. Finley he wasnt comfortable: all the other A's managers have known the feeling. One theory is that Bobby Winkles was annoyed when Charles O. Finley sold Joe Coleman, an unsigned relief pitcher with a 30 wonlost record, to the Toronto Blue Jays for only $10,000. Another that Charles 0. Finley planned to put earphones on my manager, like football coaches have, the better to advise him on lineups and strategy. Whatever the last straw was, Bobby Winkles took a walk in order to be comfortable again.

title: Hunters Dine to Aid Wildlife
description: DENVER, May 24 (AP)The big feast is over, but the memories of tough Algerian camel, rich Amazon piranha, tasty African elephant, African lion and sea serpent linger on.

title: Daylin Quits Battle For Dyno After $30 Bid
description: A takeover battle for Dymo Industries between Esselte A.B. of Sweden and Daylin Inc. of San Francisco fizzled late yesterday after Esselte raised its offering price to buy the company and Daylin withdrew.

title: Music: Schuller Conducts
description: LAST week Gunther Schuller was giving the audiences for the New York Philharmonic's Promenades a program of Americanacountry fiddle tunes, Paul Whiteman Band arrangements, music by turnofthecentury composers, marches. On Tuesday night, the conductor mixed past and present, light and serious native music in a concert in Alice Tully Hall by the American Composers Orchestra, where the audience included many of our leading serious composers. Ever the propagandist for what he believes in, Mr. Schuller is consistent about what he presents to his listeners.

title: Pearson Gets Pole Position
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., May 24 (AP)David Pearson pushed his Mercury to a fourlap average speed of 160.551 miles per hour today to take the pole position for Sunday's $350,000 World 600 stock car race. Cale Yarborough took the outside spot on the first row with an average speed of 159.736 over four laps in his Oldsmobile.

title: Backgammon:
description: When you are considering a play, remember that the past history of the game is irrelevant. Each position must be viewed with fresh eyes, regardless of whether a spectacular turnabout has just occurred. Yet players, unlike dice, have memories. This is why after a miraculous number has just been rolled, a player's judgment often becomes distorted. A recent game at New York's Bar Point House of Backgammon illustrates this point. To understand what happened when the diagrammed position was reached, it is necessary to backtrack one roll. On the previous turn, X still had a man on the bar, and O, the overwhelming favorite, was about to begin hearing off. 0 had a single man on the 17point when X rolled a miraculous 5.3 to reenter and hit O's blot.

title: BABY MAULED TO DEATH BY A DOG IN MT. VERNON
description: AMOUNT VERNON, N. Y., May 24 (AP) A young widow's 6weekold boy was mauled to death by her pet dog, the police said today.

title: Stage: Suicide Prohibited
description: THE only thing that petrifies faster than a whimsy is metaphysical whimsy. The late Alejandro Casona, a Spanish playwright of the second water, has set up a clinic whose facilities encourage suicide: a lake for drowning trees fitted out with nooses and so on.

title: Carter Lends Hand To Bob Hope Party
description: WASHINGTON, May 24Once, in a serious moment Bob Hope explained why it is that when he made jokes about Presidents and other major Washington figures, he talked about their clothes, golf scores, eating habits and other superficial mannerisms.

title: Bus Line to Resume Operations on Tuesday
description: ELMHOOD PARK, May 24  Full service on Manhattan Transit Company bus routes for the more than 20,000 daily riders in Bergen, Passaic and Hudson Counties, is scheduled to resume on Tuesday, a spokesman for the company said today. Service will also resume on a subsidiary company the Mohawk Bus Company, which handles 1,500 riders from Rockland and Orange Counties who commute to New York City.

title: Monetary System Reform Opposed by Blumenthal
description: MEXICO CITY, May 24Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal spoke out strongly today against major reform of the international monetary system, arguing that the recent instability of the dollar was the result of worldwide economic imbalances that should be tackled directly.

title: Cubs Lead East as Trillo's Homer in 10th Tops Phils
description: Manny Trillo, the second baseman or the Chicago Cubs, stands 61, weighs 160 pounds and in three previous seasons with Chicago had hit a total of only 18 homers.

title: The Eptness Issue
description: WASHINGTONStudents of Democratic powergrabs were impressed last year when Jimmy Carter, in cahoots with Speaker Tip O'Neill, tried to take over the bipartisan Federal Elections Commission.

title: Desolation at Kolwezi
description: KOLWEZI, Zaire, May 24The clutter of destruction and flight and the stink of death begins at the airport. Military debris, bottles, tin cans lie among the wreckage of burned planes and helicopters. Cars abandoned by fleeing whites are parked crazily, their innards systematically torn out.

title: McNally Schedules CorkPopping Gala
description: If all goes well, Alexander C. McNally will sell some 20,000 bottles of wine today, which is a lot of grape in anyone's book. As internaltional wine manager for Heublein Inc., Mr. McNally, 43 years old, is in charge of the company's annual auction of fine wines. This year's sale is being held at the Omni International Hotel in Atlanta.

title: Events Today
description: THE BEGGAR'S OPERA by John Gay; directed by Eve Shapiro; presented by the Jullard School Alan S??nneider, director; at tne Drama Workshop, 144 West ??6th Street, E.

title: A Guide to Getting to and Around Atlantic City, and a Look at Casino
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 24Major bus lines are sharply increasing express service from New York and Philadelphia elsewhere beginning this weekend with the opening of Atlantic City's first legal gambling casino.

title: Kennecott Claims Victory Over CurtissWright
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation yesterday claimed victoryas widely predicted  over the CurtissWright Corporation in the biggest proxy war in 20 years.

title: CITY OFFERS TO BREAK CONTROLBOARD SNAG
description: ALBANY. May 24Governor Carey and Mayor Koch tonight offered to New York City's municipal labor unions a compromise on the power of the Emergency Financinl Cl,ntrol Board that they said was being considered by the unions art their allies in the Legislature.

title: Digest BUSINESS
description: After 219 days, energy conferees approved a natural gas pricing package. But the narrow votes by which Senate and House conferees approved lifting controls on natural gas by 1985 reflected stilldeep division. But now the conferees can get on with other unassembled pieces of the Administration's energy program. [Page A1.]

title: ABC to Affiliates: We're No. 1
description: LOS ANGELES, May 24The California sun, which had taken the morning off, came out just in time for the outdoor luncheon on Monday that opened ABCTV's annual meeting with its affiliated stations. The sun's excellent timing was symbolic of how things have gone for the network the last two years.

title: Queens Primary Is Possible for Delaney's House Seat
description: The possibility of a Democratic primary fightanathema to most politicians and all but unheard of in tnc cozy party politics of Queenswas raised yesterday in a Congressional district that, the county leader said, had been predesigned to favor Republicans.

title: Chile Still Repressing Unions, Visiting U.S. tabor Leaders Say
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 23Leaders of the United States labor movement said today after a meeting with President Augusto Pinochet that Chile's repression of free trade unions had not decreased despite more freedom in other areas.

title: Accord Reached on Scaling Down Of Energy Plan Carey Had Sought
description: ALBANY, May 24Legislative negotiators and the State Energy Commissioner agreed tonight on a scaleddown energy plan that falls short of the proposal offered by Governor Carey last February to give a board of executive appointees broad powers over energy policy. The agreement followed weeks of offagain, onagain negotiations involving environmental, utility, bureaucratic and partisan interests.

title: F.D.A. Recalls Breakfast Bars And Slender Diet Meal Bars
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP)The Food and Drug Administration said today that 14.1 million Carnation Breakfast Bars and Slender Diet Meal Bars have been recalled because sonic may contain pieces of wire.

title: Seven Elderly Americans Killed In BusTruck Crash in Norway
description: OSLO, May 24 (UPI)Seven Americans were killed and four seriously injured today when the tourist bus in which the were riding hit the trailer of a freight truck, the police said.

title: Inventories Up 7.8% At Dry Goods Corp.
description: RICHMOND, May 24The president of the Associated Dry Goods Corporation told stockholders at the company's annual meeting today that, as of the first of the month, inventories were 7.8 percent above comparable totals a year ago and a concerted effort would be made to bring them in line by the end of August, He added that the deparment store chain would attempt to cancel some orders where possible.

title: Charge of Bias Bars Sale of Jersey Home
description: TRENTON, May 24 (UPI)Judge Morton I. Greenberg of State Superior Court has temporarily blocked the sale of a political leader's home over charges he refused to sell to a black woman.

title: CARTER BUDGET AIDES SEEK A MISSILE CURB
description: WASHINGTON, May 24White House budget officials, in a memorandum to the Pentagon, have opposed an Air Force plan to begin fullscale development next year of the MX mobile intercontinental missile, Administration officials said today.

title: YankeesIndians Put Off by Rain
description: The YankeesCleveland Indians game scheduled for Yankee Stadium last night was postponed because of the daylong heavy rain.

title: Hartz Mountain's Plans For Mall in Meadowland Given New Lease on Life
description: SECAUCUS, May 24The hopes of Hartz Mountain Industries to build a major regional shopping center here astride the New Jersey Turnpike remained alive today as the Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission agreed to consider a request for a rezoning crucial to the proposed project.

title: Record Utility Financing
description: The Pacific Gas and Electric Company sold 5 million shares of preferred stock yesterday valued at $137.5 millionthe largest such financing on record for an electric utility.

title: F.T.C. Orders an End to Restraints On Advertising of Eyeglass Prices
description: WASHINGTON, May 21The Federal Trade Commission today ordered that restrictions on the advertising of eyeglass prices he lifted, a move aimed at fostering competition that the commssion has estimated might eventually save consumers as much as $400 million yearly.

title: Monitor Asserts Revenues Will Fall Short of Koch Estimatel
description: New York City revenues for the fiscal year that begins July 1 will fall at least $115 million short of Mayor Koch's estimate, according to the state's chief monitor of the citys fiscal situation.

title: CARTER'S PERFORMANCE IS CALLED DISAPPOINTING
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP)President Carier's performance since taking office IC months ago has been courageous but disappointing because he has failed to deliver on his promises, a study by the Brookings Institution said today.

title: Summer Workshop
description: Summer sessions in Home Mechanics: Home Repair and Improvement will begin Tuesday, June 13, at the Knowhow Workshop's new location, 17 West 17th Street. Classes will be held on Tuesdays and Thursdays at 10 A.M., 5:55 P.M. and 7:55 P.M. The cost is $115. Each class is limited to 16. For more information, call 7415610.

title: Rhodesian Army Leader Warns Cubans Against Invasion Attempt
description: SALISIBURY, Rhodesia, May 24 (Reuters)  Rhodesia's Army commander, Lieut. Gen. John Hickman, said today that the country was prepared to deal with an invasion, and warned Cuban forces against such an attempt.

title: Seattle Slew Ailing, Out of Monday Race
description: The news that Seattle Slew would not start in next Monday's $100,000 added Metropolitan Handicap, combined with an allday rainstorm, served to dampen the opening of Belmont Park's 58day meeting yesterday.

title: Iran Slide Kills 17 in Train
description: TEHRAN, Iran, May 24 (UPI)Rock and earth loosened by days of rain hurtied down a mountainside today and strack a passenger train, burying the dera?? coaches and killing at least 17 persons The newspaper Ettelaat said the had occurred shortly after midnight near the agricultural. market town of Gorgan, 235 miles northeast of here,

title: For Airline, Stronger Wings
description: Pacific Southwest Airlines, once the Peck's bad boy of the airline industry, took another step toward middleaged maturity yesterday with an extensive realignment of top management posts.

title: Companies Report Earnings
description: For periods as show. (N) indicates stock is listed on the New York stock Exchange,(A) the American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Gen. Jones Confirmed To Head Joint Chiefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP)Gen. David C. Jones of the Air Force was confirmed by the Senate today as chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, the nation's top military post.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday, May 24, 1978

title: Anderson Quits Governor's Race For a Lack of Funds and Support
description: ALBANY, May 24Stymied by a failure to raise enough money or gain the support of party officials. Warren M. Anderson of Binghamton officially abandoned his hopes of running for the Republican nomination for Governor today, and said he would seek reelection to his State Senate seat and his post as majority leader.

title: Jersey Site Holds Nearly a HalfBillion Dollar War Stockpile
description: SOMERVILLE, N.J.Next to the fabulous gardens the Doris Duke estate, off Route 206 near here lies an unlandscaped, wirefenced, 880acre site that has the earmarks of a beggarly neighbor. It appears to contain piles abandoned materials and warehouses and railroad tracks that are only rarely used. A closed military base, perhaps?

title: Detroit Bonds Sold at 7.43% Rate
description: Taxexempt bonds yielding more than 7 percent were marketed yesterday as Detroit, one of the handful of major industrial cities that the investment community has accorded secondclass citizenship, sold $18.1 million of securities

title: Movie: 'Youngblood':Ghetto Melodrama
description: "YOUNGBLOOD," the low-budget melodrama that opened yesterday at the Forum and other theaters, effectively trivializes a lot of problems without offering in return anything in the way of entertainment???, which is what movies like this are supposed to deal in.Written by Paul Carter Harrison and directed by Noel Nosseck, whose bland achievements suggest they learned their trades in television, the film is about a troubled high school student nicknamed Youngblood (Bryan O'Dell) and his attempts to adjust to black ghetto life by joining a youth gang. The gang is really not so young since its leader, a fellow named Rommel (Lawrence-Hilton Jacobs of "Cooley High"), is a married Vietnam vet coping with the horrors of civilian life."Youngblood" tries to walk down both sides of the street at the same time. The gang is depicted as not above murder and other forms of antisocial behavior, though it becomes as righteous as a Sunday school group when one gang member dies of a dose of a bad drug. Most of the film is about the gang's attempts to bust the narcotics racket, which is complicated by the fact that Youngblood's older brother is a chief pusher.The performances seem less bad than thin. There isn't much in the way of material to work with. Instead, the actors display all these loose-jointed, no-longer-hip mannerisms that, one s???uspects, they've learned from watching dozens of other movies exactly like this one.

title: Market Place
description: IN a period of huge takeovers that has seen such giants as Babcock & Wilcox and Otis Elevator besieged and eventually absorbed, it may come as no surprise that Pet Inc., with more than $1 billion in sales, is the latest topic of takeover rumors.

title: A Bonanza for Those With Designs on Fur
description: IF a woman complains that she can't find just what she wants in fur this year, she isn't really trying. Seventh Avenue designers have jostled each other to get their names on fur labels and a number of Parisian designers have joined the stampede. Since their individual moods differ, the simplest thing for the shopper to do is choose her favorite designer in cloth and then find what he's done for the fur department. There's variety to spare.

title: Pollution Violations Laid to VW by U. S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP)The Government today charged Volkswagen's United States subsidiary and 15 Volkswagen dealers with vioiating air pollution standards by tampering with emission control systems on 20 cars.

title: SOVIET CARRIES OUT TEST OF A KILLER SATELLITE
description: WASHiNGTON. May 24 (Reuters)The Soviet Union apparently has carried out its first test this year of a socalled killer satellite almost on the eve of talks aimed at banning such weapons from space, the Detense Department said today.

title: Juanita Kreps Lauded For Lifting Agency Status
description: WASHINGTON, May 24Robert S. Strauss, the President's trade and inflation counselor, told her she had taken a thirdrate department and made it second rate. President Carter himself told her she had taken a thirdrate department and made it first rate.

title: Bridge:
description: The most remarkable feature of the 50th Goldman pairs, due to be played Saturday and Sunday at the New York Hilton Hotel will not be the presence of Oswald Jacoby, who won the first aoldman in 1929, but rather the participation of Jay Feigus, who will set in astonishing record: He will have played in all 50 Goldman events.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Old Resort, New Era
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 24In the last hours before legalized casino gambling opens a new era here, this city has been stirring with events, mostly small ones, that reflect in different ways the mood of nervous anticipation, sometimes giddiness.

title: Gen. Andre Laurier, Commanded French Forces in West Germany
description: PARIS, May 24Gen. Andre Laurier, commander in chief of French forces in West Germany, died last night in an automobile accident near Strasbourg He was 56 years old.

title: About New York
description: Judy Resnick dropped herself into East Harlem randomly in the middle of the night, skittering in like a tiddlywink into the forest, propelled far from her home in Mount Vernon.

title: Plan Offered to Mobutu
description: BRUSSELS, May 24Belgium called today for the creation of an allAfrican peacekeeping force, with logistical support from the European Economic Community, to protect the rich copper mines of Shaba Province in Zaire against any new attacks by Angolabased insurgents.

title: 26 Hurt, 5 Seriously, in the Crash of RiverdaletoManhattan Bus
description: Twentysix persons were injured yesterday, five seriously enough to be hospitalized, when an express bus going from the Riverdale section of the Bronx to Manhattan crashed into an abutment on the rainswept Major Deegan Expressway in the Bronx near Yankee Stadium.

title: Soviet Lofts Cosmos 1011
description: MOSCOW, May 24 (UPI)The Soviet Union fired the Cosmos 1011 satellite into orbit today, rims, the official press agency, reported, saying that the satellite was to he used for a continuation of space research. It is to circle the earth every 104.9 minutes in an orbit that takes it 637 Miles into space at the maximum and 607.7 miles at the minimum.

title: Economic Scene
description: CHIEF Justic Warren E. Burger voted with the Supreme Court's 5to4 majority in the Bellotti case last month, striking down a Massachusetts law that had restricted the First Amendment rights of corporations to matters directly affecting their business interests. But in his concurring opinion, Mr. Burger went beyond the immediate issue to raise some questions that he said were likely to come up concerning the rights of the press.

title: Islamic Leader Says Organization Is Taking a Turn Toward Patriotism
description: CHICAGO, May 24Two years after abandoning its separatist philosophy, the predominantly black World Community of AlIslam in the West has evolved into what its leader describes as a staunchly patriotic organization with a belief that minorities may have asked for too much and not done enough for themselves.

title: Head of Travel Agency in Jersey Faces Arrest on Charges of Fraud
description: TEANECK, N.J., May 24 (AP)Florence Ackerman, a Teaneck travel agent who stranded 41 Israelbound tourists at Kennedy International Airport when she used their ticket money to finance promotional trips to Spain and Massachussetts, will be arrested when she leaves Holy Name Hosbital here. the police said.

title: The Heal's Bed: Luxurious, Expensive, Totally Handmade
description: LONDON ANYONE with $58,500 lying idle. and a taste for powderblue damask might seriously consider enhancing his home with a fourposter bed custombuilt by British craftsmen to commemorate Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee. It is at present standing forlornly in the corner of a London store, unoccupied  a living testament to the maxim that apart from yesterday's newspaper there is nothing as pass as last year's jubilee bed.

title: Arafat's P.L.O. Rule Is Challenged
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 24Yasir Arafat's overall leadership of the Palestinian guerrilla movement was challenged today when five small groups demanded a new leadership that would make decisions collectively.

title: Mondale, at U.N., Offers Nations Equipment to Help Avert Conflicts
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 24Vice President Mondale said today that the United States would. like to stimulate regional armscontrol efforts by offering electronic earlywarning systems to other countries to help prevent regional conflicts.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, MAY 25, 1978

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: Gaudi's Legacy

title: Books of The Times
description: MORTAL FRIENDS. By James Carroll. 607 pages. Little, Brown. $10.95.

title: U.S. Bankers Negotiating Asian Loans
description: SINGAPORE, May 24A series of major loans is expected to be floated in this region in the next few months as Asian borrowers take advantage of prevailing liquidity and low interest rates to refinance old loans and fund new projects.

title: Jersey Bookstore Indicted
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J, May 24 (AP A bookstore in nearby Edison has been indicted on two counts of possessing obscene materials for sale. The indictment. issued yesterday by a Middlerex County grand jury, names the shop's parent eorporation. PHI Inc. of Allcntown. Pa., and the shop's manager, Stephen H. Mackyousky of Bound Brook, as defendantsThe indictment was the result of a raid on the establishment. the Adult Trading Post, last year, authorities said.

title: NAVY CHIEF SAYS U.S. HAS BEST SUBMARINES
description: WAHINGTON, Nov. 24The Secretary of the Navy, W. Graham Claytor, said tonight that the United States had gained a wide qualitative advantage over the Soviet Union in antisubmarine warfare.

title: Carey to Push Racing Bill; OTB Opposes Surcharge
description: Proposed legislation that would restructure New York's horseracing operations is expected to be introduced in Albany today with a message of necessity from Governor Carey.

title: Around the Nation
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 24 (AP)The Federal Government filed two suits against the City of Philadelphia today, complaining that it had violated the Clean Water and Ocean Dumping Act and seeking to hasten construction of three sewagetreatment plants.

title: Bruce Springsteen Begins a Tour
description: BUFFALO, May 24  Bruce Springsteen has been under a number of clouds of late. After an enormous amount of attention in 1975, he slipped from sight. There was a protracted legal battle over questions of his management, record production and publishing ownership. When that was resolved he spent a characteristically extended amount of time perfecting his new albumwhich is due out in a week.

title: Genet's Blacks Is Staffed by Faison
description: THE BLACKS is an endlessly fascinating play. Dance, music, ritual, ceremony, high merriment and low comedy make up the unlikely amalgam that turns Jean Genet's drama into an Expressionistic exercise. And Genet has borrowed from film the quick justaposition of scenes and the fluid flow from incident to incident. It's a director's vehicle. Nevertheless, the play is far from being only a spectacle. For its theme is somber and its implications are savage.

title: Violations Laid to Bank
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The Seurities and Exchange Commission charged today that the bond department of the First National Bank of Chicago had willfully violated trading laws, and the bank consented to an S.E.C. censure order.

title: 209,000 IN ARMY FOUND TO BE USING MARIJUANA
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP)Some 209,000 enlisted personnel in the Army use marijuana and 49,000 use such hard drugs as heroin and LSD, according to an internal Armysurvey.

title: Music: Kostelanetz in Vienna Program
description: SINCE Viennese waltzes and operetta music are staples of socalled pop concerts everywhere, the New York Philharmonic's annual Promenades always include a Vienna program. Andre Kostelanetz and the orchestra, with Carole Farley as soprano soloist, introduced the 1978 version at Avery Fisher Hall on Tuesday night.

title: Article 5 -- No Title
Chlorine] Fumes In L.I. Fire Drive Hundreds Away
description: Hundreds of Nassau County residents were forced to leave their homes early this morning when a fire at a swimmingpool products company in Bethpage sent. clouds of acrid chlorine fumes drifting !south from Hempstead Turnpike and Hicksville Road.

title: Flowers: Planting A Bouquet
description: LETTUCE at $1.49 a head is a problem many home gardeners are conquering, at least during the local growing season. But what about the $1.49 bouquet of daisies packed with a rousing five or six flowers, if one is lucky? Not to mention that the florist's selection these days seems to consist of roses, daisies, carnations (dyed), daisies, mums and daisies. Don't get me wrong. I like daisies  all the many species included under that common appellation. Still, they don't offer much variety when it comes to a bouquet for the table.

title: Dow Drops 7.37 on Rate Worries
description: Increasing investor concern over rising interest rates and inflation sent the stock market sharply lower yesterday for the second session in a row. Trading was active but ran below Tuesday's Dace.

title: WHITE HOUSE OFFERS URBAN PLAN COVERING ONLY NEEDIEST AREAS
description: WASHLNGTON, May 24The White House has devised a formula that would focus benefits on onethird of the nation's communitiesincluding all major cities in New York and New Jerseyunder President Carter's new urban aid program. But because the remaining twothirds are excluded, the program appears to be facing severe obstacles in Congress.

title: BruinCanadien Warfare Has Referees in Middle
description: BOSTON, May 24Andy van Hellemond is a mildmannered, softspoken young man who would probably cross the street to avoid an argument. Too bad he's the referee who's going to be thrust into the hot box of the sixth game of the National Hockey League championship playoffs tomorrow, a series that seems to be reaching the crisis of a nuclear meltdown.

title: Tosdanini Programs to Be Rebroadcast
description: The NBC Symphony, conducted by Arturo Toscanini, is being heard here every Sunday on radio in a series of programs that has Ben Grauer as host. Don Gillis is the producer.

title: New York Detective Story: Less Specializing
description: It was not an unusual crimea burglary of a Queens store that sells everything from stereo sets and watches to Indian spices and groceries. When the proprietors arrived in the morning to open up, they found display cases and cartons empty of their merchandise. Lentils from a slashed sack were strewn across the floor.

title: Article 2 -- No Title
REGENTS TOUGHENING DIPLOMA STANDARDS
description: The New York State Board of Regents is expected today to throw out the minimumcompetency examination, which has been criticizd as being ridiculously easy, and impose a more rigorous test for highschool graduation.

title: Advertising
