description: The people who run the radio stations in this area don't consider the $90 million in ad revenues they pulled in last year a fair share of the pie. So they'll turn to advertising, that sure cure for whatever it is that ails you.

title: Guitar: Frederick Draper
description: IF Frederick Draper had managed to play the guitar with as much easygoing charm as he revealed when chatting with the audience at Carnegie Recital Hall Tuesday night, his recital would have been a complete delight. Instead, it was erratic but fairly delightful anyway.

title: Army Will Buy German Trucks
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (Reuters)The Army said today it planned to purchase up to $120 million worth of West German trucks and other vehicles over the next seven years for use by United States forces in Europe.

title: Newark Boys Choir Sings New Menotti Opera
description: THE NEWARK BOYS CHORUS carne to New York last night to give a concert. at Alice Tully Hall and brought with it a new opera by Gian Carlo Menotti. The Trial of the Gypsy, which was given its world premiere. The opera was created for the chorus, which commissioned it, and it suited the young performers perfectly.

title: Article 4 -- No Title
Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Early Storm Warning System An Urgent Job for Scientists
description: BOULDER, Colo.Scientists at Government laboratories here believe some major discoveries about the Earth's climate may be near, and that man may soon have his first chance to do something about the weather.

title: Attorney General in Jersey Rules Town Can Own Cable TV Station
description: TRENTON, May 24 (UPI)State Attorney General John Degnan has ruled that a municipality has the right to own and run a cable televisionstation inNew Jersey.

title: Notes on People
description: IN A LONDON court hearing yesterday that took less than two minutes, Princess Margaret of Britain was divorced from her husband of 18 years. Lord Snowdon. Neither the 47yearold princess nor her husband, 48, attended the hearing on the princess' divorce petition, which was not opposed by Lord Snowdon. Only a few members of the public were among the 35 or so persons present; the rest were newsmen. The royal divorce, granted on grounds that the marriage was irretrievably broken down, came 20th on a list of 27 before the court, which also heard the cases of a barmaid, a guardsman, and an office cleaner. The princess' divorce will be absolute in six weeks, when the parties will be free to remarry. Lord Snowdon, who retains his title although it is possible he won't use it, has indicated he would like to marry Lucy LindsayHogg. who also has been divorced.

title: Turkish Premier Visiting Brussels
description: BRUSSELS, May 24 (Reuters)Prime NIinister Bulent Ecevit of Turkey arrived here today for a fiveday visit, hoping to win Common Market support for his efforts to solve Turkey's economic problems. He will also confer with officials of the Atlantic alliance in preparation for an alliance meeting next week in Washington at which Turkey will preside.

title: 2 New Typewriters Introduced by I.B.M.
description: Two new electronic typewriters that are said to make it much easier to turn out errorfree copy were introduced yesterday by the International Business Machines Corporation at Franklin Lakes. N.J.

title: '42 Study of Starvation in Warsaw Discussed at Columbia Symposium
description: While the Nazis deliberately starved the 500,000 men, women and children in the Warsaw Ghetto in 1942, Jewish doctors incarcerated there systematically recorded the effects of starvation on the human mind and body while they did their best to treat the victims.

title: Paper Union Assails U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The president of a West Coast union representing paper mill workers protested today that the Federal wageprice council had interfered, in an act of bad faith, with the union's collectivebargaining process.

title: Harris Gets Title Bout
description: Ronnie Harris has, signed to fight the world middleweight champion, Hugo Corro, in Buenos Aires on July 8, Harris's manaprs said last night. Harris is undefeated in 26 bouts and ranked as the No. 1 contender by the World Boxing Association and World Boxing Counc:l. Corro has won 41 of 43 fights, including his upset over Rodrigo Valdez for the championship last April.

title: In Occupied Territory
description: RAMALLAH, Occupied West BankAziz Shehade is a widely known West Bank lawyer, a man of 65, respected, successful. He has friends in Israel, and he spent two months this winter as a visiting fellow at Harvard. He is a model of the moderate Palestinian with whom Israel ought to be able to get along.

title: Wife of Soviet Defector Says the C.I.A. May Have Caused His Death
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The wife of a Soviet defector has asked President Carter and the Senate Intelligence Committee to investigate disclosures that have led her to suspect that her husband's life may have been needlessly sacrificed by the Central Intelligence Agency in a counterintelligence operaton.

title: Letters
description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: WHITE HOUSE OFFERS URBAN PLAN COVERING ONLY NEEDIEST AREAS
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The White House has devised a formula that would focus benefits on onethird of the nation's communitiesincluding all major cities in New York and New Jerseyunder President Carter's new urban aid program. But because the remaining twothirds are excluded, the program appears to be facing severe obstacles in Congress.

title: Reporter's Notebook: New Era Opens at Old Resort
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 24In the last hours before legalized casino gambling opens a new era here, this city, has been stirring with events, mostly small ones, that reflect in different ways the mood of nervous anticipation, sometimes giddiness.

title: Theater: Charlie At the Hartford
description: HARTFORD THE VEGAS BAR, the setting of James Borrelli's first play, Theyd Come to See Charlie, at the Hartford Stage Company, is a good luck bar facing misfortune. A remnant of palmier days on New York's Lower East Side, the Vegas is encrusted with dust and memories. Old friends once gathered for whisky and fight talk, and the proprietor, Charlie Campagna, had dreams for himself, his children and his bar.

title: U.S. Still Weighing LykesLTV Merger
description: A decision by Attonrey General Griffin B. Bell on the proposed merger of the Lykes Corporation into the LTV Corporation will not be taken for at least a week, it was estimated yesterday.

title: Leading Scorers Traded
description: SAN DIEGO, May 24 (UPI)The San Diego Sackers of the North American Seccer League have tr??ded their leading scorer for the Tempa Bay Rowdies' leading scorer. The Sockers said today they are sending Pete Anderson ?? exchange for Derek Smethurst.

title: Dollar Down on News Of Wall Street Decline
description: The United States dollar, reacting negatively to a decline on Wall Street and expected unpleasant news about inflation, edged downward yesterday in foreign exchange trading overseas and in New York, according to The Associated Press.

title: Shero Eyed As Coach Of Rangers
description: Sonny Werblin, head of the corporation that controls the Rangers, disclosed yesterday that he would talk to the Philadelphia Flyers about releasing Fred Shero to become the New York hockey team's coach.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, MAY 25, 1978

title: Weedon Ends 2 Bond Units
description: Weeden & Company, the nation's largest. third market dealer and long an antagonist of the New York Stock Exchange, has further cut hick its operations amid strong reports on Wall Street that it may be moving toward ??quidation or merger with a larger securities house.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
Carter Is Said to Want to Help Rebels in Angola
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The White House insisted today that President Carter had not yet decided to try to help guerrillas who are fighting Cuban forces in Angola. But the Senate's leading Africa specialist said he had good reason to believe that the Administration wanted to do so.

title: 21 STATES GAVE U.S. MORE THAN THEY GOT BACK
description: Twentyone states sent more tax dollars to Washington in 1977 than they received back in Federal aid, according to figures from the Tax Foundation.

title: PlainLanguage Politics
description: Efforts are under way to postpone and weaken New York State's admirable plainlanguage law, designed help consumers understand such jargonfilled documents as apartment leases and consumer contracts. The State Senate has passed a bill to carry out the law responsibly by studying its economic impact; the study would be left. to the State Law Revision Commission, a body with little expertise in analyzing economic impacts. Meanwhile, the Senate would delay the effective date of the law from June 1 to Nov. 1 for most transactionsand for a full year for real estate and insurance transactions. Some revision may well be needed; but the Senate bill offers too much to those who simply want to hold up and weaken the bill.

title: People
description: Donald Cecil, general partner of Cumberland Associates, an asset management firm, has been elected a director of Grey Advertising Inc.

title: SENATE CONFEREES AGREE TO END CURBS ON GAS PRICES IN 85
description: WASHINGTON, May 24Congressional conferees agreed today on the pricing of natural gas, the toughest issue in their 219day effort to reach an accord on energy legislation.

title: Getting Serious About Energy
description: An amazing week. A conservative Republican Congressman takes an important Chinese diplomat on a tour of his rural Illinois district; the Congressman cannot imagine that having happened a few years ago. A Democratic President contemplates giving extensive new powers to the head of the F.B.I.; J. Edgar Hoover could not have imagined that a few years ago. And now, a group of House conferees on energy approves a plan to deregulate gradually the price of natural gas; that was not easy imagine even a few days ago. The end of the Thirty Years War, exulted Energy Secretary Schlesinger. He is entitled to be proud. The conferees decision marks the end of an era on gas pricing that dates back at least to 1949; and it marks the beginning of a serious national energy policy.

title: Rogues Top Cosmos On Field's Goal, 10
description: MEMPHIS, May 24The Memphis Rogues stunned the Cosmos tonight, 10, and though Franz Beckenbauer did not play, he was just as upset as Giorgio Chinaglia, who did play.

title: Aides Urge Carter to Travel to Build Up His Image
description: WASHINGTON, May 24  President Carter's closest political advisers have been urging him to get out of the White House and travel around the nation to bolster his sagging image in the public opinion polls.

title: Speer Balks At Pledging Price Curbs
description: Edgar B. Speer, the chairman of the United States Steel Corporation, said yesterday that while he supported President Carter's effort to curb inflation, he could not commit his company to keeping prices at a certain level since the steel industry is in no position whatsoever to absorb increased costs.

title: Friends of a Soviet Dissident Say His TV Confession Was Fabricated
description: TBILISI, U.S.S.R., May 24Friends of a Georgian dissident sentenced last week to five years of imprisonment and banishment said today that most of his nationally televised confession had been fabricated by the authorities.

title: DEFENSE LEGISLATION TOTALING $38 BILLION APPROVED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, May 24In a significant victory for advocates of a stronger Navy, the House today beat back efforts to cut the authorization for construction of a nuclearpowered aircraft carrier and a nuclearpowered cruiser, then easily passed a $38 billion military procurement and research bill.

title: Quake in Aleutian Islands
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP)A strong earthquake shook the Aleutian Islands at 2:17 this morning, but there were no reports of damage, according to the United States Geological Survey. The earthquake, which registered 6.4 on the Ric??ter scale, was felt strongly on Adak. It occurred west of Adak and was measured by the geological survey at Golden, Colo.

title: Behind the LaborLaw Filibuster: Hours of Hard Work and Tension
description: WASHINGTON, May 24To an observer looking down from the Senate Gallery, the filibuster on a bill to revise the labor law, now in its seventh day and likely to go on for at least two more weeks, may seem slow, flat and paralyzingly boring.

title: Home Improvement
description: GOOD locks on all outside doors and firstfloor windows are essential to a home's security and will go a long way toward discouraging burglars. But an added protective device that is increasingly being used in homes is the burglar alarm system, which sounds a loud bell, horn or siren when someone tries to break in. Although this will not always prevent entry by a determined professional burglar, it is often enough to scare off vandals and spurofthemoment thieves who account for a high percentage of residential breakins.

title: Mondale, at URN., Offers Nations Equipment to Help Avert Conflicts
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 24Vice President Mondale said today that the United States was ready to provide electronic earlywarning systems to other countries to help prevent regional conflicts.

title: CORRECTION
description: A photograph of former President Gerald R. Ford supplied by The Associated Press and published in The Times yesterday carried an erroneous caption. The ceremony took place at New York Law School, and the person at the far right of the picture was Harold Brawner, a trustee. A typographical error caused a misspelling in the name of Charles W. Froessel, retired judge of the State Court of Appeals.

title: Disks: Britten Selections Exalt Harp and Voice
description: BRITTEN: Phaedra; Sacred and Profane: Prelude and Fugue (Op. 29); jour choral pieces. English Chamber Orchestra, Benjamin Britten and Steuart Bedford, conductors; Janet Baker, mezzo. soprano; Wilbye Consort. Peter Pears, conductor. London (OS 26527).

title: Dublin Leader Asks Britain and U.S. for Action on Ulster
description: DUBLIN, May 23Prime Minister John Lynch of Ireland has issued an appeal to the Americans and the British to help solve the violent problems of Northern Ireland.

title: Quebec Sets Up Company To Widen Asbestos Stake
description: MONTREAL, May 24Quebec has set up a $250 million public corporation as the first step toward taking over part of the province's asbestos industry and expanding its operations from simple mining to manufacturing finished products.

title: GRACE PATRICK
description: Grace Patrick, widow of Lester Patrick, a former New York Ranger coach and, general manager, died yesterday in Riverside, Conn., a spokesman for the National Hockey League club said. She was 90 years old.

title: BLACK LEADERS SUE TO STOP A KOCH MOVE
description: Representative Charles B. Rangel and State Senator H. Carl McCall filed suit yesterday in Federal Court to stop Mayor Koch's plans to restructure New York City's antipoverty program.

title: Peking Accuses Vietnam Of Abusing and Expelling 70,000 Chinese Residents
description: PEKING, May 24 (Reuters)China accused Vietnam today of maltreatment and mass expulsion of Chinese residents, in a statement. that indicated a further deterioration in relations between the neighboring Communist countries.

title: Gasoline Output Continues Rise
description: Gasoline production continued its seasonal rise in the week ended May 19, the American Petroleum Institute reported yesterday.

title: Water Projects Have Ruined Habitat, Lawyer for Wildlife Group Says
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Millions of acres of wildlife habitat around the country have been destroyed in recent years by federally approved water projects such as dams and dredgings that were allowed to proceed in violation of a seldomenforced 1934 law, an attorney for the National Wildlife Federation said this week.

title: Q&A
description: Q. We installed a hot water heating system last fall in a house that had never before been heated. In various rooms there are paneling boards of random width that were installed when the house was built. Apparently the heat has caused them to decrease in width so that the full tongue and groove is exposed at the joints. Is there any treatment that will bring the boards back to their original width and prevent future shrinking? E.A.W., Forest Hills, Queens.

title: U.C.L.A., Stanford Gain Tennis Final in N.C.A.A.
description: ATHENS, Ga.. May 24 (AP)The Unvedsity of California, Los Angeles, beat Southern California and Stanford deFeated Southern Methodist in the semifinals of the National Collegiate team tennis championships.

title: Senator's Son Is Electrocuted
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP)Gage Burdick, 16 years old, son of Senator Quentin N. Burdick, Democrat of North Dakota, was electrocuted yesterday while using an electric sander at the family's home in Fargo, N.D., the Senator's office said today.

title: National Gallery to Moun Munch Exhibition
description: WASHINGTON (AP)The National Gallery of Art next Nov. 11 will mount a major display of works by Edward Munch, a major 20thcentury Norwegian Impressionist. J. Carter Brown, the gallery's division has announced.

title: Bullets Are Determined To Erase Playoff Jinx
description: This is the third time the Washington Bullets are in the National Basketball Association finals, and they are still seeking their first victory. Their record against the Milwaukee Bucks in 1971, the Golden State Warriors in 1975 and the Seattle Supersonics in the present four  of  seven  game series is nine straight defeats.

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY, MAY 24, 1978

title: F.T.C. Orders an End to Restraints On Advertising of Eyeglass Prices
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The Federal Trade Commission today ordered that restrictions on the advertising of eyeglass pricers be lifted, a move aimed at fostering competition that the commission has estimated might eventually save consumers as much as $400 million yearly.

title: Sound
description: PROGRESS in audio, as in other fields of engineering, is usually slow and humdrum. It inches onward predictably by incremental revisions of existing designs. Imaginative leaps are rare. What is even rarer is a corporate decision to scrap the safe, cheap incremental routine and plunge into a radical reappraisal of all design factors to build a new model from the ground up.

title: Man Sentenced to Life in Murder That He Admitted After 14 Years
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 24 (AP)Joseph Egenberger, who turned himself in 14 years after stabbing an 18yearold woman to death, was sentenced today to life in prison.

title: Carter Thanks Dutch For World War II Acts
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (UPI)President Carter thanked a group of Netherlanders today for their help in the rescue of American fliers shot down behind enemy lines during World War II.

title: Blue 3M Symbol Is Turning Red
description: The 3M symbol, used by the company that is more formally known as the Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Company. will be changed on June 1. Beginning on that date, the present blue 3M symbol and socalled Russian alphabet a.re being replaced by a red symbol and Helvetica alphabet.

title: Robert Noehren, Organist, Named Performer of Year
description: Robert Nochren has been named recipient of the first International Performerofthe Year Award sponsored by the New York City Chapter of the American Guild of Organists and will piay the Winner's Award Recital at Alice Tully Hall on June 5. Miss Tuily will present the award to Mr. Nochren at the recital.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Cleveland Indians, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 8 P.M. (RadioWINS. 8 P.M.) Mets vs. Pirates, at Pittsburgh. (RadioWMCA, WGLI, 7:30 P.M.)

title: Delaware & Hudson In Creditor Accord
description: The troubled Delaware & Hudson Rallway Company completed an agreement with two of its creditors yesterday, staving off bankruptcy for at least another month.

title: Dance: Ballet Theater's Growing Soviet Influence
description: THE conventional wisdom that the arts in the Soviet Union are of little use as models to the West is belied in the one field in which the Soviet influence has been visibly feltballet in the West over the last 20 years.

title: World News Briefs
description: TEL AVIV, May 24Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan said today that the United States had found Egypt's counterproposals to Israel's peace plan 'so impossible that it refused to pass them on to Jerusalem as a basis for negotiation.

title: OneYear Treasury Bills Sold at 7.417%
description: The Treasury auctioned oneyear bills yesterday at an average yield of 7.417 percent.

title: COMMODITIES
description: The price of beef on the hoof reached a record high of 61.65 cents a pound yesterday in the Sioux City, Iowa, cattle market, while packers paid record prices of 61.50 cents in the Omaha, and ChicagoJoliet receiving centers.

title: Southern Blacks, Women Found in Low City Jobs
description: ATLANTA, May 24A study of municipal employment patterns in 16 Southern cities reveals disregard for or failure of affirmative action hiring programs in placing blacks and women in upper level job classifications and salary ranges.

title: On Urban Policy
description: WASHINGTONThe most disappointing aspect of President Carter's recently announced urban policy is that its framers have learned so little from the past. They might have considered, for example, President Gerald R. Ford's interim report on urban policy, issued in October 1976.

title: Shaping Space for Single Living
description: MEAKE no mistake about it: Nancy Lane believes the efficacy of hard work. And she takes her responsibilities seriously as a trustee of two colleges, a director on six boards and as vice president of personnel for a division of a large corporation.

title: Action on Tuition Credits Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (UPI)Action on legislation that would grant tax credits for college tuition, originally scheduled for today, was postponed for at least a week when the House spent longer than expected on a defense authorization bill.

title: Funds to Abate Pollution Rising
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (UPI)Business plans to increase capital spending for pollution abatement equipment rose by 3 percent in 1978, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Pope Attacks New Abortion Law In Italy as Sanction for Crime
description: VATICAN CITY, May 24 (AP)Addressing a crowd of 10,000 today, Pope Paul VI attacked abortion as a crime against an innocent and defenseless creature and said that human life was sacred from its beginning in the mother's womb.

title: Soviet Books Found Full of AntiSemitism
description: American analysts of Soviet books and magazines find a link between the severe sentence for antiSoviet agitation imposed on Dr. Yuri F. Orlov, head of the Moscow group exposing human rights violations, and recently published materials that are openly antiSemitic and antiZionist in tone.

title: Deaths
description: APPLEGATEAnita Emery. Age 91. of 181 South St.. Morristown, N.J. Daughter of the late Vice Chancellor of New Jersey, John Runkle Emery and the late Alla Mackie Emery. Widow of Paul Ray Applegate, President and Chairman of the Board of Buckeye Pipe Line Company. Mother of P.R. Applegate, Jr. of Morristown, NJ., Mrs. Clara A. Pollard. North Palm Beach, Fla. and Mrs. Susan A. Plum. Brandon, Vermont. She is also survived by 5 grandchildren. Services will be held at The Chaise! of St. Peter's Church, Morristown at 11 AM on Friday. May 26, 1978. Interment private. Kindly omit flowers. Visiting hours at the Raymond A. Lanterman & Son Funeral Home, 126 South St., Morristown on 24 and 79 PM.

title: Parents and Patients Hail Return Of Accreditation at Pilgrim State
description: BRENTWOOD, LI., May 24There was pain in Nathan Goldberg's face as he remembered what it had been like in mid1974 at Pilgrim State Hospital, where he had visited his son.

title: Top Pop Records
description: These are the most popular albums and singles nationwide, compiled by Record World, a trade publication. Albums are determined by sales figures from major retail outlets; singles are chosen by combined sales and radio airplay. An asterisk indicates an especially fastselling record.

title: 2 Indians Found Not Guilty In Murder and Robbery Of Los Angeles Cabdriver
description: LOS ANGELES, May 24Two American Indian activists, whose case set a California record for length in pretrial proceedings, were found not guilty of murder and robbery today.

title: Board of Education Approves Plan To Stiffen High School Standards
description: The Board of Education by a 52 vote late last night approved a proposal to toughen the standards for high school graduation and directed the incoming Chancellor to review school policy on the controversial issue of promotion from one grade to the next.

title: Reporter in Curare Case Refuses To Tell How He Got Key Document
description: HACKENSACK N. J., May 24M. A. Farber, a reporter for The New York Times, repeatedly declined, citing a reporter's privilege, to answer questions in court today about how he obtained the document that led the Bergen County Prosecutor in 1975 to reopen the case of the sudden deaths at Riverdell Hospital.

title: Bond Yields Up Sharply, Bill Rate Top Since '74
description: The taxexempt bond market dropped quickly and decisively yesterday, pushing bond yields dramatically higher as investors held back from buying the heavy volume of new securities that has been marketed in the past week and a half.

title: New York Official Says a Hospital Owner Used Medicaid Funds for 4 Mercedes Cars
description: The owner of a private psychiatric hospital in Syracuse used Medicaid funds to buy four Mercedes Benz sedans for himself and his wife and for promotional and travel expenses unrelated to caring for poor patients, the New York State Welfare Inspector General reported yesterday.

title: Cabaret: Holly Woodlawn
description: HOLLY WOODLAWN. who is in the second week of a threeweek engagement at Reno Sweeney, brings a new dimension to the conundrun of putative sexual identity. But Miss Woodlawn, to give her the identity she prefers, is not just another ambitious ambiguity; she is talented.

title: Getting a Fix on Repairs
description: UNTIL three months ago, I was a klutz around the house. Leaky faucets mystified me. Faulty light switches terrified me. Hammers, nails, fuses and screwdrivers were foreign objects to be avoided like the plague. A stylish avocado Black & Decker electric drill a Christmas present from a wellmeaning male friend sat unused and dusty in a dresser drawer because I didn't know what to do with the thing after plugging it in.

title: SENATE CONFEREES AGREE TO END CURBS ON GAS PRICES IN '85
description: WASHINGTON, May 24Congressional conferees agreed today on the pricing of natural gas, the toughest issue in their 219day effort to reach agreement on energy legislation.

title: Keeping Them Fresh
description: The flowers are ready for cutting. Now what? Early morning and evening are considered the best time to pick flowers. I opt for the evening, when the flowers have stored up the day's food production; it is also, usually, the more convenient time.

title: Museum Benefit Is a Seaworthy Affair
description: SOMETIMES it seems as though there is a special little gremlin, up or down there, whose ful Itime job is bedeviling charity ball chairmen. The first bedevilment encountered is trying to get committees away from luncheon tables into what is known in lesser circleS as work. The reason so many benefit chairmen are introduced from the podium is that they've aged so much that no one recognizes them.

title: ARCHITECTS WILL END BAN ON ADVERTISING
description: DALLAS, May 24Following the lead of the American Medical Association and the American Bar Association, the American Institute of Architects voted today to end its longstanding ban on advertising by its members.

title: Letter: On Cyprus
description: To the Editor:

title: Blowing Smoke in Miller's Face
description: A proselytizing nonsmoker, G. William Miller, two months in office as chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, has brought down the wrath of his heavypuffing colleagues by slipping thank you for not smoking acrylic signs on tables in the board room and taking away the ash trays.

title: High Court Upholds Verdict of Panel Where Alternate Joined Jury
description: TRENTON, May 24In 1975 a juror considering the fate of a defendant accused of murder became nervous after 90 minutes of deliberations and asked to he excused from the jury.

title: VANCE LAUDS OFFER BY TURKISH CYPRIOT
description: Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance told Rauf Denktash, the Turkish Cypriot leader, yesterday that the concessions offered by Mr. Denktash in a statement three days ago could open the way to a negotiated settlement of the Cyprus dispute.

title: Disarmament Delegates Greeted With Mighty Barrage of Words
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 24 Shortly before dawn yesterday, nine weary men unloaded from trucks the last of the documents required for the special General Assembly session on disarmament that opened in the afternoon.

title: Abortions and the Middle Class
description: Three disturbing abortion proposals are now before the House of Representatives. One would end health insurance coverage for abortions for military personnel or their dependents. A second would permit employers to discriminate against workers who have abortions  even though the Civil Rights Act is to be amended to forbid discrimination against other pregnant workers. And the third would tighten still further eligibility standards on Federal Medicaid payments for abortions for the poor.

title: For South Africa's Blacks, Both Crowding and Separation
description: JOHANNESBURG, May 24  Dora Mabiio rubbed her eyes with a handkerchief.

title: DEFENSE LEGISLATION TOTALING $38 BILLION APPROVED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, May 24In a significant victory for advocates of a stronger Navy, the House today beat back efforts to cut the authorization for construction of a nuclearpowered aircraft carrier and a nuclearpowered cruiser, then easily passed a $38 billion military procurement and research bill.

title: Speculation Mounts Over Winkles's Parting With Finley
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 24Bobby Winkles, who resigned suddenly as manager of the Oakland A's before last night's game, remained incommunicado today The precise reason for his decision remained unknown, although the general picture was fairly clear.

title: Article 6 -- No Title
N.C.A.A. Gets Warning On Penalizing Miss. State
description: The National Collegiate Athletic Association's Council order that Mississippi State University forfeit its last 18 football victories drew a warning yesterday from the head of a Congressional subcommittee investigating the N.C.A.A.

title: For Patriotism, Buying Some Gold
description: Morris Cannan finally decided his gcld mine in Mexico was not going to come through for him. So he took an easier route. He bought some gold from the Federal Government, almost 67 pounds of it.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Plan Offered to Mobutu
description: BRUSSELS, May 24Belgium called today for the creation of an allAfrican peacekeeping force, with logistical support from the European Economic Community, to protect the rich copper mines of Shaba Province in Zaire against any new attacks by Angolabased insurgents.

title: Koch Determined to Protect City From Arbitration Awards to Labor
description: ALBANY, May 24  Hanging over Mayor Koch's head as he struggles to reach agreement with city union leaders nil the powers of a Financial Control Board is the specter of a 24.5 percent raise awarded by an impasse panel last February to Nassau County policemen. He is determined to make sure that no arbitrator gives any New York City employee that kind of a raise.

title: 2 Jersey Mayors Ask For Legalized Jai Alai
description: TRENTON, May 24The mayors of Asbury Park and Long Branch, two economically depressed shore towns, asked the New Jersey Legislature today for leaalized jai alai.

title: Pirates Outscore Mets in 10th and Win
description: PITTSBURGH, May 24In one of their wildest performances of the season, the New York Mets took the lead three times over the Pittsburgh Pirates tonighttwice on home runs by Willie Montanez, who hadn't hit a baseball over a fence in a month.

title: Robert Bradshaw, Premier in St. Kitts For 11 Years, Dies
description: BASSETERRE, St. Kitts (AP)Robert Bradshaw, Prime Minister of the British Associated State of St. KittsNevisAnguilla in the West Indies since its formation in 1967, has died, officials here announced today. He was 61 years old.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Arco Corporation, Greenwich, Conn.,has elected Donald K. Farrar an executive vice president.

title: Deaths
description: Applegate, Allita

title: WEST BLAMED FOR RISE OF REDS ROLE IN AFRICA
description: LONDON, May 24 (AP)An authoritaL ti.e International research institute said today that the Soviet Union was able to extend its influence in Africa and elsewhere in the developing world because the Western response to the Communist challenge there was often uncertain.

title: House Unit, in Compromise Move, Approves Warning on Korean Aid
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (UPI)The House International Relations Committee today approved a compromise resolution saying that United States aid to South Korea may be cut unless ethics investigators are allowed to question a Korean diplomat accused of paying off members of Congress.

title: COAST GUARD STATION REACHES ITS NEW SITE
description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass., May 24After six months for a 40mile journey from Chatham, the historic 80yearold harbor Coast Guard station finally has reached the Provincetown site where it will be restored by the National Park Service to serve as a museum on lifesaving.

title: Hers
description: YOU do not know, I kept telling everyone the week before I went back to Los Angeles for the first time in many years, how much I do not want to go. Then when it looked as though I might not need to go and I said I was relieved, no one was fooled. I always want to see again. And I never want to see it. I want it to be exactly the same. And I also hope it will have changed so completely that there will be nothing left to trigger memory. I decided I would be businesslike this time. If I went.

title: Starrett Unit to Build Midtown Hyatt Hotel
description: The Starrett Housing Corporation said that its HRH Division had signed a construction contract worth about $40 million to build a Hyatt Regency Hotel on the site of the Commodore Hotel at 42d Street and Lexington Avenue. The midtown hotel would contain 1,400 rooms and 500,000 square feet of commercial and public space. Henry Benach, chairman and chief executive of Starrett, said work would begin im mediately and the first rooms would be ready for occupancy in 1980.

title: 23 FOOD PLACES VIOLATE NEW YORK'S HEALTH CODE
description: The New York City Health Department cited 23 food places yesterday that had violated the city health code, five that had corrected earlier violations, and two that were reopened after correcting earlier violations. The restaurants were listed as follows:

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: RHYTHM AND RHYME Come Laugh and Cry With Langston Hughes is the title of today's lunchtime jazz and ragtime revue to be performed by the AMAS Repertory Theater at Rockefeller Center, in the lower plaza of the McGrawHill Building, Avenue of the Americas between 48th and 49th Streets. In tribute to a major black literary figure of our time, the 45minute show will reprise Harlem music from the 1920's and 30's, interspersing Mr. Hughes's poetry. The free event starts at 12:30 P.M.

title: General Foods Net Up 21%
description: Farnings of the General Foods CorAeration in its fourth fiscal quarter ended April 1 rose 21 percent, but after a long bout with soaring coffee prices fullyear profits wore down 4,4 percent. the company disclosed yesterday in its annual report.

title: LEGALIZED JAI ALAI SOUGHT BY 2 MAYORS
description: TRENTON, May 24The mayors of Asbury Park and Long Branch, two economically depressed shore towns, asked the New Jersey Legislature today for legalized jai alai.

title: Polaroid Suing E.P.A. To Guard Its Formulas
description: The Polaroid Corporation, one of the world's two photographic giants, said today it had filed suit against the Environmental Protection Agency seeking to prevent the release of secret chemical formulas it holds. It argues that making the material public could destroy its business.

title: GUNMAN IN MOSCOW SEIZED IN SHOOTOUT
description: MOSCOW, May 24A gun battle erupted here today after a hooded man carrying a double  barreled shotgun walked into the office of Finnair, the Finnish airline, seized two Soviet hostages and demanded that an airliner fly him out of the country. The police exchanged shots with the assailant, then drove him from the office with tear gas and placed him under arrest. There were apparently no serious injuries.

title: Wanted: Women's BlueCollar Jobs
description: Need for further vigorous advances in opening job opportunities for women in a broad variety of fields from construction work to highlevel corporate positions was stressed yesterday in symposium in New York.

title: M'CALL COMEBACK BID REJECTED IN OREGON
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 24  Tom McCall, attempting a comeback after one term out of office, wits defeated yesterday by State Senator Victor Atiyeh in the Republican gubernatorial primary. Mt Atiyeh will face Gov. Robert Straub, a Democrat, in the general election, a rematch of the 1974 campaign.

title: Great Bear to Move
description: The Great Bear Spring Company, whose headquarters have been at 51 Madison Avenue for 15 years, said at its annual meeting yesterday that it would he moving to Teterboro, N.J., by the end of the year. The watercooler and bottledwater company, which already has its major plant in Teterboro, said it could more effectively run the company with its headquarters there. The high cost of being in New York was also a factor in the decision, the company said.

title: Carter News Parley On at 5 P.M. Today
description: President Carter will hold a news conference at 5 P.M. today. It will be televised live by CBSTV and its local station, WCBSTV, Channel 2. On radio there will be live broadcasts on WCBSAM, WINS, WMCA and WNYCAM.

title: Disarmament Efforts: Unpromising History
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 24Japan was completing its occupation of Manchuria. In Germany, a man called Hitler was advancing rapidly toward power. In South America, a border conflict between Bolivia and Paraguay erupted into a bloody threeyear war. And in Genera, in February 1932, a conference called by the League of Nations talked, prayerfully and angrily, about disarmament.

title: Bouton Loses 2d Start
description: ORLANDO, Fla., May 24 (AP)Ji?? Bouton's pitching comeback lost ground tonight as the Savannah Braves lost by 65 to Orlando in a Southern League baseball game. Bouton gave up six runs, four earned, and two home runs in 5 13 innings, as his wonlost record dropped to 11. The 39yearold Bouton was signed this month by the Atlanta Braves owner, Ted Turner, who also owns the Savannah team.

title: Times Co. Dividend Raised 10c, to 80c
description: The New York Times Company announced yesterday an increase in its annual dividend rate to 80 cents from 70 cents a share. The rise follows an earlier one a year ago and represents a 33 percent increase over the 60cent rate that prevailed until June 1977, according to Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, chairman and president of the company.

title: CORRECTION
description: A photograph of former President Gerald R. Ford supplied by The Associated Press and published in The Times yesterday carried an erroneous caption. The ceremony took place at New York Law School, and the person at the far right of the picture was Harold Brawner, a trustee. A typographical error caused a misspelling in the name of Charles W. Froessel, retired judge of the State Court of Appeals.

title: Excerpts From Vice President Mondale's Address to the U.N. Disarmament Session
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 24Following are excerpts from the text of the speech Vice President Mondale gave today at the United Nations General Assembly's Special Session on Disarmament:

title: Article 3 -- No Title
Power Rate Cuts Asked At Factories
description: Small and mediumsize manufacturing companies in New York City and Westchester County would be eligible for an electricity rate reduction of up to 20 percent, If a proposal made yesterday by the Consolidated Edison Company of New York were adopted by the Public Service Commission.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ROME, May 24 (AP)All seeded Americans swept through the second round of the Italian open tennis championship today. Topseeded Bjorn Borg of Sweden again conceded a set before overcoming an unheralded opponent.

title: Film: 'Here Come Tigers':The Bears Are Back
description: IF stock were carbon paper the 14th or 15th copy of "The Bad News Bears" might resemble "Here Come the Tigers," a low-budget Little League epic of no particular zest or stamina. Once again, a team of cute little no-accounts is coached toward victory by an older fellow from the neighborhood, even though the kids curse better than they play. Once again, success comes only after the team adds a couple of unlikely new players, in this case a karate-champ batter and a deaf pitcher.There are new touches, too, none of them helpful. The coach, played by Richard Lincoln, has a warm, understanding smile that just won't quit, even when it ought to. The kid's shout things like "Cram it!" and complain about one another's flatulence a lot, but for the most part they're pretty subdued; the adults, on the other hand, overact like crazy.And even though a Little League movie might be the last place you'd expect to find a sad song accompanying a wistful-walk-along-the-beach scene, there is one here, to mark a particularly tender moment between a boy and his coach.On the evidence of this film and others, like the "Exorcist"-based "Abby" and the current "Jennifer," American International Pictures seems to believe that there's money to be made on the film equivalent of elevator music, on toned-down versions of guaranteed hits. That may be true, but as the only person to see the film's 11 A.M. show at the Guild Theater, where it opened yesterday, I have reason to have my doubts."Here Come the Tigers" was shot in Westport, Conn. Nevertheless, it could easily have been called "The Bad News Bears Go to Queens.""Here Come The Tigers" is rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested") because it contains a certain amount of half-hearted profanity. It's much less gamy than the film on which it has been modeled.

title: The Berkowitz Legal Puzzle
description: Almost from the moment he was captured, there was little doubt in the city's criminaljustice community that David R. Berkowitz had committed the six Son of Sam murders, was mentally ill and, as a practical matter. would spend most of the rest of his lifeif not all of itin the custody of the state.

title: How to Get to Atlantic City, And a Guide to Its Casino
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 24Major bus lines are sharply increasing express service from New York and Philadelphia and elsewhere beginning this weekend with the opening of Atlantic City's first legal gambling casino.

title: Rural Health Test: Clinics Without Doctors
description: HARRELLS, N. C.  When Mary Bland's mother went to live with her, the elderly woman was in poor health. The nearest doctors were in Clinton, 22 miles away, and they were so overloaded that they were not taking any new patients.

title: Piano: The Grunschlags
description: TWOPIANO recitals are not normally this reviewer's favorite pastime. They often sound lumpish and cluttered, and the effort of coordination between the two pianists peering nervously at each other across the two pianos usually neutralizes much of each person's individual artistry.

title: Law Professors Assail Orlov Trial
description: A group of professors at the Harvard Law School has begun collecting endorsements from their colleagues around the country for a statement denouncing the trial of Yuti F. Orlov, the 53yearold physicist, who was convicted in Moscow last week of antiSoviet agitation and propaganda.

title: The U.N. Today
ASouth African Bill Bars Use of Bantu
description: CAPE TOWN, May 24 (Reuters)The word Bantu would be replaced by black in all South African legislation under a bill introduced today.

title: TV: Bing Crosby. His Life and Legend
description: AS the show business paragon of performing nonchalance, Bing Crosby does not make an easy subject for biography. In public, he was warm, goodhumored, unassuming, thoroughly professional what Ella Fitzgerald describes as just a beautiful man. Privately, according to most reports, he was shy, almost withdrawn, incapable of demonstrative affection. But that side of the surprisingly complex man is difficult to capture in a film essay.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Troopers to Get Extra Training
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J., May 24 (AP) Sixty New Jersey state troopers will be trained in the handling and transportation of hazardous chemicals and gases during emergency situations. The program is designed to provided municipalities with trained assistance until specialists from state or Federal agencies can reach the scene of a chemical emergency, Capt, Robert T. Sloss of the state police said yestgerday.

title: Rossman Stops Bennett At 1:41 of Second Round
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 24 (UPI) Mike Rossman stopped Lonnie Bennete at 1:41 of the second round tonight in a lightheavyweight bout at the Spectrum.

title: Publishers Find Romances Pay
description: The cover shows a coolly stunning brunette staring dreamily into space. Two rakish men, in period dress, loom behind her. She is a Spanish dancer, the scandal of Europe. Kings, princes and great composers compete for her affection. She is known as the queen of desire and the slave of passion. (Dare to Love)

title: City Stores Shows Deficit
description: The City Stores Company, which operated in the black in the last two quarters. returned to a deficit position in the first fiscal quarter ended April 30.

title: Desolation at Kolwezi
description: KOLWEZI, Zaire, May 24The clutter of destruction and flight and the stink of death begins at the airport. Military debris, bottles, tin cans lie among the wreckage of burned planes and helicoptors. Cars abandoned by fleeing whites are parked crazily, their innards systematically torn out.

title: Mother of 10 Guilty of Murder
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., May 24 (AP)Ella Garner, 40 years old, a mother of 10, has been convicted of seconddegree murder in the stabbing death of James Waye, 38, a friend, in their apartment here Jan. 14. Mrs. Garner found guilty yesterday, faces a sentence of up to 30 years in prison.

title: India's Sale Of Gold Aims At Smugglers
description: NEW DELHI, May 24In an effort to contain the spiraling price of gold and largescale smuggling into the country, India has started selling the metal from its own stock and has announced a plan to import it for reexport as jewelry.

title: U.S. Refuses to Link Cobalt Buying By Soviet to the Invasion of Shaba
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (Reuters)The State Department today declined to link recent Soviet purchases of cobalt with the invasion of Zaire's Shaba Province, which accounts for about 65 percent of the world's supply of the metal. The Soviet Union was among a number buyers who have forced the price of cobalt from $7 to $20 a pound in recent weeks. It is used in jet engine, missiles and submarines.

title: Helicopter Pilot Kills Woman In Hijacking and Escape Plan
description: MARION , Ill., May 24 (AP)A woman hijacked a helicopter tonight in an apparent, attempt to help three. inmates escape from the Marion Federal Penitentiary, but she was shot and killed by the pilot in the flight from St. Louis, the authorities said.

title: A Monet Party for New York's Diplomats
description: With champagne, violins and a special viewing of the Monet exhibit, New York City welcomed its diplomatic community last night at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. More than 2,000 guests filled the reception and exhibit halls.

title: Huddleston Nominated in Kentucky
description: In the Kentucky primary on Tuesday voters renominated Democratic Senator Walter Huddleston, who had feared that he would be hurt by his vote for the Panama Canal treaties. The conservative backlash did not materialize and he received 75 percent of the vote.

title: Japan and Britain Sign. Pact on Nuclear Fuel
description: TOKYO, May 24Japan signed a longterm contract here today with Britain for the transport and reprocessing of spent nuclear fuel from 1982 through 1990.

title: Article 7 -- No Title
VTN Wins Contract
description: The VTN Corporation said that its VTN Consolidated subsidiary had been awarded a management contract for an estimated $45 million geothermal project in Utah. The project is a joint venture of O'Brien Energy and Resources of Toronto, Amax Inc. and the Natomas Company. VTN will provide management and technical assistance for the project and will obtain an equity interest in it as part of its compensation.

title: Design Notebook
description: IT is no surprise to learn that Saul Steinberg studied to be an architect. His drawings have always been full of architectural images and ideas; they are often literally about architecture and, when they are not, they are about the things that architects must always be conscious of: physical detail, social reality and style in all its manifestations.

title: Security in Miami Is Tightened After Attacks on the Elderly
description: MIAMI, May 24 (AP)Dawntodusk security has been ordered at 14 highrise housing projects for the elderly where two murders and several beatings and sexual assaults have occurred in recent weeks.

title: J.P. Stevens Profits Off
description: J. P. Stevens & Company, involved in a long, troublesome batlle with organized labor, reported yesterday that earnings in both the quarter and six months ended April 29 were down 6.4 percent, while sales for both periods were 4.8 percent higher than the corresponding quarter and half of last year. The stock slipped point on the New York Stock Exchange, to close at 15.

title: Deaths
description: MEYERSiegfried. Beloved husband of anna, devoted father of Lotte Hartman, adored grandfather of Peter. Services Friday, 10 AM at the Riverside 76th St. and Amsterdam Ave.

title: New York Detective Story: Less Specializing
description: It was not an unusual crimea burglary of a Queens store that sells everything from stereo sets and watches to Indian spices and groceries. When the proprietors arrived in the morning to open up, they found display cases and cartons empty of their merchandise. Lentils from a slashed sack were strewn across the floor.

title: CITY OFFERS TO BREAK CONTROLBOARD SNAG
description: ALBANY, Thursday, May 25Governor Carey and Mayor Koch last night offered to New York City's. municipal labor unions a compromise on the power of the Emergency Financial Control Board that they said was being considered by the unions and their allies in the Legisuature.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Car Sales Up by 11.8% In MidMay
description: DETROIT, May 24Sales of Americanmade passenger cars rose 11.8 percent to set a record for the 10day selling period in midMay, the nation's four major auto makers reported here today. All of the companies reported gains for the May 1120 period.

title: Restaurants
description: TT. WANG, the chef and owner of Shun Lee Palace on 55th Street between Third and Lexington Avenues, is certainly one of the city's most talented Chinese chefs. Two years ago, a private banquet we attended at his restaurant showed he was capable of extraordinary feats, as we ate our way through course after course of what was perhaps the most breathtaking and original Chinese meal we have had this side of Singapore.

title: Mobil Urges Protection Of Constitution for Ads
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 (AP)Herbert Schmertz, a vice president of the Mobil Oil Corporation, said today that corporations should be entitled to the same First Amendment protections as newspapers and radio and television stations.

title: Decathlon to Delmore
description: MACOMB, Ill., May 25 (AP)Torn Delmoor of Mount St. Mary's College in Emmeisburg, Md., registered his highest point total ever in decathlon competition and captured first place Thursday at the 16th annual N.C.A.A. Division II track and field championships. Delmoor's total of 7,260 also qualified him for the Division I national meet to be held at Eugene, Ore., next week. He placed fifth in Division II last year.

title: I.B.M. Gets First Order For Computer for China
description: I.B.M. World Trade AmericasFar East Corporation announced that it had recevied its first order from China for a mediumsize series 370 computer system for use in a turbofan manufacturing plant in the northeastern city of Shenyang.

title: Red Sox 9, Blue Jays 5
description: TORONTO, May 25 (AP)Jim Rice broke out of an 0for11 slump with a threerun homer, and Dwight Evans hit a tworun homer to help the Boston Red Sox gain a 95 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays tonight.

title: Not Just A Cottage. Not at All.
description: TRURO, Mass.  A number of important disquisitions have appeared on the preservation, or wanton destruction, of historic buildings. Much of the material is scholarly, some of it frankly sentimental. For areal wallow in sentiment, with nothing whatever scholarly about it, I strongly recommend the demolition, slowly and with care, of a summer cottage.

title: When Beggars First Sang
description: Macheath the highwayman and other lowlife characters you may know from The Threepenny Opera will all be on stage at the Juilliard school in Lincoln Center this weekend but nobody will sing Mack the Knife.

title: Black Students Boycott San Francisco Schools in OneDay Protest
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 25Thousands of black students boycotted public schools here yesterday at the suggestion of adults in the black community. Black ministers and parents called for the oneday walkout to protest personnel, teaching, discipline and integration policies that many believe discriminate against black students.

title: Curtain Rising for High Rollers
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 25It may be a new era but on a damp, gray afternoon before its scheduled dawn, the old shabby gentility pervades.

title: Topics
description: Objectivities

title: DR. DAVID PALMER
description: MOLINE, Ill., May 25 (AP)Dr. David Palmer, one of the nation's leading figures in chiropractic medicine, died last night at a Moline hospital, where he was admitted May 8. The cause of death was not announced. He was 72 years old.

title: World News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 25Four Sovietbuilt planes will make overnight refueling stops in the United States on the way from Kiev, in the Ukraine, to Lima, Peru, according to the State Department.

title: HOW KOCH AND UNIONS REACHED AGREEMENT
description: A major concession by Mayor Koch in the early hours yesterday morning broke the logjam in the negotiations in Albany over the Emergency Financial Control Beard, and three hours later a simple trade between the Mayor and the municipal unions completed their agreement on the powers of the board.

title: Books: Letter From Two Stage Couples
description: ZERO Mostel died last September, and whatever joy was lost to the world was missed even more by his wife, Kate, and their two ciosest friends, Jack and Madeline Gilford. This book, 170 Year of Show Business. was finished after Mr. Mostel's death, but it had heen started by the four of them some time before. That is to say, what. you can read here is no luguirlous, tearjerking memorial work, but a very lively, chatty and goodnatured recollection of lives that are interesting and quite human, warts (not many) and all.

title: Consumer PriceSuit Bill Gains
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 (AP)The Senate Judiciary Committee approved legislation today that would expand consumer's right to sue and collect damages for antitrust violations.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: THE four older Osmond Brothers, normally the executive producers of the Donny & Marie Osmond series, serve as executive producers of their own show on ABC at 8 tonight. Drawing the unusual family ties even tighter, The Osmond Brothers Special was taped at the Osmond Entertainment Center in Orem, Utah.

title: Publishing: Shades of Spectra Past
description: NEXT month, Farrar, Straus & Giroux will release three of five volumes devoted to the work of Witter Bynner, a poet who died in 1968. Bynner is not a name that musters much of a charge today, but 50 years ago his name was as well known as any among the commonality of poetry lovers in America Moreover, some of his lyrics with their finely chiseled lines, muted pessimism and an endoftheage mood stand up even in the twilight of the 1970's. Nevertheless there is no use pretending that hordes of book buyers will trample down the gates on the day of publication.

title: Antiwar Film Shown During Arms Parley
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 25With a nice sense of timing, or felici sous coincidence, the United Nations staff recreation council's Cine Club has chosen the first week of the disarmament conference to screen one of the most admired and eloquent of antiwar films

title: Eritrean Rebels Defense Hindered by Rifts
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, May 23The Eritrean rebels are prepared to meet a major Ethiopian offensive and are confident that they can repel it. even if thousands of Cuban soldiers now in the important Red Sea province join the fighting on the Government's side.

title: Mindy Herman Married To James Grossinger
description: Mindy Herman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Herman of Wayne, N. J., was married yesterday to James Grossinger, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Grossinger of Grossinger, N. Y. The ceremony was performed at the Crystal Plaza in Livingston, N. J., by Rabbi Alan Greenspan.

title: Uncertain Gas Outlook
description: WASHINGTON, May 25When and If the natural gas bill gets passed and signed, a producer who drills a new well and sells his gas to an interstate pipeline will get $1.93 per thousand cubic feet for the gas, instead of the

title: 20 Municipalities Told to Say Why Gaslights Shouldn't Be Doused
description: NEWARK, May 25The State Board of Public Utilities ordered representatives of 20 New Jersey municipalities today to appear before it on June 14 to explain why they should not have their gasfueled street lights turned off.

title: House Delays Tax Credit Vote
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 (UPI)The crush of other business in the House has caused postponement of a vote on tax credits for college tuition until at least next Wednesday. The bill would allow a tax credit of 25 percent of college tuition up to a maximum tax saving of $100 in the last half of this year, $150 in 1979 and $250 in 1980.

title: Art People
description: FORMER President Gerald R. Ford, whose interest in contemporary art was triggered several years ago by a huge, wellplaced Calder stabile that helped revitalize the downtown area of his native Grand Rapids, Mich., now has a shiny new work of his own to contemplate.

title: Byrne Backs Off Stand on Housing For Poor, Citing Outside Factors
description: TRENTON, May 25Governor Byrne retreated today from his stern stand of IS months ago, when he said that New Jersey suburbs had to takesteps to provide housing for a fair share of the state's poor and disadvantaged.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
Police Are Attacked In Queens Arrests
description: Following the arrests last night of some 20 alleged drugpushers in Queens, about 60 to 80 friends of the suspects descended on a Far Rockaway police precinct house, throwing bottles and breaking windows before they were dispersed.

title: Carter and Artis Ask for Reversal, Contending That Prosecution Lied
description: Lawyers for Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis asked the New Jersey Appellate Division yesterday to set aside their clients second murder conviction and charged that during their 1976 trial the Passaic County Prosecutor lied to them, to the judge and to the jury.

title: About Real Estate
description: Real estate is often a matter of bad arithmetic or none at all.

title: Freema Gluck Is Wed to Dr. H. M. Nagler
description: Freema Gluck, a lawyer with Columbia Pictures Industries in New York, was married yesterday to Dr. Harris Mark Nagler, a resident in urology at Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center

title: TaxExempt Yields Show Sharp Gains
description: Taxexempt bond yields this week have registered their sharpest increase in two and a half years.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Deaths
description: Abbey, Elsie

title: Angry Court Officers Protest Pay Ruling
description: A crowd of about 1,000 court officers, blocking traffic, blowing their whistles and shouting through picket signs rolled into megaphones, marched noisily through Manhattan last evening to protest administrative judge's ruling that they say will mean pay cuts of from $1,000 to $4,000 for each of them.

title: Rick Mears Rides Cloud at Indy
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 25  It was carburetion day at Indianapolis Motor Speedway, the last chance for something bad to happen to the 33 cars  none of which have carburetors  qualified for Sunday's Indianapolis 500, and, of course, there was some had racing luck.

title: Creditors Back Penn Central Plan
description: Creditors of the Penn Central Transportation Company approved a plan designed to turn the bankrupt company into a profitmaking enterprise, Penn Central said yesterday.

title: M.L.KRULEWITCH.82; HEADED SPORTS UNIT
description: Melvin L. Krulewitch, the retired Marine Corps general who was chairman of the New York State Athletic Commission during the 1960's, died yesterday at his Manhattan apartment. He was 82 years old.

title: Amex Sets Up Review Panel
description: Saying that it was time to pause for a period of reflection, Arthur Levitt Jr., chairman of the American Stock Exchange, announced yesterday the formation of a committee to review its governing structure.

title: Connecticut Cracks Down on Speeding Up
description: NORTH HAVEN, Conn., May 25Left lane, 67 or. a white Ford Pinto wagon, 67, left lane barked the radio in the chase car manned by State Trooper Dante Notte, of the Traffic Division. Trooper Notte, in a brightorange rainslicker and plasticcovered hat, jumped out of the car and into the roadway, pointed and gestured at the oncoming white Pinto, and shouted into the din of passing trucks:

title: Newsprint Mills Work Full Time
description: In response to continued strong demand from customers in the United States, Canadian newsprint mills continued to operate in April at 100 percent capacity for the second straight month, the Canadian Pulp and Paper Association reported yesterday.

title: Israeli Court Halts a Settlement On Arab Land Pending an Appeal
description: JERUSALEM, May 25The Israeli Supreme Court today ordered a temporary suspension of work on a new Jewish settlement in the occupied West Bank of the Jordan River, giving the court time to consider an appeal by a group of West Bank Arabs who contend that some of their land was illegally expropriated by the Israeli military.

title: James Pratt Sinclair Weds Daisy Nieland
description: The marriage of Daisy Nieland, a vice president of Ogilvy & Mather Inc., the advertising agency, to James Pratt Sinclair, a vice president of Smith Barney, Harris Upham & Company, took place in New York yesterday. The Rev. James R. Leo performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest. A reception followed at the Colony Club.

title: Carter Plans Budget Cuts For 1980
description: WASHINGTON, May 25President Carter said today that he planned severe cutbacks in what, in his words, would be a very tight budget for the fiscal year 1980 to check inflation. He said he was willing to take the political heat from specialinterest groups that this action might cause.

title: Mets Beat Pirates in 11 Innings, 32
description: PITTSBURGH, May 25The New York Mets, who may lead the world in overtime work, played their 13th extrainning game of the season tonight and for a change came away with scmethinp: a 32 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Met Museum Director
description: MOST museum directors take a dim view of the current trend toward twoheaded leadership for art museums, where the authority of the art historiandirector is shared withand sometimes subordinated tothat of a paid professional manager hired to handle administrative affairs. But Philippe de Montebello, who was named yesterday as director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art at a special meeting of the hoard of trustees, views such a split authority as a benefit. He said that he looks forward to serving under the Met's new system, in a post subordinate to that of William B. Macomber Jr.. the museum's new paid president, because he says, it will give me a lot more time for the art side of the museumworking with curators on exhibitions, publications, education, etc. I won't be called away to deal with, say, labor negotiations.

title: Belated Wisdom About Mortgages
description: New York State's legislators appear to have learned in the past year that a legal limit on the interest rates that lenders can charge does not make mortgages cheaper for borrowers. It merely dries up the source of money. In recognition of this belated wisdom the Senate is ready to enact a bill that would remove the ceiling, temporarily fixed at 8 percent, on the lending rate for new mortgages. The rate would be allowed to go as high as 9 percent, reflecting market rates on comparable Treasury securities.

title: Cubs Subdue Phils, 51, For 5th Victory in Row
description: CHICAGO, May 25 (AP)Manny Trillo drove in two runs with a homer And a single today as the Chicago Cubs posted their fifth straight victory, a 51 triumph over the Philadelphia Phillies.

title: DeCamp Bus StoppageThreatened As Company Seeks a Cut in Salary
description: CLIFTON, May 25With the Manhattan Transit Company buses scheduled to resume operations Tuesday morning after two, months of idleness, the threat of a work stoppage at the DeCamp Bus Company loomed today.

title: RAIL HALT ORDERED FOR UNSAFE MATTER
description: WASHINGTON, May 25The Depart ment of Transportation has ordered Conrail to stop hauling hazardous materials over a sevenmile stretch in densely populated northern New Jersey because of dangerous track conditions, the department said today.

title: Curtain Rising for High Rollers
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 25It may be a new era but on a damp, gray afternoon before its scheduled dawn, the old shabby gentility pervades.

title: Civiletti Says Port Investigations Could Result in Indictments Soon
description: WASHINGTON, May 25Benjamin R. Civiletti, the Deputy Attorney General, indicated today that the Government's twoyear investigation of corruption in East Coast and Gulf Coast ports could result soon in significant indictments.

title: U.S. Sues Oil Refiners
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 (AP)The Department of Energy said today that it had filed civil suits against two major oil refiners seeking $13.6 million in import fees that it said was due the Government. The suits allege that the Sun Oil Company and the Standard Oil Company of California, plus its marketing arm, Chevron U.S.A. Inc., had failed to pay a mandatory $2abarrel fee on crude oil imported hetween Dec. 8 and Dec. 18, 1975. The suit against Sun seeks $1.8 million and the one against. Socal and Chevron seeks $8.8 million,

title: Books of The Times
description: IF, in the 19th century, Turgenev was superfluous. in the 20th century Solzhenitsyn is inconvenient: prophet and scourge, ancient mariner, Ishmael, witness. It has been the business of the 20th century to murder the Turgenevs, as if history itself were an apocalyptic Russian novel,

title: At 71, The Red Mill Takes a New Turn
description: It was said to cheer the heart, delight the eye, charm the ear, tickle the fancy and wreath the face in smiles. It was The Red Mill, Victor Herbert's latest musical to reach New York, and all those flattering clichs about it were to be found in a New York Times review on Sept. 25, 1906.

title: Rangel Is Confused On Antipoverty Suit
description: Representative Charles B. Rangel said yesterday that he was not aware that a suit in his name and the names of other black officials had been filed in Federal District Court to block Mayor Koch's plan to reorganize the city's antipoverty program because progress had been made on the issue.

title: Notes on People
description: The House of Representatives ignored its own rules of decorum to lavish praise yesterday and oneliners on a master of the one liner. Bob Hope and his wife, Dolores, sat in the front row of the House's Presidents Gallery and heard a 40minute tribute to the comedian, who is in Washington for a series of 75th birthday tributes. Jim Wright, the Texan who is Democratic Leader: looked up at Mr. Hope and thanked him for helping Congressmen laugh at themselves. We'd better, added Mr. Wright. We'd be the only ones in America who weren't. The House members who trooped to the microphone to pay homage to Mr. Hope were asked to limit their remarks to a minute, but few did, and Representative Robert Michel, the Illinois Republican, even went so far as to warble his own version of Mr. Hope's theme song:

title: Thinking About Complex China
description: Two weeks of travel and talk  on business, politics, economics and foreign policy  during a carefully conducted tour of China are not enough to provide any final conclusions about that vast, complex country. But that is long enough to make clear that our own stock of standard political labels and alignments are of little use in trying to understand China today.

title: Sears Profits Stay 48 Cents a Share
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company, the world's largest retailer of general merchandise, yesterday reported higher earnings for the first fiscal quarter than had been estimated at the annual shareholder recently, but the results were flat.

title: CAPUTO SAYS KOREA CABLES HINT SUSPICIOUS PATTERN
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 (AP)Representative Bruce Caputo said today that evidence including cables intercepted and decoded by United States intelligence showed a pattern of suspicious involvementof eight current members of the House with a former South Korean ambassador.

title: Zaire's Quest for Security
description: KINSHASA, Zaire., May 25The French forces are leaving Kalwezi, some Moroccans are arriving, and Zaire is again looking beyond its borders for help in staving off impeding collapse as its own army once more seems incapable of dealing with a small group of marauders.

title: Chinaglia Criticizes Firmani
description: MEMPHIS, May 25Eddie Firmani reacted calmly today to Giorgio Chinaglia's criticism of his coaching in the Cosmos' 10 loss to the Memphis Rogues last night.

title: Mayors Say Federal Tax Policy Caused Midwest Industry Exodus
description: MILWAUKEE, May 25Mayors and business leaders from the Middle West met here today to discuss strategies for stemming an exodus of industry to the suburbs and the Srn Belt states, a trend, they asserted, that was having a bad effect on the region's economic stability.

title: Atlantic City, the Seaside Dowager, Eagerly Awaits Gambling Face Lift
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 25  This faded pleasure haven by the sea was braced today for the start of legalized casino gambling, an ambitious experiment that is supposed to revive a town that has been dying for decades and provide New Jersey with new revenues.

title: Estelle Parsons's New Role: Director
description: Acting was never really in harmony with my lifestyle, said Estelle Parsons, whose performance last fall as a dictatorial schoolteacher who harangues her class, the audience, in Miss Margarida's Way brought her a Tony nominatlm far best actress in a play.

title: The Decline of Eloquence
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 25 You can't hear or read the speeches on the disarmament problem here at the United Nations these days without. wondering about the decline of eloquence in the political world.

title: Hunk Anderson, Nicest Tough Guy
description: When Knute K. Rockne was winning renown as a football coach, the Notre Dame varsity was only one of his responsibilities. He also coached track and field, administered all sports as athletic director, turned out a syndicated column two or three times a week, had several books published under his name and toured the country as an afterdinner speaker. During spring practice, runners would be working on the cinder track and circling Cartier Fieldthe predecessor of today's stadiumwhile the padded gladiators butted heads on the infield, and somehow Rock se med able to watch a halfmiler and a left end simultaneously. In those days his only assistant was Hunk Anderson, who would finish his job at the Edwards Iron Works in South Bend and hustle out to the campus to serve as unpaid line coach. Most practice sessions started with Rock giving preliminary instruction to the backs and ends while Hunk got the interior linemen warmed up. At length, Rock would call:

title: Stricter Laws Sought As Debtors Continue To Be Harassed
description: Several months after he lost his job and stopped making payments on a color television set and a loan from a finance company, a 37yearold security guard and laborer came home one day to find a handwritten unsigned note pasted to the door of his Harlem apartment.

title: Defense at Curare Trial Wins a Point About Evidence
description: HACKENSACK. N.J., May 25Judge William J. Arnold ruled today in the murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich that a statement the doctor gave to the prosecutor on Feb. 4, 1976, could not be admitted into evidence.

title: ALBANY SETTLES BILL ON JUVENILE CRIMES
description: ALBANY, May 25Governor Carey and the leaders of the A ssembly and Senate !reached agreement today on a package of legislation to lengthen sentences for juveniles convicted a second time of certain offenses and make 13yearolds subject to mandatory sentences for a number of felonies.

title: TALKING BUSINESS
description: Late last year, when Henry Kaufman, partner and chief economist at Salomon Brothers, predicted significantly higher interest rates and some squeezing out in the credit markets for 1978, many of his fellow economists felt he was being unnecessarily (and characteristically) pessimistic.

title: Manton Designated in 9th District
description: Democratic committee members from the Ninth Congressional District in Queens last night designated Thomas J. Manton, a City Councilman, as the candidate for the seat being vacated by the state's senior Congressman, James J. Delaney, who is retiring.

title: Bridge:
description: For New York enthusiasts, the high point of the tournament year is invariably the Eastern Regionals, which begin today at the New York Hilton Hotel with the following schedule:

title: Britain's Liberals to End Accord That Backed Labor Government
description: LONDON, May 25The Liberal Party, with 13 members in the House of Commons, will no longer support the governing Labor Party, it was announced tonight by David Steel, the Liberal leader.

title: Books: Fateful Lightning
description: THE GLORY of the coming of the Lord, which Julia Ward Howe envisioned in The Battle Hymn of the Republic, that celebrated Northern anthem of the Civil War, was a very genuine possibility for millennial Protestants who viewed the conflict as the Armageddon foretold in the Book of Revelations. As wild as that notion may seem in the present, more secular, age, it was a virtual article of faith among Congregationalists, Presbyterians, Baptists and Methodists who composed a large and vocal segment of pubic opinion in the Union throughout the 1860's.

title: Tales of Grainer Continued
description: The puzzling case of David Graiver, the Argentine financier, is scheduled to take another arcane twist today.

title: New Face: Charlaine Woodard
description: AYEAR ago, Charlaine Woodard was still in drama school. Ten days from now, she'll be waitto hear whether she has won a Tony award as the season's best featured actress in a musical. Not bad progress for someone who didn't start out to sing and dance her way into a theatrical career.

title: Jersey Sets Casino Rules to Keep Small Bettor Out
description: TRENTON, May 25The State Casino Control Commission, in its final formal meeting before the start of legalized casino gambling in Atlantic City, approved regulations today designed to discourage the small bettor.

title: Speer Leaving Steel Institute But Staying at U.S. Steel Helm
description: Edgar B. Speer, chairman of the United States Steel Corporation, is stepping down as chairman and chief executive of the American Iron and Steel Institute after two years but, despite some serious bouts of illness, has no plans to relinquish the helm at the nation's biggest steel company.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Salomone Rossi, a Jewish composer who worked in the courts of three dukes of Mantua, Italy, also left behind music he wrote in 1622 for a Sabbath service. Cantor Jason N. Bauch of Temnle EmanuEl in East Meadow, L.I., is reviving Rossi's score for tonight's unusual service. We're doing this for the fun of it, says the cantor, but we also want to show Jewish people that we have a gigantic tradition of music from different parts of the world. Cantor Bauch has arranged Rossi's composition for organ, harpsichord, bassoon, violin and two recorders. Music by other Renaissance composers will also be heard during the service, which begins at R:15 P.M. and is open to the public. From New York City take the Long Island Expressway to the Meadowbrook Parkway. Follow the Hempstead Turnpike to Merrick Avenue and turn right. The temple is at 123 Merrick Avenue. Information: (516) 7948911.

title: M.L. KRULEWITCH, 82; HEADED SPORTSUNIT
description: Melvin L. Krulewitch, the retired Marine Corps general who was chairman of the New York State Athletic Commission during the 1960's, died yesterday at his Manhattan apartment. He was 82 years old.

title: Money Rates
description: THURSDAY, MAY 25, 1978

title: Accord on MentalPatient Homes
description: ALBANY, May 254 bill that would expedite the state's placement of community residences for the mentally ill an the retarded, hut would also strengthen the communities' rights to review such placements, has been agreed upon by legislative leaders and Governor Carey's office.

title: Prices Drop for Third Day, With Market in May Jinx
description: The typical May jinx seemed to be working on the stock market yesterday, with prices falling for the third straight session. But there were pockets of strength in conglomerate issues and copper stocks.
