description: ATLANTA  For the first time in its long fight with organized labor, the J. P. Stevens & Company textile combine permitted union organizers last week to enter some of its nonunion plants.

title: J. Mark Fisher, Virginia Law Graduate, Marries Shari Kathranne Rossmann
description: Shari Kathranne Rossmann and J. Mark Fisher were married yesterday in the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church by the Rev. David H. C. Read.

title: STAMPS
description: To accent the comity between the two nations, the United States is issuing an unusual souvenir sheet of eight stamps for CAPEX 78, the international philatelic exhi bition in Toronto. For this event Canada itself is issuing its first souvenir sheet, reproducing and accompanying three stamponstamp commemoratives that recapture the nation's earliest stamps.

title: Millions of Dollars Worth of Trees Reported Stolen From U.S. Forests
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 25Federal investigators are studying allegations that trees worth millions of dollars are being stolen from the Federal forests that blanket the mountain slopes of the Pacific Northwest and provide the main support for the region's economy.

title: POLITICS
description: THE unusual appearance of Vice President Mondale at a Long Island fundraiser for Representative Thomas J. Downey provided a classic example of mutual assistance and backscratching in politics. The Vice President was the feature attraction last week at a $50aplate breakfast to raise funds for the 29yearold Mr. Downey, who will be seeking his third term in the House in the fall elections. Mr. Mondale's appearance assured a large turnout of about 500 people at a Lindenhurst restaurant.

(516) 6591800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: Gunman and Accomplice Hold Up 10 Passengers in IRT Subway Car
description: A gunman and an accomplice held up 10 passengers late Friday evening on a Dyre Avenue train of the IRT subway line, hit one passenger when he refused to yield and fled when another passenger shouted for the police.

title: Louisa Bowen Fiancee of Paul Anderson
description: Louisa Hopkins Bowen, archivist of the national board of the Young Womens Christian Association in New York, and Paul Gustav Anderson, a faculty member and curator of special collections at the University of Southern Mississippi, will be married Sept. 2 in St. Thomas Episcopal Church in Hanover, N.H.

title: Marcie Schlossman Engaged
description: Dr. and Mrs. Ralph E. Schlossman of Jamaica, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Marcie Ellen Schlossman. to Marvin Tankel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Tankel of Whitestone, Queens.

title: French Casino Robbed of $17,000
description: DEAUVILLE, France, May 27 (Reuters) Policemen exchanged shots with gunmen who held up the casino in this fashionable seaside resort early today and cook about $17,000. Two persons were wounded. The gunmen escaped, and their car was later found abandoned.

title: W. C. Wright, Artist, And Hope Harrison Married in Maryland
description: Hope Burbank Harrison, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Thomas Harrison of Stevenson, Md., and Wianno, Mass., was married yesterday to William Clarendon Wright, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Leland Wright of Tulca Okla.

title: Show to Aid Salvation Army
description: Next Thursday evening's performance of Ain't Misbehavin', the new Fats Waller musical at the Longacre Theater, will benefit the Salvation Army's program of 140 services to people in need in Greater New York. A supper party at the Pierre will follow the performance. Tickets are $100 each for theater and party, or $50 each for theater only. Reservations may be made through the Theater Benefit Corn??ittee at the army's headquarters at 20 West 23d Street.

title: Peking to Rescue Vietnam Chinese
description: HONG KONG, May 27Peking announced today that it was sending ships to evacuate Chinese residents it said were being persecuted in Vietnam, another sign that the angry dispute between the two countries is continuing to worsen.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: THE SEVEN DEADLY SINS TODAY By Henry Fairlie. Drawings by Vint Lawrence. 216 pp. Washington: New Republic Books. $10.

title: Bikini's Radiation is a Fire That Will Not Go Out
description: For as long as anyone could remember, the people of Bikini lived on the same coral atoll, where the coconut and pandanus were plentiful and the sparkling waters of the lagoon were a source of joy and of all the fish they could eat. They lived to themselves, about 170 of them on their tiny island far from any other land or people in the Marshall islands of the nest central Pacific Ocean. This was their home, their worlduntil 1946.

title: Unpaid Taxes Signify a Cloud On City's Future
description: Alvin Murray never decided to become a tax delinquent. It happened naturally.

title: Fourth Amendment Stays Healthy
description: From its start in 1971, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration has been an agency that people like to dislike. Employers complain about nitpicking regulations and harrassment. Workers complain about indecision and ineffectiveness. Just last week, the General Accounting Office joined the chorus, accusing Federal jobsafety inspectors of overlooking some hazards and not making sure that others are corrected.

title: Deaths
description: DELGADOMucio F The officers and staff of the Muscular Dystrophy Association record with profound sorrow the death of a man who, since 1966, served as MDA's Director of Program Development. The key role he played in the growth of the Association, his inspirational guidance of its efforts, and his unswerving dedication to the cause MDA represents were major factors in advancing the fight against muscular dystrophy and related neuromuscular diseases.. Moose was a man of great compassion, wisdom and strength. Those of us privileged to know and work with him will never forget this able colleague and good

title: LONG ISLAND JOURNAL
description: IT is still three years away, but David H. Peirez, who lost the Democratic primary contest last fall for the nomination for Nassau County Executive, is already thinking about another run for the job.

title: Caterer's Forte: Small Dinners at Home
description: TEWKSBURY TWP. JAN FARBER calls herself The Gingham Gourmet and, as such, is one of the busiest women in Tewksbury Township and its semirural Hunterdon County environs. This is because she excels in catering small, elegant dinners at home, a trend that is well established in London and is becoming increasingly popular in the tristate area.

title: Gamblers Eager to Get to Tables on 2d Day
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 27C'mon it's after 10. Let's go. What the hell is going on? Open up! It's a disgrace.

title: Tamara Karsavina Dies;Prima Ballerina for Diaghilev
description: Tamara Karsavina, one of the greatest ballerinas of her generation, died in her sleep at the age of 93 Friday in the London nursing home where she had lived for the past few years, Reuters reported from London.

title: 33 Cars in 200Plus M.P.H. Indy 500
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 27Even people from Akron, Ohio, call it IndyNoPlace. The in nightspot remains the Holiday InnNorthwest. Automobiles eat better than humans. But right here, on West 16th Street and Georgetown Road, the biggest and fastest sports spectacle in the world will be held for the 62d time tomorrow.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: Even when an issue is clearly black and white, sometimes decent, intelligent people are on the wrong side. No one today would support slavery, long hours or child labor, even though they were once staunchly defended for the economic advantage of a few.

title: Mary A. Doll Wed To Timothy Blum
description: Mary Ann Doll, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John James Doll of Madison, Wis., was married there yesterday to Timothy Alexander Blum, son of Mr and Mrs. John Alexander Blum of New York and Colebrook, Conn. The Rev. Robert Reardon performed the ceremony in St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Peter James Murphy 3d Weds Elizabeth Hardy
description: Elizabeth Ann Hardy, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Mannen Hardy of Easton, Md., was married yesterday afternoon to Peter James Murphy 3d. son of Mrs. Arden Beavers Dixon of New Canarn, Conn., and the late Peter J. Murphy Jr.

title: President of Cosmos Takes Team Seriously
description: Since the de??eat in Memphis last Wednesday night. Coach Eddie Firmani has taken his Cosmos troops through some fundamentals unning passing and shootingin preparation for today's game against the Rochester Lancers at Giants Stadium.

title: INTERVIEW
description: ENGLEWOOD WHEN John Harms retired in 1971 after 22 years as director of music at Trinity School in New York, many people thought that his long career as an organist, choir director and impresario was winding down.

title: House Movers in Action on the Shore
description: The ill winds of a stormy winter are blowing good this spring for Long Island specialists in the fine art of house moving.

title: In Scandinavia, a Corporate Marriage of Convenience
description: Norway has t he oil and Sweden has the industry. Last week they got together.

title: LETTERS
description: To The Business Editor:

title: Variety Is Spice for David Frost
World News Briefs
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, May 27 (Reuters)Three detachments of Belgian paratroops today were sent into mining towns in Zaire's Shaba Province to reassure foreigners who are still nervous after last week's massacre at Kolwezi.

title: Sun Flowers Can Bloom in Shady Places
description: Each summer our shady patio is splendid with bright flowering annuals that require full sun. Impossible? Not really.

title: Engagements
description: DeLeonRobinson

title: The Starting Grid
description: *Car qualified for third row by Mike Hiss, but Andretti, as replacmentdriver, must start from last place.

title: Drama of Black Family Will Be TV Miniseries
description: A drama that aspires to rise above standard vision programming through a serious story about a black family trying to hold on to its farm in Mississippi during the Depression will be aired as a short series this week.

title: Ideas & Trends
description: After the repeal by referendum  the fourth such vote in a year  of a Eugene, Ore., ordinance protecting homosexuals from discrimination in jobs and housing, Jean O'Leary. coexecutive director of the National Gay Task Force, expressed grave doubt that any such law could soon stand up to a vote in the United States, and a spokesman for the Sexual Law Reporter. a legal journal, said that day might never come.

title: DISARMAMENT RALLY DRAWS 10,000 AT U.N.
description: More than 10,000 demonstrators led by musicians and costumed performers Marched across midtown Manhattan to the United Nations yesterday to rally for nuclear disarmament.

title: 2 KOREAS COMPETING FOR SUPPORT ABROAD
description: SEOUL, South KoreaNorth and South Korea are at war, not with machine guns, cannon and tanks but with businessmen, politicians and culture.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Question. When something is presented as theater, is it obliged to produce a specifically theatrical effect?

title: White House Has No Vegetable Garden This Year
description: WASHINGTON, May 27For millions of American families, planting time in the backyard arrived some time ago. But not for Jimmy and Rosalynn. Carter.

title: GROWING UP WITH SCIENCE FICTION
description: Science fiction has led me to science, says Cornell University astronomer Sagan, who writes about the impact of scifi on his life and on our society.

title: Toughest Race in Decades for West Virginia Senator
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., May 27Senator Jennings Randolph, the rotund Democratic patriarch of West Virginia and the only member of Congress who has been in it since the beginning of the New Deal, is in the toughest race of his halfcentury of politics.

title: Around the Nation
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 27 (AP)A Greek tanker loaded with crude oil ran aground at the mouth of the Mississippi River today, blocking major shipping channels and forcing a halt to river traffic in the area, the Coast Guard said.

title: Of Special Interest
description: Hungarian playwright Istvan Orkeny's Catsplay has been seen in this country at the Arena Stage in Washington, D. C.; the Guthrie Theater in Minneapolis and most recently, at the Manhattan Theater Club. All three productions have starred Helen Burns in the role of an indomitable widow in Budapest. The Times's Mel Gussow wrote, in fact: Such is the imprint left by the actress on the role that it is difficult to envision the play without her.... Miss Burns plays this obssessive creature with queenly comic gusto. There is no tentativeness in her characterization. It is totally and at moments outrageously conceived. The play, with Miss Burns, of course, moves to the Upper West Side Promenade Theater on Tuesday for an openended run. (See Theater)

title: The Die in Dieting
description: A MONG psychiatric disorders, few are potentially more serious than anorexia nervosa. It is hard to treat, almost awesomely difficult. It is mostly young women who succumb to it: They start dieting and then (in a dramatic, unnatural defiance of a law of nature) don't seem willing to stop. They begin to waste away, but drive others crazy by claiming themselves nevertheless in danger of becoming fat or of being poisoned by the ordinary food everyone else eats. Sometimes they die  perhaps 15 of every 100 diagnosed as anorectic. The authors of this interesting and important book have worked with many of these severely distressed individuals and claim to have had a substantial amount of success as therapists. Their willingness to spend so much time with patients by no means the eas??est to treat, never mind heal, is itself deserving of re??pect.

title: HighIntensity Power Line From Canada Could Be A Jolt to Westchester
description: AHIGHINTENSITY power line has been erected in northern New York State to bring hydroelectric power from Canada to Con Edison customers in Westchester. But while county residents have been kept in the dark about its hazards and told that it is safe and necessary, it is not. Worse, it is a harbinger of an even more distressing threat.

title: World Dog Show Units Convene in Mexico City
description: MEXICO CITY, May 27Dog show history will be made tomorrow morning when Alicia Lopez Portillo y Pacheco, the sister of the president of the republic, officially opens the world show of the Federation Cynologique Internationale (the international dog federation) in Campo Marte.

title: Filming the Battle Of White Plains
description: WHITE PLAINS THE BATTLE of White Plains, a Revolutionary War standoff that has been considered an important American victory because it halted a British advance northward, has for several years been reenacted on its anniversary by men seeking to maintain the nation's heritage.

title: Vernon Proctor, Margaret Boyer Have Nuptials
description: Margaret Selfridge Boyer and Vernon Robert Proctor, who start their third year at the Harvard Law School in the autumn, were married yesterday Wilmington, Del., where the Rev. C. Frederick Mathias performed the ceremony in the Westminster Presbyterian Church.

title: Kisses in New Film in India Fuel Censorship Debate
description: BOMBAY, IndiaIn a sharp break with the tradition of modesty, the kiss has come to the Hindi motion picture screen, titillating some film audiences, scandalizing others, and fueling a national debate over censorship.

title: Dealing With China
description: HONG KONG  When Leonard Woodcock, the chief the United States liaison office in Peking, got married in a Chinese municipal office last month, he joked that he hoped the ceremony would be a small step towards normalization diplomatic relations with China. The gesture was characteristic of Mr. Woodcock, the former leader of the United Auto Workers who has become an outspoken advocate of further advancing the process Richard Nixon began with his journey to China in 1972.

title: MUSIC
description: STRATFORD THE Connecticut Center for the Performing Arts, having already brought ballet, bluegrass, Broadway and, of cgurse, the Bard to the American Shakespeare Theater, has now added Gilbert and Sullivan. Interestingly  and perhaps significantly it was not one of the stirefire Gilbert and Sullivan operettas that bowed at Stratford two weekends ago. It was Patience.

title: College Said to Overenroll Courses
description: Assemblyman Charles E. Schumer, chairman of the Assembly's Subcommittee on City Management, has charged that New York Community College in Brooklyn has assigned hundreds more students to remedial courses than could possibly be seated in the classrooms set aside for them.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodayPlainfield Kennel Club 36th dog show and MidJersey Companion Dog Training Club's 29th obedience trial, WardlawHartridge School, Inman Avenue, Edison, N.J.; 2,236 dogs; 9 A.M.7 P.M.

title: Radio
description: 7:308 A.M., WABC: Message of Israel. Address by Rabbi Jeffrey L. Balton.

title: Sin's Come Back to the Boardwalk
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J., May 27Thirty years ago an elderly couple from Iowa made their first visit to Atlantic City. After a day or so the lady of the family delivered a judgment.

title: Catherine A. Thompson Bride of Thomas Morton
description: Catherine Agnes Thompson, a financial analyst with Morgan Stanley & Company, was married yesterday to Thomas Howard Morton, a financial specialist in the food products division of the General Foods Corporation. The Rev. Ward Moore performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of Sorrows in South Orange, N.J.

title: Elizabeth Remington Is Fiancee
description: Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Ryder Remington of St. Louis have announced the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Ryder Remington, to Thomas Agnew McKay Jr. of New York, son of Mrs. Thomas A. McKay of Tuxedo Park, N.Y., and the late Mr. McKay. The wedding is planned for Aug. 5 wedding in St. Louis.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: The Soviet Union and the Western powers were locked in a battle of wills. West Berlin's survival depended on daily airlift. Talk of war preparations was commonplace. In some American backyards a new addition to the home appeared: the underground bomb shelter.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: William P. Donlon, Dean of United States paper money dealers, died suddenly at the age of 86 last month, just a few days after his Mail Bid Sale No. 12 closed on March 31. The Prices Realized sheet went out, however, and the catalogue is of great interest because of the wide scope of the offerings  and also because the sale was Bill's last (in his preface he said: And the last? Quite possibly).

title: DINING OUT
description: RIDGEFIELD WHATEVER magic  or chemistry makes one town a good restaurant town while neighboring communities flounder in a culinary wasteland, Ridgefield would seem to have it. In addition to three fairly well celebrated inns, this Fairfield County town of 21,000 has several other worthy dining establishments.

title: 130 Local Laws Make It Hard to Decide What's Fair
description: TRENTON, N.J.  For the third time in five years, the New Jersey Supreme Court is studying questions raised about rent control laws. This is a lot of time for the state's highest tribunal to spend on one matter; but then, there are a lot of rent control laws  130 New Jersey cities and towns have adopted them since 1973, when the Court ruled that municipalities have the power to apply controls where the threat of rentgouging exists.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TODAY

title: At the United Nations, Plowshares Are the Rage
description: WASHINGTON  Although disarmament has long been given great lipservice as a pressing goal by the international community, it is subject that has rarely been given serious attention by governments in the conduct of daytoday diplomacy. Thus, it was hardly surprising that when the representatives of 149 nations gathered at the United Nations last week for a special session devoted to disarmament, experienced observers of foreign affairs found it difficult to stifle a collective yawn.

title: Young Woman Returns Home to Fresh Air Fund Parents
description: When Marilyn Cabrera moved to Puerto Rico with her family several years ago, two friends on the mainland, Gerald and Sharon Saupee, were worried that they might never see her again.

title: Rice Clouts No. 17 as Red Sox Win
description: Luis Tiant and Jim Rice. That was all the Boston Red Sox needed to defeat the Detroit Tigers, 1.0, yesterday and more two games ahead of the New York Yankees in the American League East race.

title: BEHIND THE BEST SELLERS
description: Several years ago the novelist Anton Myrer was tooling along in his 1969 twodoor green Buick, listening to the radio. He had just picked up his wife, Pat, a literary agent, at the railroad station in Rhinebeck and they were driving home to their place in Saugerties, up the Hudson.

title: In the Beginning
description: WHEN journalism falters and diplomacy fails, fiction sometimes rushes in to tell us what we want to know. As the fate of the Middle East hangs again in the balance, the Israeli novelist Amos Oz, with rare second sight, has written a timely book that scrutinizes the origins of modern Israel. Born in 1939 and the author of five previous works of fiction, Oz saw action on the Golan Heights during the perilous combat in 1973. The Hill of Evil Counsel, made up of three interwoven stories written in 1974 and 1975, is his oblique reaction, an indirect comment on Israel's status as a nation. He turns back to the world that preceded the first ArabIsraeli war of 1948, the Jerusalem of his boyhood, the crucial last years of the British Mandate over Palestine. The result is Oz's most beautifully sustained and evocative book of fiction since his first novel, Elsewhere, Pqrhaps, was published in Hebrew in 1966.

title: Lawyers Agree on Developing Former Rockefeller Estate
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Lawyers for a community of wealthy Washington homeowners and for the real estate developers who have bought the $5.5 million former Foxhall Road Estate of Nelson A. Rockefeller said today that they had reached an agreement on a plan for the site. The plan, they said, will preserve the heavily forested character of the 25acre estate and reduce the number of dwellings to be built.

title: Headliners
description: Decoration Day came early this year for Armand Hammer, who last week in Moscow received the Order of Friendship Among Peoples in honor of his 80th birthday and in recognition of his promotion of trade between the United States and the Soviet Union. Dr. Hammer, who is chairman of the Occidental Petroleum Corporation, first went to Russia in 1921 as a physician, but was persuaded by Lenin to go into the exportimport business instead, and has maintained business connections between the two countries ever since; at present he is providing half the financing for an international trade center in Moscow and building the first golf course in Russia. The Soviet medal, which is not known to have been awarded before to a capitalist, joins the French Legion of Honor, the Mexican Order of the Aztec Eagle and several other foreign ornaments Dr. Hammer is now entitled to wear.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Long Grind for Bullets, Sonics
description: LANDOVER, Md., May 27This professional basketball season has lingered so long, like a common cold, you can't help becoming immune to it. The regular season began in October. The playoffs actually began 45 days ago, and the games have been spaced out so far they seem to be annual telecasts, like the Bob Hope Christmas Specials. This season may not end until June 7. That's almost nine months of flow, transition, intensity and this season's instant clich, chemistry.

title: Abby Francis Betrothed to Peter Kohnstamm
description: Mr. and Mrs. Charles G. Francis of Chappaqua, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Abby Constance Francis, to Peter L. Kohnstamm, a planning associate for the Young Men's Christian Association of Greater New York. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul L. Kohnstamm of Pound Ridge, N.Y.

title: Princetonians Propose Changes
description: Princetonians Propose ChangesSTUDENTS at Princeton University know that their school stresses hard work  and plenty of it. During the finalexamination period, which is now coming to a close, any one of them will tell an observer about the academic pressure on campus, if he or she can get them away from the books long enough.

title: American Jumbo Jet Delivers 6 F5E Interceptors to Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 27 (UPI)A United States Air Force jumbo jet has delivered six new F5E interceptors to Thailand military spokesmen said today.

title: Grosvenor G. Nichols To Wed Sally Willets
description: Sarah Ayres Willets of Sausalito, Calif., an officer of the Crocker National Bank in San Francisco, and Grosvencr Gcodridge Nichols, a management consultant with the San Francisco office of Peat, Marwick, Mitchell & Company, the accounting concern, plan to be married next September in Sewickley, Pa.

title: Nkomo's Group, at Big Rally, Assails Smith Coalition
description: BULAWAYO, Rhodesia, May 27 (Reuters)A crowd participating in the first legal major rally of the Zimbabwe African People's Union in 15 years roared its opposition today to the majority rule agreement reached in March by the white Prime Minister, Ian D. Smith, and three moderate black nationalist leaders.

title: Cuba Welcomes Foreign Anglers
description: BARLOVENTO, CubaFinca Vigia, Hemingway's house, is a museum;the Pilar, his beloved 38foot fishing boat, is a national landmark; the prostitutes no longer ply their wares at the Floridita Bar. But the billfish have not changed.

title: Tuxedos: Preening for the Prom
description: Fifteen or 20 years ago, the kids going to proms would rent a white Tony Martin tuxedo, black pants, a formal white shirt and that was it, recalled Harry Spector, owner of Midway Formals on Queens Boulevard in Forest Hills. In the early 1960's, they were into the costume look, and the most requested styles at rental shops were kneelength tuxedos, shouting colors and brocades. Today it's all coordinate, complement or match.

title: The Sunday Brunch Circuit
description: HAVING brunch out is often a pleasant way to combat the bloodySunday blues. The message is evidently spreading to restaurateurs. More and more now open their doors late in the morning or at noon for a special and often quite festive Sunday brunch.

title: Caramanlis to Link A Stronger NATO To Cyprus Solution
description: ATHENS, May 27Prime Minister Constantine Caramanlis of Greece says he will warn the leaders of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization when they meet in Washington next week that only a fair settlement on Cyprus will restore the strength of the alliance's southern flank.

title: Policeman Seized in Fatal Shooting After Return of Impounded Guns
description: A 35yearold New York City police officer whose firearms had been returned to him last Wednesday after months of psychiatric counseling was arrested yesterday in the fatal shooting of a neighbor during an argument outside their North Bronx homes.

title: Deaths
description: Abbott, Joseph

title: S.B.A. Success Story, Rewritten
description: WASHINGTON  Charles Wallace seemed to be one of the few successes of a beleaguered Small Business Administration program that was designed to help minority entrepreneurs get into the nation's economic mainstream.

title: NEW JERSEY JOURNAL
description: ASTATE negotiator asserted last week that New Jersey state troopers had only themselves to blame if they owed money to the Internal Revenue Service for unpaid F. ederal taxes on meal money.

title: Wine
description: What seed catalogues do to some people, wine lists do to me. Tomatoes planted from an armchair in February are always winners. So are the wines I select at leisure from lists people have sent me. Moreover, I don't spend a nickel and I don't get a hangover.

title: NORWALK POLICE GET 20 MINORITY ROOKIES
description: NORWALK, Conn., May 23Twenty black or Hispanic canditates have been selected for the Police Department here after passing a gederally supervised test drawn up as a result of a suit by blacks claiming discrhbination and a countersuit by whitet also claiming discrimination.

title: Bank Building Dedicated in Boston
description: Sometimes a building needs a lift. In the case of the nearly completed Citicorp Center here, Hugh Stubbins of Boston, the architect, placed the office tower on stilts 10 stories off the ground to create new pedestrian space at congested Lexington Avenue between 53d and 54th Streets.

title: Article 5 -- No Title
MinorityRun Business: Lack Of Visibility
description: WHITE PLAINS RUNNING the gamut from food vending and office furniture sales to light hauling and reinforcedconcrete work, there are 143 minorityoperated businesses in the county, according to Lloyd Foote, the county's minority business adviser. But while many of them are not only viable businesses, but also competitive with whiteowned enterprises, they all suffer, he said, from a visibility problem in a county that more readily brings to mind the landscaped and opulent corporate campuses of companies like I.B.M. and General Foods.

title: Tensions on Rutgers Campus
description: NEW BRUNSWICK AFTER months of student protest against the Rutgers administration, and a dramatic demand for the resignation of Dr. Edward J. Bloustein, the university's president, the end of the school year has brought a changed atmosphere of improved internal communication. Student leaders are hopeful and university administrators are relieved.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Twentyoneyearold Mario Tremblay, after scoring two goals in the Montreal Canadiens' decisive victory over the Boston Bruins: This is my third [Stanley] Cup in three years. Not too many young guys get that. I'm going to celebrate with champagne, beer, all night, for a good part of the summer for sure.

title: CONNECTICUT REAL ESTATE
description: THIS year may go down in local realestate history as the Year of the Mortgage. An enabling act that was passed by the Legislature this session and signed into law by Governor Grasso on May 18 permits banks to start offering many of the alternative mortgage programs long in the planning stage.

title: Registry Organized for the Donation of Bodies for Medical Research
description: An anatomy professor and two undertakers have come up with what they believe may help solve New York City's chronic shortage of cadavers for use by local medical, dental and healthrelated schools for research.

title: Release of Retarded Juveniles  In Pennsylvania Ordered by Court
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 27 (AP)The Federal District Court in Philadelphia has ordered the release within 180 days of all 3,400 mentally ill or retarded juveniles now held in Pennsylvania institutions.

title: Trekking the Peruvian Andes: Eucalyptus Burning in the Campfire
description: The Cordillera Blanca of Peru, one of the few high iceclad regions in the tropics, attracts alpinists and mountain travelers from all over the world. Having had a taste of United States mountains and the Alps, Mount Kenya in East Africa, the Mexican volcanoes and the lower reaches of the mighty Himalayas, I decided to go see this gem in the Andean chain myslf.

title: ART VIEW
description: There have been times in the history of modern paintingthey tend to recur at regular generational intervalswhen the decision to paint flat, with as little visible reference as possible to an illusory depth or third dimension, seemed to embody the very essence of the modernist imperative. The Colorfield painting of which we have seen so much in recent yearsand examples of which now hang in our museums as classic works of modernist artis only the latest of many similar episodes. Illusionism was said long ago to belong to tradition, which meant all the permutations and modifications of Renaissance perspective that still persisted in 19thcentury painting. This was what the flat style of Gauguin and Puvis and Matisse so brilliantly contravened; yet, some remnant of illusionism always managed to survive.

title: Landmarks Stir Princeton Row
description: PRINCETON APROPOSED ordinance that is aimed at preserving historic landmarks here has generated considerable controversy in this university community, a community that takes its history seriously and values its property rights highly.

title: Lefkowitz Studies a Possible Link Between Esposito and L.I. Track
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz has begun an investigation into the connections, if any, between Meade H. Esposito, the Brooklyn Democratic leader, and a bankrupt race track on Long Island.

title: Secretarial Jobs Go Unfilled
description: WHEN Westchester became the corporate home for Texaco, Pepsico and dozens of other big companies, it made the good life just a little better for highlevel executives living in the area. But it also created an unexpected problem  secretaries and skilled clerical workers were in short supply.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: BROOKVILLE  Graphic arts by Graphiska Sallskapet of Stockholm; weekdays 11 A.M. to 4 P.M.; weekends 2 to 5 P.M.; Thursday through June 30; Schwartz Library, C.W. Post Center.

title: What If a Mars Landing Were Faked? Asks Peter Hyams
description: LONDON In Britain, there is a vociferous organization that calls itself the Flat Earth Society and is dedicated to exposing all astronomers since Galileo as dupes or frauds, collectively propagating the lie that the planet is round. And NASA's mail reportedly suggests that in America a much more substantial minority suspects that the moon program was all a gigantic hoax. Such skeptics can take heart from a new movie, Capricorn One, which involves a fanciful Mars landing foisted on a credulous public by astronauts no more than a microsecond's rocket ride from mission control in Houston. [The film is scheduled to open in New York on Friday at the Rivoli Theater.]

title: Sandra Stuchell Wed in Jersey
description: In the First Congregational Church of Darien, Conn., yesterday afternoon, Sandra Stark Stuchell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Torrence Stuchell Jr. or Darien anti yuogue, L.t , DeCaMe ine bride of Walter Wilsey White of Wyckoff, N.J., son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Seymour White of Ridgewood, N.J.

title: Wood, Field & Stream
description: As a lad I read the story of a North Woods traveler who had time to save only one possession from his canoe when it capsized in a rapids. The object he flung ashore in the snow was his ax, and the author explained that it, more than his rifle, was essential to the voyageur's survival.

title: POLITICS
description: WHITE PLAINS ASSEMBLYWOMAN Mary B. Goodhue, the Mount Kisco Republican, has worked out an ideal political scenario for herself in which she will be elected to the State Senate in November and, as a member of the majority, will have an influence on legislation she has not had in the Democraticcontrolled Assembly.

title: On the Run: In a Norwalk Park, Everybody Wins
description: NORWALK

title: David M. Fleisher Is Fiance Of Melissa Marianne Krantz
description: Rabbi and Mrs, Abraham Krantz of West Nyack, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Melissa Marianne Krantz, to David Michael Fleisher, son of Dr. and Mrs. Harold Fleisher of Poughkeepsie, N.Y.

title: Goldin and Abrams Seem Safely in Primary
description: Less than three weeks before the Democratic, State Committee designates a state ticket, Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin of New York City and Borough President Robert Abrams of the Bronx have apparently won enough support for their respective bids for the State Comptroller and Attorney General nominations to assure themselves a place on the Democratic primary ballot.

title: The Social Contract, Writ Small
description: There was some welcome news on the inflation front this week: a number of large companies responded to the President's appeal to resist wage pressures. American Telephone and Telegraph, General Motors, and Time Inc. all announced that they would hold salary increases for their top executives below last year's. In the same spirit, a group of major unions pledged to avoid strikes and to eliminate inefficient work practices that add to construction costs.

title: ELLIOT K. LUDINGTON JR.
description: Elliot K. Ludington Jr., president of the Chase Bag Company of Greenwich, Conn., died Friday at his home in Greenwich at the age of 73.

title: LETTERS TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR
description: As a member of the Westchester County Bar Association and a practicing trial attorney for over 20 years, I am constrained to join the Supreme Court endorsement fracas that was initiated, in part, by the illadvised multiparty endorsement by that association. [Politics column, May 7].

title: Joblessness Plagues India's Educated Elite
description: BOMBAY, IndiaWhen the Government here took out a very small advertisement recently announcing that it might have some openings for grade school teachers, the line of applicants at the old Victorian city hall the next morning stretched around the corner and into the next block.

title: WESTCHESTER REAL ESTATE
description: ALL HOUSES in Westchester are not in the $100,000 price range, despite the county's reputation for high cost and the high asking prices listed by some brokers.

title: Votes in Congress
description: Last Week's Tally for the Metropolitan Area

title: DINING OUT
description: AFTER 32 years in the same location, Ravet t's has earned the right to be a bit oldfashioned. We use that twofaced description in its better sense. Guests are welcomed by one or another of the Ravetto family and seated at comfortably spaced tables. There is no participation, however inadvertent, in neighboring conversations.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: The other week Speculum Musicae gave the world premiere of the Quartet Romantic by Henry Cowella work that Cowell had composed in 1917. It had not been played in 1917 because there was no instrumental group in the world at that time capable of playing it. On the printed pagethe Quartet Romantic has recently been published by C.F. Petersthe music does not look that difficult on cursory examination. But then one takes a closer look. The piece is dissonant counterpoint. Each of the four playerstwo flutes, violin and violahas his own rhythm. And such rhythms! In a typical measure the first flute plays in 62/3, the second flute in 51/3, the violin in 4 and the viola in 22/3.

title: Guardsman Dies in Fall From Jeep
description: PALMER, Mass., May 27 (AP)A member of the Rhode Island National Guard was killed today when he apparently fell asleep while driving in a convoy on the Massachusetts Turnpike and fell out of his jeep. Maj. Gen. Leonard Holland, commander of the Rhode Island National Guard, identified the victim as Joseph L. Folcarelli, 41, of Providence, a member of the 2d Battalion, 103rd Field Artillery Group. The convoy was on its way from Providence to Camp Drum near Watertown, N.Y., for a twoweek training period.

title: DINING OUT
description: WERNER'S LAKE EDGE is superbly situated, as the name suggests, on Lake Watchung. The lake is small, but who would expect even a miniature lake not to mention pine trees, a Bavarian chalet and a gaggle of Mercedes  just a fiveminute drive west Plainfield and away from the excrescences of Route 22?

title: Claudia Gitelman Presents Two New Dance Works
description: Claudia Gitelman is a choreographer in the tradition of Hanya Holm, Alwin Nikolais and Murray Louis. Unsurprisingly enough, she tends to make dances of disengaged movement. They flow and are for the most part softeredged than the work of her mentors but at the same time they lack its bite and resolution.

title: Airliner and Small Plane Reported in Narrow Miss Near La Guardia
description: An American Airlines Boeing 727 jet and a twinengine turboprop plane narrowly missed a midair collission just north of La Guardia Airport Tuesday evening.

title: The Call Of The Wild Is Not Too Distant
description: THE WOODS have turned green, the call of the wild gets louder, and wouldbe campers dream of crisp, dewy mornings and appetites whetted by the sharp aroma of bacon frying over an open fire.

title: NEW JERSEY REAL ESTATE
description: GERALD and Joyce Hoffspiegel were not looking for a Victorian house. But when they saw the ninebedroom, Queen Annestyle home at 86 Llewellyn Road in Montclair, with its six fireplaces, three kitchens and a domed study in the turret, they were enraptured.

title: Weiss Rides Zacharian To Junior Jumper Title
description: DEVON, Pa. May 27It was just about a year go that Steven Weiss of Roslyn Heights, L.I., decided it was time to make his move in the horse show worldto find out just how far he could go.

title: Editors' Choice
description: THE EYE OF THE STORY, by Eudora Welty. (Random House, $10.) Selected essays and reviews, mostly on writers she loves.

title: New Jersey/ This Week
description: CRANFORD (Dramatic Club Theater, 78 Winans Avenue)  Godspell. Friday and Saturday, 8:40 P.M. (through June 10). $5$6; group rates. (201) 2767611.

title: Survey of Lawyers Finds Few Who Plan to Advertise Services
description: CHICAGO, May 27 (Reuters)Only a small minority of American lawyers plan to advertise their services, despite a decision by the United States Supreme Court upholding their right to do so, according to a survey by the American Bar Association.

title: THE NEW NEW WAVE OF FILM MAKERS
description: SUNSET BEACH, Hawaii. John Milius likes military metaphors. The surfboard he rides through the mountainous surf here while directing Big Wednesday, a movie played against a backdrop of surfing, is called the Bismarck. On the beach he has surfboards named the Scharnhorst, the Graf Spee and the von Tirpitz, all named after World War II German sea raiders.

title: Blue Jays Down Yankees With 3 Runs in Ninth, 41
description: There was no 5 o'clock lightning for the New York Yankees yesterday at the Stadium. Instead it was the visiting Toronto Blue Jays who supplied the lateinning rally, scoring three times in the ninth to beat the New Yorkers, 41.

title: Ford Gets Physical Checkup
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI)Former President Gerald R. Ford had a routine physical examination at Bethesda Naval Hospital, Md., on Thursday, military sources said. It was understood that Mr. Ford took the opportunity of his visit to Washington to got the checkup. It was not disclosed how long Mr. Ford was at the hospital.

title: CRIME
description: Kin Platt must have had a lot of fun in his life. Years back, he drew a popular cartoon feature, Mr. and Mrs., for The New York Herald Tribune and its syndicate. More recently he has started a series of detective stories featuring the private eye Max Roper. So far each has had to do with a sport. That means onthespot research, consorting with jockeys, hockey players, body builders or whatever the substance of the novel might be. A nice way to pass the time.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: IT HAPPENS every year. Just as the first tulips poke their heads through the newly softened soil, Spring SpruceUp FeVer hits us.

title: Drs. Jane V. Petroff,  John Mears to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. John Petroff Jr. of Freehold, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Dr. Jane Veronica Petroff, to Dr. John Gregory Mears, son of the Rev. John D. Mears, rector emeritus of the Episcopal Church of the Good Shepherd in Buffalo, and the late Grace K. Mears. A summer wedding is planned.

title: FILM VIEW
description: Seats to the left, said the usher, who looked like a recycled toy soldier. Seats to the left, and, like the sheep I tend to be when I enter Radio City Music Hall, I took a seat to the left. It was only when I was sitting that I realized there were almost as many vacant seats to the right as there were to the left. I moved to the center section. Grumbling. Every time I've been to the hall in the last 20some years, I've been directed to take a seat on the left. Is it a comment on my politics in relation to those of the hall? Never once in all this time has an usher ever told me there were seats available in the center. It's not as if there were a matron on duty in the leftsection. Nothing. Is seatstotheleft something they teach at the Music Hall School for Ushers along with Good morning, Good afternoon, Good evening and I'm sorry, madam, you're only allowed one piece of hand luggage in the auditorium?

title: Jane Popiel, Neil Kozarsky, Graduating Students, to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Charles I. Popiel of Rockville Centre, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Janet Lynne Popiel, to Neil J. Kozarsky, son of Mr. and Mrs. Eliot Kozarsky of Moorestown. N.J.

title: Roberta Coffin Is Married
description: Roberta Peckett Coffin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Peckett Coffin of Stuart, Fla., and Pawling, N.Y., was married yesterday afternoon to George Onderdonk Linkletter 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Linkletter Jr. of Glenside, Pa.

title: Highlights of Package
description: ALBANY, May 27Following arc highlights of the New York City fiscal legislation that the Legislatire approved early today:

title: ART
description: TRENTON MOST of us can easily tell a print from a painting, although some advances in printmaking have made it possible to make prints ?? closely resemble paintings.

title: Biennials Are Fascinating to Grow From Seed
description: Among the best loved garden flowers are the biennials which, as their name implies, live only two years. They develop their foliage growth the first year,flower in the second season and then die.

title: WESTCHESTER JOURNAL
description: THE WESTCHESTER Transportation Commissioner, R. Raleigh D'Adamo, made an interesting discovery driving on a Washington thoroughfare recently, one that might help in getting Federal permission to have bus shelters  with advertising  erected along county roads.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: POWER MOWERS, edging machines, garden tractors and other powerdriven yard and garden tools can save a lot of work for the homeowner, but they also can lead to lots of frustration and fail to perform as expected if they are not serviced periodically and otherwise not maintained properly.

title: Meeting the Needs of Travelers on Diets
description: Until recently Harold Kellar felt that vacation travel was not for him because he has high blood pressure and is on a saltfree diet. Dr. Kellar, a professor of international trade at the City University of New York, reached that conclusion two years ago after taking a fiveday cruise with his wife, Charlotte, on the Soviet liner Maxim Gorki.

title: Ocean Spray's Aggressive Marketing Pays Off
description: PLYMOUTH, Mass.  The Pilgrims who stepped ashore or a rock just across the road from the souvenir stands here would probably have felt comfortable with the idea of cranberry sauce. Even cranberry juice cocktail or, Puritanism aside, cranberry liqueur to ward off the chill of a foggy New England night.

title: CAMERA
description: Before the 35mm single lens reflex became so popular, the allround favorite with both professional and amateur photographers was the 2x2 twinlens reflex. Physically, it was shaped like a rectangular box standing on end with two lenses, one directly above the other. The bottom lens transmitted its image directly to the film, the upper one sent the image to a ground glass which showed the photographer the picture he was taking.

title: Irvington Pupils Get Closeup of Nature
description: IRVINGTON THERE are 703 sixthgraders in the Irvington school system, and none of them should ever get lost in the woods.

title: VIETNAITS REFUGEES SET POSTWAR RECORD
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 27Refugees are streaming out of Vietnam at the highest rate since the end of the war. In April, the number of arrivals in Malaysia and Thailand, the two countries in which most of the Vietnamese refugee boats make their first landfall, was a record and the number this month is likely to be even higher.

title: Paperback Best Sellers
The Coaches' Coach
description: After the 28 National Football League coaches assembled at the New York Hilton last week to discuss how to put on two more game faces this season, they were asked to huddle for group photos. Chuck Knox, now with the Buffalo Bills after five seasons with the Los Angeles Rams, lined up offside with the National Conference coaches instead of the American, but he had time to recover. Tom Landry was still explaining the flex defense to the bell captain. Bud Grant was out shooting ducks. When those two eventually arrived, the photos were taken, and the 28 intellects settled into 28 chairs below 28 team posters to expound on the new rules and the new schedule. But a private pbllster confronted each with the same question: Aside from yourself, each was asked to avoid a conflict of interest, who is the best coach in the N.F.L. and why?

title: Mondale's Appearance Fulfills His Part of the Bargain in Political B ackScratching Mission for Downey
description: The unusual appearance of Vice President Mondale at a Leng Island fundraising event for Representative Thomas J. Downey provided a classical example of mutual assistance and backscratching in politics. The Vice President was the feature attraction last week at a $50aplate breakfast for the 29yearold Mr. Downey, who will be seeking his third term in the House in the fall elections. Mr Mon ?? s appearance assurea a large turnout of about 500 people at a Lindenhurst restaurant.

title: VAST SCIENTIFIC DRIVE IS UNDER WAY IN CHINA
description: China is embarking on what may prove the most ambitious program of rapid scientific and technological development ever undertaken by a nation.

title: A Tayloresque View Of Paul Taylor's Choreography
description: What's this? It's an essay about Paul Taylor, director of the Paul Taylor Dance Company, which opens a twoweek season Tuesday night at the City Center. This essay consists of a chronicle, some musings and some interruptions, all pertaining to Mr. Taylor's choreography.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: JOHN STOCKWELL'S In Search of Enemies is the latest in a burgeoning genre  books by former Central Intelligence Agency men. Mr. Stockwell was chief of the Angolan Task Force in 1975, and his book exposes previously secret C.I.A. activities during the Angolan civil war.

title: A Season Of Outings Opens Up
description: IT may not yet be swimming weather, but from one end of the Island to the other, enough spring activities are on tap to keep families busy until they take that first plunge. Depending upon interests, an adventurous family can spend a weekend steeped in Long Island history by visiting the many historic buildings that now survive as museums (Suffolk alone has more than 50 operated by local historical societies), tour the gardens and arboretums now bursting forth in spring foliage, take quiet walks through nature preserves and trails for a glimpse of what existed here before the bulldozer came, or wander through imposing estates to see how the fabled Gold Coast residents lived. And all within a tankful of gas from home.

title: NATO Meets in Solemn Conclave This Week
description: WASHINGTON  Summoned by President Carter, the heads of government of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, with the exception of Valery Giscard d'Estaing of France, will meet in Washington Tuesday and Wednesday. By all appearances, the conference has all the makings of just another high altitude publicity operation. But it could also turn out to be something much more valuable  a hard look at NATO's ability to balance the Soviet Union's advances in nuclear and conventional armament through longterm programs extending into the 1990's.

title: Carter's Election Warning Underlines a New Caribbean Policy
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic  It was both curious and perhaps revealing to watch Dominican attempts to fan the emotional fires of their election crisis with antiAmerican fervor.

title: On New Issues, Hearing the Word Can Be as Hard as Doing
description: Last week at the General Assembly of the United Presbyterian church in San Diego, an observer asked a delegate what authority would most likely be used to decide the debate over the ordination of homosexuals.

title: Philip Ross Fiance Of Chandler Burns
description: Mr. and Mrs. William Shelly Burns of Saunderstown, R.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Ch??ndler Knight Burns, to Philip Lanier Ross, who expects to receive a master's degree in architecture in December from Carnegie Mellon University.

title: THEATER
description: ELMSFORD, N.Y. IF ONE thinks of the musical Shenandoah in terms of when it appeared  in January 1975, when America was very sick of warits success makes sense. If you think about tne progress made in the musical theater, its success makes no sense. It is a Civil War soap opera reeking with noble characters who feel all the proper clich emotions, who speak poor dialogue and who sing thirdrate lyrics to a thirdrate score.

title: Arts Center Urged In Meadowlands
description: RUTHERFORD WITH industry and sports already thriving in the Hackensack Meadowlands, leaders in Bergen County are pressing for the development of a state cultural center they describe as a logical centerpiece for drawing people to New Jersey.

title: BANK MEETING SOUGHT ON CITY FISCAL BILLS
description: Governor Carey, Mayor Koch and officials of the unions. representing New York City's municipal employees will be asked to meet Wednesday with representatives of a group of large banks to discuss their objections to legislation intended to help resolve the city's latest fiscal problems.

title: Mets Rally to Beat Astros, 97
description: HOUSTON, May 27  Joe Torre glanced at the calendar tonight and said: Wednesday's my anniversaryone year since I became manager of the Mets, It feels as though I've had this job a lot longer. Not that time passes slowly because your're hanging by your thumbs, nothing like that. It's just been a full year.

title: U.S. Expedites Travelers' Arrivals
description: WASHINGTON, Mal, 27It is several hours before your flight leaves Zurich for New York and you, an American traveler, discover that your wallet and passport are missing. You want to leave as scheduled anyway.

title: Article 4 -- No Title
HOME CLINIC
description: POWER MOWERS, edging machines, garden tractors and other powerdriven yard and garden tools can save a lot of work for the homeowner, but they also can lead to lots of frustration and fail to perform as expected if they are not serviced periodically and otherwise not maintained properly.

title: Oh Clouts 16th Homer
description: TOKYO. May 27 (AP)Sadaharu Oh slugged his 16th homer of the season today as the Yomiuri Giants trounced the Hanshin Tigers, 147, on 21 hits before, a crowd of 58,000 in Osaka. Oh is two homers behind Adrian Garrett of the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

title: Barbara Creasy Fiancee Of Robert J. Sheldon Jr.
description: Barbara Lee Creasy, who graduated last Sunday from St. Lawrence University, plans to be married July 15 in the university's Gunnison Memorial Chapel to Robert John Sheldon Jr., a member of the physical education staff at the Northfield  Mount Hermon School and a graduate of St. Lawrence, class of '77. member of the physical education staff at the Northfield  Mount Hermon School and a graduate of St. Lawrence, class of '77.

title: TaxAbatement Plan Extended by Council Despite Controversy
description: The New York City Council has voted to extend for up to three years a program that grants major tax benefits to landlords who upgrade existing apartment buildings and to owners and developers who convert industrial and commercial buildings to apartments.

title: By Dawn's Early Light, More Progress Sighted
description: There was scarcely enough glue to go around last week as first one piece of New York City's fiscal survival plan came unstuck, and then another.

title: Shero Among Four Eyed by Werblin
description: Shero Among Four Eyed by WerblinSo the Rangers are looking for a coachagain.

title: GARDENING
description: THE No. 1 problem for some doityourself gardeners in North Jersey is what to do about the rocks that work up endlessly out of the soil. What you choose to do about them depends, to some extent, on the kind of person you are.

title: IN BRIEF
description: A benchmark was reached last week on the long path to enacting some form of an energy bill. Senate and House conferees accepted a plan to lift Federal price controls on natural gas in 1985. There are still several side issues to delay the pricing plan and plenty of opponents to rip into the proposal when it is taken up by both houses  those who believe that unregulated prices will stagger the consumer and those who feel thin controls should he ended more quickly to allow the industry to raise prices and thus spur gas exploration.

title: What's Doing in BOGOTA
description: CONTRASTS  Bogot is a big booming capital city, total population just ver four million, built on a rolling plateau more than 8,000 feet high in the Arides in central Colombia. Indians clad in wool ponchos and black brimmed hats crowd the plazas, jackhammers set up a ceafening din as construction crews siart yet another highrise building, gamy outdoor markets stand not far from sophisticated French restaurants featuring European wines and salmon from Scotland. Altogether Bogota is a land of contrasts, a city of now and then, which does give it a marvelous flavor for the visitor. Over the sprawling urban mass hovers the spirit of the liberator, Sunn Bolivar, his name and his deeds forever cast in legend and statuary.

title: Deaths
description: KIRSCHSTEINMorris, beloved husband of Eva, devoted father of David B. and the late Barbara Anne. Loving father in law of Diane, dear brother of Barney and Benedicta. cherished grandfather of Bette, Laura and Bonnie. Services today, May 28, 12:45pm, The Riverside, 76th St and Amsterdam Ave.

title: INTERVIEW
description: EAST WINDSOR HILL DAVID M. SEYMOUR said he didn't mind at all stopping for a chat along the roadside here the other day and getting the 12pound pack off his back for a few minutes. And who could blame him.

title: Connecticut/ThisWeek
description: BRIDGEPORTWorks by Willem deKooning, Saturday through June 10, Museum of Art, Science and Industry, cooperative exhibit with Fairfield Arts Festival. Admission $1.50, students 75 cents. 3723521.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 12:30 P.M. (2) Public Hearing': Deputy Mayor David Brown; Andrew Stein, Manhattan Borough President.

title: State Ownership, European Style 3 Case Histories
description: When the public's attitude toward American business is its lowest, or when consumer anger over high profits or charges of corporate skullduggery reaches fever pitch, the cry is apt to be heard: Nationalize! The idea gets short shrift here, but across the Atlantic, it has been embraced with some enthusiasm.

title: Freeport Has Fresh FishBuying Idea: Right Off the Boat and at the Right Price
description: FREEPORT, L.IYou cart buy fish in every town on Long Island, but the most colorful market of all is in Freeport, where dockside places line Woodcleft Canal, the nautical mile. This is a busy commercial fish and boat area seasoned with authentic salt. You can combine serious shopping with an interesting outing.

title: An Old Cemetery Is a Modern Classroom
description: Northport UP a road near the Long Island Lighting Company generating plain, in a clearing that is so hidden by trees and bushes that one would walk right past it unless he were aware of it, there is a site that a teacher has turned into an outdoor classroom where he can teach his fifth graders history, arithmetic, archeology, botany and art.

title: Sailors Urged to Use Safety Devices
description: The captain of the tugboat Bronx Queen radioed an urgent Message to the United St:tes Coast Guard's Group Long Island Sound in New Haven: Man overheard. Two miles east of Buoy 4 off Lloyd's Neck, L.I.

title: GARDENING
description: MAY is a marvelous month. Everything bursts into bloom and the memories of that long and arduous winter have faded. Almost.

title: City Ballet Joins Ivesiana, Calcium Light Night
description: There was peculiar logic at work at Friday night's performance of the New York City Ballet at the New York State Theater. The company appeared to be operating under the assumption that if two good ballets to music by the same composer were combined, the result would be one even better ballet.

title: Peter Culver Marries Mary Alsop
description: Mary Oliver Alsop, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Alsop of Avon, Conn., was married yesterday in Farmington, Conn., to Peter Farnum Culver, son of Mrs. Charles F. Culver of Simsbury, Conn., and the late Mr. Culver. The Rev. Robert B. Wardrop and the Rev. Borden W. Painter performed the ceremony in St. James' Episcopal Church.

title: The Nation
description: President Carter had seen the past and it worked, so last week he continued his headlong rush into 1976.

title: Equal Rights Amendment Is Mired In Confused and Emotional Debate
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, May 26A strident, sometimes gamy, grassroots campaign waged by a proliferation of rightist organizations has placed the sixyearold equal rights amendment for women in serious jeopardy, according to both proponents and opponents of the measure.

title: In the Old Days Getting to Belmont Was Half the Fun
description: On Decoration Day in 1948, 62,000 plungers crowded through the gates at Belmont Park. That is a remarkable statistic if you consider the track had a seating capacity of 20,000.

title: Murphy Moves Into Atlanta Golf Lead
description: ATLANTA, May 27 (AP)Bob Murphy birdied three holes in a row on the way to a fiveunderpar 67 that gave him a oneshot lead today after the third round of the $200,000 Atlanta golf classic.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Theater

title: CONNECTICUT JOURNAL
description: LAST Oct. 1 the centerpieces of Governor Grasso's plan to reorganize state government were put into place with the formation of the Office of Policy and Management (which is to Hartford what the Office of Management and Budget is to Washington) and the Department of Administrative Services, which pulled together personnel, purchasing, data processing and other housekeeping functions that had been scattered throughout the state government.

title: BRIDGE
description: Amajor headache for organizers of contractbridge tournaments is the sound problem: Experts complain bitterly if their cerebrations are interrupted by the chatter of other players, by a noisy roof or by an adjoining basketball game.

title: Food
description: It has always been one of the mysteries of life that the general public seems to consider the preparation of rice a routine affair. Actually, producing a perfect dish of rice Westernstyle does require a precise attention to detail. (The technique for mak ing Japanese sushi rice, or chello, the Persian version, is considerably more involved). The proportion of rice to liquid and the cooking time must be exact. But these two requirements are easy to learn because they are constant, no matter what the other ingredients.

title: Johns Hopkins Takes Lacrosse Title, 138
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., May 27Johns Hopkins ended Cornell University's twoandahalfyear dominance of college lacrosse today by heating Cornell, 138, in the National Collegiate Athletic Association final before a record crowd of more than 17,500 fans in Rutgers Stadium.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: NAMES of places probably go back to the days when man first learned to speak, but it is a subject that has never really been perfected  least of all on the Islaud, where names often overlap the same pieces of geography and envelop unwary bystanders in confusion.

title: Randy Heller Zasloff Wed
description: Randy Heller Zasloff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Howard Bernard Zasloff of Rockaway, N.J., was married last night to Frederick Lloyd Cohen, son of Lillian Goft of Worcester, Mass., and the late Sidney Jacob Cohen. Rabbi Joseph Gelberman performed the ceremony at the TavernontheGreen in Manhattan.

title: Unmarriage
description: He called me on a Wednesday afternoon and I listened. The weekend was, after all, imminent. Especially that night during which John Travolta runs a fever, married people go out for the Sunday paper and bagels or BaskinRobbins, and unmarried people have intimations of mortality (or worse).

title: Thinking On Thought
description: THE LITE OF TIME MIND By Hannah Arendt. Vol. 1: Thinking. 258 pp. $12.50. Vol. 11: Willing. 277 pp. $12.50. New York: Harcourt Brace Jovanovich.

title: Westchester/This Week
description: BALDWIN PLACE  You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown. Today only, 2 P.M. Anything Goes by Cole Porter. Thursday to Saturday S P.M. (through June 18). $5.50, except Saturday $6.50. Reservations. Mahopac Farm Playhouse, Rte. 6.6281169.

title: State Judge Named to Investigate Charges of Stamford Corruption
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 25A state j?? ge was appoi..ed today to serve as a special oneman grand jury to investigate allegations of widespread corruption in the municipal government here.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: With the American economy about to enter the 39th month of its current advance  and thus virtually assured of matching, a month hence, the longest previous peacetime expansion since World War II  analysts are beginning to look for signs that the upturn is showing its age and heading for a demise. There some evidence that such a point is approaching, though not nearly enough to warrant the writing of this boom's obituarynot just yet, anyway.

title: H. Dickson McKenna Weds Susan Thomas
description: Susan P. Thomas and H. Dickson McKenna were married yesterday in the First Congregational Church in Washington, Conn., by the Rev. Lee A. Neuhaus

title: D. H. Blanchard Weds Catherine Crichton
description: The First Presbyterian Church of New Canaan, Conn., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Catherine Crichton, daughter of Mrs. John H. Crichton of New Canaan and the late Mr. Crichton, to Donald Hutt Blanchard, son of Mrs. William H. Blanchard of Fort Worth and the late Gen. William H. Blanchard, who was vice chief of staff of the Air Force.

title: Ombudsmen For the Elderly
description: IN Vancouver, B.C., a woman in her 80's received a telephone call from a local radio announcer. How are you feeling today, Mrs. Brown? the young man asked cheerfully.

title: Randy Herman Betrothed
description: Dr. and Mrs. Melvin J. Herman of Great Neck, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Randy Sue Herman, to Dr. Joel Howard Schenkman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Schenkman of Miami, Miss Herman, whose father is a physician in Bayside, Queens, is a thirdyear student at the University of Miami Medical School, from which her fianc graduated. He is serving a surgical residency at the Jackson Memorial Hospital in Miami. His father is president of the J and M Engineering Company in Miami.

title: Cynthia Coulter Married
description: Cynthia Marze Coulter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William B. Coulter of Fairfield, Conn., was married there yesterday afternoon to Daniel G. George 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel G. George of Brooklyn. The Rev. Robert L. Bast performed the ceremony in St. Timothy's Episcopal Church. The bride is an alumna of Cornell University and the Loyola University Schcol of Law. Her husband graduated from Holy Cross College and the Tulane University School of Law.

title: Fuchs Plays Violin Sonatas By Beethoven
description: The third and final concert in the cycle of Beethoven violin sonatas being offered at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. by Joseph Fuchs and Artur Balsam had its distinct virtues Thurs

title: Nobody Climbs Mountains Any More
description: WE came to college as alert and vigorous teenagers in the era of the flapper, the Charleston, saddle shoes and plusfours, ModelT's and silent movies. Our expectations were modest and in large part domestic, for ours was a settled world. But we did not limit ourselves, as legend thinks we did, to becoming instant wives, homemakers, mothers. The fact is that 77 percent of us have earned our living at one time or another as artists, as acountants, dieticians, editors or by running businesses of our own. We have been executive secretaries; guidance counselors; inkeepers; lab technicians; librarians; office managers; social workers; statisticians; therapists; teachers of art, drama, English, French, Latin, kindergarten, math, music and physical education. One of us breeds collies and is an AKC [American Kennel Club] judge. Another is a binder of rare books. We include in our number a retired cartographergeographer; a ceramist; an illustrator of children's books; a literary executor; a textile designer; a toy manufacturer; and a former graduate secretary of our own alumni association.

title: SELECTION
description: Below are a recollection and four puzzles from the beginning of Raymond Smultyan's What Is the Name of This Book? The author points out that these initial puzzles are mainly old chestnuts but as he presents them have some new wrinkles. Solutions to the puzzles appear at the end.

title: Letter T0 THE EDIT0R
description: Henry Kissinger, no doubt, left his mark on our history (What Will Henry Do For an Encore? by Marvin Kalb, April 16). But are episodes like the Vietnam War, the destabilization of Chile and the invasion of Cambodia so trivial that they deserve to be a mere moral stain on his record? Or are they not the substance of the record itself? Mr. Kalb worries that the Kissinger memoirs are getting to be too long. That's not surprising to me. Dr. Kissinger has a lot of explaining to do.

title: HIGHLIGHTS
description: The Government escalated its attack on inflation last week, winning headlines and pledges from industry to do its bit. But even those leading the attack do not expect any quick success.

title: Ma Bell's Great Dream Machine
description: MURRAY HILL, N.J.  It has been called by some the greatest of industrial laboratories. Others speak of it as a corporate Edison. At the Inwood Diner on Route 22, a blustery man hunkered over eggs at the counter. When asked about the nearby lab, he said: That? That's where they make dreams come true.

title: Steven Hirsch Fiance Of Elizabeth J. Taylor
description: Mr. and Mrs, Joseph W. Taylor of Wilmington, Del., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Jean Taylor, to Steven Eliot Hirsch, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Hirsch of Hewlett Harbor, L.I., and Boca Raton, Fla. The wedding is planned for September.

title: School Bands March To a Different Beat
description: KILLINGLY IT was the invasion of the marching bands and Killingly had turned out to greet them. Brass glistening in the sunlight, batons twirling, flags slapping back and forth in the hot, dry wind, eyes riveted dead ahead, they suddenly appeared  thumping their way past the old black cannon on the green and on through the center of town.

title: The Region
description: Assemblyman Perry B. Duryea lost rival and gained a prospective running mate last week on the way toward winning the New York Republican gubernatorial nomination.

title: Knights And Knaves
description: RAYMOND M. SMULLYAN is a gifted magician. Even when crowded about by friends and watched from every angle, he has invariably baffled us all. He is also an accomplished logician. A sudden deft turn and surprising conclusion in his logical writings sometimes remind one of his legerdemain.

title: Bowman May Look to Leave Canadiens
description: Though their third straight Stanley Cup was celebrated in the normally boisterous, champagnesquirting manner by the Montreal Canadiens last Thursday night in Boston Garden, one sober fact stood out: Scotty Bowman, the victors coach, had not stayed around to join in the festivities.

title: Disks: Worthy ReIssues From the Recent Past
description: Through good times and bad over the past 20 years, ever since the introduction of stereophonic sound in 1958, the major classical record companies have released many thousands of recorded pertorm ancesmore versions of standard repertory pieces, in fact, than the world market can absorb. As a result, many records, often ones of estimable musical value, fall by the wayside and become unavailable as newer performances of the same works arrive to take their places. Such is the hard dollarsandsense reality of the record business, in which a Beethoven symphony and the most ephemeral pop music are bracketed together in the corporate mind as the product.

title: Fresh Air Fund: Tale of 2 Cultures
description: MIKE AND LOIS ARACE live in a sixroom yellow farmhouse in the middle of 20 acres in Jutland, a Hunterdon County community 16 miles east of Easton, Pa. Mr. Arace is an insurante salesman and Mrs. Arace 15 an elder in the local Presbyterian Church, in which they are both active.

title: Who Wants All Those Rooms!
description: She sounded almost wistful. Nobody has touched the toys in the play corner in months.

title: The World
description: Since Christopher Columbus landed in Santo Domingo in 1492 (his bones are buried there), the island's affairs usually have been decided by force coups, revolutions and foreign occupations.

title: New York's Churches Make Their Worldly Influence Felt
description: ALBANY, May 26  Every week, a dozen or so men and women gather in the upstairs room of a wood frame house about a mile from the Capitol to talk politics.

title: Rights Unit Studies Charges by Indians Of Beatings in Jail
description: LOS ANGELES, May 27The trial of two American Indian leaders for murder and robbery has ended in their acquittal and release, but the 1974 case, which drew international attention, continues to stir controversy.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: Today through SaturdayDevon, Devon Show Grounds, Route 30. Devon, Pa. Regular, green and amateurowner working hunters; open, intermediate and amateurowner jumpers; regular and green conformation hunters, Hackneys, threegaited. fivegaited, fineharness, pleasure, Welsh, roadsters, coaching. Morning, afternoon and evening classes daily except today, afternoon and evening classes only.

title: LONG ISLAND REAL ESTATE
description: WHAT happens if a homeowner can't pay his property taxes? Under the procedures prescribed by the New York State Real Property Law, if taxes remain unpaid, property is eventually forfeited to the local taxing authority.

title: Atlantic City's Fringe Benefits
description: ATLANTIC CITY EVERYONE is sure that the 1978 summer season on Absec'n Island, riding as it will on the tide of casino gambling here, will he one of the best ever. But how about all the other resorts along the coast from Cape May north to Ocean and Monmouth Counties?

title: Attempts to Reshape the Federal Grand Jury System Are Stalled in Congressional Subcommittees
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Congressional efforts to reshape Federal grand juries, which appeared promising last summer, are stalled in House and Senate subcommittees and appear dead for this year.

title: Police Moonlighting Stirs a Tax Dispute
description: POLICEMEN in the busy suburbs of Fairfield County can earn almost twice their salaries by moonlighting, and many municipalities have encouraged because the policemen's presence as security guards helps keep the peace.

title: Deaths
description: TOBIN]William F.; on May 26, 1978, Knight of the Holy Sepulchre, beloved husband of Edith, devoted father of William J. and Maureen McNulty, loving brother of Eleanor McNally and dear stepfather of William Magee, also survived by 11 grandchildren. Funeral Tuesday. from the Albert R. Connor Funeral Home, 4955 Broadway. Mass of the Resurrection Our Lady Queen of Martyrs R.C. Church, 10AM. Interment Gate of Heaven Cemetery. Visiting hours 2 to 5 and 7 to 10PM, Contributions may be made to Catholic Charities, Archdiocese of New

title: The Two Senates of the United States
description: WHEELING AND DEALING Confessions of a Capitol Hill Operator. By Bobby Baker with Larry L. King. Illustrated. 296 pp. New York: W. W. Norton & Co. $10.95. THE SENATE NOBODY KNOWS By Bernard Asbell. 466 pp. New York: Doubleday & Co. $10.

title: AGENCY PLANS CURBS ON ESKIMOS' HUNTING
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, May 27 (AP)The United States Fish and Wildlife Service, conceding that it is stirring up a hornet's nest, has announced plans to deny special waterfowlhunting privileges to Eskimos and Indians who have become part of the cash economy.

title: World Cup Tournament Is More Than a Game for Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 27Argentina, a country troubled by political terrorism and economic distress, is throwing itself open to world attention with the statrt here next week of the 11th World Cup soccer championship.

title: SPORTS
description: TRENTON THE E college coaches and recruiters arrive at all hours, bearing their wide smiles and even loftier stories. They sell their school, their program and themselves.

title: SCHMIDT IS CRITICAL OF FAILURE TO LIFT ARMS BAN ON TURKEY
description: WASHINGTON, May 28Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany criticized the United States Congress today for refusing to lift the embargo on American military assistance for Turkey.

title: Question Box
description: Breaking ball is a general term for many types of pitches that are not straight, as a fastball or a change of pace usually is, A curve is a particular type of breaking ball, the most common type. It breaks down and away from a righthanded batter when thrown by a righthanded pitcher, and down and away from a lefthander when thrown by a lefthander.

title: Chess:
description: Even before the world championship match between Anatoly Karpov, the titleholder, and Viktor Korchnoi, the challenger, begins July 16 in Baguio City, the Philippines, at least one of the tournaments heralding the start of a new cycle will have finished.

title: Foul Gas Preceding China Quake Called Sign of Methane Reserves
description: A report from China that large volumes of evilsmelling gas escaped from the earth before a major earthquake in 1975 has been taken by Dr. Thomas Gold of Cornell University as support for his thesis that the earth contains enough gas to provide energy for the indefinite future.

title: Joanne Susan Stern Is Bride Of Thomas B. Fleeter on L.I.
description: Joanne Susan Stern, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul R. Stern of Westbury, L.I., was married yesterday in Temple Israel in Great Neck, L.I., to Thomas B. Fleeter, scn of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald M. Fleeter of University Heights, Ohio. Rabbi Maurice Aranov performed the ceremony.

title: Rhodesian Sees Gain In Invasion of Zaire
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 28 (Reutere)Rhodesia's white joint Foreign Minister, P. K. van der Byl, said in an interview published today that the invasion of Zaire could be a blessing in disguise for those warning against Soviet penetration in Africa.

title: Poland Raises All Liquor Prices To Curb High Consumption Rate
