description: WARSAW, May 28 (Reuters)Poland increased the prices of all alcoholic beverages today by an average 25 percent, in an attempt to curb the effects of rapidly rising consumption on the economy, family life and civil order.

title: Sadat and Liberalization
description: CAIRO, May 28A popular political joke going around Cairo tells of an Egyptian who flies to the United States to have a tooth pulled. Don't you have dentists in Cairo? the puzzled American dentist asks. Yes, and much cheaper, too, replies the Egyptian. But on one dares open his mouth at home these days.

title: Sports World Special
description: The International Tennis Federation, in a rather weighty proclamation, has defined a tennis racquet. The. federation says the frame may be of any material, weight, size or sir.pe, It says that the strings may he of any material but that the distance between the main and/or cross strings shall not he less than on???r of an inch nor more than onehalf of an inch.

title: Chinese Fleeing Vietnam Report Harassment and Forced Moves
description: HONG KONG, May 28Accounts by Chinese refugees fleeing their homes in Vietnam tend to substantiate charges by Peking that Hanoi has harassed them, ccnfiscated their property and forced many of them to volunteer to move to harsh, uninhabited areas in the countryside.

title: Yanks Top Blue Jays Twice
description: Ron Guidry, the ycung lefthander of the New York Yankees, won his seventh game of the season yesterday in Yankee Stadium, beating the Toronto Blue Jays, 53, on a sixhit performance. Then Rich Gossage, who is supposed to be a short reliever, worked seven innings and posted his third triumph as the Yankees won the second game, 6.5, in 13 innings.

title: SCHMIDT IS CRITICAL OF FAILURE TO LIFT ARMS BAN ON TURKEY
description: WASHINGTON, May 28Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany criticized the United States Congress today for refusing to lift the embargo on American military assistance for Turkey.

description: NASHVILLE AT a Nashville Sounds game, this is the kind of thing that happens: A visiting pitcher spots an usherettethat is, a Soundettein the stands. He sends her two autographed balls, with I think I love you written on one of them and Please meet me in Room Number [suchandsuch] in the [suchandsuch] Hotel on the other.

title: Deaths
description: LIPSCHITZRabbi Meyer, beloved husband of the late Ruche!, devoted tattler of Hyman, Jack, Louis, Lena, Judah, Ida, Minnie, Sanl. Revered fatherinlaw. Cherished grandfather and greatgrandfather. Funeral held Sunday, May 28. Shiva at 1423 57 St., Brooklyn.

title: Jacob A. Goldfarb Is Dead at 83; Philanthropist and ExExecutive
description: Jacob A. Goldfarb, retired chairman of the Union Underwear Company and Fruit of the Loom Inc., died yesterday at Doctors Hospital. Mr. Goldfarb, who lived at 895 Park Avenue, was 83 years old.

title: Events Today
description: ARETHA FRANKLIN, Pop singer, Carnegie Hall, 7:30 aiul 10:30.

title: News Summary
description: Washington is asking its allies in Western Europe to join the United States in what Administration officials describe as one of the most. ambitious joint defense programs since the establishment the North Atlantic Treaty Organizaton in 1919. [ Page A I, Columns 156.]

title: Rescind Helsinki
description: WASHINGTON  Okay, so our Africa policy has turned out to be a disaster, says a Carter supporter heatedly. And okay, we look a little desperate blaming Congress now for constraints that we supported all along. But what do you want us to do to discourage the Russians in Africasend in U.S. troops? Break off the SALT talks? Blockade Cuba?.

title: Mission Boat Brings Spiritual and Material Help to Islands Off Maine
description: NORTHEAST HARBOR, Me.Sunbeam, a chunky 65 foot dieselpowered vessel with a large white cross painted on either side of her black steel hull, nosed out of this mountainous anchorage the other Simday and headed for Maine's offshore islands.

title: Books of The Times A Life of TooMuchness
description: In the first volume of Lord Clarks autobiography, Another Part of the Wood, we learned how, despite singular lack of qualification for anything he ever undertook in his life, the author nevertheless became the highly successful Director of the National Gallery and Keeper of the King's Pictures, and with his wife, Jane, surceeded at befriending most of England. In The Other Half: A SelfPortrait. the incompetent bumbles on. He begins with the events that led to his receiving false credit for being the man who saved the nation's pictures during World War II by depositing them in the Manod caves in North Wales. This claim is entirely unjustified. The man was F. I. G. Rawlins. He received inadequate thanks from me, and, as far as I know, no official recognition, not even an O.B.E. That was partly due to his diffidence, and partly because he was the most relentless bore I have ever known, and the kind of people who distribute honours fled from his approach.

title: Two Deaths and an Escape Raise Green Haven Tensions
description: STORMVILLE, N.Y.Very early on cold Wednesday morning two weeks ago, William Peterson was trapped in a tiny cell as a fire suddenly spread through a special ward at the Green Haven Correctional Facility here. He died a few hours later.

title: How to Control Social Security
description: The chance for a rollback of Social Security tax increases next January is probably gone, and with it goes an opportunity to use tax policy in the fight against inflation. The House Ways and Means Committee. under pressure from the President and the Congressional leadership, recently voted to bury a measure that would have substituted general Federal tax revenues for payroll tax increases to bolster the Social Security system.

title: Television
description: 6:00(4)Aerospace Down to Earth

title: That Nearly Fatal Call
description: LANDOVER,Md., May 28Thevictory  that  might  have  been hinged on Earl Strom's whistle with 3 seconds left in today's SonicsBullets baskthall playoff game. At that moment, after Tom Henderson's layup had cut the Sonics lead to 9392, Paul Silas sought to inbound the hall to Fred Brown. Brown planned to stay in the backcourt killing the last three seconds. But Strom, al veteran National Basketball Association official, ruled that Silas, in his haste to pass the ball to Brown, had illegally straddled the line.

title: Carter's Pastor Says U.S. Lost the Torch
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (UPI)President Carter's pastor today said that America had lost the torch of inspiration it had carried to the world, and he called on the nation to stop concentrating on its flaws.

title: A DECISION IS NEAR ON ES. HIGHWAY AID
description: WASHINGTON, May 28A bruising battle is nearing the decision stage in congress over how much Federal money should be put into highway projects, especially for such work as rehabilitation of bridges and older roads, which has been given high priority in New Jersey.

title: Democrats and Republicans Show True Colors in Choosing Tickets
description: The process of selecting candidates for the Democratic and Republican state tickets is already under way and it provides a classic example of the differences between the two parties on the question of primary contests, party discipline and unity, and providing opportunities for candidates to take their case to the party rank and file. Next month's scheduled Republican State Cornmittee meeting to designate candidates, for example, is shaping up as a mere ratification of the ticket that will he chosen by Perry B. Duryea, the allbutnominated Republican gubernatorial candidate. and a handful of party leaders. Their choices are not likely to be challenged either at the state committee or in the September 12 primary.

title: Heard Wins by Two Strokes
description: ATLANTA, May 28 (AP)  Jerry Heard, playing with the ease a.nil authority that once made him one of the most promising young players in the game, finished off a fiveunderpar 67 with a birdie on the final holy ioday and won the Atlanta Golf Classic.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Teenagers with drinking or drug problems have a low opinion of themselves and see their parents as unloving and hostile, says Dr. Robert Pandina, a Rutgers University researcher at the New Brunswick campus.

title: PLANNERS OPTIMISTIC ABOUT WATER SUPPLY
description: HACKENSACK, May 28  Differing with Federal projections, the Tristate Regional Planning Commission. has predicted that North Jersey should have enough water sources to supply its needs for the next 50 years without having to draw from the Hudson River.

title: Puerto Rican Deprivation: A Call for Federal Action
description: A recent memorandum from Arthur S. Flemming, chairman of the United States Commission on Civil Rights, to Stuart E. Eizenstat, President Carter's chief adviser for domestic policy, is a reminder of the extent of deprivation in the Puerto Rican community. The existence of the note may spur more effective Federal action on behalf of that. groun if the attitudes and conditions described by a number of Puerto Rican spokesmen, Administration officials and civil rights analysts actually exist.

description: Partlel list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Memo Says F.B.I. And a Black Talked Of Ousting Dr. King
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (UPI)An unidentified black leader apparently worked with the Federal Bureau of Investigation in the 1960's in an effort to remove the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. from national prominence in the civil rights movement, according to F.B.I. files.

description: With smaller families, more working women and rising levels of discretionary income, increasing numbers of Americans are choosing to eat out more often. But millions of people also eat out by necessityschoolchildren, prison inmates, office workers, hospital patients and the like.

title: Model California College System TroubledbyDroppingEnrollment
description: LOS ANGELES, May 28California's system of public higher education, which has set a national standard for quality and accessibility, faces a troubled and uncertain political and economic future because or declining enrollments and changing attitudes toward college decrees.

title: Pocono Plane Crash Kills Woman
description: TANNERSVILLE, Pa., May 28 (AP)A woman died and a man was severely burned yesterday when a singleengine plane crashed in fog in Big Pocono State Park near here, the state police said. Roberl Radcliffe, 50 years old, of Wayne, N.J., was in critipal condition at Sacred Heart Hospital in Allentown, according to the hospital. The police said Laurie Kooistra, 22, also of Wayne, was burned in the wreckage.

title: Nome to Vote on Liquor Sales Ban
description: NOME. Alaska, May 2S (AP) churchbacked group, working on the premise that alcohol is the root of health problems and crime in this harddrinking Gold Rush town has hid a nropocition nut on the ballot to ban the sale of liquor.

description: George H. Tryon, an authority on fire atety, died Thursday at the New England Deaconess Hospital in Boston. He was 62 years old and lived in Wahan. Mass.

title: Mill Owner Who Spends Like King
description: For the first time in years, Mr. Warner's big white house has an unlisted number to ward off calls from hardhanded millworkers who are, in some cases, the sons and grandsons of men who worked for Mr. Warner's grandfather. Mr. Warner was infuriated, friends say. when the University of Alabama's business school, where he serves on the board of visitors, announced it would study his closing of he mill in a course on corporate planning and social responsibility. the green tree family, after the tiny emblem printed on the millions of grocery bags produced here. But with unemployment in Tuscaloosa County up almost two full points, to 8.7 percent, since the closing of the mill, family feeling for Mr. Warner has given way to a sense of betrayal.

title: Opera: Barber's Vanessa at Spoleto
description: CHARLESTON, May 28  When Samuel Barber's Vanessa had its world premiere at the Metropolitan Opera in 1958, it was received with considerable praise.

description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 28Al Unser, a great driver in search of the right car for the better part of this decade, found it today and became the fifth man to Win the Indianapolis 500 a third time.

title: Influence and Power Of Minority Caucus Doubted in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 27In 1966, in a decade of political activism and liberal solidarity, a group of black and Puerto Rican legislators created the hope of greater minority power in state government by uniting under the banner of the New York State Black and Puerto Rican Legislative Caucus.

title: U.S. Judge Sentences 14 For Magic Marker Fraud
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 28 (AP).A Federal judge has parceled out fines and terms of probation to 14 men who participated in a major swindle involving Magic Marker stock. In addition, a man described as a ringleader in the swindle, Jack Silbiger, was sentenced to a year in jail.

title: The New York TImes/Paul Hosef ros
description: MOURNING FALLEN COMRADES: A fireman buried his face in his whitegloved hands yesterday during a memorial service for Joseph Dunn and Robert Hassett, who were killed in a fire last week in Bethpage, L. I., Page.

description: New postal rates that took effect at 12:01 A.M. today were reported incorrectly in The Times yesterday. The correct rates are 15 cents for the first ounce and 13 cents for each additional ounce.

description: Regina Ortenzi, creative assistant to Gloria Vanderbilt, and manager of the GV Design Studio in New York, and Robert G. Button, manager of public relations of GAF Corporation in New York, were married yesterday at the home of her parents, Col. Anthony H. Ortenzi, U.S.A. retired, and Mrs. Ortenzi, in Maitland, Fla. The ceremony was performed by Julian Friedman, a Maltland notary public. The bridegroom is son of Mrs. Ruth Button of San Mateo, Calif. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.

description: AN ARTFUL EXCURSION: Visitors to the traditional spring art show around Washington Square in Greenwich Village found the sidewalk exhibits as lovely as the weather.

description: Jim Rice's 18th homer of the season and Dwight Evans's ninth helped the Red Sox score a 43. 43 sweep over the Detroit Tigers in Boston's Fenway Park yesterday.

title: Cosmos Triumph Over Lancers, 51
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., May 28The Cosmos were in the right frame of mind today in posting their 17th consecutive homefield victory, a 51 trouncing of the Rochester Lancers.

title: Vance, at Fordham Law Graduation, Calls for Innovative Justice1
description: Calling for a justice system rather than a judicial system, Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance urged lawyers yesterday to seek more innovative approaches to making justice available for all.

title: Wendy Robbins, Lawyer, Is Married to Gary Fox
description: Wendy Robbins and Gary Fox, New York lawyers, were married yesterday at the Plaza by Rabbi Nathan Rosen. The bride, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Robbins of New York, is an associate with the firm of Stroock & Stroock & Lavan. Her husband, who is with White & Case, is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Fox of Pawtucket. R. I.

title: MOST FRENCH TROOPS PULL OUT OF KOLWEZI
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, May 25Most of the French Foreign Legionnaires who were sent to recapture the copper mining center of Kolwezi from rebels have withdrawn, leaving behind a force of 150 to complement 1,000 Zairian soldiers now responsible for the defense of the area.

title: Sugar States Ask Revival Of Quotas
description: WASHINGTON, May 26Another battle in the politically bloody war over sugar prices was shaping up this week in Congressional committee hearings.

title: What Rights Amendment Could and Couldn't Do
description: Frances Wasiolek didn't pay much attention to the women's movement. She had three small children and she stayed at home caring for them. Her husband worked for the city of Philadelphia, and his paycheck supported them.

title: 109 POLLED CONGRESSMEN UPBRAID U.S. ON VETERANS
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (AP)Half of the members of Congress who responded to a survey feel that the Government is failing to fulfill its obligations to veterans of the Vietnam War, especially the disabled.

title: Himalayas Lure Tourists To a Forbidding Kingdom
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, May 26Twentyfive years ago, when a bold young New Zealand beekeeper named Edmund Hillary called the world's attention to this ancient kingdom by climbing Mount Everest, Nepal was remote and forbidding and almost completely closed to foreigners.

title: Maureen Mahon Is Married to David Egen, Designer
description: The marriage of Maureen Mahon, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James J. Mahon cf Short Hills, N. J., to David Egen, on of Mrs. Frederick W. Egen of New York and the late Mr. Egen took place yesterday in St. Rose of Lima Roman Catholic Church in Short Hills. Msgr. Harrold Murray performed the ceremony.

title: The Area's Best Streams
description: The top Long Island streams for alewives or bluebacks are in Suffolk County: Alewife Creek in North Sea, the Peconic River in Riverhead and Wading River in the community of the same name. Other SuItolk County spawning streams are the Nissequogue in Smithtown; Mill Creek in Flanders; Quantuck Creek in Quogue; the Carmans River in Brookhaven: the Swan River and Tuthill Creek in Patchogue; the Connequot River and a tributary, Rattlesnake Creek, in Oakdale; Oarlock Creek in Islip, and the Carlls River in Babylon.

title: Portuguese Employers Protest
description: OPORTO, Portugal, May 28 (Reuters)A meeting here of some 10,000 employers organized by the Confederation of Portuguese Industry has called for an end to discrimination aga1nst private enterprises in favor of nationalized industry.

title: A Couple of Guys in the Foxhole of Middle Age
description: SANTA FE, N.M.  Every 10 years or so, traveling about the country, run into Willie and/or Joe, the exdog faces with whom f soldiered for while during World war II in Eunipe.

title: The Problems FacingNATO
description: The centerpiece of the North Atlantic alliance's summit meeting in Washington this week is a complex longterm defense program, but it is likely that the leaders will spend more of their time on immediate and urgent problems facing the alliance.

title: 2 in Invasion of Zaire Report Seeing Cubans
description: Two members of the Katangan force that invaded Zaire's Shaba Province contend that two Cuban advisers accompanied the troops, Newsweek magazine reports.

title: ABCTV Sweeping Ratings Bonanza
description: LOS ANGELES, May 26James E. Duffy, president of ABCTV, opened session of the fourday affiliates meeting here with a bulletin.

title: Tennis: Borg Victor in Italy
description: ROME, May 28 (AP)Bjorn Borg, unshaken by the presence of a bee and a barrage of coins hurled from a rowdy partisan crowd, overpowered the unseeded local favorite, Adriano Panatta, 16, 63, 61, 46, 63, in the final of the $210,000 Italian open tennis championships today.

title: G. E. Dividend Up 10c
description: The General Electric Company announced that its directors had voted to increase the quarterly common dividend to 65 cents a share from the previously paid 55 cents, payable July 25 to holders of record on June 7.

title: Miss Engel Is Wed To Gary Gallagher
description: In the Mariners Chapel at the United States Merchant Marine Academy in Kings Point, L. I., yesterday afternoon, Elizabeth Jane Engel, daughter of Rear Adm. Arthur B. Engel, U.S.C.G., retired, and superintendent of the academy, and Mrs. Engel, became the bride of Gary L. Gallagher. He is the son of Mrs. Kenneth Fisher of Bement, and the late Virgil L. Gallagher.

title: Business People
description: Joe E. Lewis, the comedian, used to say that he only went to the race track to visit his money. It's been said that some foreign banks have the same thing in mind in coming to these shores.

title: BROOKE'S PROSPECTS IN ELECTION ASSAYED
description: BOSTON, May 28Senator Edward W. Brooke's prospects as a candidate for reelection this fall were being measured and weighed from Cape Cod to the Berkshires this long Memorial Day weekend, following his admission on Friday that he had made false statements under oath about a $49,000 loan.

title: Sarah J. Sager Is Married to Rabbi Stuart A. Gertman
description: In the Westchester Reform Temple in Scarsdale, N.Y., yesterday, Sarah J. Sager, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Sager of Chicago, was married to Rabbi Stuart A. Gertman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ivan Gertman of Trenton. The ceremony was performed by Rabbis Jack Stern Jr. of Scarsdale and Seymour J. Cohen of Chicago. They were assisted by Cantors Joseph Boardman and Moses Silverman.

title: Egypt Bars Heykal And Other Writers From Travel Abroad
description: CAIRO, May 28Five leading Egyptian journalists and writers, including Mohammed Hassanein Heykal, the former editor of Al Ahram and close friend and adviser of the late. President Gamal Abdel Nasser, have been forbidden to travel abroad pending an investigation into materials published or broadcast abroad that authorities contend were slanderous to Egypt.

title: Spain's Feminist Movement Concentrating on Rape Issue
description: BARCELONA, Spain  In a back room of the Bar Lasal, which is for women only, Inma explained to a male visitor the thinking behind a campaign that has galvanized Spain's latestarting feminist movement. The issue is rape.

title: Refac Acquires 35% Of Electronic Shares
description: The Refac Technology Development Corporation said it acquired, for an undisclosed amount, 35 percent of the common stock of Electronic Research Associates Inc. and the right to purchase additional shares through the exercise of stock options and warrants that would give Refac more than 50 percent of the shares of Electronic Research.

title: Bush Says C.I.A. Must Continue Oaths of Secrecy for Employees
description: PITTSBURGH, llay 28 (AP)The Central Intelligence Agency must continue its employee secrecy oaths to keep our open society open, George Bush, former Director of Central Intelligence, said yesterday.

title: Racing: Buckaroo Peter Pan Victor
description: While Affirmed and Alydar rested yesterday at Belmont Park, management began trying to round up some fresh troops to oppose them in the Belmont Stakes a week from next Saturday.

title: Indy's Top Brother Act
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 28There is no special rivalry between the Unser brothers, Al and Bobby, about who wins the Indianapolis 500 more often. After winning his third 500 this afternoon, going one up on his brother, Al Unser observed, We just feel it's important to keep in the family.

title: WILLIAM C. RICHARDSON
description: William C. Richardson, a retired vice president in the Manhattan office of thei St. Paul Fire and Marine Insurance Company, died Saturday at his home in Nassau Pcint, L.I., after a long illness. He was 71 years old.

title: Democratic Contest for Essex Executive Heats Up
description: NEWARK, May 28As the June 6 primary approaches, the race for the Democratic nomination for the new, powerful post of Essex County Executive is becoming increasingly heated, with the two frontrunners, Assemblyman Peter Shapiro and Sheriff John F. Cryan, openly hostile to each other.

description: George H. Tryon, an authority on fire safety, died Thursday at the New England Deaconess Hospital in Boston. He was 62 years old and lived in Waban, Mass.

description: WASHINGTON, May 28  Zbigniew Brzezinski, President Carter's national security adviser, said today that the Soviet Union had violated the code of ddtente and called for an international response to Soviet and Cuban military activity in Africa.

title: Robert J. Hawley, a Lawyer, Weds Holly Patrick, Student
description: Holly O'Hair Halpin Patrick, daughter of Mrs. Paul J. Zahner of New Canaan, Conn., and the late Richard Lee Halpin of Chicago, and adopted daughter of the lase William I. Patrick of New Canaan, was married yesterday afternoon to Robert James Hawley, son of Robert Barrows Hawley of Willsboro, N.Y., and the late Bonnie Mullens Hawley. The Rev. Walter Taylor performed the ceremony in St. Luke's Episcopal Church in Darien, Conn.

title: MARCHING BAN IS FOUGHT BY ANTIABORTION GROUP
description: GREAT NECK, May 28 (AP)A judge in Federal District Court in Brooklyn will conduct a hearing here at 10 A.M. tomorrow on the demand of an antiabortion group that it be allowed to put marchers in a Memorial Day parade in Manhasset, L.I., sponsored by the Amen, ican Leeion.

title: Hungarians Try to Build U.S. Trade
description: BUDAPESTDoing their best to ignore the ups and downs of the broader issues of EastWest dtente, Hungarian Communist Party and Government officials are vigorously pursuing better relations with the United States.

title: York College Plan Called Key to Jamaica's Future
description: Next to York College's main building, which is in a converted department store on Jamaica Avenue, stands a littered lot, empty except for a peeling sign that identifies it as part of a proposed Office Development District in Jamaica, Queens.

title: True New York Times/Jim Simpson
description: THERE MUST BE A PARADE: If it's a holiday weekend, there's marching going on and so was the case in Jersey City yesterday where residents turned out to see the drum major from Passaic V.F.W. Post lead the way as youngsters lined the route of march in Journal Square.

title: Settlement or Solution?
description: NEBI SALAH, Occupied West Bank  Drive north from Jerusalem, and you are in an area of prosperouslooking Arab villages and attractive farms. It is a beautiful part of the West Bank, the rolling hills green at this time of year, wild rosemary in bloom on the roadside.

title: U.S. Presses NATO to Approve Ambitious Programs for Defense
description: WASHINGTON. May 281n response to the growth of Soviet military power, the Carter Administration is pressing allied governments in Western Europe to adopt what officials here call one of the most ambitious defense programs since the establishment of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization in 1949.

title: GOING OUT  Guide
description: ALLEN'S EARFUL New Yorkers who plan to he in the midtown area this holiday can try two of Manhattan's diversion novelties during the course of the day and evening, they're in quest of something really different. There is the regular Woody Allen jam session tonight, at Michael's Pub. And the world's largest center of ballroom dancing, Roseland, at the convenient edge of the theater district, opens this afternoon in a special session starting at 2:30 P.M.

title: Brat110
description: GOLDFARBJacob A. The Board of Trustees, Officers and Members of the family of Brandeis University mourn the death of a giant of American Jewish philanthropy, whose devotion to our University set standards for others to follow. He and his beloved wife, Bertha, established our main central Library, which bears their name and will always symbolize their generosity and love of learning. His warmth and enthusiasm inspired countless others to ioin him in supporting the University since its earliest years. Elected a Trustee in 1956, he served as Treasurer of the Board of Trustees from 1961 to the time of his death. In recognition of his commitment to the University and achievements on its behalf, we established in 1976, the Jacob A. Goldfarb Medal, to pay fri bute annually to an individual who embodies the integrity. selflessness and regard for humanity that motivated and characterized Jack Goldfarb. His gentle voice and giving heart are now still. But the memory of his sweet soul and his legacy of nobility and excellence will be forever part of the Brandeis tradition. To Bertha, the children, and the bereaved family we extend heartfelt condolences. in the hope that the knowledge of all who mourn with them will be of solace during this trying time.

title: Rally Asks an End to Hiroshimas
description: Hundreds of Japanese women. many of whom were directly affected by the atomic explosions at Hiroshima and Nagasaki, represented a coalition of pacifist and feminist groups yesterday with an exhibit, of wartime photographs at an International Women's Gathering in Stuyvesant Park.

title: U.S. Presses NATO to Approve Ambitious Programs for Defense
description: WASHINGTON May 28In response to the growth of Soviet military power, the Carter Administration is pressing allied governments in Western Europe to adopt what officials here call one of the most ambitious defense programs since the establishment of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization in 1949.

title: Italians Puzzled by 10Day Lull in Terrorist Activity
description: ROME, May 28The Red Brigades and other leftwing terrorist organizations in Italy have been holding their fire for the last 10 days.

title: 7 Legion Disease Cases in Indiana
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., May 28 (AP)Seven cases of Legionnaire's Disease, three of them fatal, have been confirmed heer in the last five months, accordine to a state epidemiologist.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: New postal rates that took effect at 12:01 A.M. today were reported incorrectly in The Times yesterday. The correct rates an 15 cents for the first ounce. and 13 cents for each additional ounce.

title: Study Panel Urges Establishment Of Huge MovieProduction Center
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, May 28A proposal to establish a movieproduction complex similar in size and scope to that of the Meadowlands Sports Complex in East Rutherford was announced yesterday by Sidney Kingsley, Pulitzer Prizewinning playwright and chairman of the Motion Picture and Television Development Commission.

title: Nongambling Casino Owner
description: ATI Al,: TV: CITY, May 28James M. Crosby, a nongambler at slot machines or gaming table :i v. ho has made a fortune in the gambling business, may have made another million dollars here this weekend with the ccuntr,'s firq legal casino outside Nevada. Mr. Crosby, a quiet 51yearold bachelor who lives in a large apartment on East 69th Street in New York City, is the chairman and principal owner of Resorts International Inc., which operates two casinos in the Bahamas and opened a third here on Friday.

title: Defender of Robber Barons Who Spends Like a King
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  Its time somebody dia something for the rich, Jack Warner proclaimed in the last interview he gave before Charles Kirbo, his lawyer, shut him up.

title: Copter Hijacker Who Was Slain Is Buried With Military Honors
description: ST. LOUIS, May 28 (AP)Two days after she was shot to death in a helicopter she had hijacked for a prison break attempt, Barbara A. Oswald was buried yesterday with full military honors.

title: Florence Ann Davis And Kevin O'Brien, Law Students, Wed
description: Florence Ann Davis and Kevin James O'Brien were married yesterday at Cronkhite Hall at Radcliffe College. Rabbi Benjamin Rudaysky and the Rev. Robert F. Drinan, a Roman Catholic priest and a Democratic Representative from Massachusetts, officiated.

title: One Dead and 10 Injured in Turkey As Rival Political Factions Clash
description: IZMIR, Turkey, May 28 (Reuters)One person was killed and at least 10 were injured when rival political factions clashed yesterday in the small town of Demirci, 100 miles northeast of here, according to reports from the town today Leftist students protesting against an attack on a college lecturer clashed with a group of rightists, who later marched through the streets, damaging property and setting fire to the local headquarters of the Republican People's Party of Prime Minister Bulent Ecevit.

title: Merger For Mervyn
description: Mervyn's, a West Coast department store chain, said that its shareholders had approved the previously announced agreement to merge into the DaytonHudson Corporation, a Minneapolisbased department store operator, DaytonHudson shareholders also nave approved the transaction. Under the agreement, DaytonHudson will acquire Mervyn's for about 7.6 million of its common shares. Based on DaytonHudson's closing price on the New York Stock Exchange Friday of 40 the transaction is valued at about $304 million.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (UPI)The Church of Scientology has received word from sources in the Federal Government that a number of its highranking officials will be indicted soon, a spokesman said today.

title: Peggy Small Bride in Jersey Of Jed Fox, a Dental Student
description: Peggy Small, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Harvey L. Small of Ridgewood, N. J., and Seabrook Island, S. C., was married yesterday afternoon to Jed Fox, son of Mr. and Mrs. Abe Fox of Oceanside, L. I. Rabbi Selig Salkowitz performed the ceremony at the Ridgewood Small home.

title: Ridgway's May Sell
description: Ridgway's Inc., which makes commercial reproductions including blueprints, said it was discussing the sale of the company with various prospective buyers that it did not identify. The company said negotiations were at a preliminary stage and declined any further comment.

title: MovieFilm Complex Proposed for Jersey
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, May 28Sidney Kingsley, Pulitzer Prizewinning playwright and chairman of a commission to attract movie and television production to New Jersey, announced yesterday a proposal to establish a movieproduction complex on the scale and scope Gf the Meadowlands Sports Complex in EaSt Rutherford.

title: Deaths
description: FEINEPSumner B (Barry). Res iclent of Paris, rance,on May 28, in Caracas. Venezuela. Adored husband of Thais Mora Feiner and dearest daddy of Venassa. Beloved bioth er of Mildred Feiner Kaplan of N.Y.C. Son of the Idle Jack and Mitzr Feiner. Survived also by two ??? ren of a former marriage, Jean f Junto of Tampa, Fla. and Jack B. Feiner of Miami, Fla. and two grandchildren. Visiting Wednesday, 79 PM at Frank E. Campbell, Madison Ave at 81 St.

title: Commodities
description: ALTHOUGH the cost of beef hit a record high last week, the price action in the livestock futures markets again centered in the pork bellies pit of the Chicago Mercantile Exchange.

title: Werblin Weighs Changes at Top
description: THE Knicks and the Rangers are teams without pride, says David A. (Sonny) Werblin, the president of the corporation that owns them. And, he says, no one in either club's front office, with the exception of Michael Burke, has a guarantee of returning next season.

title: Coastal States Unit To Buy Howard Oil
description: The Coastal States Gas Corporation said that a unit, the Belcher Company of New York Inc., agreed to buy the assets of the privately owned Howard Oil Company, Inc. and its subsidiary, th Ross Oil Terminal Corporation.

title: Montclair's Gifted Pupil Integration Plan Praised
description: MONTCLAIR, May 27Two years ago, when the Montclair Board of Education announced a voluntary desegregation plan, parents in this 10squaremile community were angered and formed picket lines to protest the proposal.

title: PLAN TO STANDARDIZE COURT JOBS OPPOSED
description: A draft of a plan that would change and standardize the job titles of 9,600 nonjudicial employees in the New York State court system has been released, provoking sharp criticism from union leaders representing some of those workers.

title: Long Foresees Gains Tax Cut
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (Reuters)Russell B. Long, chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, has sa.d that he believes the Senate wculd approve a cut in the capital gains tax to stimulate business.

title: The New York Times/Pout Hoseiros
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., May 28On this Memorial Day weekend of 1978, the residents of this community weep not only for the fallen of past wars but also for two firemen who died last Thursday in fire that the police said had been set by an arsonist.

title: Chicago Plan Seeks to Draw Middle Class From Suburbs
description: CHICAGO, May 28Chicago is resounding with the clatter of giant machinery in a multimilliondollar effort to rejuvenate the central business district and attract middleclass families back to the city.

title: Operetta: Red Mill By Bel Canto
description: THE revival of a Victor Herbert operetta has become something o a tradition with the Bel Canto Opera this time of year. In 1976 it was Babette, last year saw Sweethearts, and currently the company is staging The Red Mill at its headquarters in the Madison Avenue Baptist Church at 31st Street.

title: Contract to Chrysler
description: The Chrysler Corporation has been awarded a $302.7 million Army contract for special tools, test equipment and engineering services leading to the production of the XMI tank, the Defense Department announced. Major subcontractors for the contract include the Arco Corporation, the General Motors Corporation, Computing Devices of Canada and the Singer Company. The Army plans to buy more than 7.000 XMl's for $10.4 billion.

title: Architects Discuss Future of the Art
description: DALLAS THE American Institute of Architects did something radical at its convention here the other dayit talked about architecture. And not only did it talk about architecture, but it also assembled eight of the nation's most respected designersPeter Eisenman, Frank Gehry, Charles Gwathmey, Michael Graves, Charles Moore, Cesar Pelli, Robert Stern and Stanley Tigermanto show their most advanced works and engage in a discussion, led by Philip Johnson, about where the art of architecture is going.

title: Outdoors: The Alewives Intense Yearly Drama
description: NO alewives were to be seen when I walked a short distance up a trout brook in Connecticut recently, but lying like small bright coins on the dark bottom were dozens of silver scales rubbed off when the fish surged upcurrent over the pebbly shallows during their spawning ritual.

title: Southern Co. Rejects South Africa Study
description: Stockholders of the Southern Company at the annual meeting in Mobile, Ala., voted down a resolution calling for a detailed report on controversial purchases of lowsulfur coal from South Africa for the holding company's Florida power plants.

title: PLAN TO STANDARDIZE COURT JOBS OPPOSED
description: A draft of a plan that would change and standardize the job titles of 9,600 nonjudicial employees in the New York State court system has been released, provoking sharp criticism from union leaders representing some of those workers.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Mandolin Concerto, Hasse; Fugue in D, Bach; Sonata No. for Flute and Piano, J.C. Bach; Rondo Capriccioso, Mendelssohn; Concert Rondo in E flat (K. 371), Mozart; L'Estro larmonico Concerto No. 1, Vivaldi.10:06Noon, WQXR: The Listening Room. Robert Sherman, host. (Live) Guests: Blair String Quartet; Russell Oberlin, countertenor.23:55 P.M., WNYC. Sonata for Cello and Piano, Chopin; Concerto for Violin and Oboe, Bach; Quartet No. 2, Bartok; Symphony No. 41, Mozart.

title: Model California College System Troubled by Dropping Enrollment
description: LOS ANGELES, May 28California's system of public higher education, which has set a national standard for quality and accessibility, faces a troubled and uncertain political and economic future because of declining enrollments and changing attitudes toward college degrees.

title: News Summary
description: Washington is asking its allies in Western Europe to join the United States in what Administration officials describe as one of the most ambitious joint defense programs since the establishment of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization in 1949. [Page Al, Columns 56.1

title: Toolmakers Are Getting Big Orders
description: New orders for machine tools continued to surge ahead last month coming primarily from the big automobile makers who are now ordering the equipment that will make the new lighter cars of the 1980's.

title: Defender of Robber Barons Who Spends Like a King
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  It's time somebody did something for the rich, Jack Warner proclaimed in the last interview he gave before Charles Kirbo, his lawyer, shut him up.

title: A Chandelier Shop Soon Will Go Dark
description: Clearly, this is no place for the proverbial bull in the china shop. Those rows upon rows sparkling cutglass chandeliers are looking bit dusty these days, but no less breakable.

title: Egypt Cancels Huge Resort Project at the Pyramids
description: CAIRO, May 28In a surprise decisicn, the Egyptian Government has yielded to public pressure and canceled the contract for a multimillion dollar resort community, the Pyramids Oasis, that was to have been built with foreign planning and financing in the desert overlooking the Great Pyramids of Giza.

title: Washington Watch
description: WASHINGTONA summit is coming, andin a break with traditionsomething may actually happen in Bonn on July 18 and 19. Robert S. Strauss, the President's Special Representative for Trade Negotiations, has been insisting recently that he expects to take a major new international trade agreement to Bonn for President Carter and the six other leaders of industrial nations to sign. The agreement has been under negotiation in Geneva for more than four years.

title: Mets' Espinosa 4-1 Victor
description: HOUSTON, May 28The New York Mots, unheeded and almost unloved at the start of the season, continued their remarkable rush today by defeating the Houston Astros, 41, for the eighth victory in their last 11 games.

title: Preventing Blackouts Past
description: Will we have another blackout this summer? That question haunts New York as regulators and utility executives search for ways to make the city's electrical. lifelines more reliable. Last week, the New York Public Service Commission ordered Con Edison and other utilities to carry out a number of shortterm improvements while investigations continue on costly, longerterm proposals. The new requirements are more stringent than those previously in forcebut they fall short of the rigorous standards suggested by the state's own investigation of the power failure. The P.S.C. has concluded, for the time being at least, that the additional protections would not be worth the cost.

title: Thousands Mourn 2 Firefighters Who Died in Blaze on Long Island
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., May 28On this Memorial Day weekend of 1978, the residents of this community weep not only for the fallen of past wars but also for two firemen who died last week in a fire that the police said had been set by an arsonist.

title: WILLIAM C. RICHARDSON
description: William C. Richardson, a retired vice president in the Manhattan office of the St. Paul Fire and Marine Insurance Company, died Saturday at his home in Nassau Point, LI., after a long illness. He was 71 years old.

title: Jacob A. Goldfarb Is Dead at 83; Philanthropist and ExExecutive
description: Jacob A. Goldfarb, retired chairman of the Union Underwear Company and Fruit of the Loom Inc., died yesterday at Doctors Hospital. Mr. Goldfarb, who lived at 895 Park Avenue, was 83 years old.

title: Keeper Of the Yanks
description: MY musings about the New York Yankees as the first zoo ever to represent a major league franchise we.e interrupted the other morning by the keeper. Ballplayers always bicker and curse and shout and call people names, said Al Rosen, the new president of the Yankees.  What do you think our ball club is, the New York Choirboys?

title: Jean L. Hochheimer Is Bride of James B. Hochron
description: The Sterling Forest Conference Center in Tuxedo, N.Y., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Jean Linda Hochheimer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kurt Hochheimer of Teaneck, N.J., to Jemes Berry Hochron, son of Mr. and Mrs. Manuel Hochron of Binghamton, N.Y.

title: Golf: Mrs. earner Leads by 2 Shots
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., May 28When the final putt was dropped today at Wykagyl Country Club, the stage was all set for another shootout between JoAnne Carner and Nancy Lopez starting at high noon tomorrow in the final round of this week's $100,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association tournament.

title: Dance: Summers Company
description: THERE were little dances and big dances on Saturday night's program by the Elaine Summers Dance and Film Company at the Theater of the Riverside Church. The little dances resembled sketches. But so did the big ones. For while Miss Summers employed several forms of dance and mixed media, her works nevertheless tended to be slight.

title: Rock: Neil Young on Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 28Neil Young has never been predictabla. Must successful rock stars follow certain patterns, with annual album re easesand tours to massive indoor arenas and outdoor stadiums to support those albums.

title: Egypt Said to Propose Israel Yield West Bank and Gaza to 1967 Rulers
description: CAIRO, May 28 (UPI)Egypt has submitted new Middle East peace proposals to the United States calling for the return of the West Bank of the Jordan to King Hussein's Governmentrather than turning it over to the Palestiniansand returning the Gaza Strip to Egypt, the weekly journal October said today.

title: World News Briefs
description: TEL AVIV, May 28An important Israeli Cabinet debate on the future of the West Bank and the Gaza Strip, scheduled because of United States pressure, was postponed today because Prime Minister Menachem Begin was ill.

title: Helping Couples Cope With the Loss of an Infant
description: On a dreary March day in 1977, Debra Dixon entered the Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn to give birth to her first child. Seventeen hours later the baby, a boy, was born dead, with an umbilical cord wrapped around his neck.

title: U.S. Airmen Honor Dutch
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (AP)The Air Force's Escape & Evasion Society enterta Med 43 members of the Dutch underground of World War II last week in Washington. A spokesman for the society said the purpose was to impress upon those who served in the Resistance in Europe that we haven't forgotten them. The guests were members of the Dutch Air Crew Helpers of the Second World War.

title: Occidental and Poland Plan to Trade Minerals
description: WARSAW, May 28 (Reuters)The Occidental Petroleum Corporation of California has signed a preliminary agreement with Poland for an exchange of minerals worth more than $1 billion.

title: Atlantic City Is Held No Threat to Reno
description: RENO, May 28 (AP)A few hours after the East Coast welcomed its first legal casino, a new one opened here, too.

title: Jazz: Ono Leads Festival
description: THE second annual Japanese jazz festival at Barbara's, West Third and Thompson Streets, opened over the weekend with a quintet led by Shunzo Ono, a trumpeter, playing on Friday and Saturday evenings. Unlike most jazz festivals that offer a variety of groups, Barbara's Japanese festival, which will continue for the next two weekends, presents a single group each evening.

title: Music: Haitink Conducts Beethoven
description: S OMEinterpretations of Beethoven's Ninth  Furtwangler's 1951 Bayreuth recording is a famous example  attain nearly manic intensity. Bernard Haitink's spacious, civilized account with tne Loncertgebouw Orchestra Saturday night at Carnegie Hall was relatively sedate by comparison, but memorable nevertheless. If its impact was less than earthshaking, the soundness of its conception, the magnificence of its execution, and the unencumbered warmth of its afterglow offered satisfaction enough.

title: Influence and Power Of Minority Caucus Doubted in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 27In 1966, in a decade of political activism and liberal solidarity, a group of black and Puerto Rican legislators created the hope of greater minority power in state government by uniting under the banner of the New York State Black and Puerto Rican Legislative Caucus.

title: First Casino in Atlantic City Finds Gamblers Endure Initial Problems
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 28Resorts Internation, in its third day of operating the nation's first legal casino outside Nevada, is finding a gambler's capacity for suffering matches his desire for action.

title: United Pross international
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 28Al Unser, a great driver in search of the right car for the better part of this decade, found it today and became the fifth man to Win the Indianapolis 500 a third time.

title: CLOSE SENATE RACES ENDING IN TWO STATES
description: ATLANTA, May 28Democrats in North Carolina will vote in a runoff election Tuesday to select either a selfproclaimed populist or a wealthy banker with a wellknown political name to challenge Senator Jesse Helms, the Republican incumbent who enjoys a national following among wellheeled, staunch conservatives.

title: Theater: Rib Cage, Ketron's Rural Drama
description: IN his previous two plays at the Manhattan Theater Club. Patrick Henry Lake Liquors and Quail. Southwest, Larry Ketron revealed a del inite talent as a local colorist. Each play was immersed in rustic atmosphere and character. The apparent realism of the landscape went a long way in compensating for the dramatic deficiencies of the scripts.

title: 3 Steelmakers Merge in Japan
description: TOKYO, May 28 (Reuters)Three mediumsized Japanese steelmakers, all affiliated with the Nippon Steel Corporation, have sirmed a merger agreement, under which the Usaka Steel Company will absorb the Daltetsu Steel Industrial Company and the Yamato Steel Works on Oct. 1, Osaka Steel said.

title: SelfSufficiency in Oil Projected by India
description: BOMBAY, IndiaOut in the deep blue waters of the Arabian Sea 100 miles west of here, India is rushing to complete the development of its major oilfield, in a race toward what it hopes will eventually be selfsufficiency in oil.

title: The New York TIMRS
description: PEDALING WITH A PURPOSE: Not all the participants in the Bicycle Marathon in Central Park traveled the 25 miles required to receive an award but almost all showed they had the heart. The annual Memorial Day event atI tracted a record number contestants and was won by last year's champion, James R. Black, 21, of Ithaca.

title: Dominican President Recognizes Election Victory of His Opponent
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, May 28 (AP)President Joaquin Balaguer has sent a telegram to his apparent successor, Antonio Guzman, recognizing for the first time Mr. Guzman's stillunofficial victory in the presidential election twelve days ago.

title: Deaths
description: BELLIN Avraham. Rivcrdale Jewish Center extends its sympathy to our esteemed member Dr. Eucienc Bcllin upon 1lte loss of his beloved father. May the family bo comforted with all the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem. Services Tuesday 11:15 AM from The Riverside 76 St & Amsterdam Ave. Shiva to be observed 1621 Livingston Ave. until Monday June 5.

title: Miss Guthrie Hides Injury
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 28Without the knowledge of track officials, Janet Guthrie, who today became the first woman to complete the Indianapolis 500, drove the grueling race with a broken right wrist. She had a Novocain injection before the race and sped to her eighthplace finish while reaching across her body to shift with her left hand.

title: Holiday Closings
description: Most stock and commodity exchanges in the United States will be closed today in observance of Memorial Day. Banks in Connecticut and New Jersey will also he closed. In New York, banks will be open today and will observe the holiday Tuesday.

title: Karen Kohlberg Bride of Dr. David Davis
description: Karen Kohlberg and Dr. David Hammeken Davis were married yesterday at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Kohlberg Jr., in Chitmark, Martha's Vineyard, Mass. The Kohlbergs also live in Larchmont, N.Y. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi A. Bruce Goldman. The bridegroom a son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth Angus Vavis of Nottingham, Pa.

title: DE GUSTIBUS Eggs: Over Easy and Unrecognizable
description: It is my curious conceit. that fried eggs wit h bacon, ham, sausages and so on are a distinctly American invention.

title: Connecticut to Reimburse Cities For Tax Lost on Exempt Property
description: NEW HAVENFrom his 13thfloor office window, Mayor Frank Logue looked down at the YaleNew Haven Hospital, and then at the hills beyond the city line  and beyond the city's tax grasp where most of the patients come from. Only one in five patients in the hospital over there comes from New Haven, but its tax exemption hits us. he said.

title: Editorial Notebook
description: The unemployment rate has come of age. Monthly bulletins from the Labor Department compete for headlines with train derailments and political Scandals. Few professionals, however, snare the public's enthusiasm for this statistic. Indeed, it is hard to find an economist who believes that the published unemployment rate has much use as a gauge of economic wellbeing.

title: 3 Terrorist Suspects In Italy Stage Protest
description: TURIN, Italy, May 28 (Reuters)Three men accused of being leaders of the Red Brigades terrorist group smashed glass barriers in their prison visiting room in front of relatives to protest jail conditions, officials said today.

title: Harlem Prep Fights Relocation to a Site Notorious for Drugs
description: Harlem Prep, which gained a national reputation for turning street youths into college candidates, is fighting a proposal by the Board of Education that would shift it to an area that the school's officials say is notorious for heavy drug traffic.

title: Ballet: Sleeping Beauty
description: To SAY that American Ballet Theater presented two sets of major cast changes in The Sleeping Beauty Saturday afternoon and Saturday night at the Mettropolitan Opera House is only part of the story. Just as newsworthy are the changes undergone by this production itself.

title: Therese Ann Rosenblatt Married to Stuart Arbeit
description: At the Jewish Community Center of White Plains yesterday, Therese Ann Rosenblatt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Rosenblatt of Scarsdale, N.Y., became the bride of Stuart Carl David Arbeit, son of Amelia Arbeit, also of Scarsdale, and the late Arnold Arbeit. Rabbi Maurice Davis performed the ceremony.

title: Metroliner Is Using Standard Coaches While Amtrak Is Renovating Equipment
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 Amtrak, in the process of refurbishing its aging Metroliner equipment, is now using standard coaches and locomotives on a number of its New YorktoWashington runs, spokesmen for the passenger train agency said last week.

title: Shoe Salesman Stabbed to Death In Alexander's Department Store
description: A 23yedrold shoe salesman was found stabbed to death yesterday on the third floor of Alexander's department store, at Lexington Avenue and 59th Street, just before the store opened.

title: STUDY LAUDS CHANGES BY NEW YORK POLICE
description: WASHINGTON, May 27A federally financed study has concluded that policies begun in 1970 by Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy of New York City reduced corruption in the city's Police Department.

title: The Politics of Art
description: Among the notable figures invited to testify some weeks ago before a House committee considering a bill for a White House conference on the humanities was the novelist John Updike. His statement, reprinted last week's National Review, contains little enthusiasm for the idea. While acknowledging that he has received his share of Federal largesse, Mr. Updike expressed unease about government intervention in the humanities and t he arts, albeit well meant.

title: Hanoi Denies Charge Of Abusing Chinese
description: HONG KONG, May 28In a statement released today through the Vietnamese press agency, Hanoi denied that it had mistreated any Chinese and insisted that the overwhelming majority of the working people, including Vietnamese of Chinese origin, had enthusiastically taken part in the program to abolish private business. It proposed a meeting soon to end the dispute with China over the matter..

title: An Answer to Crowded Courts
description: The jam in the courts, plus new and growing areas of business controversy, are adding impetus to the idea of resolving disputes by private arbitration, rather than through the public justice system.

title: $500,000 in Jewelry Stolen Despite Alarm
description: Burglars knocked through a base ment wall and then punched in a huge safe at an Eighth Avenue pawnshop last night getting away with as much as $500,000 worth of jewelry even though they twice set off the store's burglars alarm, the police said.

title: Mary Haggerty Bride Of Steven Simmons
description: Mary Eileen Haggerty, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. William Clifford Haggerty of Redlands, Calif., was married yesterday afternoon to Steven Jack Simmons, son of Edith Simmons of Palo Alto, Calif., and Robert Simmons of New York.

title: South African Leader Rejects West's Rhodesia Plan
description: JOHANNESBURG, May 28  Prime Minister John Vorster has struck a potentially fatal blow to the BritishAmerican peace initiative on Rhodesia by demanding that London and Washington abandon the plan in favor of the internal accord worked out by Prime Minister Ian D. Smith and three moderate black leaders.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M.Listed to speak in general debate on disarmament: Malta, Pakistan, Bulgaria, China, Denmark and Iceland.

title: Bridge:
description: The world's oldest contract bridge event, the Goldman Pairs, celebrating its 50th birthday, entered its twosession final round at the New York Hilton Hotel last night with 56 pairs contending, survivors from an original field of 104 pairs.

title: Sonics Win, Lead, 21
description: LANDOVER, Md., May 28  The Seattle SuperSonics defeated the Washington Bullets, 9392, today and took a 21 lead in the National Basketball Association four of  seven  game championship series. Both teams head for Seattle where the Sonics have won 21 straight and are looking to sweep the next two games and bring the franchise its first championship.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y.. May 28Bevin Koeppel's Congere, a 53foot sloop from Mamaroneck. N.Y., won the Storm Trysail Club's annual Block Island race today. The race wa., tedious for most of the 800 yachtsmen because the wind died and frightening for many reasons because of the heavy fog that descended on Long Island Sound last midnight.

title: CutRate Power Triggers Dispute
description: PORTLAND, Ore.A Pacific Northwest institution established during the Roosevelt era 40 years ago is under serious attack.

title: Pinkerton's Bid Open
description: Pinkerton's Inc., the security and investigative service, announced an extension of its offer to purchase up to 400,000 of its Class B common stock at $32 net a share.

title: Himalayas Lure Tourists To a Forbidding Kingdom
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, May 26Twentyfive years ago, when a bold young New Zealand beekeeper named Edmund Hillary called the world's attention to this ancient kingdom by climbing Mount Everest, Nepal war. remote and forbidding and almost completely closed to foreigners.

title: Weicker Still Critical of Brzezinski Stand on Jews
description: WASHINGTON, May 27One of the most controversial remarks of the debate over whether to send F15 warplanes to Saudi Arabia was made by Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., a Connecticut Republican with a long and consistent record of verbal bluntness and maverick politics. Speaking to 800 members of the American Israel Public Affairs Committee here May 8, he charged that Zbigniew Brzezinski, President Carter's national security adviser, had singled out American Jew's as an impediment to the Administration's foreign policy, much as Jews had historically been singled out time an.1 again by frustrated leaders in other countries.

title: Deaths
description: GOLDFARBJacob A. The Board of Trustees, Officers and Members of the family of Brandeis University mourn the death of a giant of American Jewish philanthropy, whose devotion to our University set stan. dards for others to follow. He and his beloved wife. Bertha, established our main central Library, which bears their name and will always symbolize their generosity and love of learning. His warmth and enthusiasm inspired countless others to loin him in supporting the University since its earliest years. Elected a Trustee in 1956, he served as Treasurer of the Board of Trustees from 1961 to the time of his death. in recoonition of his commitment to the University and achievements on its behalf, we established in 1916, the Jacob A. Goldfarb rectal, to nay tributt, annually to an individual who embodies the intenrity, selflessness and regard for humanity that motivated and characterized Jack Goldtarp. His Gentle voice and giving heart are now still. But the memory of his sweet soul and his legacy of nobility and excellence will be forever part of the Brandeis tradition. To Bertha, the children, and the be reeved family we extend heartfelt condolences, in the hope that the knowledge of all who mourn with them will be of solace during this trying time.

title: Palestinians Insist On Right to Remain In South Lebanon

title: Deaths
description: GOLOFARBJack A. It is with profound sorrow that Congregation EmanuE I of the City of New York records the death of Jack A. Goldfarb, a most beloved and distinguished member of our Board of Trustees. Mr. Goldfarb's lite was a testimony to grandeur, a reflection of that which is most beautiful in the human spirit and most enduring in the traditions of Judaism. Gentle of heart, noble of spirt, he was universally beloved by all whose lives he touched. Those lives were many, for his generosity knew no boundaries. His commitments to and expressions of love for institutions of learning, disadvantaged people, the Wellbeing of America and Israel, have in. scribed Jack Goldfarb in the souls of thousands. We sorrow at his passing, and with his wonderful family vie share a deep grief. His memory will endure for the works of his hands benediction.

title: Two Die in Stockholm Plane Crash

title: Ballet: Allegra Kent inFaun
description: CHANCES to see Allegra Kent dance have been scattered in recent years but the star, mainstay of the New York City Ballet since the late 1950's, popped up Saturday afternoon at the New York State Theater for a performance of Jerome Robbins's Afternoon of a Faun. If the role of the young ballet girl gives us too little of Miss Kent, it is one that nevertheless makes good use of her air of perpetual muted astonishment. The substance of this ballet is mood and Miss Kent alternated between dream and reality with lust the right fleeting delicacy. As the boy she meets in a mythical encounter in ballet studio, Helgi Tomasson injected A welcome note of unnarcissistic boyishness to the ballet.

title: Sporting Gear
description: The latest in on deck baseball bats is Bratt's Bat, a weighted but evenly balanced model that duplicates the regulationsize wood bats in all respects except weight. Since batters like to swing something heavy before going up to the plate, in order to make a regulation bat feel lighter and more controllable, they have been practicing with two bats at once, swinging bats weighted at just one end or placing metal doughnuts over the handle. Bratt's offers a better feel and more natural swing, and aids in strengthening the wrists, the maker says. It is made of wood and plastic, and comes in eight lengths, ranging from 29 to 35 inches, and in eight weights, from 45 to ounces. It sells for $20. Order directly from the maker, Bratt Corporation, 1 Wellesley Road, Danvers, Mass. 01923.

title: Notes on People
description: ACCORDING TO Representative 3. Herbert Burke, Republican of Florida, the reason that he was in a nightclub where he was arrested on charges of disorderly intoxication.and resisting arrest was that he was observing trafficking in narcotics. Mr. Burke, who is a member of the tfouse JeleCt tommittee on Narcotics Abuse and Control, said yesterday that Saturday night, he followed two men into the Centerfold Club, a har in Dania, near Fort Lauderdale, where nude dancers perform, and while there he witnessed a drug purchase: He said lie told one of the men, I was going to tet'liim, and the next thing.I knew the Police'Department was there to get me. May 29 ( AP)Metro activated its silent alarm system for bus drivers yesterday, a week and a half after the rape of a driver sparked a. citywide walkout over bus safety. he alarm system enables drivers to signal for help in emergencies to Metro headquarters.
