description: MORONI, Comoro Islands, May 29 (Reuters) The recently deposed president of the Comoro Islands, Ali Soilih, was shot and killed today while trying to escape from houe arrest, the Government announced.

title: East Germans Spur Atom Power With No Open Public Opposition
description: EAST BERLIN. May 29 (Reuters) Undeterred by any public oppoiti;)n to atomic power. East Germany has taken a big step forward in a program it hopes will provide at least half its energy by the end of the century.

title: Cafe Adds Item to Menu: A Rebate
description: PONTIAC, Mich., May 29 (AP)Regular customers at Nguyen Huy Han's restaurant get sweet and sour pork, enchiladas, curry and some of their money back.

title: News Summary
description: China called the Soviet Union the most dangerous source of a new world war and warned Washington that a policy of appeasement would only bring war closer. Foreign Minister Huang Hua, speaking at the United Nations in the General Assembly's special session on disarmament, accused both Moscow and Washington of duplicity in preaching disarmament while expanding and perfecting their arms. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: TV Sex Upsetting Sponsors
description: Prime time television's growing preoccupation with sexual themes and innuendo, a trend that is expected to accelerate in the fall TV season, is causing widespread concern in corporate boardrooms. The result may well have farreaching consequences for network television.

title: Lawyers Ask Justice Marshall To Halt Joan Little's Extradition
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (UPI)Joan Little's lawyers have asked Supreme Court Justice Thurgood Marshall to block her extradition to North Carolina, where she is wanted in connection with an escape from a state prison facility.

title: ABORTION FOES WIN PARADE CLEARANCE
description: GREAT NECK, L.I., May 29A Federal judge today ordered a Long Island American Legion Post to allow a group opposed to abortions to march in tits Memorial Day Paraec tomorrow, saying that such marching is an expression of free speech guaranteed by the United States Constitution.

title: U.S. to Sell $2.25 Billion of Notes
description: The Treasury tomorrow will sell $2.25 billion of fouryear onemonth notes in a holidayshortened financing week that has relatively little other financing activity scheduled.

title: Dollar Off a Bit; Gold Prices Up
description: ZURICH, May 29 (Reuters) The dollar declined one centime against the Swiss franc today to 1.936575, after touching a low of 1.933040 francs. promoting slight intervention by the Central Bank dealers said. The dollar and the pound sterling also dipped elsewhere. but trading was light because of the Memorial Day holiday in the United States and the spring bank holiday in Britain, and because of uncertainty over West Germany's April trade figures.

title: Noted Writer Accused by Sadat Says The Whole Thing Is Bizarre
description: CAIRO, May 29 The other day Mohammed Hassanein Heykal savored cigar as he told a visitor how President Anwar elSadat three years ago offered to make him a deputy prime minister. I was grateful. I said thank you, but this is my profession. Mr. Heykal gestured at the books lining his elegant airconditioned study. You can always find 2,000 people in Egypt to be ministers. But you can find only 10 or 15 to be newspapermen.

title: CHILE'S RIGHT VOICES BITTERNESS AT U.S.
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 26  AntiAmericanism has become fashionable again in Chile, this time in the rightwing circles that support President Augusta Pinochet rather than among leftists.

title: Miss Lopez Sets Record, Wins by 3
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., May 29Nancy Lopez, already the most outstanding rookie in the history of women's professional golf, won another battle with JoAnne Carner today, establishing a course record 65 at the Wykagyl Country Club, and gained her third straight victory on the Ladies Professional Golf Association tour.

title: ROBERT L. HOWARD
description: Robert L. Howard, a pioneer in the field of summer camping for children, died Sunday in New Rochelle (N.Y.) Hospital after a brief illness. He was 83 years old and lived in Palm Beach and at 65 Greenhaven Road, Rye.

title: Second Balcony Triumphs In Devon Jumper Event
description: DEVON, Pa., May 29Rodney Jenkins, for the last decade the nation's leading professional rider, piloted Second Balcony to a narrow victory today in the Intermediate Jumper Class at the Devon Horse Show.

title: Ben Carre, an Art Director For the Early Movies, 94; Helped to Found Academy
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., May 29 (AP) Ben Carre, an early film art director and a founding member of the Motion Picture Academy of Arts and Sciences, died of a heart attack yesterday at St. John's Hospital. He was 94 years old.

title: P.B.A. Assails Albany's Changes In Rules on Arbitrating Pay Raises
description: Changes in arbitration rules voted by the Legislature last week have ruined the bargaining strategy of New York City's policemen, the head of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association and its lawyer charged yesterday. They said they were considering challenging the constitutionality of the change in court.

title: Many of Holidayless New Yorkers Made Yesterday Day Off Anyway
description: Admittedly, there were legal distinctions as to who was supposed to observe Memorial Day yesterday rather than today, but many New Yorkers, cocking the same collective jaded eye they do toward, say, the jaywalking laws, took the day off.

title: PSYCHIATR1STS'VIEWS FOUND INCONSISTENT
description: A new handbook issued by the American Civil Liberties Union contends that psychiatrists and psychologists can be expected to agree only abuut 54 percent of the time, a rate of agreement only slightly better than the law of averages.

title: adio
description: 7:309 A.M., WNYCFM. Threepenny Opera Music,. %Vein ; Turkish March, Mussorgsky; Symphonies, Mouret ; Violin Pieces, Kreislcr; La Bataille de Marignan, Jannequin/Cabrielli.

title: POLICEMAN, FACING DEMOTION, MAY QUIT
description: A highranking New York City police official has filed for retirement after being told that he faced possible demo. 1 tion as a result of a new toplevel person. nel evaluation program initiated by the Police Commissioner, Robert J. McGuire

title: Lowell, Canadian Star Wins Tour of Somerville
description: SOMERVILLE, N.J., May 29Jocelyn Lowell. a burly 28yearold threetime Canadian Olympic team member from Toronto, broke away from a starting pack of 200 on the last lap.today and won the 35th Memorial Day Tour of Somerville 50mile bicycle race. The time of 1 hour 52 minutes was four minutes short of a national record for a 50mile event.

title: A Model Integrated School In California Told to Close
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., May 29  A Palo Alto elementary school, praised as model of successful integration, has been ordered closed  to maintain racial integra tinn. A San Francisco elementary school, also known for its innovative multicultural program, was barely saved from closing in a recent districtwide reorganization plan designed to insure racial balance.

title: Jazz: Bennie Wallace
description: BENNIE Wallace had to work his way through a couple of selections in his program in the New Jazz series at the Public Theater over the weekend before he hit his stride. But then the tenor saxophonist emerged from the sketchy, impressionistic, breathytoned manner in which he opened his set and drove into the highenergy virtuosity in which he excels.

title: Analysts See Demand for Credit Continuing at a Slackened Pace
description: Commercial banks last week raised their prime rates to the highest level in almost two and a half years, mortgage rates are rising and consumer debt has become more burdensome than at any time since 1960. While most money and credit analysts predict interest rates will climb further, some believe financing volume has already crested for the current business upswing.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: TIS OF THEE A free African bazaar today from noon to 7 P.M. initiates MinceAfrica, a weeklong festival of five prominent American dance troupes at the Brooklyn Academy of ttiroqin This afternoon the public is invited to attend the display and sale of African clothing, jewelry, ceramics, paintings and artifacts, along with music and African, Caribbean and Southern foods. The place is the academy's parking lot, entered on Ashland Place at Flatbush and Lafayette Avenues.

title: Reporter's Notebook
description: TOKYO, May 25Out ui. the beach of the steepsided, wooded island of Enoshima, the Coney Island of Tokyo, an elderly man in a suit sat upright on a towel on the rocky foreshore and stare out across a flat sea.

title: Moynihan And Kissinger
description: Is it really true that a defeatist consensus is preventing the United States from making adequate response to the global challenge of the Soviet Union?

title: Television
description: 6:00(4) Aerospace Down to Earth (13)P.O.W.: Atlanta Revisited (Captioned)

title: Concert: On the Mall
description: THE weather could not have been more cooperative for the first Naumburg concert of the summer on the Mall in Central Park Sunday afternoon. Bright skies and 80degree temperatures, as well as an enterprisingly offbeat program, attracted a larger than usual crowd. Nearly every bench was filled to mark the opener in this free orchestral concert series, a New York institution since 1905.

title: IND Passenger Disarms Bandit Robbing Train
description: A former marine who said, You knock the bully out of them if you talk in strong, authoritative voice, stood up to robber en an IND subway train yesterday, got him to surrender his knife and recovered the money taken from some of his 50 fellow passengers.

title: Cash Glut Vexes London Banks
description: LONDON  The big international banks here are so flush with funds these days, it is threatening their profits.

title: World News Briefs
description: THE HAGUE, May 29 (AP)  The Dutch Supreme Court overturned today a lower court's conviction of Pieter Menten and ordered a new trial for the millionaire art collector accused of havino killed Jews for the Nazis in Poland during World War II.

title: Supermarket Manager Is Slain In Manhattan by 2 Holdup Men
description: The manager of a Pioneer Supermarket at 2780 Broadway near 108th Street was shot to death last night by two holdup men who escaped on a motorcycle, the police reported.

title: Lashing Out at Soviet:Product of Frustration
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 The Administration's latest attack on Soviet mmettvering in Africa reflects rising frustration at American difficulty in countering Moscow's moves and the fear in some guartern that the Soviet Union may see Mr. Carter as a weak President whose hands are too tied to respond effectively.

title: Hopes Rising On Recovery Of Copper
description: The nation's copper industry, beset in recent years, with sluggish demand, overcapacity, declining prices and di., mal earnings, may be on the verge of a recovery, according to copper analysts and industry executives.

title: The Aging of Massa, a Simian Legend in His Time
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 29  Massa woke up this morning and rubbed his rheumy eyes with great hairy fists. He got to his feet and, looking a little loose in the seat, shuffled out to greet the day. By that simple act, Massa shattered another world record.

title: Pilot Safe as Jet Fighter Explodes And Crashes Next to Apartments
description: TACOMA. Wash., May 29 (AP)An F106 jet fighter plane exploded and crashed today near an apartment complex outside McChord Air Force Base. No serious injuries were reported.

title: Associated Press
description: DROPPING SON TO SAFETY: William Sheridan releasing his son, William Jr., from the burning second floor of his apartment in South Boston. He also dropped his daughter safely before he and his wife were rescued. Children, twins, are 7 months old.

title: Deficit Reported At Medical Unit In Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 29An audit disclosed today that Westchester Courtty's new medical center on the Grasslands Reservation in Valhalla had ended its first year with a $13 million deficit, largely because it had not conectea reuoactive Medicare payments from the Gov. ernment and had had problems collecting cash from regular patients.

title: Avoiding Default on NoFault
description: Of each dollar spent on personal auto liability insurance, only about 45 cents end up in the hands of accident victims. Much of the remainder pays the selling and administrative costs of insurance companies. But more than 20 cents of the premium dollar are burned up in legal battles over who is responsible for accidents.

title: Baffled by The Men Of the Right
description: WASHINGTON  Having been involved in conservative Republicanpolitics since the Goldwater campaign of 1964, I was not surprised when Senator Howard H. Baker Jr., a nonideological nragmatist, supported the Adm inistration on the ratification of the Panama Canal treaties and on the sale of F15's to Saudi Arabia. Nor, to make my meaning clear, would I have been surprised had the Senate Minority Leader pragmatically voted the other way, in either or both instances.

title: Deaths
description: GOLDFARBJacob A. The American Friends of the Hebrew University mourn the passing of a great bene factor and supporter of education both in Israel and in the United Slates. The world is a better place for his having been in it. Stanley M. Bogen, President Seymour Fishman, Exec Vice Pres

title: Perce R. Judd, Former Official Of U.N. Secretariat, at Age of 70
description: Perce R. Judd, former director of the commodities division of the Economic Council of the United Nations, died yesterday at Central General Hospital in Plainview, L.I., after a stroke. He was 70 years old and lived at 195 Woodbury Road in Hicksville, L.I.

title: Jersey Casino Reports Foiling A Few Cheaters and Prostitutes
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 29The chief security executive for Resorts international Said today that in the Resorts gambling casino's first four days of operation at full capacity here, there had been few problems with robbers, cheaters and prostitutes.

title: Disaster Areas Are Declared
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (UPI)President Carter today declared stormbattered parts of Montana! and Wyoming major disaster areas, qualifying the two states for Federal money for relief and recovery efforts. Heavy storms swept through the two states on May 15 and 16, leaving heavy property damage.

title: Next Week's Vote on a Tax Limit Has California Officials in Turmoil
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 29With the California primary election a week away, these two situations dominated political news here over the holiday weekend:

title: Some A. & P. Incentives Still Exist
description: Shareholders of the Great Atlantic &; Pacific Tea Company who read the proxy statement sent to them in advance of the company's annual meeting on June 23, will find some interesting reading on page 4, in and below the table of aggregate remuneration paid to company officers. It is of particular interest in light of the company's lackluster performance recently and the consequent criticism of several of these same officers.

title: For Liv Ullmann, Cannes Means Work
description: IT happens that the year feminist movies are making an impressively strong impact on the Cannes Film Festival, the only woman on the jury is Liv Ullmann, one of the most delicate, reserved and unassertive actresses.

title: Soecialists Look to Prevenfrve Medicine to Improve the Nation's Health
description: Many health care specialists are turning away from doctors and hospitals and looking instead at individuals and their environment as the most effective and least costly way to improve the nation's health.

title: Business People BornAgain Radio Profitable Inspiration
description: Jack Adamson is stuck with the term bornagain radio. He isn't exactly happy about it, so he cries all the way to the bank.

title: The New York Times/Gary Settle
description: CELEBRATING CENTRAL PARK: There may be some confusion among New Yorkers on just when Memorial Day is being observed, but there is no doubt on when to take advantage of Central Parkwhenever possible. it was an ideal time for a picnic at lake, a casual stroll or carriage ride yesterday. Park will, of course, be open again today.

title: Deaths
description: FRADK INBecky. Devoted mother of Edward. Loving grandmother of Bennett and Ava. Dear sister of Dora Lapidus, Fay Manna,and Anne Swetloff. Services 1:30 P.M. Tuesday at Temple Memorial, Inc., 13435 Northern Boulevard, Flushing.

title: HOW PAYOFFS AFFECT 2 MEDICAL STUDENTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 29  The two men have much in common. Both were born in New York and grew up there. Their fathers are welltodo, one the vice president of a major department store, the other a liquor distributor.

title: Unions Formed in Afghanistan
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, May 29 (Reuters)The new Government of Afghanistan has allowed the formation of unions for the first time in the country's history, its official radio reported in a broadcast monitored here.

title: Weekend for Resorts Spurs Rivals
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 29With the financially successful opening of this resort's first gambling casino this weekend, competition intensified today for the second game in town.

title: TURKISH CHIEF SEES NO RUSSIAN THREAT
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 Prime Minister Bulent Ecevit of Turkey said today that he felt no threat to his country from the Soviet Union and in fact would go to Moscow next month and probably sign a political document affirming each nation's good will toward the other.

title: TURKISH CHIEF SEES NO RUSSIAN THREAT
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Prime Minister Bulent Ecevit of Turkey said today that he felt no threat to his country from the Soviet Union and in fact would go to Moscow next month and probably sign a political document affirming each nation's good will toward the other.

title: Blockbuster Art At National Gallery
description: WASHINGTON FOR the inauguration of its elegant new East Building on. Thursday, the National Gallery of Art has organized a dazzling corncopia of exhibitions and acquisitions both wideranging in subject matter and diverse in scale.

title: Cyprus Leader Criticizes Schmidt For Opposing Arms Ban on Turkey
description: UNITED NATIONS, May 29 (Reuters) President Spyros Kyprianou of Cyprus today criticized Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany for having advocated an end to the American arms embargo against Turkey during a television interview yesterday.

title: MAN SHOOTS HIS FAMILY AND THEN KILLS HIMSELF
description: COHASSET, Mass., May 29 (AP)A 46yearold merchant seaman ended a daylong family fight today by shooting his three small children, fatally shooting his wife and then killing himself, the police said.

title: Thieves in Pakistan to Lose Hand
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, May 29 (Reuters)  Three convicted hank robbers will have a hand amputated in accordance with traditional Islamic punishment for thieves, Pakistan's military Government announced today.

title: Advertising
description: MARIO HIRSCH has joined that exclusive group of retailers who are finding fame by starring in their own TV commercials. Fame, however, is not quite what he's looking for. He's more interested in sales.

title: Essex Freeholder Races to Shape New County Rule
description: NEWARK, May 29The hotly contested race for the newly created post of Essex County Executive has overshadowed another facet of the Charter change provision adopted by the voters last Novemberthe complete revision of the 59yearold system of county government.

title: Mets Top Cards, 72, Lose in 10th, 62
description: Pat Zachry, the lean righthander of the Mets, scattered three hits in pitching New York to a 72 victory over e St. Louis Cardinals last night at Shea Stadium. The Mets backed Zachry with a 12hit attack that included tworun homers in the fifth inning by Bruce Bo!sclair and Willie Montanez.

title: U.N. Force Says It Curbs Arabs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 29 United Nations peacekeeping forces announced today that without using force they had barred almost daily attempts at armed infiltration of the zone they control in southern Lebanon, but at the same time they protested that some of their units had been caught in crossfire between opposing forces.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. Listed to speak are Congo, Mongolia, Libya, Cuba, Uruguay, Japan, Ecuador, Mauritania, Peru. Equatorial Guinea.

title: Conferees Consider Meaning of Religious Freedom
description: NEWPORT, R.I.  They skirted dangerous obstacles and struggled with treacherous currents, as though they were contenders for the America's Cup instead of scholars attending a threeday symposium entitled From Religious Toleration to Religious Freedom.

title: New Washington Gallery a Palace
description: WASHINGTON, May 29It could not, at first glance, be more different than the building it adjoins: the new East Building of the National Gallery by I.M. Pei and Partners is sharp and geometric, a trapezoid sliced into triangles, while beside it the original gallery of 1941 by John Russell Pope is a NeoClassical palace, serene and sumptuous.

title: Tho Now York TImos/Bob Glass
description: A BIT OF GAY NINETIES IN WESTFIELD: Celebrating its 250th anniversary yesterday, the Presbyterian Church in Westfield sponsored a parade in which 250 congregation members dressed to represent each year since 1728.

title: Caution: Huthan Zone
description: Mrs. M.L. of Hackensack had passed out of the Port Authority Bus Terminal in New York Friday just before the bullets started flying and, so, did not get shot. Even had she been there during the gunplay the odds on her escaping would have been excellent.

title: Letters
description: James L. Hecht's May 11 OpEd article, Apartment Hunting, in Black and White, should shock the sensibilities of every American. A survey of 40 cities around the nation financed by the Department of Housing and Urban Development, indicates thateven if, as the author claimed, the problem is somewhat understated in the report only one out of four blacks is given, the same choice as a white person: when seeking an apartment.

title: Firemen From Other States Join Tribute to Bethpage Volunteer
description: PLAINVIEW, L.I., May 29Representatives of firefighting forces from as far away as Florida joined the family and Mends of Robert Hasset today at the funeral for the young man, one of two tiremen who died last Thursday in blaze the police believe was set by an arsonist. A double line of 2,000 volunteer and professional firemen stood outside St. Pius X Catholic Church here during the 15minute funeral mass for the 21yearold firemen who had served on the Bethpage volunteer force for three years.

title: Washington Journal
description: DOWN at the Atlanta Airport week ago, more than a hundred tired travelers were milling around Gate 71, wondering why. Delta's Flight 208 up to Washington was delayed.

title: Carter Set to Open Gallery on Thursday
description: WASHINGTON, May 29The National Gallery of Art will step smartly into the 20th century on Thursday when President Carter snips a ribbon across the doorway of a modern marble palace at the foot of Capitol Hill.

title: FiveInning DebutIndians Lose, 20
description: CLEVELAND, May 29Andy Messersmith, the Yankee righthander who separated his pitching shoulder during spring training, made a remarkable return tonight by allowing one hit in five innings.

title: Letter: On Hamburgers
description: To the Editor:

title: Capt. Charles C. Hartigan Jr., 63; Ship Commander in Korean War
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Capt. Charles Conway Hartigan Jr., U.S.N., retired, died Friday at Bethesda Naval Hospital. He was 63 years old.

title: SEVERE INFESTATION OF GYPSY MOTH DUE
description: TRENTON, May 29Officials of the State Agriculture Department said today that they expected an especially heavy influx of gypsy moths this year and that spraying of 33,000 acres of residential nn.sc in New Jersey had begun.

title: How to Put TeenAgers to Work
description: For over a decade, severe unemployment among ghetto teenagers has been a tragic and destructive fact of urban life. As the rate approached 50 percent; Candidate Carter embraced the issue as a major campaign theme; within months after taking office, he obtained bipartisan passage of a $1 billion youth jobs bill. What good has it done?

title: West Given Revival Plan
description: PARIS, May 29Charles L. Schultze, President Carter's chief economic adviser, and senior economic officials from other Western industrial countries were presented today with a new, detailed economic recovery plan designed to prevent any further increase in unemployment in the West next year by raising its overall rate of economic expansion to about 4.5 percent.

title: Market Place
description: IN a move with ominous overtones for both stockbrokers and a wouldbe acquirer, the Chicago Pneumatic Tool Company, which produces compressed air tool, announced last week th'at another company had apparently purchased 5 percent or more of Chicago Pneumatic's shares.

description: The New York Times/Willam E. Sauro

title: Bronx Man Is Killed By Officer in Attack
description: A Transit Authority police officer shot and killed a 24yearold man and wounded the man's brother in the West. Farms section of the Bronx yesterday when the officer and his partner attempted to break up a knife attack and were themselves attacked, the police said.

title: 21 RESTAURANTS VIOLATE NEW YORK'S HEALTH CODE
description: The New York City Health Department cited 21 restaurants yesterday that had violated the Health Code, three that had corrected earlier violations and two that were closed for failing to correct their violations, The restaurants were listed as follows:

title: German Gambler Has Illness of the Soul
description: FRANKFURTThe way Rainer Kuhn told it to the judge, he went to Yonkers Raceway for the first time in 1963, hit a 42to1 shot driven by Carmine Abbatiello and came home hooked. Since then, Mr. Kuhn has lived as if he were a fish being reeled toward oblivion.

title: Sisalee Hecht Married
description: The marriage of Sisalee May Hecht. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Murray Hecht. of New Milford, N. J., to Stephen David Cosloy, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman Cosloy of Hackensack, N. J., took place yesterday at the Richfield Regency in Verona, N. J. Rabbi Harold Halpern performed the cermcmy.

title: Aid for Britain In Ryder Cup
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va., May 29 (UPI)In an effort to improve competition in a series dominated by the United States, the British and American Ryder Cup committees agreed today to allow the British team to include players from Other European countries.

title: Associated Press
description: ISRAEL'S NEW PRESIDENT: Yitzhak Navon taking the oath of office at ceremony in Jerusalem yesterday. left is Ephraim Katzir, the outgoing President. Mr. Navon is a member of the opposition Labor Party.
