description: A highranking New York City police official has filed for retirement after being told that he faced possible demotion as a result of a new toplevel personnel evaluation program initiated by the Police Commissioner, Robert J. McGuire:

title: Elizabeth Compton Is Married at Smith
description: Elizabeth A. Compton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. C. Arthur Compton of Exeter, N.H., was married yesterday to Andrew H. Eichenfield, son of Dr. and Mrs. Stuart M. Eichenfield of Baldwin. L.I. The ecumenical ceremony was performed in the Smith College Chapel in Northampton, Mass., by the Rev. Donald A. Fonda Jr., a BaptiSt minister, and Rabbi Charles J. Davidson of Hebrew Union College in New York.

title: ALLEN L. LINDLEY
description: Allen L. Lindley, who retired in 1965 as vice chairman of the Mutual Life Insurance Company of New York, died yesterday in his home, 77 Hillside Road, Rye, N.Y., after a long illness. He was 68 years old, and also had a home in Kennebunkport, Me.

title: A Plea to Actors: Speak Up
description: SOME of the mail a reviewer gets is fascinating, and some of it is simply misdirected. I'll save the fascinating stuff for another time (you knew you weren't going to get the cream today, didn't you?) and concentrate for the moment on the plaints that are reaching me, all right, but are really being delivered to the wrong place, at the wrong time. I do this in the interests of saving postage, the cost of which has gone up.

title: Real Places
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J. THE CARILLON plays gently at noon over, by City Hall and out across the..old streets of this quiet town, touching the sotl of movie buff to call forth wholesome old dreamfactory, characters Mrs. Wiggs and Scattergood Baines.

title: NBC, CBS Losing Affiliates to ABC
description: For 10 years. V'AAYTV in Huntsville, Ala., enjoyed the prominence and prestige that came with being the NBC outlet. Last December, the station switched its affiliation to ABCTV, an action that forced NBC to align with somewhat weaker station, WYURTV.

title: Janet Guthrie Faces Reprimand by Indy 500 Officials
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 29  Janet Guthrie probably faces a reprimand for driving in the Indianapolis 500 yesterday without telling track and United States Auto Club officials that she had a fractured rieht wrist.

title: Margaret Hilton and Morgan Freeman Win Derwents
description: MARGARET HILTON, who played Eve, the housekeeper, in the Hudson Guild Theaters production of Molly, and Morgan Freeman, who played Zeke, the wino, in The Mighty Gents, about Newark's black neighborhoods, have been chosen the winners of the 34th Clarence Derwe;,1 Awards.

title: 810% Rise In Food Cost Seen in 78
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP)Consumer food prices now are expected to climb 8 percent to 10 percent this year, the steepest rise since 1974, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Overflow Crowd at L.I. Fire Funeral
description: PLAINVIEW, LI., May 30 (AP)Firemen from Maine to Florida attended funeral services today for Capt. Joseph Dunn, 28 years old, one of two volunteer firemen killed in a fire last week at swimminz pool store in Bethpage.

title: Q & A
description: Q.I know that the muchspokenof English specialty called toad in the hole is made with sausages and a puddinglike mixture, but I still cannot trace the origin of the name. Do you know?

title: Wages Up 1.9% In First Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (UPI) Wage and salary rates rose 1.9 percent during this year's first quarter, according to the Employment Cost Index, issued today by the Bureau of Labor Statistics. It showed a record increase of 3.6 percent for service workers.

title: One Holiday Too Many
description: The only memorable thing about New York's double Memorial Day was the confusion it produced. The Memorial Day dilemma started in 1967 when the Federal Government moved national holidays generally to the Monday nearest the traditional celebration.

title: Cards Martinez Stops Mets on 1 Hit
description: Silvio Martinez, a 22yearold rookie making his first start in the major leagues, almost made baseball history last night in Shea Stadium when he pitched the St. Louis Cardinals to an 82 victory over the New York Mets and allowed only one hitthree days after he had pitched a nohitter in the minors.

title: Israelis Ponder Strategic Effect of F15's Sale to Saudis
description: During hearings before the recent Senate approval of the controversial package sale of jets to the Middle East, Senator Jacob K. Javits, Republican of New York, asked the acting chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff: Isn't it a fact that Israel could be extinguished as country in an hour by an effective air attack of the kind which they launched in 1967 against their Arab neighbors? The general's answer was, No. It could not be done today or in the future, he declared.

title: Fire Loss at Film Museum Less Than Was Feared
description: ROCHESTER, May 30 (AP)Officials at the George Eastman House International Museum of Photography said today that fire damage to their collection of rare movie films and still photographs was not as great as they originally feared.

title: The New York Times/John Soto
description: ATTACKS ILLEGAL DUMPING: Borough President Robert Abrams of the Bronx during a tour of illegal dumping sites in the Bronx yesterday after he held a news conference at Tillotson and Boller Avenues, where he protested the rampant abuse. Also present at the tour were City Councilmen Stephen Kaufman and Aileen Ryan.

title: Vilas, Ashe And Gottfried Win at Paris
description: PARIS, May 30 (AP)Guillermo Vitas, the defending champion; Brian Gottfried and Adriano Panatta gained easy firstround victories today in the $300,000 French open tennis tournament.

title: Property
description: WHAT this city needs is more mom an pop steres. In that belief the Southland Corporation, a 51yearold merchandise conglomerate, has decided to introduce its 7Eleven convenience stores to Manhattan.

title: Horse as Smart as a Horseplayer
description: Making small talk in Shea Stadium, Ralph Kiner of the broadcast team said: Who's going to win the Belmont?

title: Cash Prices (Prices in N.Y. unless otherwise Posted)
description: TUESDAY, MAY 30, 1978

title: Schlosser Moving to RCA And Video Disk Project
description: Herbert S. Schlosser, president of NBC since 1974, is to become an executive vice president of the RCA Corporation, which owns NBC, on June 7two days before Fred Silverman, departing head of ABC Entertainment, succeeds him.

title: Sophie Spector Udell, 77, Founder Of Association for New Americans
description: Sophie Spector Udell, a founder in 1949 of the New York Association for New Americans and its president from 1971 to 1975, died in Beth Israel Hospital yesterday of cancer. She was 77 years old and lived at 300 Central Park West in Manhattan.

title: Chancellor's House In Princeton Is Sold
description: A Princeton house formerly used by the New Jersey Chancellor of Higher Education has been sold for $212,000, the state announced.

title: Proxmire Panel to Hold Hearings In a Week on Aid to New York City
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Senator William Proxmire, chairman of the Senate Banking Committee, announced today that his panel would hold hearings June 67 and June 1213 on proposed financial assistance legislation for New York City.

title: More Salmon in Connecticut
description: WINDSOR LOCKS, Conn., May 30 (AP) Five Atlantic salmon ranging in weight from 10 to 14 pounds were found today in the new Rainbow Dam fishway on the Farmington River. That brings to 15 the number of salmon caught in the Connecticut and Farmington Rivers in the last month. Officials have spent years of effort and millions of dollars to restore the fish in Connecticut, Massachusetts and New Hampshire.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: DEVON, Pa., May 30Gigi Gaston, who spent most of last winter recovering from pneumonia, rode Emerald Bay to victory today in the fault and out class for amateurowner jumpers at the Devon Horse Show.

title: Labor Talks Resuming Amid Doubt Over Deadline
description: With New York City's labor negotiations scheduled to resume today, the City Council President and Finance Committee chairman said yesterday that they feared that the uncertainty of a settlement would block them from meeting the June 5 deadline for approving the budget.

title: A Day of Parades Amid Confusion
description: Despite the errors in subway scheduling and the weak showing by parade watchers, tradition managed to outhit confusion in the second day of the Memorial Day doubleheader yesterday  but it was a squeaker.

title: SEOUL SAID TO SHIFT ON TESTIMONY BY KIM
description: SEOUL, May 30  Kim Dong Jo, former South Korean Ambassador to the United States and one of the key figures in the Korean influencebuying scandal under investigation by Congress, is now likely to go Washington to testify, Western diplomats said today.

title: Eyeglass Prices In Focus
description: Not so long ago, customers in one Oakland, Calif., store paid $80 for a standard type of eyeglass frame and lenses. If Oakland's opticians had been able to advertise their wares, those customers could have found identical glasses elsewhere in the city for just $22. The Oakland case is not an isolated example. A study in New York City a few years ago showed prices for common pair of glasses varied by as much as 200 percent. In states that ban eyeglass ads, the lack of competition kept prices an average of 25 percent higher than in states where price advertising is legal.

title: North Carolina Populist Wins Upset in Democratic Runoff for Senate Nomination
description: RALEIGH, N.C., May 30 In an upset victory here, Insurance Commissioner John R. Ingram, a populist who campaigned against the big moneybankinginsurancespecial interests, defeated Luther H. Hodges Jr., a Charlotte banker with a familiar name, to become the Democratic nominee to challenge Senator Jesse A. Helms, a Republican, in November.

title: Lobbying Season for Sugar Prices, Both Higher and Lower, Is Begun
description: WASHINGTON,. May 30  The letter was short and pointed. Addressed to the Congressman's campaign committee, simply said: We are considering making a contribution to the Congressman's campaign. Please mail us the appropriate contribution request.

title: Museum Tower Delayed by Rift
description: Negotiations between the Museum of Modern Art and the Arlen Development Corporation are at a critical stage over the luxury apartment tower and gallery expansion for which the museum announced construction plans more than two years ago, with Arlen as the builderdeveloper.

title: Vandalism at New Paltz College Leaves 2 Dorms Badly Damaged
description: NEW PALTZ, N.Y., May 30Students at the State University College here did extensive damage to two dormitories last week before leaving for the summer vacation.

title: C.A.B. Bids Airlines Pick Own Routes
description: WASHINGTON, May 30The Civil Aeronautics Board, in an experiment in reduced Federal regulation, proposed today that airlines decide for themselves whether to fly a particular rnute.

title: PRAVDA DENOUNCES BRZEZINSKI ON ZAIRE
description: MOSCOW, May 30  The Communist Party newspaner Pravda today denounced Zbigniew Brzezinski, President Carter's national security adviser as a toe of dtente for having accused Cuba and the Soviet Un:on of responsibility for the rebel raid into southern Zaire.

title: Pop: Aretha Franklin
description: ARETHA FRANKLIN'S stature among contemporary popular vocalists is second to none. Of all the black gospelrooted singers, she has been most successful at translating the power and soaring lyricism of church music into purely Necular passion. But while she is incapable of singing badlyincapable, in fact, of singing less than spectacularlyshe is capable of giving a less than satisfying performance.

title: Deaths
description: GOLDFARBJack, A.The Board of Overseers of the Albert Einstein College of Medicine of Yeshiva University expresses Its deep sorrow at the death of Jack A. Goldfarb, a Founder and generous supporter of the programs of the College of Medicine. To his beloved wile, Bertha, and his devoted family,we extend our heart-felt condolences. ELI L.ROUSSO,Chairman, Board of Overseers DR. NORMAN LAMM,President, YESHIVA UNIVERSITY.

title: U. of Wisconsin Challenging U.S. On Secrecy Issue
description: MILWAUKEE, May 30The University of WisconsinMilwaukee has decided to cballenge a Federal secrecy order imposed on universitysponsored, publicly funded research on computer security.

title: Actor. Is Killed by Car on Highway As He Rides Bicycle to Fire Island
description: Cameron Burke, who played several small roles in the current Off Broadway production of The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas, was killed early yesterday while riding his bicycle on a Long Wand histhwav.

title: Curare Trial to Hear Experts on the Drug
description: The murder trial of Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich resumed in Superior Court in Hackensack after a fourday Memorial Day recess. Funeral directors and cemetery superintendents testified about when the bodies of the alleged victims were buried and then disinterred a decade later for tests to determine the nresence of the drue curare. Dr..Tascaleich is accused of killing five patients at Riverdell Hospital in Oradell by injecting them with curare. A 1966 investigation into the sudden deaths at Riverdell had een dropped because it was impossible then to detect the presence of the drug. The prosecution has said, it will show that techniques developed since then have proved the presence of curare in the hodis. Experts are expected to begin testifying on that today.

title: In Civil Rights Organizations, Possible Conflicts of Interest
description: BOSTONThe recent furor over the energy platform of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People raises embarrassing questions for our major civil rights organizations.

title: Feminist Drive Is Likely to Persist Even if Rights Amendment Fails
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  It is a bright Sunday afternoon in May, and the ladies are plotting.

title: Conditions Tied to Peru Copper Loan
description: A consortium of international hanks, led by the Chase Manhattan Bank of New York, has told Peru it will not. extend a $54 million loan to a major copper company there, unless the Peruvian Central Bank guarantees that will not siphon away the future hard currency earnings of the company.

title: CUBA, IN U.N., CALLS ACCUSATION ON ZAIRE ABSOLUTELY FALSE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 30A Cuban Vice President declared in the General Assembly today that President Carter's charges that the Cuban Government had a role in the recent rebel invasion of Zaire were absolutely false.

title: NATO Study Sees Soviet Military Growth Continuing
description: WASHINGTON, May 30  Despite growing economic problems, the Soviet Union will continue to give top priority to continuing its military buildup, according to a stillsecret study of EastWest relations accepted today by the heads of the 15 governments of the Westernaliance.

title: Antiabortion Group Marches in Parade In Manhasset, L.I.
description: MANHASSET, L.I., May 30Supporters of the North Shore Right to Life Commit tee, a group that has opposed, abortions. today stepped to the tunes of a fife and drum corps in the Manhasset American Legion Memorial Day parade, after the local post had lost in court in its effort to keep the group out of its annual event.

title: Vietnam Plans Resettlement Of 10 Million Over 20 Years
description: HONG KONG, May 30Vietnam's recent directive ordering many Chinese residents of Ho Chi Minh City, formerly Saigon, to move to uninhabited areas in the countryside is part of an ambitious program to resettle 10 million people, onefifth of the nation's population, in the next 20 years.

title: Feminist Drive Is Likely to Persist Even if Rights Amendment Fails
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.It is a bright Sunday afternoon in May, and the ladies are plotting.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: THERE was one tning tnat puzzled me about Paul Theroux's eighth and latest novel, Picture Palace. (Mr. Theroux is still best known for his bestselling travel book, The Great Railway Bazaar.) And I think the way this puzzle was resolved for me may indicate what very profound and effective, not to mention entertaining, novel Picture Palace turns out to be. It is about 71yearold photographer named Maude Coffin Pratt who usese the occasion of a retrosnective exhibition of her work to recall her incestuous love for her brother, Orlando, and how it shaped her life.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Petition Tiled By:

title: CARTER PRAISES ALLIANCE AT WHITE HOUSE DINNER
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (UPI)  PresidelitCarter told g gathering of North Atlantic Treaty Organization dignitaries tonight that for 30 years the strength of the alliance has permitted democracy and freedom to flourish.

title: Capital Gives All for Art
description: You won't see many more like this in our lifetime, Donald Blinken, president of the new Rothko Foundation murmured to James Rosati, the artist, Mr. Rosati chimed in, Yes, we are blessed to see it.

title: Golf's Blazing Rookie Pro
description: Nancy Lopez has taken a week off from the golf tour to rest at her home in Roswell, N.M., count her blessings and bank the latest $15,000 of her record earnings. Then the 21yearold, the best rookie ever to hit the women's tour, will return to competition June 8 in the Ladies Professional Golf Association championship at Kings Island, Ohio.

title: Bridge:
description: A successful defense of a major pair title is a rare event indeed. In the 48year history of the National Life Master Pair Championship, for example, this feat has been accomplished once, notwithstanding a threeyear streak by Howard Schenken and the late David Burnstine in the early 30's when they finished first, second and again first.

title: Food Dehydrators: Making a Dry Run
description: PUT this in your calculator and ponder it. Thirtyseven million American homes buzz to the tune of the electric blender. Five million households boast microwave ovens. Americans bought some 500,000 electric food processors last year. What else could possibly come along to zap the nation's watt power and hike up domestic electric bills? If some manufacturers have their way, food dehydrators could become the next appliance many will be convinced they can't live without.

title: Business People
description: Samuel Kalish, one of the betterknown figures in the cosmetic industry, agreed yesterday to step down as president and chief executive of Max Factor & Company. In announcing the move, David J. Mahoney, chairman of Factor's parent, Norton Simon Inc., said that while cosmetics operations outside the country were doing well, a disappointing U.S. performance will result in lower earnings for Max Factor & Company this year.

title: BYRD ASKS STEPS TO DETER; SOVIET AND CUBA IN AFRICA
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (Reuters)  The Senate Democratic leader, Robert C. Byrd, said today that the Carter Administraticn should consider strong diplomatic and economic pressure against the Soviet Union and Cuba to discourage them from military involvement in Africa.

title: Indians Set Back Yankees
description: CLEVELAND, May 30Rick Wise the bespectacled, cigarsmoking pitcher who saw plenty of fire power in Boston, finally saw some fireworks in Cleveland tonieht.

title: Around the Nation
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 30 (AP)  A foundation to help convicted whitecollar criminals has been awarded a startup grant by the city of Philadelphia.

title: Stocks Up After a 4Day Drop
description: Estimates by Wall Street analysts that the Consumer Price Index for April, scheduled for release today, will increase at about the same rate as in March apparently allayed some investor fears of a speedup in the inflation rate and turned stock prices slightly higher in late trading yesterday after four consecutive days of decline.

title: Filler Up and Check Under the Computer
description: ONCE upon a time, the classi fied ads bragged about a used car if it had R&H or WW's. Then, when everybody had radios, heaters and whitewall tires, the things to advertise were auto trans, 8track and full pwr. And the next progression, if General Motors has its way, probably will be trp cmp, standing for Trip Computer, perhaps the first really new auto accessory since Packard introduced airconditioning back in 1940.

title: New Accounting Method for Corporations Studied
description: The Financial Accounting Standards Board, the private sector's top rulemaking body in accounting, released a discussion memorandum yesterday that may set In motion an important change in how corporations handle their quarterly financial reports.

title: CARTER SAYS WEST CAN'T IGNORE MOVES BY SOVIET IN AFRICA
description: WASHINGTON, May 30  Prestuent Carter opened a twoday meeting of allied leaders today with renewed criticism of the Soviet military buildup in Europe and an assertion that Western nations cannot be indifferent to alleged Soviet and Cuban actions in Africa.

title: Saudi Spurring Lance Bank Bid
description: ATLANTA, May 30 (AP)  Offers from a Saudi businessman to buy the controlling interest in the National Bank of Georgia, formerly headed by Bert Lance, were being prepared for mailing to stockholders today.

title: Argentina Sets Holiday ForWorld Cup Opener
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 30A national halfday holiday for public offices, schools and most private businesses has been declared Thursday for the opening game of the 11th world soccer football championship here between West Germany and Poland.

title: Parr Track Gets Funds to Reopen
description: A Federal bankruptcy judge ruled yesterday that the Parr Meadows Racing Association would be allowed to increase its debt by $600,000 so that it could open its quarterhorse track at Yaphank, L.I., in Suffolk County for the 1978 season.

title: House Democratic Whip Questions Carter's Aims In Speaking Out on Africa
description: WASHINGTON, May 30  An influential Democratic Congressional leader suggested today that President Carter's attack on Soviet and Cuban activities in Africa might be an attempt to appear decisive in order to reverse his decline in the polls.

title: Eckersley of Red Sox Defeats Blue Jays, 40
description: Dennis Eckersley had a memorable gams last night, although not as memorable as the one last May 30. The Boston Red Sox pitcher posted an eighthit, 40 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays in Fenway Park, widening Boston's lead over the Yanks in the American League East.

title: A.T.&T. Sets Fee to Rivals; MCI Critical
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company said yesterday that it had filed proposed rates for the use of its local telephone facilities by competitors in the longdistance business. A.T.&T.'s main rival promptly charged that the rates would, if put into effect, drive it out of business.

title: PROSECUTORS CRITICIZED BY 2 NURSES IN V.A. CASE
description: MANILA, May 30 (AP)Two Filipino nurses who were convicted and then cleared of charges that they poisoned patients at a Veterans Administration hospital in Michigan criticized Federal prosecutors today of doctoring evidence against us, but described American justice and the press as gener4.11y fair.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Prices of precious metals, soybeans, grains and foreign currency futures advanced sharply yesterday as the value of the dollar plunged in overseas money markets.

title: Deaths
description: JDELL  Sophie. The Officers Trustees and Staff of the Jewish Child Care Association of New York loin In mourning the loss of one of the truly great figures in Jewish philanthroDY. For over three decades she helped to shape, with compassion and understanding, the pioneering programs of the Jewish Child Care Association, as an Agency Vice President and as Chairman and member of numerous Board committees. She was particularly devoted to the Agencies Foster Home Program and served over ten years as Charlman of the FosterHome Committee. In 1975, the Federation of Jewish Philagthropies of New York awarded her the Naomi & Howard LehmanMemorial Award for significant contribution to the welfare of children. Before becoming ?a Trustee of the Jewish Child Care Association, Mrs. Udell had been a Board Member of the Foster Home bureau. Hebrew Sheltering Guardian Society, one of four organizations which merged to form the present Association. Her contributions to the care & treatment of neglected and troubled children are beyond measure. We who had the privilege of serving with her In this great work were ourselves enriched by our association with this beautiful and decticafed woman. We extend to her reaved husband, Jerome, her child. ren & grandchildren our profoo:vl sympathies.

title: A Young Author Probes Old Themes
description: All of a sudden, this first novel called Final Payments has surged up out of the me generation of selfabsorbed, navelcontemplating, dropout American children, and has knocked the critics for a loop.

title: After 7 Years, Police Schedule Test for Captain, and 700 Will Take
description: The first thing Edward Mamet does When he gets behind the wheel of his 1974 Gremlin is to turn on his cassette player. What comes out is not music to help make the ride more pleasant, but idol mation about law enforcement, criminal investigation, personnel supervision and police problems and procedures.

title: Vietnam Plans Resettlement of 10 Million Over 20 Years
description: HONG KONG, May 30  Vietnam's recent directive ordering many Chinese residents of Ho Chi Minh City, formerly Saigon, to move to uninhabited areas in the countryside is part of an ambitious program to resettle 10 million people, onefifth of the nation's population, the next 20 years.

title: Summer Skimmer: The Old Straw Hat
description: If there's nothing new under the sun, chat means there must be something old. And the straws in the spring breeze indicate that this summer's hot hat is the old favorite that goes by the name of skimmer, boater or sailor.

title: MARGARET WEBER BUBAR, WRITER AND NATURALIST
description: Margaret Weber Bubar of Darien, Conn., a writer, naturalist and civic leader, died yesterday in Stamford Hospital after a long illness. She was 58 years old.

title: THREE SPLITTING VOTE IN ARKANSAS PRIMARY
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., May 30  Gov. David Pryor and two Congressmen who came home to challenge him were locked today in an extremely close race for the Democratic nomination to the Senate seat held for 36 years by the late John L. McClellan.

title: Wine Talk
description: INCREASES in wine prices continue unabated and the search for good reasonably priced wines gets to be tougher all the time. There are some buys around, however, and one of the best is chianti. Not the cheap stuff that used to come in strawcovered bottles and burn your throat, but solid, wellmade chianti in bordeauxstyle bottles, and most of it still available at under $4 a bottle.

title: 60 Minute Gourmet
description: IT is a fact of cooking that some dishes equally palatable may vary vastly in the amount of time required to produce them. And, psychologically, one dish may be much more admired for the simple reason that it required more effort and knowhow than did another.

title: News Summary
description: Criticism of the Soviet military buildup in Europe was expressed by President Carter at the opening of a twoday meeting of North Atlantic Treaty Organization leaders in Washington. He warned that Western nations cannot be indifferent to asserted Soviet and Cuban intervention in Africa. Leaders of the 15 NATO nations held an allday closed meeting on EastWest political issues, including a detailed report on longterm relations with the Soviet bloc. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: SAUL SCHARY, ILLUSTRATOR AND DANIEL GROUP PAINTER
description: Saul Schary, an illustrator and a painter in oils and watercolors whose works included a series of murals done for Ben Marden's Rivieraa nightclub in Fort Lee, N.J., in the 1930'sdied yesterday in a nursing home in New Milford, Conn., after a kidney failure. He was 73 years old and lived in New Milford and in Manhattan.

title: TV: Circle in Square's Tartuffe
description: THE Circle in the Square's production of Moliere's Tartuffe was not generally deemed successful on the stage. Now the television version, specially adapted and featuring, a manor cast change, would appear to be even less so. It will be seen at 9 o'clock tonight on WNETTV.

title: The Forgotten Principles
description: WASHINGTON The North Atlantic allies, meeting here this week, have so many problems that they tend to forget their achievements and their possibilities. This alliance has held together longer and under more difficult circumstances than any other combination of nations in this century. It was formed to defend a free civilization, and despite savage external and constant internal pressures, it has restored Europe, established a tolerable balance of military power in the world, and avoided a major war for almost two generations.

title: 26 Are Held in Italy In Opera Payoff Case
description: ROME, May 30 (Reuters) The police today detained 26 officials from the Italian opera world, questioning them about alleged corruption in the statebacked opera houses. The managers of theaters in Rome, Naples and the Sardinian capital of Cagliari were among those involved in the scandal over huge payments allegedly made to foreign singers.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation adjourned its annual meeting for the third time yesterday, setting a new date of June 14. The rescheduling is to allow the company time to get final tally of the voting in a proxy contest with CurtissWright Corporation for control of Kennecott.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: The New York Nmes/Chester Higgins Jr.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: If it does nothing else, the U.N. special session on disarmament should remind us what an artificial and precarious world we have made for our children.

title: Industrial Nations Reject Growth Plan
description: PARIS, May 30 Senior economic otficials from major industrial countries today generally rejected proposals for bolstering world economic growth that were put forth yesterday by the Secretariat of the 24nation Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.

title: Ruling Against Replies On Commercials Stands
description: WASHINGTON, May 30The Supreme Court left standing today the Federal Communications Commission's 1974 decision that broadcasters are not required to provide air time for responses by critics of their ordinary rnmmercial advertising.

title: White House Seeks A Bill to Guarantee Aid to Puerto Rico
description: The Carter Administration has proposed legislation to guarantee up to $15 million a year to Puerto Rico for social services, such as day care for children of working mothers.

title: Reporter's Notebook: OffOff Publishing
description: ATLANTA THE thousands of titles placed here by publishing houses for the benefit of the American Booksellers Association during its annual conclave bear a resemblance to the themes and styles of Broadway, Off Broadway and Off Off Broadway, book division.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: The dollar drifted lower against most major currencies in quiet foreignexchange trading yesterday in the United States, Europe and Asia as dealers waited for the official pulsetaking today of the United States rate of inflation, according to The Associated Press.

title: Class War
description: WASHINGTON  More and more often these days, one hears talk of class war. What does this expression mean? There is a good deal of confusion because some people think that a society in which certain distinctions are ritually observed (for example, distinctions of speech, dress, manners) is by the same token a classridden society

title: Blasts Rock Texas Refinery for HalfHour, Killing
description: TEXAS CITY, Tex., May 30 (AP) A series of spectacular explosions ripped through an oil refinery today, killing five persons, injuring 10 others and blowing up two 55,000gallon gasoline tanks.

title: BrunswickVapor Accord
description: The Brunswick Corporation said yesterday that it had reached a tentative agreement to buy the Vapor Corporation for $89.1 million in cash and stock a deal it v alued at $33 a share for the maximum of 45 percent it would buv for cash.

title: Staze: Awake and Sing! Revisited
description: IS Clifford Odet's Awake and Sing! a period piece? Is his 1935 threeact play a sentimental excursion into the minor crises of a poor Bronx family or is it a play that comes to grips with what were once burning issues for a large part of the American people?

title: Mrs. King Rejoins Apples
description: Billie Jean King, who missed six World Team Tennis mvtches because of bronchitis, will rejoin the New York Apples tomorrow in Los Angeles, the club said yesterday. The Apples lost four of the six matches they played while Mrs. King was sidelined.

title: Events Today
description: WAITING FOR GODOT by Samuel Beckett. Staged by Walter Asmus. Cast includes Sam Waterston, Austin Pendleton, Michael Egan and Milo O'Shea. Presented by the Brooklyn Academy Of Music. At the Le Perco Space, 30 Lafayette Avenue, 6:45.

title: Merger Creates Wiss & Lambert
description: Two jewelry firms, Wiss Jewelers of Hackensack, N.J. and Lambert Brothers of New York, are being merged into a 12store chain under the combined name of Wiss & Lambert.

title: Construction In April Up 7%
description: With a strong rate of commercial and industrial building, the value of newly contracted construction last month rose 7 percent from the yearearlier level to a total of $13.2 billion, according to the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company.

title: Carter to Attend Houston Pinner
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP)  President Carter will attend a $1,000acouple fundraising dinner June 23 in Houston nn behalf of the Democratic Party.

title: Atlantic City Casino Calls Crowd a Record
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 30An official of Resorts International said today that the hotel's gambling casino had attracted more people and had taken in more money from slot machines than any other casino in history on any previous holiday weekend.

title: Road Accidents Killed 506 in 3Day Weekend
description: CHICAGO, May 30 (AP)Traffic accidents killed 506 people during the threeday Memorial Day weekend, toll exceeding estimates by the National Safety Council and substantially higher than the 432 deaths during the period last year.

title: Deaths
description: BACKMANSusan. Beloved wife of Gerald. Devoted mother of Jonathan and Kenneth. Loving daughter of Helen Pergament. Dear sister of Hernia Levine. Services at BoulevardPark West 1450 Broadway, Hewlett, today at 11am. In lieu of flowers, contributions to Sylvan League Jrs. will be appreciated.

title: Zaire's Head Says Retreating Rebels Killed All Hostages
description: RABAT, Morocco, May 30 (Reuters) President Mobutu Sese Seko of Zaire said here today that insurgents retreating from the southern coppermining center of Kolwezi had killed all their European hostages in the bush last Saturday.

title: Bullets Topple Sonics, 120116
description: SEATTLE, May 30The Washington Bullets. down b 15 poii ts late irt the third quarter, caught the Seattle SuperSonics and beat them in overtime tonight, 120116, to even the National Basketball Association championship series at two games apiece.

title: Best Buys
description: RISING beef prices were blamed yesterday by the municipal Department of Consumer Affairs for pushing the cost of feeding a family of four in New York City last week to an unprecedented high.

title: A Day of Parades Amid Confusion
description: Despite the errors in subway scheduling and the weak showing by parade watchers, tradition managed to outhit confusion in the second clay of the Memorial Day doubleheader yesterdaybut it was a squeaker.

title: Slain Port Authority Officer Is Eulogized at Funeral
description: FORDS, N.J., May 30Henry J. Koebel Jr., the only Port Authority of New York and New Jersey police officer ever slain in the line of duty, was eulogized today for offering the noble gift of his life while protecting the rights and lives of others. He was then buried in this quiet central New Jersey community.

title: Whittaker Raises Earnings by 95%
description: The Whittaker Corporation, a diversified producer of metals, boats and chemical and electronic devices, reported a 95 percent jump in net incomt for the fiscal second quarter. Earning, more than doubled in the sixmonth period ended April 30.

title: Jets Look to Playbook for Answers
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I.It is not a chore the head coach of a bigleague football team usually does. But Walt Michaels took the book to the copying rrrIchine himself instead of letting Elsie Cohen, his secretary, do it.

title: World News Briefs
description: GUATEMALA CITY, May 30 (AP) Trcops were flown today to a northern village where violence involving landowners and squatters has taken 34 lives, the authorities said. Newspapers here placed the death tell at 38 :n the fighting at the village of Panzs.

title: Proxmire Panel to Hold Hearings In a Week on Aid to New York City
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Senator William Proxmire, chairman of the Senate Banking Committee, announced today that his panel would hold hearings June 67 and June 1213 on proposed financial assistance legislation for New York City.

title: Dance: Paul Taylor
description: FOR THE last two years, the Paul Taylor Dance Company has been riding along an incredible creative crest. Mr. Taylor, although retired from dancing, has never seemed so consistently inspired in his new works and his dancers, just as consistently, seem truly to he among the best in the world.

title: Deaths
description: KLUGERJulia, on May 29, 1978. Beloved mother of Sydney. Irving and Milton. Dear grandmother of nine grandchildren. Services will be held today at 2 P.M. at the Beth David Cemetery, Elmont, L.I.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Why should you be the only family on the block without a skeleton in the closet? If you've been mortified at this genealogical deprivation, you need no longer hang your head in shame. Go out and buy a skeleton of your own. Actually, what you buy is a kit, and you snip a bit and sew around the edges and you end up with a dangling, gangling brown and white skeleton with ribbons tied around its joints. And this skeleton has the advantage of also acting as a sachet. The fabric is impregnated with scent. The price is $25 but it's a long skeleton, if that helps. Art Adventures Unlimited at 888 Madison Avenue (72d Street) is where the skeletons are hanging out, literally.

title: Chess:
description: Grandmaster Arthur Bisguier of Rock Hill. N.Y., won the 12th annual National Open Championship in Charleston, S.C., with an almost perfect 61/21/2 score. The first prize in the fiveday, sevenround Swiss system tourney was $1,000.

title: Article 4 -- No Title
description: HOLIDAY JAUNT: Maria Press, a 12yearold volunteer at the Overpeck Stables, breaking in a new horse, Barnacle Bill, to get him accustomed to the riding ring. She is one of many young volunteers at the stable.

title: DAVID JATO MIRANDA
description: MADRID, May 30 (Reuters)David Jato Miranda, once Francisco Franco's propaganda chief, died today. He was 62 years old.

title: Countering Soviet Imperialism
description: Not long ago, those of us who believe that the primary objective of the Soviet Union is not accommodation but the expansion of its imperial power were widely dismissed as paranoid and worse. At first it did us no good to cite the buildup of Soviet military forces, both conventional and nuclear, on land and on sea. We were told that we were exaggerating.

title: TV Reruns Sales Brisk; Record Prices Are Set
description: THE television series, the continuous weekly presentation that, after one has marveled at all the specials and short series and oneshots, usually makes the difference between success and failure for a network, often has the characteristics of wine: It goes down better with age.

title: MasseyFerguson in Red; Weak Demand a Problem
description: Substantial losses in the latest quarter and six months were reported yesterday by MasseyFerguson Ltd., Canadian based producer of farm equipment that derives more than 90 nercent of its sales outside Canada.

title: Notes on People
description: IN ceremonies at the Washing. ton Navy yard yesterday, Adm. John Briggs Hayes took command of the United States Coast Guard, replacing Adm. Owen W. Siler, who is retiring after 35 years in the service. Admiral Hayes was sworn in as the Coast Guard's 16th commander by Brock Adams, Secretary of Transportation. The new commander was nominated by President Carter last February, when the admiral was serving as chief of the 17th Coast Guard District in Alaska. He is 54 years old.

title: Letters
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION: You concluded an article, Grown Child, Aging Parent: Help Arrives [May 10], with a listing of social agencies that provide educational programs to assist adult children in coping with the problems of aging parents. The list did not mention programs that exist in New Jersey.

title: Supreme Court Roundup Sex Distinction in State Alimony Laws to Be Weighed
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 The Supreme! Court agreed today to decide whether state divorce laws can prohibit alimony payments by a wife to a husband while authorizing such payments by a husband to a wife.

title: STATE DEPT. OPPOSES NEW BORDER AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, May 30  A number of senior officials in the State Department are trying to block a proposal that would give the Justice Department greater control over visa applications and refugee policy, according to Administration sources familiar with the plan.

title: ISRAELI SITE SET FOR DIG IS ACTUALLY FOR HOMES
description: TEL AVIV, May 30  Defense Minister Ezer Weizman aacknowledged today that Israelis authorized to work on an archeological dig at Shiloh in the occupied West Bank were instead building homes there.

title: Visitors to Winter Olympics Will Face a Shortage of Rooms
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y.The King of Sweden and the Crown Prince of Norway have rented houses already for the winter Olympics to be held here in 1980. A suite has been reserved for the president of the International Olympic Committee. Hotel and motel rooms for other high sports officials, the press and various VIP's have a top priority. An Olympic Village for the athletes is under construction.

title: Television
description: 6:00(4)Aerospace Down to Earth (13)Captioned ABC News (R)

title: Experts Upset by Drop In Innovative Research
description: WASHINGTON, May 30  An increasing number of experts, in both government and the private sector, fear that American industrythe standardsetter in commercial innovation for more than a centuryis steadily losing its creative edge because of the neglect of exploratory research.

title: Japan Ponders Aluminum Plan
description: TOKYO, May 30 (UPI)The Ministry of International Trade and Industry has proposed the consolidation of seven aluminum smelters as part of a campaign to rebuild the deficitridden aluminum industry.

title: Braila
description: COULOUCOUNDISAnthony G. U on May 28th. Loving son of Anthony G. and the late Marion. Dear brother of Roxann and Georgette. Friends may call at Frank E. Campbell, Madison Ave. at 81 St. on Thursday 35 and 79PM. Services to be announced tomorrow.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, MAY 31, 1978

title: Longer 79 Soccer Year Planned to Rest Players
description: Wilk the Cosmos were complaining yesterday at Rockefeller Plaza about the shortness of the soccer season, few blocks down the Avenue of the Americas the commissioner of the North American Soccer League was announcing an extension of next year's season.

title: Careers
description: FINDING new engineers: Ray Stata, president of Analog Devices, small hightechnology company in the Boston area, calls it the company's No. 1 problem. Other executives at similar, relatively small companies in the area agree.

title: Private Lives
description: HE arrives in his usual good humor. I have sometimes thought that, like the ice cream truck, he should have a jingle. He is made lazy afternoons; children adhere to him. His perpetual good humor is a mystery to me, as is the business that brings him once or twice a year to our city. As I understand it, he fiddles with other people's money. This has made him thirsty. I feed him a drink a martini, of courseand he settles in. Remember when we used to say unlax? I suppose that to be unlaxed was the way the children of the 1950's were laid back. My friend is always unlaxed.

title: E.E.C. Rejects Comecon Pact
description: MOSCOW, May 30 (UPI)  Officials of the European Economic Community today rejected any immediate trade agreement with the East bloc trading association, Comecon, which they said had no authority to act on behalf of its members.

title: Deaths
description: RUSSOFrank A.Retired NYC Fire Lieutenant Engine 250. Devoted husband of Elizabeth (nee Lima). Beloved father of Elizabeth Cerullo, Patty McCormack and Maureen Alaimo. Also survived by 5 grandchildren. Reposing Scarpacl Chapels, 1401 86 St,Bklyn until Thursday 9:00AM, Mass Holy Ghost Church 9:45AM.

title: U.S. Park Will Memorialize Cotton Mills
description: LOWELL, Mass.It has been 175 years since the first clack of a cotton mill here sounded the death knell of America as an agrarian society and, for better or worse, ushered in the Industrial Age.

title: U.S. Stars Win at Cannes
description: CANNES, France, May 30 (Reuters)Jon Vcight was voted best actor and Jill Clayburgh shared the bestactress award with Isabelle Lippert. of France today at the Cannes Film Festival.

title: LAWYERS GIVEN GUIDE ON SOLICITING CLIENTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 30The Supreme Court ruled today that states may discipline lawyers who personally seek out clients for private gain but not those who offer free advice on behalf of nonprofit organizations with political goals.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: NEW YORK is a city where everyone is will. ing to mind your business for you. It doesn't matter that you think you know what you're doing, or that you think you know what's best. There's always someone who knows better.

title: 36 Miles of Information
description: Sixtytwo miles to a gallon in a winecolored Cadillac? Hah! But that's what Trip Computer said during a test drive on the Long Island Expressway. Granted. the car was going downhill and drafting along in the wake of a truck at the time. but..

title: Heart Attack Killed Guardsman
description: PROVIDENCE, R.L, May 30 (AP)  An autopsy has shown that a member of the Rhode Island National Guard thought to have died of injuries when he fell from a jeep in Massachusetts actually suffered a heart attack. The police believed the 41yearold guardsman, Joseph L. Folcarelli, died in Palmer, Mass., Saturday when he dozed off at the wheel of the jeep and fell into the highway, striking his head on a guardrail. But officials said Sunday that the autopsy showed that the euardsman died of a heart attack.

title: GOING OUTGuide
description: VILLAGE ORBIT There's a Middle Eastern dance party tonight from 7:30 to midnight in the main ballroom of the Case Galicia, 119 East 11th Street. For a S5 admission, with drinks and food available guests can see an exotic lineup that includes Anshid Sofian, who won acclaim at the New York Dance Festival; the Indian and gypsy stylings of Majma from Pakistan, the Guzey Onor Turkish Dance Ensemble and others. Guests can alss.) join in the gceeral dancing later e: the evening.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: The C.A.B. proposed that authority to fly between the Oakland, Calif. International Airport and 15 other cities be extended several airlines as part of a continuing experiment to deregulate the induStry. [Page DI.]

title: Market Place
description: The Control Data Corporation, long perceived Wall Street to be an alsoran against the International Business Machines Corporation, has emerged as a leading factor in the dynamic computer services industry and, as such, appears to be finding some friends among investors.

title: Tomorrow's Badillos and Chisholms
description: Though it is all too common nowadays to look upon ghettos as vast wastelands of poverty and defeat, it is nevertheless a fact that City College is attracting scores of intellectually gifted and wellprepared students from, among other places, Harlem, the South Bronx and BedfordStuyvesant.

title: Local Produce Is In
description: The city's farmers market season is in full swing, with local produce now on sale each Saturday at the Union Square Greenmarket, at Union Square and 17th Street. The market, one of several to open at various times throughout the season, now features fresh peas, lettuce, rhubarb, and strawberries from New Jersey, along with eggs, honey, homebaked breads and cookies.

title: Casino Reports Weekend Records In Crowds and Slot Machines Use
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 30  An official of Resorts International said today that the hotel's gambling casino had attracted more people and had taken in more money from slot machines than any other casino in history on any previous holiday weekend.

title: U. of Wisconsin Challenging U.S. On Secrecy Issue
description: MILWAUKEE, May 30The University of WisconsinMilwaukee has decided tb challenge a Federal secrecy order imp)sed on universitysponsored, publicly funded research on computer security.

title: Issue and Debate U.S. in Africa: What Are Limits of Congressional Curbs?
description: WASHINGTON, May 30The Carter Administration's search for a way to respond to Cuban and Soviet involvement in African disputes has spawned a growing controversy over whether the decadeold movement in Congress to restrain Presidential power to conduct foreign policy has gone too far.

title: Christen Gets 2d School Board Term
description: Robert J, Christen was appointed yesterday to a second fouryear term on the Board of Education by Borough President Robert Abrams of the Bronx. Mr. Chris ten, who served for one year as president of the board, is a faculty member at Manhattan College in Riverdale.

title: Menza's Ethusiasrn Is Unflagging Despite Poor Showings in Polls
description: UNION, May 30  Aiexander J. Menza's campaign for the Democratic nomination for United States Senate is short on capital but long on enthusiasm.

title: 2 MultiInstrumentnlists
description: EGBERTO GISMONTI and Nana Vasconcelos, Brazilian multiinstrumentalists whose music eludes categorization, recorded a striking album for the West German EGM label last year. It combined influences from neoRomantic classical music, ethnic instruments and rhythms and improvisation in a consistently fresh and atmealine way.

title: CARTER SAYS WEST CAN'T IGNORE MOVES BY SOVIET IN AFRICA
description: WASHINGTON, May 30  President Carter opened a twoday meeting of allied leaders today with renewed criticism of the Soviet military buildup in Europe and an assertion that Western nations cannot be indifferent to alleged Soviet and Cuban actions in Africa.

title: Madagascar Reports Three Dead As Riots Continue Into Second Day
description: TANANARIVE; Madagascar, May 30 (Reuters)  An official statement said tonight that three people had been killed and that the police had made about 150 arrests in the second day of riots in this Indian Ocean republic. Rioters also set fire to buildings and looted shops.

title: Belmont Handle Exceeds $15 Million for Four Days
description: New York's biggest ontrack betting spree of the season churned to a close yesterday at Belmont Park with 18,399 customers pushing the fourday holiday handle over the $15 million mark.

title: Steel Rally Continuing; Output Is Up
description: The recovery of the steel industry continued through this month, according to production figures issued yesterday that showed that the industry's plants on the average were operating at full capacity, a level they had not achieved for a sustained period since Vlav 1976.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, MAY 30, 1978

title: TheWriting on the Wall: In Quebec, It's French
description: MONTREAL, May 30  In a few weeks, The Bagel Shop on St. Viateur Street may have to be known as something else  La Boutique du Bagel, maybe? But its owner, Meyer Lewkowicz, says he is waiting for a letter before making a move.

title: Farmers Get Loans
description: An estimated 200 Burlington County farmers whose crops and land were damaged by heavy rains last November are eligible for Federal loans, Governor Byrne announced.

title: Company Earnings Reports
description: For periods as shown. (N) Indicates stock Is listed on the New York Stock Exchange,(A) the American Stock Exchange and (0) overthecounter.

title: The New York Times/Jack Manning
description: MEMORIAL TO NAZIS VICTIMS: Auschwitz Memorial Figure, a bronze sculpture by Elliot Offner, was dedicated yesterday at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine. The Very Rev. James Parks Morton, who is Dean of the Cathedral, said the statue was a reminder of the tragic consequences of religious and racial bigotry.

title: Marine Dies of Gun Accident
description: OCEANSIDE, Calif., May 30 (AP)  Ma rine Cpl. Robert Forte of Philadelphia died in a hospital yesterday of a head wound inflicted accidentally at a civilian target range, spokesmen said today. Corporal Forte, 22 years old, was at a target range near the airport Saturday with two friends. He died after surgery in TriCity Nospitul.

title: Yugoslavia Weighing Extradition of 4 Terrorists
description: BELGRADE. Yugoslavia. May 30  The Yugoslav Government, responding to public pressure by West Germany, announced today that it was investigating tie cases of four West German terrorists who were under arrest here and whose return had been demanded by Bonn.

title: Talks Today Seek To Raise Payments For State Disabled
description: Scores of disabled industrial workers or their survivors will meet in Manville today to press for an increase in payments from a state compensation fund that allows many of them only $35 or $40 a week, based on benefit rates in effect half a century ago.

title: SENATOR IS TRAILING IN MONTANA CAMPAIGN
description: BUTTE, Mont., May 29  With a week to go before the June 6 primary election for United States Senator from Montana, the Democratic race looks like a walkaway for Representative Max Baucus. The last poll taken by the Baucus campaign gives Mr. Baucus a 30point lead, and the campaign of his opponent, Senator Paul Hatfield, a judge who was appointed to the seat in January, appears to be a shambles.

title: Going Down To the Sea In Search Of the Wild Cherrystone
description: EAST HAMPI ON; LI IT is a singular truth that those who, ave a passion tor water, particularly those.whotar=: age from the sea, care not a fig about time,: tides and the vagaries of the weather. Else why would Robert McDdrialdbe ih hiS bO;at recently, adrift the mist; on an unSea'. sonably cold morning searchinefor clams?.

title: CORRECTION
description: It was incorrectly reported in SportsMonday that S. E. Nichols carried a Big Boy bicycle pump. The pump can he purchased at any R & S store in New Jersey or at the East 47th Street Bike Shop in Manhattan. The list price is $23.36.

title: The Writing on the Wall: In Quebec, It's French
description: MONTREAL, May 30In a few weeks, The Bagel Shop on St. Viateur Street may have to be known as sometning elseLa Boutique du Bagel, maybe? But its owner, Meyer Lewkowicz, says he is waiting for a letter before makine a move.

title: Califano Drops Trip To Soviet in Protest
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP)  Joseph A. Califano Jr., Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, said today that he was putting off a trip to the Soviet Union. He said he had decided not to make the trip next month, largely out of concern ever the recent trial and sentencing of the physicist Yuri F. Orlov and the detention of other dissidents.

title: Personal Health
description: HANKS to pharmaceutical advertising, virtually everyone has beard of tired blood and the notion that the body's vital fluid can be revived by elixirs and tablets containing iron. But few may realize that despite Popeye's popularization of spinach and countless parental exhortations to eat your liver, dietary shortages of iron represent the nation's most widespread nutritional deficiency.

title: Jerry West Marries
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., May 30 (AP)Jerry West, who recently completed his second season as coach of the pro basketball Los Angeles Lakers, married Kristine Bua on Sunday, his 40th birthday. It was the second marriage for West and the first for his bride, 25.

title: CUBA, IN U,N,, CALLS ACCUSATION ON ZAIRE ABSOLUTELY FALSE
description: UNITED NATIONS. N.Y., May 30A Cuban Vice President declared in the Gcneral Assembly today that President Carter's charges that the Cuban Government had a role in the recent rebel invasion of Zaire were absolutely false.

title: British Crude Oil Output
description: LONDON, May 30 (Reuters) British crude oil production from the North Sea in April averaged a record 981,342 barrels a day, against 874,307 barrels in March and 718,000 in April, 1977, Department of Energy figures show. April crude oil production totaled 3.9 million tons, against 3.6 million tons in March and 2.9 million tons in April last year.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. St. Louis Cardinals, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8:05 P.M. (TelevisionCh WGLI,annel8M. 9,8 P.M.) (RadioWMCA, WGLI, 8 P.M.)

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Capital Preservation Fund, Palo Alto, Calif., a noload money market fund specializing in United States debt, has elected Paul K. Roberts president. He succeeds Jamees M. Benham, who conues as chairman.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The corporate and tax exempt bond markets showed little if any change in price yesterday as trading slowed to a semiholiday pace. The Treasury securities market, along with most commercial banks, was officially closed.

title: Inmate Escaoes From Ossining
description: OSSINING, N.Y., May 30 (AP)  An inmate, serving time for murdering New York City parole officer escaped from the Ossining Correctional Facility. The escape was made by Donald Wiggins, 41 years old, of Manhattan, around 1:15 P.M., according to the state police. He was serving 25 years to life for shooting Barry Sutherland, 32, a parole officer in December 1976 as Mr. Sutherland and two other officers tried to arrest Mr. Wiggins in Times Square.

title: Trucking Industry Is New Target of Senate's Antitrust Panel
description: WASHINGTON, May 30After striving for cheaper fares by stimulating airline competition, the antitrust subcommittee of the Senate Judiciary Committee has turned its attention to trucking, a much larger, tougher and more complicated industry.

title: U.S. to Join Paris Parley on Southern Zaire Next Week
description: WASHINGTON. May 30Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said tonight that the United States would participate in a conference of Western nations in Paris next week to discuss ways of reviving the economy of Zaire in the aftermath of the invasion by exiles based in Angola.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 4 P.M. to consider extension of peacekeeping force on Golan Heights.

title: After 7 Years, Police Schedule Test for Captain, and 700 Will Take
description: The first thing Edward Ma met does when he gets behind the wheel of his 1974 Gremlin is to turn on his cassette player. What comes out is not music to help make the ride more pleasant, but information about law enforcement, criminal investigation, personnel supervision and police problems and nror Prinrec.

title: Plaza Water Shutoff A Plumbing Problem
description: You could have been paying up to $130 a day for a room at the Plaza Hotelor up to $350 for a suiteand had a problem yesterday that even Eloise would have found not much fun: no water and no toilet facilities from 9:30 A.M. to 3:30 P.M.

title: Text of President Carter's Speech at the Opening of NATO Parley
description: WASHINGTON. May 30 (Reuters)Following is the text of President Carter's speech at the opening ceremony of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization conference today:

title: School Lunch Program Assailed
description: Consumers Union, the nonprofit produtevaluating service, has charged that 600.000 New York City schoolchildren and millions outside the city have been netting school lunches that do not meet Federal nutrition requirements, and are unattractive and often inedible.

title: Economic Scene
description: Smaller Tax Cut Urged by Wallich

title: CORRECTION
description: It was incorrectly reported in SportsMonday that S. E. Nichols carried a Big Boy bicycle pump. The pump can he purchased at any R & S store in New Jersey or at the East 47th Street Bike Shop in Manhattan. The list pricb is $23.36.

title: Gelsey Kirkland Happy Right Where She Is
description: A CLUTCH of fans waited outside the Metropolitan Opera House stage door to greet Mikhail Baryshnikoy as he entered the Theater for his last performance with American Ballet Theater before joining the New York City Ballet this summer. Among the fans, the ballet talk was earnest, as it is apt to he. Was George Balanchine, director of City Ballet, looking for a successor in Mr. Bary shnikov? Would the City Ballet nostar policy hold true for Misha? And would Gelsey Kirkland, Ballet Theater star, join him or waste away, now that the man she had once loved and followed to Ballet Theater has quit that company?

title: Clergymen of 3 Faiths Eulogize Slain Port Authority Police Officer at Funeral in Fords
description: FORDS, May 30  Henry J. Koebel Jr., the only Port Authority of New York and New Jersey police officer ever slain in the line of duty, was eulogized today for offering the noble gift of his life while protecting the rights and lives of others. He was then buried in this quiet central New Jersey community where he spent his boyhood and adult life.

title: Sadat Ready to Talk With Israelis Again If They Ease Stand
description: CAIRO, May 30President Anwar elSadat declared today that Egypt was ready to resume formal talks with Israel in an openhearted and openminded manner once the Israelis offered some new elements in their position, but not before.

title: DisasterLoan Deadline Today For Damage From Snowstorms
description: Today is the deadline for those whose property was damaged in last winter's snowstorms to apply for disaster loans from the United States Small Business Administration.

title: Don't Buy Books by Crooks?
description: A bit of a furor enlivened the gathering in Atlanta last weekend of the American Booksellers Association. Some people calling themselves the Committee to Boycott Nixon's Memoirs undertook a campaign to discourage visitors from purchasing copies of RN: The Memoirs of Richard Nixon. They sold Tshirts bearing the slogan : Don't Buy Books by Crooks?.

title: Humphrey Scholarships Approved
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP)  President Carter announced today that he had signed a bill he said would create a living memorial to the late Hubert H. Humphrey instead of erecting yet another granite or marble edifice. The memorial named for the former Vice President and Democratic Senator from Minnesota is an annual fellowship in social and political thought. Recipients need not be Americans. Congress authorized $1 million to establish a trust fund to finance the fellowship.

title: Thefts Are Said to Show Bonsai Expertise
description: GREAT NECK, L,IIt was after midnight on a rainy windswept night. Outside Suzanne Berv's sprawling ranch house, the rumble of a truck and the bark of the Bervs Labrador retriever could be heard  and then silence.

title: Textile Import Subsidies Seen
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP) The Treasury Department ruled tentatively today that seven countries were illegally subsidizing shipments of textile mill products and men's and boys clothing to this country.

title: Progress in Newspaper Talks
description: For the first time some progress was reported yesterday by Harry Fisdell, executive vice president of the Newspaper Guild of New York, in negotiations with The New York Post. Neither he nor a management representative would give details. The two parties met at the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service offices at 26 Federal Plaza with a mediator, Leonard B. Farrell.

title: Police Kill a Man Who They Say Lunged At Them With a Bayonet in Ozone Park
description: Shortly before 3 A.M. yesterday, two policemen looked out of their patrol car and saw a man with a bayonet creeping along Liberty Avenue in the Ozone Park section of Queens.

title: FINAL ORDER SUSPENDED IN BROOKE DIVORCE CASE
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 30 The judgment completing the divorce of Senator Edward W. Brooke and his wife, Remigia, was suspended here today by Middlesex County Probate Judge Lawrence T. Perera on the ground that Senator Brooke may not have made a full crIngure of his finances.

title: State Senate Votes Tomorrow on the Death Penalty
description: TRENTON, May 30  The State Senate today scheduled a vote for Thursday on a bill to restore the death penalty in New Jersey, and its sponsor, Senator John F. Russo of Toms River, said he believed the measure would pass.

title: Metroolitan. Briefs
description: The 5 feet 2 inch exmarine who took a knife away from a man threatening fellow passengers on a southbound IND subway train accepted a $200 reward yesterday and said he would use the money to buy sneakers for a children's basketball team he coaches. The reward came from the Federation of New York State Rifle and Pistol Clubs.

title: Wall St. Weathers Surge
description: A week after ending a sixweek trading surge in which volume reached record levels, Wall Street is relieved that its institutions came through the crisis virtually unscathed.

title: Spring Cookbooks: Unseasonably Good
description: Although spring is the second season where cookbooks are concerned, the current crop, while small, provides few offerings of more than routine interest.

title: ExIwo Jima Marine Dismissed From Job
description: Memorial Day, set aside to honor former servicemen, both the dead and the living, turned out to be a bitterly ironic holiday for Rene Gagnon, a former marine who was one of the six men in the famous photograph of the American flag being raised on Iwo Jima in World War II.

title: The Kettle Drums and the Triangle
description: The headlines notwithstanding, the world did not move any nearer to war over the holiday weekend. A great many important people just happened to be near American microphones and so there erupted what the idling citizen might well have mistaken for a Great Foreign Policy Debate. There is no particular cause for alarm; those who feel a need to worry about the diplomacy of the day might grieve with us not over what was said but over what was left unsaid.

title: Advertising
description: RICHARD K. LESSLER, vice chairman of McCannErickson, took brief time out from the weekly executive committe meeting yestereay to respond to an itinerant questioner's query on why at this late stage the agency has finally gotten a direct marketing capability.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: LAWYERS GIVEN GUIDE ON SOLICITING CLIENTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 30The Supreme Court ruled today that states may discipline lawyers who personally seek out clients for private gain but not those who offer free advice on behalf of nonprofit organizations with political goals.

title: Brezhnev Visits Prague
description: PRAGUE, May 30 (Reuters)Cheering Czechoslovak crowds brought out in organized groups today welcomed Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, while the police rounded up humanrights activists to nrevent hostile demonstrations.

title: Money Rates
description: TUESDAY, MAY 30, 1978

title: Records (Classical) Are Posted (by Mail)
description: ST. HYACINTHE, QuebecSix years ago, Andre Perrault was wondering whether the little record and television shop he had opened in 1958 in this rural town could be kept going. A few blocks down the Rue des Cascades, a Woolworth store had started a price war on pop records that threatened to drive him out of business.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Divertimento No. 64 for Baryton, Viola, Cello, Haydn; Scherzo, Brahms; March, Berlioz; Three Spanish Vilancicos for Christmas, Anonymous; Fidelit) Overture, Beethoven; Sonata for 2 Violins, Cello, and Organ (K.244) Mozart.

title: Senator Marchi Backs Cuomo For a Spot on Republican Ticket
description: Secretary of State Mario M. Cuomo, Democrat, should be considered for spot on the Republican ticket in New York State this year, State Senator John J. Marchi, Republican of Staten Island, suggested yesterday.

title: 2 Canoeists Found Safe at Home After Craft Capsizes in Delaware
description: LAMBERTVILLE, N.J., May 30 (UPI) A search for two canoeists, missing and feared drowned in the Delaware River, had a happy ending last night.

title: Talley's Profit Off Despite Sales Rise
description: Despite slightly higher sales, the earnings of Talley Industries declined 15.4 percent in the fiscal fourth quarter, ended March 31, However, the full fiscal year's profit was up 44 percent.

title: Wilkins Denies Link to King Memo
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI) An F.B.I. memo describing a black leader who cooperated in an undercover campaign to discredit the late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. referred to Ray Wilkins, the former NAACP head, but Mr. Wilkins subsequently denied any such involvement, The Washington Post reported today.

title: Manhattan Transit Resumes Service
description: Manhattan Transit buses resumed operations yesterday after a strike of inlmost two months.

title: ExNazi Loses U.S. Citizenship InChicagoTrial
description: CHICAGO, May 30 Frank Walus, 55yearold Germanborn Pole who became an American citizen in 1970, was stripped of his citizenship today after a 17day trial in which more than a dozen witnesses linked him to the deaths of at least 10 Jews while he allegedly was a member of Hitler's Gestapo in occupied Poland.

title: Giants 1, Astros 0
description: AT HOUSTONBob Knepper not only fired a fivehitter for his seventh victory and second shutout, but also drove in the only run with a seventhinning sacrifice fly. San Francisco posted its third straight triumph and 15th in the last 18 games. Knepper (72) struck out four men and walked only one in completing his sixth game in 11 starts.

title: William Casey Memorial Today
description: A memorial service will be held today for William C. Casey, professor emeritus of sociology at Columbia University, in the St. James Chapel of the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, Amsterdam Avenue and 112th Street. Professor Casey died in New York on April 30.
